Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gasman66
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice at this hotel 2010 4 nigts and 2011 10 nights and on both occasions we have found the staff and the hotel excellent.The location is on the freedom trail and within easy walking distance to the common ,harbour, north end and the trains where you can get to most places in boston its also close to the airport.The rooms are clean and tidy, they are not huge by us standards but i think they are comparable to most Boston hotels.The restaurant and bar also serve good food and if you do eat in the restaurant ask for JFK's table!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Gem”
Reviews.Author: angie1130
Reviews.Content: From the moment we hit the front step, friendly kid glove service every moment. Start with our arrival at 9am--when we asked to check in early, they took our number and said they would call as soon as the rooms were cleaned...received the call around 10am! In the meantime, they checked our baggage so we could wander around while we waited. Room was fitted with many amenities, including robes,a night light in the bathroom and snacks in addition to the usual coffeemaker, hairdryer, etc The hotel is located in downtown and an easy walk to many historic sites. Convenient business area to print boarding pass and small gift shop on site. Ate breakfast in first floor restaurant and although pricey, serving of fruit was huge and all fresh and beautifully presented. Our lunch was served in the banquet room, and despite serving 150 guests, food arrived hot and tasty--excellent clam chowder and baked scrod. Room for a king mid week was $189, but the employer was paying, so didn't mind the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Double Wow.”
Reviews.Author: BabeinWoods
Reviews.Content: This was worth every penny. From the steeped-in history atmosphere, to the elegant dining, to the amazing rooms, the Parker House is terrific. It's lovely. The beds are super comfy, and I could have camped in the bathroom. We stayed there before and after a trip, and I was delighted to find that the second stay made us frequent customers by Omni Rules. That means free Internet, free breakfast drinks, and free newspaper. This is across the street from the Granary Burying Ground. It's down from the State House and the Old South Meeting House. There are places to see, shop and eat within walking distance. The staff is great. The first time we were there, we had a regular room. The second time, we somehow had an upgrade to a handicapped room. I say upgrade because the bathroom was bigger than my college dorm room. The decor is very Old World--it's dark. But it's so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: B8YOU
Reviews.Content: Me and partner stayed here for 4 nights over the St Patrick's Day Weekend. Hotel was busy but check in was a breeze, Olivia was very helpful with loads of information around the city. house keeping staff seems happy at theor work and very present. The concierge booked our trip to the Wrentham outlet with instant confirmation, $42 round trip per person. We've ask for late check out at 2pm and it was no problem. the front desk also have UK plug adaptor is you need. Room were a bit on the small side but that was expected. Flat screen TV, Coffee Machine, safe, Mini Bar, Iron / Ironing Board and hair dryer in room. air conditioning works well and quite. the double bed was super comfortable. Location is the biggest selling point for choosing this hotel; Freedom Trail and Boston Common on the doorstep. there is a Costa Coffee, Mcdonalds, Dunkin' Donuts, 7-Eleven and Macy's within a few mins walk. China town and Quincy market within 10/15 mins walk. 4/5 Irish Pubs within 5mins walk. Downtown Crossing Station is 5mins also and it will take you everywhere in Boston. Tip: Sign up to the Omni loyalty program and recieve free Wi-Fi together with free USA today. We took a taxi from Logan Airport for $25, on the way back is on $20. I think it's well worth it as it saves a lot of time dragging the luggage around. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially for st patty's day.”
Reviews.Author: Mmmitchelli
Reviews.Content: The only negatives were how thin the walls are and the bathrooms are tiny. Kids down the hall will sound like they are in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brinjag
Reviews.Content: Great location and rooms. Service was great and they let me check in early at no extra cost. The front desk checked if everything was ok with the room after i entered. Great breakfast in bed. Not sure is it was complimentary or an upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastmomof3
Reviews.Content: We just spent the night in an executive room on the 2nd floor. The room was large and well furnished with 2 very comfortable double beds, 2 closets and sitting area. The bathroom was tiny and the mirror which is on a tilting bracket would not stay in position so it tilted down towards the sink. The view out the window was a dreary gray side of another building and the room was very dark. The heating system fan was very loud but it did help drown out any noise from the outside streets. The front desk staff and concierge were extremely nice and helpful. So I would stay there again if I could get a room with some type of view. There are numerous places to eat within a block especially on School Street. Used the valet parking which worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Another two great stays at the Boston Omni”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a five night stay at the Omni (Rm 1030). A great corner room, with windows on two sides. Prior to that I was at the Omni for New Years (Rm1024); again a decent room with sufficent space. I've stayed at the Omni several times before, so knew what to expect. The hotel is just a very short walk from Government Center T stop (on Blue line from Airport). On both occassions, great welcome from staff. And provided with good, clean rooms. My rooms were of good size, but I know some of the rooms are fairly small - beware if you travelling as a couple. I'm a member of the Omni select guest program which entitles you to complimentary beverage in the morning, and free wifi. (Definately sign up before your trip). The hotel is on the freedom trial, and walking decent to the majority of sights in Boston. I was in town for the hockey and basketball - a short walk to TD Garden. I will definately return to the hotel, and would throughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly disappointed and I have 3 nights left here!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: slp1978
Reviews.Content: I am currently stayin at the Omni with my husband and our experience has been terrible. Unfortunately we still have 3 nights left here. We booked online and nothing we read about the hotel gave us the impression that we were booking a terrible room and that moreover the staff would do absolutely nothing about it except give us excuses. Our room has 1 double bed that's too high for me to even get into! There's only enough room for one side table turned sideways! The bathroom is larger but there are no shelves, hooks, tables to put anything on which means we put everything including our towels on the floor in order to reach them. The sink is just a sink - there's not even space for you to put down your toothbrush! These may sound like small complaints but add them all together and it makes for a very functionally challenged room! In addition you can't open the curtains because you can see right into the rooms in the adjacent buildings. To top it off the clock in our room had not been changed to reflect the time change so we were an hour behind to start our day thi morning. We told the front desk staff that were not happy with all of this (and I have to say my husband was very nice) and the result was either we take a worse room or we take a table that they woul put in our room. We came back tonight to a table way to big and it made us feel like we were in a ghetto hotel. Basically we will never stay at an Omni Hotel again!! I seriously hope that something changes our mind about this hotel but I won't hold my breath.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, fully modernized hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Bettina131
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the beautiful Omni Parker House. I usually prefer modern hotels but this is so historic and so beautifully kept and updated, I absolutely loved it. I loved reading about the history and the people who had stayed there (Charles Dickens!), and admired all the details in the lobby. I had a small room but it didn't feel cramped. The bathroom was nicely updated and everything was very clean. The bedding is luxurious. The location is very central, close to two subway stops, just steps away from Boston Commons, and pretty close to the North End, as well as Faneuil Hall. The only somewhat negative is that the room was quite dark, no sunlight would ever come in (on the 9th floor), the same was the case with my friends' room, and it looks like a good number of rooms are situated like that. However, it didn't bother me too much. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pucci0506
Reviews.Content: We love staying at this omni hotel the location is perfect right next to the freedom trail and the staff is super friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Boston Cream Pie”
Reviews.Author: KraZ4food
Reviews.Content: Oh my! We didn't stay here this weekend because we were only up for the day, but we made a special stop for Boston Cream Pie. The best part for me was being able to share it with my kids (ages 5&8) and my mom. We truly enjoyed our visit and devoured this awesome Boston treat. Definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Classic”
Reviews.Author: abarasol
Reviews.Content: Classic old time hotel in a good downtown location. Very nice lobby. Some rooms are very small, so make sure you book a size you are comfortable in. Bathrooms are very small, but typical of many old hotels. We stayed in an "executive suite" which was very nice; however, I would not have enjoyed my stay as much in a small room. Nice lobby... helpful staff. View from room ..... brick wall 20 feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Grundsu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Omni Parker House in Boston several times and have always enjoyed my time there. My recent stay was a two night mini-vacation with my sister. We had a lovely room, which had two double beds - very comfortable; the room had all the usual hotel amenities. While the bathroom was small, with only a shower, it did the trick. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and engaging. The room and bathroom were both very clean. We had one meal in the hotel restaurant, the breakfast buffet, which was substantial and delicious. The best feature of the hotel is its location, just steps from two different subway stations, five minute walk to Faneuil Hall Marketplace, right on the Freedom Trail and very close to many more historical and entertainment attractions. They regularly offer good deals on their website, including "theme" deals, such as a theater weekend, or museum weekend. Worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa38Kent_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to a lot of attractions and it meant we could easily come back in the afternoon to drop off bags and have a rest. There is a starbucks and bagel bar just down the street where we ate breakfast as the hotel breakfast is rather expensive! The room was spacious, clean and comfortable and happily slept our family of five. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely thin walls!!”
Reviews.Author: ERCauswell
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great staff in a great location. That said, be warned about the walls...toilet paper is thicker than these "walls". I had a phone conversation at normal volume and had security called on me not once, not twice, but thrice! Absolutely absurd. They need to refit this place, ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Who rates this 4 stars?”
Reviews.Author: dn5019
Reviews.Content: This is one of those Priceline coups - for those of us who trust Priceline a whole lot more than we should - this must be where they make their money back. Even after you pay for the upgrade to a double bed suite, the rooms are cramped, walls are very thin, windows are tiny and the staff - well, they're just not as friendly as a real "four-star" hotel. Great location, but your $100 priceline room will run you over $200 after you pay for your upgrade, your parking, your internet access. Then we add taxes. Speaking from experience, you can do a lot better in the theatre district with priceline if you drop one of the stars.

Reviews.Title: “terrible choice for a romantic night away”
Reviews.Author: dilettanteMB
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 star hotel in Boston on Priceline and thought I couldn't really go wrong. I never, ever guessed that I'd get stuck with one double bed. What an awful choice for what was supposed to be a romantic night away, the first since we had a baby more than a year ago. The double bed was tiny, an anti-romance and anti-sleep buzzkill. The sympathy-less front desk clerk wanted $50 to "upgrade" to a different tiny room with a queen bed. Plus, the bathroom was so tiny that you had to wiggle the door around you just to be able to use the toilet. Every sound traveled into the room until we stuffed towels around the door. And service in the restaurant was laughably bad (though the original Boston Cream Pie was indeed yummy). The location is great but I recommend you choose someplace else nearby.

Reviews.Title: “wow, what a meal!”
Reviews.Author: flexikins
Reviews.Content: Went here for my friend's birthday and what a superb experience! I'm not even a huge steak lover, but I couldn't resist ordering the filet mignon. So tender, and was a huge two-inch thick piece! I'm ashamed to say I finished the whole plate, as well as the foie gras appetizer (two generous pieces of foie gras atop toast with chutney and micro greens. To die for!). We also got the onion soup which was very well made (I like it when restaurants properly leave the salting up to your tastes), and the chocolate mousse cake and Boston cream pie for dessert. Both very good and beautifully presented but I could have gotten 2 of the chocolate mousse cakes instead- while the restaurant is known for their Boston cream pie, it just isn't my favorite thing. The service was exceptional; fast and very professional. Oh and their bread rolls are excellent and note-worthy. Notice you can get the recipe from their website. Overall I had a wonderful experience and I will surely be back. One of my now favorite classically elegant restaurants in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't stay any other place. The hotel is beautiful and the service is great. We feel pampered and spoiled every time we stay there. The food is terrific too!

Reviews.Title: “Post wedding luxury!”
Reviews.Author: BostonFixieRider
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker house was fantastic! Stayed here after my brothers wedding. Beautiful ceremony on the top floor of the hotel and then comfort, quiet, and rest to sleep the night away...

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in a GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveler243
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a beautiful and historic hotel located in the perfect location. Guests can walk to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, the Common/Gardens, and the waterfront-really can't get much better than that. There is a grand, historic feel to the hotel the minute one walks into the lobby and the staff is fantastic. I have stayed as a guest and used this hotel for work related events and have had a wonderful experience with every interaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ekeeghan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House for my brother's wedding and it was incredible! The function rooms were beautiful and the guest rooms were well-appointed. The staff was incredibly helpful and went out of their way to ensure everything we needed was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: The location, service, and high class feel of this place makes it my favorite hotel is Boston hands down. Stay there for one night and I promise you that you wont want to stay anywhere else in th city again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: lauren t
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Great location. Absolutely beautiful lobby and rooms. Everything is clean and the hotel staff are very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Another Night on the Town - Valentine's Day Style”
Reviews.Author: umass123
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel, great staff and quality room. Stayed with my wife recently for an early valentine's day celebration and had dinner at Parker's restaurant and went to the Shubert Theatre to see the Adams Family. The building itself is old which the style of the hotel embraces with the decor which makes it all seem elegant and adds to the experience. On this occasion, we had a basic room which is very nice. The room is big enough, the bedding very comfortable, however if an upgrade is availabe, I would recommend the deluxe room as it is much nicer. I think the biggest drawback to the hotel is the location. Although it is in the middle of everywhere you would want to go in Boston, it is located in a dark and dreary area with not much immediately accessible. It does have a nice lounge, the Last Hurrah and the on site restaurant (Parkers) is okay and Ruth Chris Steak House is right across the street, but otherwise it is a dark couple of blocks in either direction to Faneuil Hall or the Boston Common. (at least at night). I also did the online checkin which made checking in a breeze. We walked to the Shubert Theatre, through china town in the theater distict in little more the 15 minutes. All and all a great night starting with dinner at Parker's, the show at Shubert Theater, then back to the hotel for a night cap at the Last Hurrah.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Elegance can't be beat!!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper5
Reviews.Content: From the second I was met at the door by the doormen to the second I left to head home again, I was treated to affordable luxury in a location that is perfect for exploring Boston. I reserved the executive suite for myself and my 2 teen boys. It was exactly as described on the website. We stayed here for 5 nights and never felt crowded. Even the closet was huge in this room. Sign up to be a select guest (no charge), and you receive complementary wifi, a turn down service in the evening, and a complementary morning beverage for 2 delivered right to your room at a time you designate. You also have the option to include a breakfast item for an additional charge. The only minor inconvenience was the small bathroom because the sink is a pedestal, so there's no room for toiletries. However, I managed to utilize the shelves above the toilet, and because we were out and about all day and most evenings, we didn't need a big bathroom. I might caution someone with very small children since it's nearly impossible to fit more than one person in there at a time. Also, there's no pool or self laundry facility, so if that's a requirement (it used to be for us when our boys were small), you're out of luck. But, again, for us it was fine. Boston kept us very busy! If you are traveling alone or as a couple, the smaller rooms are just as beautiful, but there's little floor space. My mother stayed in a regular double room. She was happy with it, but I would have gone crazy with children. Check out the website; they identify the square footage of the various room choices. The hotel staff is extremely friendly, professional, and helpful at all hours. Importantly, I felt safe for myself and my children. As for the location, it's unbeatable. You can walk just about everywhere. We walked as far as the Aquarium, Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market (fun food court), North End (amazing restaurants - another review), and Chinatown. The hotel is also close to Boston Common, so there's a T if you want it (we used the T to go to the Museum of Science and Prudential Center). Additionally, there's a few Dunkin Donuts nearby for breakfast options, a Subway, pubs, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, etc... within a block or two. My family and I have travelled all over the country and have never felt loyal to any hotel since we're "bargain" shoppers, though we also love Drury Inn's. But we'll be frequenting Boston since my oldest son is in College there, so I know where I'll always be making my reservations from now on. I can't say enough about Omni Parker House. I recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: micahg11
Reviews.Content: Lived in Boston for many years and have stayed in many hotels in the downtown area. Within the past 2 months I have stayed in 3 different hotels that I would recommend over the Omni Parker House. To be clear I would not recommend the Omni. Booked the hotel through Priceline (only reason I stayed there). My 2nd recommendation would be to not use Priceline. The Omni is in a great location if you want to be downtown, but so are many other hotels. The Omni's rooms are incredibly small. I have never encountered a hotel in Boston with guest rooms even close to as small as the ones at the Omni. Most only have full size beds because the rooms are so small. I stayed in a "queen" room however the bed was a full size bed. The bathrooms are so small the door almost hits the toilet. The Omni is listed as a 4 star hotel but I do not believe full size beds and tiny rooms deserve 4 stars. Don't be fooled by the "history" of the hotel. Stay comfortably in any one of the surrounding hotels that are of similar to better quality. Westin Copley, Sheraton Copley, and even the Marriott Copley all offer bigger rooms, equal amenities if not better, great locations, and are similarly priced. One positive: friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funtootravel
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at an Omni property (we previously reviewed the Omni Championsgate in Orlando and the Omni Berkshire in NYC). Unfortunately, this was the least impressive property in our experience. When we arrived, there was an "ambassador" standing in the middle of the lobby "greeting" guests. She was extremely aloof and did not smile - it felt as if she preferred to not be there at all, let alone to be welcoming. The room was also tiny (and we are from NYC, so we know what small hotel rooms mean). It was not comfortable for a family of 4 at all. If we wanted to move around, we had to rearrange ourselves so we could get by the furniture. Finally, the bathroom was so small, we had little room to get ready and it needed refurbishment. With all that negative, there were some highlights. The location of the hotel is excellent - it is right across from the Old North Church and a block from Boston Common. Easy walking to some great restaurants and very near the T. Also, there were a few front desk attendants who were very nice and accommodating (especially at check out). We had one problem with our TV not working and they addressed it extremely quickly and took very good care of us. Overall, we will probably try another property the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful .....wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: I am so shocked by some of the previous reviews for this hotel, it's so sad that the hotel is run down for the small bathrooms and old decor. It's an old hotel, the oldest in Boston I believe, people must realise that it has probably had the bathrooms added in later years hence the space, but perfectly adequate I have to add. The decor is in keeping with hotel, we had all mod cons flat screen TV and the most amazing bed, best couple of nights sleep I've had for ages, you had to actually climb up onto it it was so sumptuous. Also the hotel staff were all really friendly and made our stay wonderful, even the guys outside on the street and we hadn't even tipped them when we arrived. We also ate in Parkers restaurant which unbeknown to us was where JFK proposed to Jackie, food was very good but large portions. Great breakfast with a choice of buffet or menu, for a couple of dollars more the buffet was great with unlimited juice and coffee and the chef cooked omellettes to order. This hotel is in the perfect location, near shops and restaurants and the freedom trail starts right outside the hotel. Lots of historic buildings all around and the park just minutes away.The stop for the trolley tour is just up the hill so perfect for everything. Just one piece of advice if you go to visit old Ironsides in the dockyard you need photo ID to be allowed on. I did join the loyalty scheme before we went and we were given a top floor room with choice of free drinks in the morning. We were travelling from Boston to New hampshire to go skiing and the staff were very helpful with information and there even is an Omni hotel up in the white mountains which looks fantastic. If we visit Boston again we will be sure to stay at the Omni Parker House, thanks to the wonderful team for such a pleasant stay and making us feel welcome on our first visit to Boston

Reviews.Title: “The front desk manager is so MEAN (Louis)”
Reviews.Author: Jake R
Reviews.Content: First, I am a frequent traveller and i do business in the Boston area, so i am speaking with some sort of experience about hotels, especially in Boston. This hotel has a great location, it's very convenient, within few blocks from the main attractions in Boston. If you're looking for history, this is your spot. The rooms however are so small but clean. The food at the restaurant was good and so was the service (room service food bad and expensive). All the hotel stuff were nice EXCEPT a front desk manager, his name is Louis. He was VERY mean, and not professional. Someone from the hotel messed up with my reservation so it's their fault, and they put me in a very tiny room with no desk!!!!!!!!!! I spoke with the desk agent, who was nice and understanding, i asked to speak to the manager, and this guy showed up. First, he blamed it on me, and tried to make sound like i am the one who screwed my reservation. When i showed him the email i received, all he said was this " but we didn't have it in our system" OK. All this happening and he's talking to me like i did something wrong, he was meager and does not how to handle issues. He tried to offer me breakfast, but was too late for that. In general, the hotel is ok. if i didn't spoke with that guy, my stayed would had been better.

Reviews.Title: “If you want Peace and Quiet with in your Domain, this is not the Place! But let me finish!”
Reviews.Author: jvgaz
Reviews.Content: Ok, for those who wrote bad reviews you should have read the other reviews before booking this hotel! Now that being said, this is a OLD GEM of a HOTEL which is the oldest continuously operating hotel in the country. The walls are very thin and depending what your neighbor is doing next door, you will hear it! You will also hear every word spoken in the corridors too! Now you might think I'm going to give this hotel thumbs down, this is farthest from the truth. Our stay was fantastic and will return! So that being said some details. The standard rooms are very small, around 125sq and the deluxe rooms are 225sq which is what we stayed in. Bathrooms are very small, but very clean! Rooms have HiDef TV's and beds were very comfy! Don't expect a view unless you are in a suite. The lobby was of a by gone era and spotless, restaurant and bar was very nice! Staff from front desk to housekeeping were friendly and always spoke to guests and were very professional I highly recommend joining the Omni rewards program, this will get you free internet access in your room, turn down service, express check in, and a few other perks. Location was perfect, right on the freedom trail and 5 minute walk to Faneuial Hall, Cheers in Beacon Hill was a 10 minute walk. Blue line stops at Government center was a 3 block walk and the State street stop was 2 blocks, so getting from the Airport to this hotel is a breeze! fare from the airport was 2 bucks. Lastly DO NOT, I REPEAT DO NOT FORGET to get a Boston cream pie, which had it's start right in this hotel, and also get the Parker house rolls! One last think go to Wikipedia and read the history of this GEM!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Bueno
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal to stay at the Parker House 2/18/12. The hotel is one of the more historic places in Boston and is in a great location. Easy walk to Faneuil Hall, the North End and the Waterfront. The room was clean but verrry small. The view out the window was into the windows of another building about 20 feet away. The walls of the rooms are paper thin and you can hear everything that is going on in the rooms next to you and the hallways. While we had a good time and loved the location I would not come back as there are no shortages of hotels in Boston with better atmosphere, views and more spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: naxos0714
Reviews.Content: Great room and staff. Initially we were booked in their run of the house room. Upon entering the room I realized I would not fit on the bed as it was too small as I am tall. I returned to the front desk and explained my predicament. He immediately went to work finding a larger room/bed for us. They were fully booked, however, within a couple of hours somehow he found an acceptable room. Thanks to the staff we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs, a hair dryer and a fan”
Reviews.Author: nina9153
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying how much I love this hotel. The antiquity, the lobby, the location, all of it combines to make a stay here perfect. We arrived on a Friday and stayed two nights. The first thing I noticed was a lack of fan in the bathroom. I called Housekeeping, which informed me that "none of them work." Whoa. Okay ... Then I asked to have an Engineer show us how the heating/cooling system worked. They guy showed me the wall thermostat that could be adjusted and that was good to know. However, you cannot get the fan to stay on. It goes on to either cool or heat the room. I was up three times at least, adjusting it in the dark because the noise in the streets (sirens) and in the halls (bon vivants) kept waking me up. The beds were completely comfortable, high off the ground with a mattress topper and lots of duvets and comforters. On and off they went, depending on the room temp. After a great shower (very good pressure), I went to dry my hair. All heat and no fan. I thought it might burst into flames. Called Housekeeping. They sent up a hair dryer. This one was all fan and no heat. I called the Front Desk to ex(com)plain. "You want a third?" she asked, good-naturedly. Nah. The mirror in the bathroom, which is not spacious but adequate, is tiled at an angle, I guess to allow a fuller-length view of the body. However, it then blocks the light from above unless you think to move the top of the mirror back. Just odd. So, although this hotel should be a five-star experience, it ended up average for me because, at bottom, a hotel is for sleeping and that is not what we ended up enjoying the most. The second night I used ear plugs. My daughter, however, complained in the morning that it was too hot in the room and that she woke up sweating and throwing off the blankets. Again, a room should be absolutely perfect for sleeping and this one was not. Also, despite my complaints, nothing was offered to compensate and that is truly no one to engage customer loyalty. Sorry, Parker House!

Reviews.Title: “Historic gem”
Reviews.Author: Cashew50
Reviews.Content: After having read some bad reviews I was hesitant. It was a great stay. Fortunately we paid for an upgrade and got a king size bed. Otherwise, the smaller cheaper rooms only offer a double, not good with a partner that snores. The bathroom was very small but had all we needed. One plus is you can open the windows to get some fresh air and alleviate the sometimes stuffy hotel room air. The bar downstairs was awesome and my sidecar ginger martini to die for. The service was also very good. I can't wait to go back. We booked through Hotwire but paid 50 for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jahjah01
Reviews.Content: I arrived on an early morning flight many hours before check in. The staff was pleasant and allowed me to check in early with no problems, which I greatly appreciated. The room was small but clean, quiet and really well appointed. The bed was super comfortable. The hotel is centrally located with a lot of good places to eat nearby. I will certainly return soon.

Reviews.Title: “History, location, service, Boston Cream Pie: what's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: MayorMike
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip with my 16 year old niece (train up from NJ) and my 17 year old nephew down from Maine I bought the Omni on Priceline.com for about 125.00 (don't actually recall) but it was real bargain as normal room rates are more expensive. I have stayed in many many top star hotels thanks to Priceline and the Onmi lived up 100%. As a former Boston cabbie I recalled the location but had never stayed there before. Reading up on TripAdvisor I was a bit worried: some rooms have only one bed (3 people?) and views in some rooms look at a nearby wall. I wrote about our plans and threw ourselves on mercy of the Manager and heard from the Insurer of Loyalty assuring me all would be well. Our room when we arrived was great. Two beds and a view down the street towards Gov. Center. Friends: it pays to write nicely to the boss. We were happy as can be. The hotel is dead center for the waterfront, theatre district, commons, Beacon Hill, downtown, Faneuil Hall, etc. etc. The hotel: oldest continuous operating hotel in the USA, very well maintained and history kind of drips out of the place, cool genteel lobby with bars, cafe and restaurant, JFK proposed to Jacquie here, Boston Cream Pie was invented here, Parker House Rolls too, Dickens read The Christmas Carol for the public the first time here, etc. etc. And from the front door you can see the tower where Paul Revere saw the lantern that started our revolution. On the 2nd floor you can look into a mirror Charles Dickens looked at himself inâ€¦ is there a shadow? Everything is in great condition, that I saw, my niece worked out and loved the gym, the valet parking is not cheap but they kindly hid my gps for me and were very cheerful and helpful: the hotel truly has an old school sense of style and wears it well. Hallways were lovely. Elevators ran great. The rooms are not huge, the one we had, but very adequate, even with two kids. Smallish bathroom but I always love and appreciate the curved shower rods for extra room. Lots of towels and great "products". Big flat screen TV etc. etc. Lots of pillows! Anyway: I cannot say enough how nice the room was, how well placed the hotel is, how much of a great time we had there. Walls are thick: no noise. Oh yes: They invented Boston Cream Pie here so we ordered it up from room service at 1:30AM! Pie party. Okay it was 36.00 for 3 with the tip but that's called living it up and making it rain! I fully recommend the hotel to anyone. Even if you had a room without a view ...the location and the hotel itself make it well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: adventuregirl62
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel in the heart of the city. Great bar with a great bartender, Martin. Restaurant extremely expensive. Rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny. Biggest complaint is the windows don't open (even an inch) and the rooms get very stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and what we expected”
Reviews.Author: omahatravels49
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is a charming hotel in a fantastic location. We were visiting our daughter for a school break and booked an executive room with 2 queen beds and were very glad we did. The regular rooms we saw were quite small. There appeared to be just enough room to walk around the bed. The executive room had a sofa and chair in a sitting area as well as a desk. We did have drinks one evening in the bar and the service was nice. Breakfast at Parker's on Sunday was nice. When we called to make a reservation the host wasn't terribly clear on the breakfast/brunch times. We wanted a breakfast and it was just closing when we arrived but the chef was kind enough to keep the bar open and make omelets for us. He even came over to make sure we had everything before he closed down. We got a great package through the Omni sight that included valet parking ($42 per day). We didn't need to take the car out until we were ready to leave, as you can walk most anywhere in downtown or take a short cab ride. Overall, the Parker House makes for an enjoyable spot in a great location in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, exactly what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: jmortensen
Reviews.Content: The great location is the reason for the 4 star review. The hotel has the old charm feel but has updated amenities such as a flat screen television and new bathrooms. The double bed, standard room is simply too small for two people. I wanted to save money so I booked the room using a Hotwire deal for under $100/night knowing we would be getting the double bed room and assumed we could tough it out since we would only be there at night to sleep. I am no small guy though and fitting my girlfriend in the double bed comfortably was a chore. I would rather had the hotel jam a queen bed in the room and sacrifice whatever space there is to sleep comfortably. We also had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and was very pleased with the food.

Reviews.Title: “just not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: west_meets_east_2004
Reviews.Content: Small, hot, stuffy room with an incredibly uncomfortable bed. Though, the bathroom was freezing cold as the heater didn't work properly. Housekeeping was an abomination as they simply did a terrible job of making up the small room. Called maintenance 3 separate times to repair the heater in the bathroom to no avail. We're not even sure if they tried and failed, or simply ignored us. Our fine view of the neighboring building cast a long shadow over the room at all times. And, this place was NOT cheap! Even on Hotwire. So, just skip it...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvanHoes_Backpack
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful. Maybe a little expensive if you're a university student like me, where the bars sold $15 cocktails and the room, with parking and some room service came to about $250 - standard room, no view, very small. Not a place I would take kids, if I had any. But I was just there with my girlfriend, and we had no intentions of spending too much time in the room, other than when we were sleeping. A lot of history attached to the hotel too, as Charles Dickens, Nathaniel Hawthorne, JFK, and others used to hang out here. Also the apparent birthplace of both the Parker House Roll and Boston Cream pie. Some of the staff were a little dull, but get the right person and you can learn a lot about the fantastic building. One more thing, if you're using GPS be sure to put the zip code in as well as the address - apparently there are several School street's in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: DIANE W
Reviews.Content: Every staff member my husband and I interacted with, were absolutely fantastic! We could not ask for better service. The room was tastefully decorated and very cozy and comfortable. The food at Parker's Restaurant was wonderful!! I highly recommend the Omni Parker House to anyone planning a visit to Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: delgal
Reviews.Content: After reading alot of these reviews and just spending 2 nights at the Parker House, I agree with all the pros and cons. My husband attended a conference here and I came along. It's an historic hotel and I got the feeling I was stepping back in time - the room and hallway gave me a 1940's feel. The rooms were adequate, bathroom was small, and there could have been (should have been!) another piece of furniture in the room to put a suitcase and other incidentals on. Rooms were clean, beds very comfortable, location is great, close to shopping and small restaurants. I felt safe walking around and saw many people strolling in the evening. We had a banquet dinner in the hotel, which was very good. The famous Parker House rolls were fluffy and delicious. The only real drawback for me was the noise level. Guests walking down the hallway, cleaning people chatting all morning in the hallway, and even a child staying a few rooms away from ours - you hear it all. And for some reason I couldn't turn on the blower on the heating unit as white noise. Overall, I had a nice stay, but had to overcome the issues with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in boston-dirty old poor service too loud to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: traveller9898
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 of the worst hotels in all of boston it is old dirty horrible service terrible service people loud elevators old building could not sleep 2 out of the 4 nights because of noise from 3 am until 7 am no need for a wake up call you'll be awake at 6 am from noise. There is a reason they have to give away their rooms on hotwire!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: teryn
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Omni Parker House using Hotwire. Now, using Hotwire I expect to not be put in the nicest/biggest room. However, Hotwire's guarantee tthat the room will sleep the indicated number of people to me means 1 queen or king bed or 2 full. Not so at the Omni Parker House, where they give you one full size bed. The Omni will tell you that a full size bed comfortably sleeps 2 people. I don't agree. They didn't give us the option to upgrade, but did say that MOST people would find this acceptable, along with a pointed glance at my mid-section, which I took to be a hint that I could stand to lose a few pounds. I let that one go. . . . The lobby of the hotel is very nice and ornate; it's definitely more old school than modern, but it's very nice. The hallways were fine and the room itself, while dated, is clean and in good repair. We had a dresser, desk and full size bed and that took up most of the room; the room size was okay for us as we weren't there much, but if you wanted to lounge around in the room it might not be ideal. There is also a small closet. The bathroom is small but in good working order. Valet parking was $42, but that's pretty much par for the course for hotels in downtown Boston. You don't really need a car staying here, though - it is very central and within 3 blocks of three subway lines. It's a great location. We didn't eat at the restaurants, so I can't comment on those. Our room was next to the ice machine (expected when booking via HotWire), but this ice machine seemed exceedingly loud and made noise 24/7, so if you book via regular means I would be sure to request that your room not be nearby. We also had an up close and personal view of the offices next door, meaning the blinds had to be closed at all times; you should also keep that in mind. Also, if you book via HotWire you cannot take advantage of the loyalty program that allows free wi-fi etc., even if you area already a member.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Betty S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parker House for a couple of days while in Boston for a conference. I chose the Parker House because they offered an excellent online rate if you stay more than one night. So basically I chose it because of price, but after this experience, it will be my first choice for accommodations in Boston no matter what the price! All of the staff were extremely nice and helpful and the concierge service was excellent. The room I booked really seemed kind of small from the pictures online, but in actuality, it was far from it. Very large with a nice sized desk and all of the usual ammenities. Wifi costs $10/day but if you sign up with Omni, which is free to do, the wifi is free, and you get a bunch of other things courtesy of the hotel. So, that's a no brainer. My only gripe is parking. There isn't any unless you pay the $42/day for hotel parking, which is a little steep for me, but I did it anyway. That being said, the service was excellent and I didn't have to mess around with parking my car, I don't parallel very well, so that was kind of a relief. Location is super. I could walk to the park and to some terrific restaurants. All in all a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Such History”
Reviews.Author: janiensk
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, right in the centre, on the Freedom Trail, could see it from the window. Beds so comfy that did not want to get up!! This is where Kennedy wooed Jackie, lots of history and great intimate bars within hotel, little notes to inform you of various famous staff. Absolutely perfect. Join their frequent stayer for free and get little extras on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Kati L
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled to Boston in January and stayed at this wonderful Hotel! From the moment we walked in we knew we had chosen correctly. The ambience of this historic hotel was exactly what we had hoped for. From the staff who greeted us, to the darling room, this hotel met all of our expectations! While the rooms were a bit on the small side, it mattered not! The decor was impeccable, the beds were so comfortable and the staff helpful! We were within walking distance to great restaurants and wonderful shopping! When I return to Boston, this is, without question, where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on School Street”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Last minute decision to stay over in Boston prior to a west coast trip so I went Priceline w/ 4 stars in downtown in Boston as how coukld I go wrong at a great price? Well, it ended up as the worst stay in any hotel since I have been travelling over the last 30 years. Actually pretty excited as I got Omni Parker House and I had passed it a number of times and had walked through the lobby in the past which reminds me of old world elegance, albeit, a mite shabby. Checked in and as the front desk was handing me the keys (my wife and I) he slipped it in w/ a smile that I had a nice room w/ a full size bed. I told him(will take it up w/ priceline) that Priceline guarantees a bed for 2 people and of the numerous times I have used Priceline it is either a queen bed or two doubles or fulls. The desk clerk immediately launched into telling me the ONLY way I could get a queen bed was to upgrade at $50 and his sales department set the policy and he was listening to it. After a few minutes of give and take and w/o wanting to make a scene we said we would check it out before making a judgment. Well, it was a very small room w/ a very small bed facing the back alley and clearly was not for two people so I called down and spoke w/ the manager. Have got to believe this was a staff room. Ugly conversation w/ the on duty manager and he ended up threatening to escort me out and verfied that it was a sell up policy but I should have booked it differently and it was all my fault. I offered to split the upgrade, he kept shouting at me that I was changing his words so I just caved and gave up. Too embarrasing... he kept summarizing position which I had not staed and it was a very unnecessary conflict. It was clear this was a sell up. We actually ended up habving a great dinner at a nearby restaurant, a wonderful walk @ Boston and a great breakfast at a nearby coffee house. Good trip but certainly marred by this exchange. The issue was that the manager made it so nasty, that I started noticing the peeling paint/wallpaper in the room, the too small bathroom w/ no room to even put your bathroom essentials, the thin walls where we got woken up in the morning twice by hallway exchanges, the mini bar on a basket in the room rather than locked away and all the little things that spoil a good hotel visit. Would have liked to say that all the little things saved the visit after such a disappointing management response but it was all downhill. Love Boston but unfortunately will avoid this place....

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend..”
Reviews.Author: 1974Gigi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Central to everything and we were able to walk almost everwhere from the hotel. The hotel lobby is very nice and the staff is pleasant and informative. We booked through priceline, so we got a good rate but upon check in found that all of our requests were upgrades (i.e 2 double beds, joining rooms, king bed...all upgrades) I def. felt like we were being nickle and dimed a bit. As soon as we arrived upstairs I immediatley felt liek I just stepped into, "The Shining" the long delapitated hallways, it just gave me that feeling. The rooms are TINY! The bathrooms are TINY! So if you are booking here (like we did) expecting 4 star rooms, you will not get it. The air conditioning units in the windows block ALL light, so you feel like you are in a box the whole time. The rooms and hallways are run down. I get that they are trying to pull off the whole historical hotel thing, but it is time for an upgrade to the rooms, hallways, elevator banks...... If I were to go to Boston again, I would for sure stay elsewhere. It is not the worst hotel I have been in, but I travel enough to know what other hotel offer and look like and what this hotel was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great service great room”
Reviews.Author: johns012
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is a great place to stay in Boston. The staff is terrific. They always go above and beyond to ensure you're taken care of. I recommend signing up for the Omni select guest program, no cost, but you get beverage service in the morning, newspaper, and wifi. I can't say enough about the service, never been dissapointed everyone is great. Some rooms are a bit small but always spotless. I stay in hotels around 60 nights a year and this is a favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for a business trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: SF2UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker house for a business trip from Jan 13th - 19th 2012. Was looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the downtown area, that was convenient for public transportation as I needed to travel on the T to Newton each day. Check in was extremely quick and efficient and was told about a free loyalty program I could sign up for which would give me wifi in my room for free during my duration. I had booked a jr bedroom...which I was expecting to be really small. However, either I was upgraded or the jr bedroom wasn't that JR. The room was pleasantly a decent size and the bathroom was huge. Outside of that, the room was clean and had all the things you'd expect a hotel of that caliber to have. The one not so great thing was the food offered. They had a nicer restaurant called Parkers or something like that that was a little too expensive for what I could expense on the company. The other food option in the hotel was at the bar/pub...and I must admit that the choices didn't look that appealing. That being said, you're in Boston and there are plenty of other great restaurants within walking distance. Overall, great value for the money (I got a room for around $100/night); really close to public transportation; nice, attentive staff; and clean. What more could you ask. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Indell79
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful and the staff was very friendly. My husband loved the gym. We had a package that included parking. Wish it also included breakfast, as it was a little bit expensive. We ate there because it was convenient. Really comfortable bed, clean room,but overall the room was tight. Would stay here again and maybe get a slightly larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Great location...”
Reviews.Author: vbrody
Reviews.Content: We stayed In the Parker House for 6 nights over the new year and honestly we were a bit worried as a lot of the reviews say the rooms are small but when we checked in we were given the option of a small room with a view or a larger room with no view, we chose the larger room and it was perfect no complaints at all,it was on the 11th floor and was a corner room so had 2 windows, not a great view from one but from the other we had a lovely view of the skyline. The bathroom was perfect and the pressure from the shower was great, its the one thing i look forward to when travelling abroad :) There was a small room beside the bathroom that had the iron safe etc which we used to store the huge amount of shopping we did. The hotel itself is in a perfect location no matter where you want to go to and even though we have been to Boston on a number of previous occasions we never realised how easy it was to get to all the places on our '' to do'' list. We had signed up for the select guest program and had complimentary wifi and beverages every morning. We will definitely be staying in the Parker House again.See you there for First Night 2013. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Cardinal51
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline's name your own price for a 2 night stay in Boston. To my surprise I "won" the Parker House. The room was on the small side but fine for my needs. The bed was really comfortable and the room was immaculate. The bathroom was also small but again, for my needs, perfect. The hotel itself is ideally located and an easy walk to different neighborhoods. I would look forward to staying at the Parker House again. Oh, and for parking, I parked at the Post Office Square parking lot. Entered Friday at 5 and left Sunday at 7am and the total was only $18.00 versus Parker House @ $48.00 per day! Short walk about 8 minutes, worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, classic and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: purplesuitcaseblues
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. This hotel is grand and beautiful. The service was pleasant and attentive. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed... My only disappointment was the fact that I didn't have a very good view from my room on the seventh floor, but thereâ€™s really nothing to be done for that. I was actually really looking forward to being centrally located in downtown Boston and being able to overlook the city skyline. Instead, I was able to overlook the side of a building and an alley. Slightly less intoxicating.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of History”
Reviews.Author: SymnCwl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful lobby, charming bar, and was able to get a room upgrade when complained about the size of the first one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: Daysie76
Reviews.Content: If I could recommend some changes it would be to make sure that the alarm clocks work and that the tv is easy to use, but those were my only complaints. The housekeeper on my floor was really sweet, the concierge staff was excellent, and the food was good yet reasonable priced! The hotel overall lived up to my standards!

Reviews.Title: “Historic and great location for Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: TonyDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Omni Parker House Hotel was a real treat. the staff were efficient although I'd wonder why printing from rooms seems to be franchised to the hotel shop and therefore has no direct customer service available in the evenings. From the splendour of the lobby to the atmosphere of the surrounds, it's quite an experience. A busy hotel, but well managed meaning the guest feel their needs are well catered for, be it luggage, taxis or local information. Nice touch in summer was the complimentary ice cream in the afternoons. Room was very tastefully appointed , if a little tight for a family of four and had little space for the accompanying luggage. I'd certainly recommend this hotel for others and booking in advance meant it was more reasonably priced than I'd have expected for it's location and style.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: janet4g
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Old Hotel right on the Freedom Trail. North End close enough to walk to dinner. The staff was very helpful especially the Concierge service. I have been to Boston a few times before but will stay here on my next trip. More than just location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Good business stop as a couple”
Reviews.Author: Clonket
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with my husband on a business trip. We had an executive room. nice size, huge king size bed. Only negative was the bathroom was so small my husband could barely fit through door and close it behind him. The shower was small but had a great shower head, it was therapeutic. I would stay here again. We had room 804 and there are two separate entrances into hallway so it's a little more noisy and light shined from hallway through door so room never really got dark.. Room service was great also. And staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great history for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Trevor M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni over New Years weekend. None of us had ever been to Boston so weren't sure where we should be staying in the city so that we were close to all the action. From the moment we arrived on the Friday night we knew we made the right choice. I do most of my travelling for business so I try to stay in some of the higher hotel chains but since we were travelling with friends, we decided to stay on a budget. The Omni rate was incredibly low for what they were offering. We thought it was a mistake. Stepping into the lobby feels like stepping back into time. Complete with fresh hot apple cider for guests. We were lucky enough to get into the "haunted" room 1012 which added. Areally cool experience. At night they have security standing by the elevators to make sure no randoms make their way up to your floor which I really appreciated. The concierge did an awesome job explaining where in the city we could get to by foot and by cab. We were able to see most tourist spots by foot (had to take a cab back after shopping though). Bottom line. A clean, historic, affordable, place to stay in Boston. I really enjoyed staying there and wouldn't hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Parker House- a warm oasis on a cold, snowy day”
Reviews.Author: CB-Mass
Reviews.Content: Booked an overnight at the Omni Parker to celebrate a friend's birthday. Ofcourse it was snowing on Saturday and instead of leaving early we left leominster around noon. due to the condition of the roads it took us three hours to get to the hotel instead of the usual hour. Slipping up Park Street with snow swirling, slush on the sidewalks and the wind blowing once I entered the lobby it was majical. Beautiful deep colors and a warm ambiance welcomed us. the front desk was friendly and got us in the room quickly. Small room but very comfortable beds, a nice view of the King James Church in lights helped us to relax and get out into the city for food and drinks. Good breakfast the next day, park house rolls, bacon, eggs and all the morning foods plus excellent coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring the city!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy R
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is dated, it is clean and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Hilbertos78
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent! Right in the centre and walking distance to many of the sites. Like many American hotels the staff were friendly and very helpful giving tips and advice. The room we had wasn't the biggest but was clean and traditional. There was also a rustic charm about the place just don't expect the room to be 5 star, 3 and a half star at best. Having said this if you want a nice historic hotel, with great service and with easy access to all the main sites at good value for money then this place is ideal. This was the first stop in a 6 leg tour of New England back in Sept 2008, have some great memories and loved Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect historic setting”
Reviews.Author: RJMcLeod
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the Omni Parker House. The location on the Freedom Trail could not have been more amazing for seeing the downtown sites. Just entering the lobby felt like stepping back in time.The hotel was comfortable and so well-kept. Additionally, the Last Hurrah Bar was a great way to end each evening. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable...but can get pricey!”
Reviews.Author: JBRed
Reviews.Content: For the price, I thought our room was a bit cramped and only had a double bed. It was an incredibly comfortable bed though. The building was beautiful and filled with history but the stay was riddled with unexpected fees. Only parking option onsite is valet which was over $40/night and seemed very slow. Also had to pay daily for wifi. Not bad for a night, but can really add up for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not your Cookie Cutter Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Central_MA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the Boston area and decided to do a weekend getaway last minute. It was a beautiful hotel, we upgrade when we got there to the executive suite! A must! It was so nice I did not want to leave the room. I have nothing bad to say about the chains, Hilton, Hyatt etc this was just a nice place and reasonable priced! If you can Book this Hotel you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Why not”
Reviews.Author: ACoonin
Reviews.Content: If you are in Boston, why not stay at the historic Parker house. The location can not be beat. While you're at it,try a Parker house roll from the namesake

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junit1988
Reviews.Content: Great location walking distance to most Places & railway just down the street Very friendly staff and rooms are very well kept

Reviews.Title: “it was a know hotel”
Reviews.Author: phyllism38
Reviews.Content: This was one of the first hotels I stayed at when i went into the travel industry. It was very old but has been updated. Use to have on of the Celtic signing in the bar

Reviews.Title: “Small, well equiped rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Ileana
Reviews.Content: I had to make last minute hotel reservations for the JMM in Boston. The hotel rooms were small but well appointed. My room was in the back without view so it was mostly noise free. The room was clean with nice supplies in the bathroom. The hotel is a quick trip to the South Station Amtrak and the Hynes Convention Center by subway. Subway stop is only about 2 min walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fat_Rick99
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Clean, elegant, and very friendly. There's a lot if history here, too. One of the hotel's lobby "ambassadors", Shamus, was so helpful in helping us plan our activities and restaurant selections. I can't say enough about how valuable his services were. Be sure to seek him out. The drawbacks? The rooms, very European-like, were small and we had NO view to historic Boston at all; only a red brick wall about 15 feet away with a view into other guests' rooms. The bar was particularly pricey, but with quaint wall-to-wall bars all around the hotel, we were not without choices. (We watched the Patriots/Broncos game at a bar up the street). Would I go back? You betcha!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ana S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and stayed at the Omni Parker House while we were in Boston. We took the Amtrak up from New York City and we didn't have very good walking directions from the station to the hotel. So we decided to call them after we arrived and were put on hold for at least 10 minutes. We both tried calling and each time were transferred to the concierge. That was no help at all. We even tried asking complete strangers and looking on a street map. Eventually, after probably 45 minutes we found it. My suggestion is to have walking directions ready, since it's not too far of a walk from the Amtrak station, and not to call the hotel to ask for directions since they were no help at all. We were able to check in pretty quickly and were helped up to our room. The rooms are very tiny, but the ambiance and history of the hotel is very nice. The hotel is near various restaurants and shopping and the Freedom Trail is easily accessible. We were able to walk to the famous "Cheers" bar and restaurant from the hotel, as well as the Freedom Trail which we both really enjoyed since we like history. All in all, it was an enjoyable stay if you're looking for a hotel within walking distance of attractions, at a reasonable price compared to other places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Living History”
Reviews.Author: maxclancy72
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to get a feel for old Boston. Entering the lobby, Parker Restaurant, and Parker Bar are like taking a step back in time. The rooms a show their age a bit but in a good way. Service was impeccable. Wellfleet oysters on the half shell with a cocktail at the bar are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here years ago.Nice then,better now.Top summer location...”
Reviews.Author: tluddy1
Reviews.Content: This place only gets better with age. Home of Parker hose rolls, and Boston cream pie. Classy in a old world way. Reserved ambience. Excellent location for walking. Spring, summer, and fall. Boston Garden, (Swan Boats), easy walk. Gov.Center, and other points of interest not far. Hotel is on the Freedom Trail. Rooms bit small, but nicely done, and very clean. They could use more soundproofing, as many sounds from the hall, and other rooms filter thru. We had a high floor, with a good view of the city. Parking is at the back of the hotel, and for Boston, not overly expensive. We ate at the bar, below, which was very good. Make sure you have the Boston Cream Pie. Is almost as good as my wife`s. Staff very nice. Would come again..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: kjtrunky
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week over New Year and could not fault the hotel. The location is just great for walking around the north Boton area or getting a train out to the City Art Galleries and Airport. Had an excellent meal in the restaurant and would highly recommend the Sirloin Tips and a glass of Malbec.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Service with New World Amenities”
Reviews.Author: GoodWilliam
Reviews.Content: I recently have stayed at three Ritz-Carltons (Philadelphia, Toronto, Dallas), the Westin Kierland Resort (Scottsdale, AZ), and various other high-quality hotels. I spend more than 100 nights per year in hotels, and I can say without any reservation that the Omni Parker House has the finest staff of any hotel I ever have visited (including destination resorts such as the Hamilton (Bermuda) Princess and the Fairmont Lake Louise). The Omni Parker House combines incredible historical location, an unmatched ambiance that is saturated with tradition, and beautifully-maintained original craftsmanship to provide the best of both worlds if one enjoys honoring the past while enjoying the comforts of modernity. There are many nice buildings in my travels, though. What sets the Omni Parker House apart is the management and literally every member of the staff with whom I ever have had contact: the loyalty ambassador who is cheery despite my turbulent, frequent schedule-changes; chambermaids who are never intrusive yet always vigilant about my individual needs; the bell staff (which I never need but from whom I always get a courteous and sincere greeting); the food service folks who literally cater to my desire to have a nice glass of wine and a fruit basket in my room. If something is not running to the staffâ€™s satisfaction, I have had senior management apologize to me directly! Unheard of! They really, really care. I could stay at any one of about a half- dozen hotels that are well-located for my business in Boston. It is a no-brainer. This is home away from home, and while I am fascinated and in love with the building, it is the people that make it great. It is one-of-a-kind, at the very top of the industry.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute Here”
Reviews.Author: GreatescapesNewYork
Reviews.Content: This place had the historic charm and modern amenities to make our stay in Boston perfect. The structure is old, but in a charming way. Rooms were spacious enough and very clean. The staff here was wonderful and very accommodating. Be sure to sign up for the Loyalty Program before arriving. Once there, it allows for free internet (pretty fast too) water bottles and coffee/tea/juice delivery daily. The only "problem" we encountered was that we could hear the people entering their rooms (New Years Eve/Day) as if they were literally entering ours. While this isn't a real fault of the hotel, the walls do seem pretty thin. Overall, we would definitely recommend to others especially since their beds were extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel - Some issues with rooms (size and view)”
Reviews.Author: HawkEye935
Reviews.Content: Well, the Parker House is a charming hotel, right beside the Freedom Trail and in front of the Commons. Hotel's location is then excellent, being close to almost every touristic place in Boston downtown. There is a kind of enchanted atmosphere in the lobbies, which let you spend your time like in a movie. There are just a couple of drawbacks; there aren't many restaurants in the surroundings to have dinner and, more important, most of rooms are small and directly face (6 ft.?) the brick wall of an office building (with its windows, of course). I mean it's like you share your room with employees at work during business hours. I'd recommend not to book the "petite" room (which is really small), and even the "traditional" room is small (hardly suitable for a solo traveller, despite the fact that the hotel says it's good for a couple, maybe they have in mind The Seven Dwarfs); if travelling in couple, book at least the "superior" room (even if most of those rooms share, with the cheaper ones, the brick wall view). .

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Harvjd1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Omni Parker House for a weekend getaway in December. The hotel is grand and historic.Our room was nicely appointed, very clean and spacious enough for 2 of us to be comfortable. Probably the best feature of the Omni Parker House is the location. On the Freedom Trail, minutes to North End, Faniel Hall, Boston Common, Theather District. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmom82
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the Omni Parker House over New Years Eve. Everything was exceptional. Customer service on the phone making reservations was great. The double beds were a bit small for our kids to share, queen would've been nicer. But, the hotel had a wonderful ambience, and very helpful staff. The Freedom Trail is right outside the door. We were able to walk to so many tourist sights. The view out our window was not great (wall of another building), but I guess thats hard to avoid in a city. The downtown neighborhood was great for Freedom Trail access. However, we went to church at the nearby St. Anthony's Shrine upon the hotel's recommendation for Sunday Mass. We were told it would be a "three minute walk". Turned out to be much farther than that, and the dark, semi-deserted streets had more than a few questionable characters wandering about. (we went to church at 5:30 pm). Overall, it was a great stay in a beautiful, historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but such a small bed!!”
Reviews.Author: Sailorsteph
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the start of a 2 week holiday. The people at the reception were very helpful and the location for us was perfect. The room was small, but manageable! The main problem for us was the super small beds! The rooms were nicely laid out and the bed looked lovely, but sleeping two people in it was a struggle, they were high off the ground and any movement would wake the other person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 850MurphyM
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but to be expected for age of hotel. The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and the location can't be beat! Easy walk to everything in Boston and the T is almost across the street. We enjoyed our stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Omni”
Reviews.Author: Anna19-19
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Boston for a pleasure trip. We stayed at the Parker House Omni Hotel which is the oldest consistently run hotel in the country as well as the home of the Parker House rolls and Boston Cream Pie. The location is excellent - right beside the Freedom Trail and walking distance to everything! Since it is the oldest hotel the rooms were a little small which is the only reason I give it 4 and not a 5. The staff was very attentive and helpful. We ate at the restaurant which was excellent. They were very accomodating to a friend who has food allergies. We also went to the bar and even there were greeted and remembered by the manager. It has the old rich feel of the wonderful hotel it is. I woud stay there again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile stay - with caveats”
Reviews.Author: StevesReviews
Reviews.Content: Let me please start this review off by saying the people who work for this hotel are very good at what they do and share a pleasant quality in dealing with customers. Our stay was for one night during the Xmas-New Year's week. Upon arrival, the check in agent asked us if we wanted to wait for a room with a great view, or take the room they had available. We said we would wait, dropped off our bags, and headed off to the Museum of Science/Bunker Hill etc. Agent/Bellman etc all very nice. They have little back packs for the kids also that are a very nice touch. Got back, tired, went to room - and - uhhhh - well basically there was no view. Now I'm not a pain in the neck about this kind of stuff, but given that we were told the wait would yield an amazing view, and it didn't (unless you like looking at office buildings) that was dissapointing, but not a hige deal. The room itself was on the 9th floor - next to a suite. Nicely furnished, ample space in fact better than expected given other reviews i've seen. Beds were VERY Comfortable. Entire room was clean and updated so no complaints at all there - in fact surpassed expectations. Now here's the two (only) issues i had with the hotel. First - the room we stayed in had two doors to enter/exit. We entered the room, latched the door, and left through the other. No big deal right ? Well yeah it kinda was. Apparently we were not supposed to leave through the other door (which would have been extremely useful information) because upon return, our keys would not work. It's ~9pm and I have a tired family.......so working on borrowed time. Call down to front desk, person was less than sympathetic (only person i encountered not really nice) basically asking me how this happened - ummmm it's your hotel i just want to get into my room. I was forwarded to front office whoc sent up a bellman with new keys - guess what - they don't work either (was apologetic) and asked me if i was told not to use this door......uhhhhhh if I had been I wouldn't be standing here with you :) So he stays up there - calls security who comes up and uses his master key - guess what - doesn't work. So they now need to call maintenance (again everyone was nice) who asked me the same question about using the door. Now I'm a pretty even keeled guy, and I kept my cool - but they could tell I was at the end of my rope on patience. So eventually we get back into the room after about 30min which was unfortunate, but let me reiterate the experience was not made worse because the staff were quick to arrive and tried to be helpful. The other note to mention is the sundries store downstairs, big sign says closing at 10pm - it is 9:15 - we walk in to buy water and were told rudely "We're closed" uhhhhh okay but your sign says 10pm, response was "well it was slow" I mean all we wanted were bottles of water, but hey everyone has an off day i guess. To their credit - the hotel staff overheard this - apologized and brought us some bottles from the check in desk which was nice. The breakfast buffet was really nice as a side note, the hotel lobby and areas were clean and nicely done - the hotel has a lot of charm. I'd suggest this place as a stay, but if there are two doors - always use the one you came in originall ;)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: kansas28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for a long girls weekend. It was perfect. The location is wonderful. So much to see and do within walking distance and close to subway. Service was very good. Food excellent. We had breakfast there every morning and it was tasty plus a good value. Loved the bar. Great place to unwind after a grueling day of sightseeing. Room was very nice and bigger than expected after reading some of the reviews. Not huge - it is an old hotel after all. Only snafu. I asked about printing boarding passes. Was referred to the little office/work area. But you had to pay to use the computer and I didn't really want to do that. When I referred to this in their follow up questionnaire, they replied that they would have printed them free. So I should have asked again. Not sure why I didn't! I would stay there again. Really loved it. Got a very good deal I think with a Travelocity package.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aussie1313
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel which is in a fantastic location to explore Boston. It's a historic hotel with a lovely reception area and helpful staff. The concierge recommended and booked a great restaurant for us around the corner (The Oceanaire) and we were given a free entree as a result. I ate breakfast twice in the hotel and had dinner once in the dining room. The food was of good quality. The breakfast buffet was good value and it includes omlettes cooked to order. On the downside the room I was in on the 8th floor was the size of a prison cell. I can't recall staying in a room so small and for US$220/night I expected more. The bathroom was also tiny but it had some nice toiletries. I have also never had to walk so far from the lift to my room. Up and around winding corridors and beware some floors have staicases you need to traverse. If you have a lot of luggage I'd suggest you get the porter to help. Overall while the location is great I probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service - Excellent Location - Pretty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mytibt
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in many of the other reviews, the Omni Parker House's location is ideal for tourists and business travelers, alike.
