It is the most central (no more than 15-20 min by foot) to the North End, Boston Common, Theater District, Chinatown, etc. It is also nearby a number of great eateries i.e. Beantown Pub, Silvertone, Sam LaGrassas. We walked to the Prudential Tower one morning and even that only took about 30 min. The cool thing about the surrounding environment is the fact that you will run into alot of locals and not just other tourists. The property meanwhile, is clean and well maintained. Decor is classically elegant and rooms are quaint and nicely furnished. Nice touch with the scenic channel and music as part of the turn-down service. Heating / cooling was fast to respond. The rooms that offer a city view provide for sights of the Old City Hall, Granary Burial Grounds, and high risers. However, the rooms are generally on the smaller size, which is understandable considering the building's age. Even though there's not much that one can do about this, it does have to factor into the overall rating. I definitely recommend grabbing a drink at the bar - wide selection of spirits and nice street view for people watching. With regard to service, the Omni did not dissapoint. Service usually carries the most weight for me when rating a hotel and our Loyalty Ambassador, Kate C, was awesome. I had talked with her / her staff six months prior with information about the trip (my fiance's 40th birthday) and it felt like they took alot of notes, because alot of thought was put into the welcome package. The best part for me, was the hand-written / signed Birthday Card. Kudos to Kate for this one. House-keeping, front-desk, and lobby staff were all very pleasant as to be expected. For service and location alone, I would stay at the Omni for future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for our weekend getaway to Boston. It was Labor Day weekend and Boston was hopping. Hotel was walking distance to all major tourist sites.The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating with questions, request, directions.We did not try the restaurant as there are so many good restaurants right in the area of the hotel. I would definitely go back to the Omni Parker House

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff, Fantastic Location & Fantastic Scotch Menu!”
Reviews.Author: ogtgrl88
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House was the perfect place to stay for my trip to Boston. Not only is it located in close proximity (walking distance) to Government Square, Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall, Newbury Street, the North End, Boston Commons and Downtown Crossing but there are also three very close subway stations that allow easy access to the rest of the city. This area of the city also seemed to be very safe and as a lone female traveler that was very important to me. Having arrived extremely early (about 9 am) I was checked immediately into a room which was than immediately stripped of all down and feather products (due to an allergy). Not only that but they offered to hold my luggage if I would have rather waited for a room to be deep cleaned if my allergy was severe. The bell hop showed me to my room and pointed out everything Iâ€™d need to know throughout the lobby and my room. Everyone, the concierge, bartenders, wait staff, bellhops, housekeepers, etc. all went out of their way to say hello, smile, and be helpful without being over zealous or being too invasive. While I didnâ€™t try a lot of the food at the restaurants, the breakfast buffet was mediocre and as was my caesar salad, however located so close to so many other restaurants this isnâ€™t a problem. The Last Hurrah located in the lobby by the Tremont Street entrance serves excellent cocktails with an extensive single malt/scotch menu. This hotel was perfect for my travels with my only complaint being the walls were a bit thin as I could hear the family spread across three rooms down the hall from me running about, laughing, etc. Iâ€™m sure however if I brought this to the attention of the staff that it would have been handled in an appropriate manner. I will not hesitate to return to the Omni Parker hotel for future trips to Boston and will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historical hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AJulie
Reviews.Content: Great location, right by the main touristic attractions of the Freedom Trail. The architecture of the place is amazing! The room we got was tiny, but really clean and very silent, I had a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: TwinCityTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: I was pretty happy when I booked a room at the Parker house for $55/night on priceline (for a total of $70/night). The hotel has some interesting history and is located in the heart of "the hub." Park Street station is just a block or two away, and from there you can catch a trolley or train and get just about anywhere in Boston. Other aspects of the hotel were pretty disappointing. For one, the only onsite parking option is valet at $42/night. It takes the valet 25-30 mins to get your car (after waiting a while to get an operator), so it is not the most convenient option. Second, the room that I got through priceline was a "traditional room" with a single full-sized bed. This room is really small and is just barely suitable to double occupancy. Finally, as other reviewers have noted, the hotel needs some updating. All in all, I am satisfied with the deal I got, but I do not think that this hotel should be labeled four star and I would not be very happy if I had paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: UkAwayfromhome
Reviews.Content: Having already experienced the "Omni Service" in DC, we did not have high hopes for the Parker House. But boy were we in for a shock! We arrived in the middle of a rain storm (not the hotel's fault) but we were offered NO assistance with our bags through the revolving door and up the small flight of stairs (side entrance). We were then greeted by a look of disdain by the lobby team who could barely speak to us when we asked for help in checking in. Check was fine and well managed by a girl from the UK ! but the initial room that we were put into was tiny, fortunately they did manage to move us to a larger room. Every time we came down to the lobby in the lift of came back to the hotel from a day out we were asked to explian what we were doing in the hotel, maybe out British accents worreid the staff. As with our Omni experience in DC we really don't know what all the fuss is about, and I am a member of the loyalty programme, goodness knows why! Location is great but that is about all I can say that is positive.

Reviews.Title: “History, location and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: shelandi
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is my home in Boston, just beautiful and in the heart of the city! It is close to all subway stations and great shopping. I love the restaurant for the brunch, Parker House rolls and of course Boston Cream pie. Drinks are great too, I recommend the Sage Advice cocktail too. The beds are great, only real complaint is that walls are somewhat thin. Front of the hotel is louder than the back. Government rate is very reasonable. Don't forget to ask for it if you qualify.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: busymum1234
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here 1st Decenber for 4 nights. As we were on our own we wanted some where we felt safe. The Omni Parker was home from home, the staff, from reception to porters to cleaners, were lovely friendly and helpfull when needed. The reviews we read before we went said the rooms were small, they were but cosy, warm and clean. The hotel is in a great location with brueggers bagel bakery just across the street for your morning coffee and bagel. We were 15 minutes from the Italian district were you were spoilt for choice with restaurants and you must visit Mike's Pastry shop. To die for cakes!!! We will be going back to Boston and will stay in the Omni Parker.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Christopher G
Reviews.Content: When I arrived early I was given an early check in, but I wanted two fulls rather than a single bed. They granted me this, at no charge, with an early check in to boot. After a long afternoon of entertaining clients into a late evening with friends I returned in less optimal condition...lol. Woke up and left, realizing I lost a very expensive watch and returned and was unable to find it. Calling a few days later not only had someone turned it in, but the hotel had it, in perfect condition and shipped it, insured, at no cost. It arrived with a letter from the head of security wishing me well. UNREAL! I will stay at no other location as this is obviously a testament to the management culture and its staff....

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Katheethecamper
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Parker House twice this year. Last was Dec 9th through the 11th. This hotel has exceptional service. The concierge, Joseph, went out of his way before, and after our visit to accommodate us. He sent packets of maps, and things to do. He ordered our tickets for the holiday pops, which is a must see. The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail. It is best to take a guided tour, and spend time on your own. The hotel is historic, and a full book of details is given to you at check in. It has wonderful, antique charm. Be aware that if you enjoy contemporary, this is not the place for you. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are small, and the neighbors can be heard through the walls. Unfortunately, we didn't have nice quiet neighbors that weekend. The breakfast buffet is exceptional, but expensive. If you sign up for Omni membership the kids will get a backpack of goodies on check in, and cookies and milk delivered to the room the first night. Don't miss the Boston cream pie, it originated here. This hotel is in the heart of the city. The airport, and Science Museum are accessed by the very safe Boston subway system. Tickets are $2.00. Much cheaper then a cab. Visit the Northern section (Italy) to experience some of the finest dining in Boston. This city is beautiful, and has wonderful American historic experiences. Great for families, and couples who want an adult experience. You won't be disappointed. One other great thing about the Parker House. The will allow you to check in early. We flew in from Philadelphia both times, and were up since 3am. They allowed us to check in by 9:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: LovesPR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night right after thanksgiving. The room rate was great (through hotwire). This is a historic Boston hotel with small rooms. The best part of our stay was being close to great areas of town like Quincy market and Beacon Hill. Also very close to Gov. Center and Park Street T stops. Would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Historical icon”
Reviews.Author: Elussv
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Omni Parker house. The room was extremely clean and the housekeepers were very attentive. They don't mention this on the booking, but they offer free Wifi if you register to the omni select program which is also free! As some of the negative reviews mention, booking with hotwire means the room was near an ice machine and you get a double bed, but for the money paid it was excellent. At the end of the day, if you're a heavy sleeper, you get to stay in a beautiful and clean hotel for very little money. I'd recommend the hotel to everyone. Also, the location was great! Close to the Italian north end and right on the freedom trail!

Reviews.Title: “Historic elegance”
Reviews.Author: RobertP47
Reviews.Content: This was our 4 stay at the Parker and I don't know why I haven't reviewed it before. As always, we were warmly greeted by the hotel staff and check in was a breeze. Actually, the receptionist said there were rooms ready but would we like a room with a view - we said yes and were told it would be an hour or so, which was ok with us. We were given a 6th floor end room which was quite spacious and the bathroom was slightly larger than the ones on previous visits. The room was very comfortable (as was the king-size bed) and my only (slight) complaint was that a bit of the wallpaper in the bathroom was lifting. This hotel is centrally located, which was the main reason we first chose it, and the valet parking is convenient, if a bit expensive. Parkers Bar was very pleasant for evening drinks but I was disappointed that the Last Hurrah (one of my favorite bars anywhere) was closed on the Sunday we were there. As always, the staff were very friendly and courteous throughout the hotel and we were very comfortable. We had breakfast on our first morning in the splindid Parkers Restaraunt but watch out! We ordered what we thought was a small modestly priced breakfast with juice and coffee. The final price was only a couple of dollars less than the all-you-can eat buffet, so I must remember that the next time I visit. The only thing that marred the stay was that it took almost half an hour for the valet service to bring my vehicle at the end of our visit. However, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Alhowt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in Boston on a British Airways deal. There was a choice of about 3 hotels but after reveiwing each of them on Trip Advisor, the obvious choice was the Omni Parker House. It was definitely the right decision. Before travelling my wife registered as an Omni member which gave us a free bottle of water on arrival, tea/coffee delivered to the room each morning and free wi-fi. The journey from the airport took approximately 20 minutes. The lobby of the hotel is a sight to behold. You can feel the history oozing from every corner and can imagine what it must have been like back in the 1920's or 30's with loads of glamorous people arriving in big cars. Sorry, got carried away for a minute! Check in was very staright forward and we were given a room on the 12th floor with a king-size bed. The room was not massive but more than adequate for our short stay. The bathroom was small and a little old-fashioned but clean and warm. Some reviews comment on the small rooms but this is the price you pay for staying in on older hotel. The location is fantastic and as Boston city centre is quite compact we were able to walk everywhere. The freedom trail is a must and my wife downloaded an app to her i-phone which gave you information as you walked round. The Boston Bruins (ice hockey team) were playing one night. We went to the stadium before the game but the cheapest tickets remaining were $90 each! We were so pleased that we went to Boston, it really is a lovely city with some great history. We were even more pleased that we chose the Omni Parker as our base.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for its history & location”
Reviews.Author: TerrySisk
Reviews.Content: Never have I traveled from an airport to a downtown city hotel in so little time. My plane touched down at 11:30a, and I was standing in the hotel lobby at 12:08p (no checked luggage). This hotel is just 4 subway stops from Logan Airport, and the price is right: $2. You can walk anywhere from this hotel to the downtown area. More far-flung destinations are accessible by subway/tram, since Park Street and Government Center stops are both within 2 blocks. I'm a fan of historic hotels, and this one is a member of Historic Hotels of America (National Trust for Historic Preservation). It's the oldest continuously operating hotel in the nation. Naturally, the rooms and bathrooms are somewhat smaller than newly built hotels. But here you get a lobby with authentic wood paneled walls and elaborate bronze elevator doors, They don't (and can't) build them like this anymore. You can see where the transom air vents used to be above the guest room doors, a relic from the days before air conditioning. An aura of history lingers throughout the hotel: Charles Dickens, Emerson, Hawthorn and, more recently, the Kennedys. A stay at this property should be on anyone's bucket list, since hotels such as this one are a vanishing breed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good rate.”
Reviews.Author: boboli111
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very distinguished and classic lobby. The bellmen were plentiful and always ready to assist. The front desk staff is very professional and courteous. The beds in the room was extremely comfortable but some of the furniture is a bit outdate and hard. The bathroom is a bit on the cramped side. These 2 minor criticism is what is holding down the hotel from getting 5 stars. The Parker restaurant is very comfortable and the breakfast buffet was very good. The buffet had a good selection of hot and cold items as well as a good asortment of fruits and cereals. The service was also exceptional. Warning, read the sign before you attack the in room fridge and food basket. $4.50 for a small pringles can and $12 for a small jar of gummy bears is a bit excessive. If you are bringing kids make sure you enter the room and hid all those items from site.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but it is an older hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: amancini
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my husband's birthday because Travelzoo had a great nightly rate. We had a queen bedded room on a high floor all the way down a long and winding hallway. The room, including the bathroom, was quite small but clean. The hotel is old and slightly outdated but they make up for the flaws with a few perks. I became an Omni Select member and with the free membership, we were welcomed with bottled water in the room, free internet, and a "good morning" beverage (we chose coffee) delivered to our room. Little extras like this will make us want to come back to the Omni Parker.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: airicab
Reviews.Content: After reading a bunch of trip advisor reviews I decided to stay. I am so glad I did! First off you have to sign up to be a Omni memeber. We revieved a free bottle water upon stay, plus they delivered coffee to our room for free every morning. From the moment we got their the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Like another review said this is not the place to go if you can't appreciate the classic beauty and elegance behind this place. The room was beautiful and clean (Room 1220) and our view was incredible) I made sure to request a room with a view on a high floor as that seemed to be an issue for people. Because I was a member I guess I got first choice and wow, what a view of Boston we had! This was such an amazing stay. We did a walking tour of the city and this hotel is actually part of most tours because of its incredible history. Look for discounts and specials too, I paid $104 a night plus tax for this wonderful experience. Rooms easily go for double!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great History”
Reviews.Author: neilb1959
Reviews.Content: If you like modern, clinical chain hotels, then this place is not for you. But if you like classical elegance, with a big chunk of history, backed by excellent service levels then be sure to book into Parker House! Excellent location, clean rooms, top notch service........ Ignore the poor reviews, some people are just far too nit picky for their own good! (I often wonder if their own homes live up their own expectations???) An added thank you to the staff who left a birthday card, champagne and cake in my room for my arrival on my birthday - a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nezza28
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker for 3 nights last week. The first things that strikes you about this hotel as you walk in is its classic charm. The only hotel that I could compare it to in appearance would be the Waldorf Astoria in New York. Staff were extremely helpful, efficient and friendly. My friend and I had a deluxe room on the 7th floor with 2 double beds. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. Yes the rooms could probably do with a little updating but that is just nitpicking. When staying here you are left in no doubt that you are staying in a truly classy hotel with a rich history. I truly hope that this is something that does not get lost as time goes on and the hotel inevitably gets a facelift. Also for its location (pretty much 10 mins walk from everything) and the cost I would certainly not hesitate to stay at the Omni Parker during any future trips I take to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renonovated but lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: 862garrison
Reviews.Content: Most disappointed with my stay in room 207, a deluxe king sized bedroom with adjoining suite that was newly renovated but lacking in essential amenites. There was no chair in the bedroom and no reading light on one side of the bed, plus no Kleenex box near the bed. The bathroom was spacious but with no chair on which to put clothes or bathrobe while bathing, only one small hook on the back of the door and a mere single towel rack five feet from the stand-alone sink that was so narrow the soap dish didn't fit and there was no shelf anywhere, much less near the sink, on which to put toilet articles. There was one hanging shelf above the toilet in the far corner of the room miles from the sink, essentially useless as it was mostly taken up \with stacks of towels. This had to be the most ill-thought out hotel bathroom I have ever encountered. The desk in the sitting area had no drawer and hence no local phone book, obliging one to call the often busy concierge to look up a number for you, which meant being put on hold and waiting for a call-back.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MrCottage
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House has been a legendary hotel in Boston for perhaps 100 years. It has a central location for my office near South Station, so it is my hotel of choice. It's history and design are reminisent of another time and place. Warm and grand at the same time. The rooms are not cookie cutter, so if smaller bathrooms and cozy drapes and beds are not your thing, this may not be the place for you. But then again, maybe it is if you like the feel of a B&B but the services of a hotel. They have 3 excellent restaurants. I have only eaten in the 2 casual ones, as I travel solo and prefer a less formal atmosphere. The infamous Boston Creme Pie is a must. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisT152
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House with my husband when we attended a concert at the Orpheum. The hotel was in great location for our purpose. Our room, the John Quincy Adams Suite, was of nice size for a room but a little on the small side for a suite. All in all, our stay at the Omni Parker House was very pleasant - clean room and friendly staff. If you are a fan of scotch, the hotel bar is definitely worth a visit: the Omni Parker House offers tasting samples for more than 60 brands.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but got it for a bargain”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLudwig
Reviews.Content: I managed to snag a great deal at this place last year from December 29-Jan 2nd, for $99/night. I'd never been to Boston and I was a member at Omni so I figured what the hell. This hotel is part of all kinds of historical events and facts: it's one of the oldest hotels in America (of course, haunted too), it's where the Boston Creme Pie was invented and it's where JFK proposed to Jackie (awwwww). The place is as grand as its history and is in a pretty good location. Right across from city hall and the commons, right on the Freedom Trail and about a ten minute walk from all of the North End restaurants. Though the service is friendly and the hotel is aesthetically pleasing, I didn't find the atmosphere to be very nice. It's loaded with sloshed old people and weird out-of-towner-amateur-historians. As a 23 year-old, this is a little disconcerting, especially since we had to spend a lot of time there due to all the sleety, snowy icy mess outside. I took off a star because our room was dreadfully small and the walls were pretty thin. We didn't hear people having sex (this time) but we could hear everyone else's tv's. A second star was taken off because there was no wifi in the room even though we were select guests and receive free wifi. There was nothing they could do about it, apparently. Still, this is a great hotel to start with and in a way better location than a lot of the other places I found and if I got a good deal, I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: amdgMd
Reviews.Content: An Omni frequent guest program participant, I stayed here recently and was disppointed in the service and the quality of the room. The room was traditionally furnished and elegant but very small. There was very little counter/desk space throughout the room and bath. The TV was mounted on the wall; this was fortunate because there was no table or desk space for it! While I have never before used drawers in hotel rooms, this time it was necessary because of the lack of open space. The desk was too tiny for work (and cluttered with the coffeemaker, room service menu, etc.). Per the front desk staff all the rooms have similarly small desks. Not a good choice for business travelers. The complimentary morning beverage never arrived at the designated time. The room service salad was small and pricey. All room service food here is pricey. If you want rolls or bread with your dinner you will be charged extra (you would think that at the Parker House Hotel Parker House rolls would be provided). On the positive side, the location is close to several historic sites. As a frequent business traveler in Boston I have stayed at the Omni, Eliott, Hilton Back Bay and Commonwealth Hotels. Of these four the Commonwealth is by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....Bad Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: danthetravelguy
Reviews.Content: We checked in November 19th, 2011, and were amazed by the beautiful lobby and how clean everything looked....it was like walking back into history...it was wonderful. Unfortunately, the front desk said that our room wasn't ready, so we waited, and waited, and waited....I went up to the front desk a total of eight (8) times, and still got the same answer: "Not ready yet". I happened to know the room number of our eventual room, so I went upstairs and found that it was empty, so I went to the front desk and they said they would get housekeeepping to clean it....we waited more...I went upstairs again and found out it was ready...so I had to inform the front desk, as they didn't seem to care...they said it still wasn't ready, and I said, that I had personally talked to the maid that cleaned it...wow! Really? My wife has just recently gotten over a severe illness and is just about to collapse on the floor of the lobby, but still no action or sympathy from the front desk. This was a sad introduction to such a wonderful hotel. Would I recommend the hotel? Yes. Would I recommend the front desk help? I would recommend they take a refresher course in courtesy and customersatisfaction; something that this customer did not receive....shame! The Kruse's from California.

Reviews.Title: “halloween and history”
Reviews.Author: shirlhut
Reviews.Content: What a great time i had at this hotel during Halloween. The Concierges were so helpful, gracious and obliging in answering all my queries. I sat at the corner dining room table where John Kennedy is reputed to have proposed to Jackie and looked in the mirror where Charles Dickens(also a previous guest) practised his lectures including a first rendition of A Christmas Carol. History abounds here and it was a privilege to be a guest. The snow was an extra bonus also. I should love to return

Reviews.Title: “Great location great price”
Reviews.Author: wildder
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel not 5 star, so what, the price is right and for the price a very good hotel, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A long weekend away”
Reviews.Author: 2011davant
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a nice relaxing weekend away in Boston staying in the Omni Parker House Hotel. What appealed to me on booking this hotel was the short distance from the airport which is around 10-15 minutes in a taxi and cost between $18 - $25 dollars each way depending on traffic and how much in extras the driver decides to add before setting off. As in previous reviews the standard rooms are a bit on the small side. However a quick chat with the reception staff and a lot of computer clicking and moving people, we upgraded to a suite for not much more per night. This room (1106) was a nice sized room. Lounge area with a sofa and big TV, desk with internet / wifi access, mini-bar and a bit of a view to one side. The bedroom was a good size with a comfortable bed and en-suite. If I had to be picky the bathroom was a bit small and decor wise it let itself down a bit, but was spotlessly clean which is the important bit. I personally found all the staff to be very friendly and approachable and could not fault the service and assistance we had. I also liked the fact that tips wern't expected as in some hotels we have stayed in previously. If they were expected it was hidden very well, and tips given were gratefully recieved, which makes it a much more plesasant experience for all involved! It is an old hotel so do not expect glitz and glamour, and you could be mistaken for thinking it needs renovating. We did use the restaraunt on Thanksgiving evening and had a very tasty meal. Good food portions, served hot and very nicely cooked. Obviously not the cheapest meal as it was hotel prices, but still very nice. Again very good service from polite, friendly and helpful staff. Another nice touch that the lady (Sheri) on reception did was on finding out the trip was a belated birthday present for my wife,sent a personal hand written card with a bottle of fizz and some chocolate covered strawberries up to the room. Again not requested by me, just a nice touch from her, which was a nice gesture, and if she's reading this review thank you again! Location wise we found it to be very good as china town and theatre district were a short walk away, as was Fenuile Market and North End which has a load of very good Italian Restaraunts. We ate in both China Town and North End and had very good, well priced meals with a ton of food in both. Also from a shopping point of view Macey's is just around the corner and the main shopping areas of Newbury Street, Prudential Building and various other streets are about a 15 minute walk across Boston Common. The Common is a nice green area with an ice skating rink and some good buskers if music is your thing. It can also be used to get to Cheers bar which is the one used in the TV show. We had lunch there on Thanksgiving day and had a thoroughly nice meal with good and friendly service, so worth a look in my opinion.It also has the set and a gift shop upstairs as well. One note on thanksgiving if you are planning to visit for shopping. All the shops are shut on this day as it's the equivalent to Christmas day here, although there were convenience stores and restaraunts open, so eating and drinking is not an issue. However, once thanksgiving is out of the way the shops open at ridiculously early times with some good sales/bargains to be had even in these times when the Â£ / $ exchange rate can be poor. These opening hours on this day are very handy for us Brits and the time difference who find themselves wide awake at 4 in the morning! Boston is a very nice, clean city and all the Bostonians that we encountered we found to be nice, friendly and helpful. From a shopping point of view I think New York edges it, however it's not as manic as we found New York, although we both enjoyed our previous stays there as well. All in all from my experiences I would reccomend both the Omni Parker House Hotel and Boston as a nice long weekend break away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: delzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House for one night on our way to NH. Check in was easy and there was no wait. They had kiddie bags for my children when we checked in which was nice. We had an executive suite which was a decent sized room. The bathroom is a little small but nicely done. There was six of us staying in the room and we also had a cot which was waiting in our room when we got there. When we came back to the room from dinner, there was milk and cookies waiting for my children which was a very nice surprise. They also had put extra towels in our room which was nice instead of having to ask. It was actually very refreshing to have a hotel be prepared for your arrival! We did use the valet parking which is $42.00/night. Staff was all very pleasant and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel and when my daughter found out that our hotel was where the Boston Cream Pie was created, she was upset that we didn't get any. We walked to the Public Gardens, Boston Common, Beacon Hill and Quincy Market - all not too far from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Old-World" class!!”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper305
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston to visit with relatives for Thanksgiving, but being a cityphile, had to spend a day in Boston proper. Stayed at the Parker House. What a beautiful, old-world hotel (well at least as "old-world" as it gets in the States!) Phenomenal service, beautiful room, great service. It's not funky or edgy (like the "W" and its sort), but if you like the "classics" you'll LOVE the Parker House. Staff was very proper, helpful and friendly. Also, great location, and it was wonderful hearing the church bells in the afternoon!. I ventured onto the mezzanine level and found exquisite ballrooms! Seemed to me to be a great location not only for a personal getaway, but for a festive event (such as a wedding)..... in proper style! Will definitely add this to my "must stay" list when in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: momeees
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Omni Parker House over the Thanksgiving weekend. As members of the loyalty program, we received a great rate on a double executive room with two double beds and a pull out double sofa. The size of the room was nice for our family. I realize that rooms are small; since my husband has stayed on business in the past, we realized we needed a larger room. The only downfall was the fact that there was no view. No matter. Front desk staff, valet, doorman, etc. all very pleasant. Check in was a breeze (checked in online the day before). Breakfast buffet was nice, and the wood furnishings throughout the lobby and restaurant make it such a warm, inviting place. Central location in a city that is meant to be walked. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ph03nix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Thanksgiving week in Boston. I travel a lot personally and this falls into the pretty good category. Its got all the things you would want beds, shower etc but its very conventional for all that and feels like it could get an upgrade to catch up with more modern boutique hotels. The beds are comfortable but very high; a small ladder or a trampette might help to get on there. The flat screen is nice but there is no ipod dock which seems de riguer nowadays. The room was smallish but thats pretty much the story for most US hotels in major cities. In has retained its oldy worldy charm and is in a great location so if you want a mid range hotel this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very small room”
Reviews.Author: fullm00n
Reviews.Content: Overall, I had a pleasant stay (3 nights) in this hotel ( I stayed in a single economy room) but the fact that the room was small (and I mean really small) may prevent me from coming back to this particular hotel in the future. It's a shame because the bed was actually very comfortable and there was nothing in particular that was bad with the room, it's just that you can get bigger rooms in the city for the same amount of money (and not far away from this particular location). The view from my window was as bad as it gets (a brick wall, that's it) but I didn't spend much time in my room so it didn't really matter. On the positive side, I ordered a Boton cream pie through room service one evening and I went to sleep very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JVCNP
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House Hotel is a beautiful, historic building in a central location - close to the T, a few blocks from Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall and the North End, surrounded by many dining options, etc. We travel to Boston at least once a year to soak in the history of the city, enjoy the museums, restaurants, and try to catch a play at the Lyric Theater. We have found it best to park at one of the T's long term parking lots for $7 per night instead of the $40 per night parking garages in the city, especially since we purchase a Charlie Card to ride the T anyway. Minor complaints w/ room: a/c / heating unit installed in such a manner that we were unable to see out of the window at eye level - giving us only a view of the sky and the building next door's roof line (10th floor); paint on baseboard below window was in need of touch up. Overall, we were pleased w/ a great value in a convenient location especially at the Travelzoo rate of $105/night - plus, it is on the Historic Register,. Hot cider in the lobby on a brisk autumn day, complimentary wifi, coffee delivered to our room each morning - what could be better?

Reviews.Title: “Good Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: A couple mentions on this hotel-first, they told me that their liquor license didn't allow them to allow patrons to have liquor in the rooms-interpretation is, buy from the overpriced Parker lounge or the overpriced mini-bar. Second, we asked for a reasonably priced lobster restaurant and was told that reservations would be made and they would let me know where/when. They never called back! My roommate stopped by to check on her way back to the room and the concierge said that he had called me!!! I called from my room to let him know that I had not received a call from him and HE ARGUED WITH ME!!! When we tried to find this restaurant, it was in a completely different direction than what he said and THEY DIDN'T SERVE LOBSTER!!! The third thing was that they wanted $9.95 daily for internet...unreal!!! Other than the above, the hotel was in the perfect location and the room was adequate for our needs. P.S. we had liquor in our rooms! Yes, I would go back but I wouldn't listen to the concconciergeierge or the clerk at the desk. Count on going across the street for you free internet! Boston was FAB!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yerffej14
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the omni as part of a package deal and hoped for the best! We requested the 10th floor as rumor has it (haunted). The hotel has a very classic appeal to it. It's old and beautiful. The rooms are small yet updated and very clean. Staff was vey pleasant and you can't beat the location, it's on the Freedom Trail. We didn't experience any haunting other than a girlfriend's purse falling unexpectedly from the nightstand. Ultimately, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve g
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Omni Parker House and we will be back again. Location is great, lots of attractions within walking distance. It is a short ride on the T from the airport. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: dc4Vermont
Reviews.Content: We have stayed stayed a few times at the Omni Parker House in the past. We continue to return due to the central location, quality of bedding/furniture, amenities (particularly if you are an Omni Select Guest), cleanliness and value of the hotel. However, during this stay, one employee in particular stands out - Neal at the front desk. We appreciated his outstanding, personalized customer service from check-in to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Parker House Hotel Great value - Great location”
Reviews.Author: selake92
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House Hotel is a great value in a great location in Boston especially for a classy historic hotel. We stayed a Friday and Saturday night at $105 per night through Travel Zoo. Room was in excellent condition approximately 11 x 16 not including the bathroom, clean and well appointed with nice furniture, queen bed, nice bedding, desk and a new tv. We joined their loyalty club (free) and it entitled us to free wifi and free coffee delivered in the morning (in addition to the little coffee maker in the room). The hotel is in a great location - walking distance to many attractions. Our only complaint would be that the window heat pump (for cooling and heat) takes up the whole lower sash of the window obstructing almost the entire view. Try requesting a room with a view. Again for $105 in a major city in a great location this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Level Of Service”
Reviews.Author: Billytwosheds
Reviews.Content: First time in the United States from the UK we stopped at the Omni Parker House for our 35th wedding anniversary. The hotel lived up to our expectations, knowing that it was decorated in a colonial style. Everywhere was very clean and tidy and every staff member we dealt with polite and efficient. Our room was adequate in size, very clean and nicely furnished but overlooked what seemed like staff quarters, but who spends time looking out of the window in the dark and that seemed to be the only time we were in our room. The T stop was just a short stroll away and we purchased a weeks pass so we got to all corners of the city during our stay. All in all we came away with a memory for life from our first time in the states and we are already planning a return. If that turns out to be Boston The Omni Parker House will be the first port of call.

Reviews.Title: “Adore The Parker House,”
Reviews.Author: JSAjr
Reviews.Content: My Family has been visiting the Parker House several times a year for decades. It is a beautiful, classy Hotel with exceptional staff. We have stayed in all the room categories and find if you ask for an upgrade most of the time you will receive one. The rooms are lovely, spacious and well appointed. This Hotel is loaded with History and all of the Suites are named after important people in Boston History. Boston Cream Pie originated here as did Parker House Rolls. JFK got engaged in the Dining Room, which is exquisite, the food outstanding. We also enjoy the bar The Last Hurrah for drinks and a light bite. The Hotel is located in such a terrific location...moments away from Restaurants and Shopping, a short walk to Fanuell Hall and the Commons and Swan Boats. The Loyalty Program led by the lovely Kate Casey is exceptional, and a huge shout out to our dear friend Eddy, head of the Bell Department ( and the Go To Man for everything!) Francesca in the Dining Room as well. We love The Parker House not just for it's wonderful location, food, rooms and service, but because they treat us as family every time we return! The best!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: reppop
Reviews.Content: This is our organization's second year hosting an event at the Omni Parker House. The event staff are professional and provide great service to our guests. Special thanks to Maureen, Constantina and Stephanie!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Area”
Reviews.Author: graynode
Reviews.Content: Convenient location one block from subway. Many nearby restaurants. Room was small but clean. The bed was so comfortable I slept better there then at home. Disappointed in the quality of the Boston Cream Pie in their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: WrightTrips
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a great Location. I can honesly say the only complaint would be we did not have room to unpack. We stayed for a week. The hotel was close to several breakfast/lunch places at great prices. We were able to walk to the Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market. We also we able to walk to the North End for some great dinners and dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston”
Reviews.Author: k g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days after NYC. A sterling hotel iwth great history. What a wonderful room. The bar/cafe was particularly pleasant. It is very well located, can walk from the Metro It can be pricey, but join their favoured members club for free and you will get benefits!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: High-Dry
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House in Boston is a great location, right on the Freedom Walking Trail. My room in the hotel was the smallest that I have ever stayed in, the size on the smallest bedroon in my home. A double bed filled the room, throw in a night stand and a desk, the room was crowded. Lucky that it was a business trip and I wasn't traveling with my spouse. The window view was of an air shaft. Talking to other travelers revealed that their rooms for dinner you'll need to take a cab. The hotel dining room is expensive and only so-so. Don't oder the Boston Cream Pie as we were very disappointed with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Joleen K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there in Oct, it was a beautiful time to go. We had a great time and the location of the hotel was perfect. We basically went to the north end or boston commons every day. There were 2 close train stations. Our room it self was cozy and well small, but it worked fine for us. We booked on expedia so we got a combined flight and hotel deal that was good. We did not endulge in breakfast there, there was a good crepe place across the street. We did see a dog in the hotel once, so they may be allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: ATP1
Reviews.Content: I really want to give this hotel more stars. The location is ideal, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. These alone are persuasive reasons to choose this hotel. Many have commented on the small rooms. My room was very small. The bathroom was EXTREMELY small. For a three-night stay on my own, I could overlook the lack of space in the bathroom and bedroom given the historic importance of the hotel and the superb location. What I cannot overlook is the disappointing shower pressure. It was very difficult to rinse soap out of my hair and off my body. My business colleague (in another hotel room) had a similar experience, so this was not unique to my particular hotel room. My bed was small (smaller than a queen-sized), but it was very comfortable, and the room was clean. During an earlier stay about a year and a half ago, we ate in the restaurant (the more casual one), and it was very good -- I would definitely recommend it. Also, if you like pizza, be sure to eat at the original Pizzeria Regina location on Thacher Street -- about a mile's walk from the hotel (15 minutes). One of the best pizzas I have ever eaten, and I have eaten a lot of pizza in my lifetime! The hotel has a nice gift shop and also a fitness center (which is not mentioned on the hotel's website). If you are a runner/walker, it is located very near Boston Common, a large park that is ideal for a nice run/walk. I look forward to returning to this hotel for a future visit...after they have invested in improved showers. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: ob4123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really all about location, it's right in the middle of everything so perfect for a short city break in beautiful Boston. Rooms are on the small side, what you'd expect from an older property but very clean and all necessary amenities in the room. The bed was comfortable but a little on the small side for an adult couple who are used to a larger bed at home. If you join the Omni hotel's free loyalty scheme before you arrive, you get free newspapers, free tea/coffee delivered to your room every morning and free wifi in the room. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has two bars both somewhat lacking in atmosphere, but there's plenty of choice elsewhere because you're right in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Really classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: peggy914
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Our check in was easy and friendly. I had heard about the Boston cream pies and was anxious to try one. Yum. Didn't dissappoint. The location is good for walking safely around the area. We only stayed one night, as we were sailing on a cruise the next day. Would like to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: SueBee135
Reviews.Content: We just spent a great 4 nights at the Omni Parker House. It was in such a great location that we didn't need our car the entire time we were there. The staff was very attentive, friendly, and helpful. To help us celebrate our anniversary they even gave us complementary champagne and Boston Creme Pies.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, historic hotel downtown - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ladyadventurers
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House is a beautiful old hotel in downtown Boston. The lobby and bar are full of old-world charm, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel's history is fascinating: Malcolm X worked here as a busboy in the 1940s, and Ho Chi Minh (later leader of Viet Nam) worked in the bakery from 1911-13. The only downside is that the standard rooms are very small. There was not really room for a suitcase on the floor if you wanted to be able to walk around. But on the other hand, you probably won't spend much time in your room, and the ambience and location (close to many "T" subway stations) makes up for a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, however the room we stayed in was poorly equipped (one tea bag?!) & a little shabby - for example, black grouting around the bath tub & cracking plaster on one of the walls. Whilst the room was a good size, it was particularly cold - and the heating system was very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: OrpheusTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location being a block away from the Park Street station in the Boston Commons. It is an old historic hotel with beautiful public spaces. The hallways and the rooms do need some updating. Some of the rooms can be very small although the room we stayed in was pretty average in size. The hotel is very busy but the staff are always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: txtravelagenttx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a Trafalgar tour. It is a great location. Perfect for getting to freedom trail, public transportation, great restaurants and shopping. Its a beautiful but old hotel. The rooms are tiny. We had a connecting room and heard everything that our neighbors did. Even with the noise, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pittsburgher33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is close to the T line and the Freedom Trail. The hotel staff is extremely nice and helpful. This hotel is a historical landmark and is the oldest continually operating hotel, so don't expect a modern room. It is updated but still is old. The heating and air conditioning was a window unit. It was the same as other hotels but was just in the window. It was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “If you like historic hotels, this is for you”
Reviews.Author: mainland_wahine
Reviews.Content: Very old, historic hotel. Great ambiance and exceptional service but the hotel is very loud (they were doing street construction overnight and it woke me up several times during the night). I have stayed at this hotel often for work and find the location to be very convenient to shopping and restaurants and the subway. Rooms are clean but pretty dated (back to that historic vibe).

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsmp
Reviews.Content: I spent a few day for work in Boston and stayed at the Omni Parker House. Although the room was small (like many old city hotels), it was very comfortable and had everything I needed. The hotel has great history, excellent service and within walking distance of all the history in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort, history”
Reviews.Author: excel4success
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, the room and amenities are comfortable and is a part of history.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt!!”
Reviews.Author: pol73
Reviews.Content: Where do I start in my review of this fabulous hotel? If you are a planning a stay here you MUST join the loyalty scheme before you travel. It is probably the best and most valuable piece of information I have received from reading other people's reviews on Trip Advisor apart from the obvious "don't stay here!" . We joined the scheme which offered complimentary morning drinks delivered to the room, express check in and the services of a loyalty ambassador (booking reservations etc) We were contacted a few days prior to arrival, by their loyalty ambassador, Kate Casey offering to complete any reservations etc for us. I was amused by us sharing a surname and even more so when she informed us that she had a sister with the same name. I explained that we would be celebrating our second wedding anniversary whilst in Boston and would like to book a table in the restaurant for the Monday evening, which was booked for us with a request for the table at which JFK proposed to Jackie (I don't know if we got it, as there were no table numbers and to be fair, by then we didn't care too much!) The loyalty ambassador excelled herself as on arrival, we had been given a lovely room with dual aspect and partial views overlooking Boston Common. Having read some of the other reviews I know we were really lucky to have these views. (When you stay at the oldest running hotel in the US where the city has grown up around it, views are something of a rarity!) But not only we were allocated a lovely room with the biggest, comfiest bed ever- waiting for us on arrival was a chilled bottle of bubbly and some chocolate covered strawberries! We were thrilled. We also had a room with a full bath and a huge walk in closet for our clothes and bags. We were hugely impressed with the service we received from all the staff in this hotel. Everyone from the luggage porter to the concierge were helpful and accommodating. We had been checked in on arrival, we were able to check pick up locations for a tour that we had booked (the concierge telephoned to confirm for us saving us a fortune in overseas call charges) restaurant staff were pleasant and service was good. I know we may have been spoilt during our stay here and may be a little biased having had such a nice surprise on arrival, but the hotel was beautiful. We loved the age and the history of the building and admired the faded grandeur and sense of old fashioned glamour in a building that had hosted (and at times employed) so many famous people. The location of the hotel was second to none, providing easy access to Boston Common, where we walked in the gorgeous October sunshine (We were blessed with fantastic weather too, which always helps!) and to Quincy market where we shopped and ate. The food in the restaurant was excellent, although we filled up on Parker House rolls and really rather regretted it when we couldn't finish our delicious meals- In fact, we didn't even have room to sample the famous Boston cream pie! We always felt safe and well looked after in and around this hotel and the hot drinks being delivered to the room was a godsend! (We followed our stay here with a trip to new York and powdered milk in the first cup of tea of the day is just not the same!) and while I appreciate our stay here may not have been typical, we absolutely loved this place. The only thing we were not happy about was having to leave and if we were to return to Boston, we would undoubtedly stay here again. Thank you to all the pleasant and hard working staff from whom British customer service providers could learn a lot! Do: Join the loyalty scheme, eat in the restaurant (Good value food by UK standards!) Don't: Expect great views if you're staying in a standard room. You are in the middle of a city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the rest.......”
Reviews.Author: n s
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with this hotel, whilst we understand that it is an old hotel, the rooms,bathrooms and public areas were all very tired. The rooms were tiny and despite upgrading we could not both use the bathroom together. There was a great deal of noise from both externally and also corridor traffic. No interconnecting rooms and it seemed other than the doorman, everything was too much trouble for the staff. The front desk staff were the rudest and most unhelpful we have ever experienced. The only reason to stay here is the great location, and if we had not prepaid, I would have checked out.

Reviews.Title: “old and regal”
Reviews.Author: christine z
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel even though the walls were a bit thin. I will second what has already been said about the location, the history, the size of the rooms. The staff were great. The decor was lovely. The beds and bathtubs are stellar. I had a few days of grim weather during my stay, so I was quite happy to stay in and pamper myself. (If you need a new, modern, shiny, and big hotel, then this is not the one for you.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DJS377
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location for seeing things in Boston. We received a warm welcome. The room wasn't great - a function of being in an old hotel. The bed was really comfortable. There's always a manager on duty in the lobby checking things are OK. One serious negative point - the bar had run out of Sam Adams! In Boston!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Spend Your Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary at The Omni Parker House in Boston this past weekend. We joined the Omni Club, which is free to join online and then made reservations using our membership and also used the AAA rate. We were able to book the larger room with a king size bed and a desk at a value that beat the Priceline.com deals by a big span. The membership will entitle you to free internet and free morning tea or coffee delivered to your room each morning at a time you select. You are greeted with free full size bottles of water to enjoy at check in. The room also has a coffee maker with Wolfgang Puck coffee and to go cups are in your room if you want it to go. We were celebrating our anniversary and they surprised us with the sweetest chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in our room at check-in. This was complementary. The room was immaculate and very clean. The closet is large and included an ironing board with spray starch. The omni club includes 2 free pressings also by the hotel if you wish. The lobby is stellar and old world beautiful. Our room had a great view of Boston. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We used the Omni website to pre-order 2 breakfast buffets at The Parker Restaurant at a great savings. The breakfast has a great variety and high quality service and food. We choose the made to order omlettes with Parker rolls and fresh fruit. We also bought 2 original Boston Cream pies in their coffee shop. Delicious! It was a great location and close to everything in Boston. We walked everywhere. The greatest feature is the baggage hold. The porters will check your bags and hold them is a safe room after you check out so you can squeeze in some last minute fun until you are ready to go to the airport. A first class historic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: Great location. Center of everything. Within walking distance to all the historic sites. Clean hotel but old. Beds are very comfortable and minimal noise level.

Reviews.Title: “historical hotel. great if catch a price break.”
Reviews.Author: sfo-ord-bos
Reviews.Content: supposedly the longest continuously operating hotel in the States with a lot to offer if you are into history. can be pricey, so great if one can catch a deal. the club membership is worthwhile as it includes free upgrades and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: paula b
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House is in a great location. Parking is $42.00/day Very old hotel. Rooms (we switched rooms) were less than desirable. Very dim and old smelling. Staff was friendly but did not go out of their way. Very happy to help upon your arrival in order to get a tip but never around after that. Loved the city but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic”
Reviews.Author: nyc1acc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful check in/check out experience. I checked in online, so they had my room packet ready upon arrival. I was in my room in less than 2 min. The room was tiny (see pics) they should not put a king bed in such a small space. I definitely could not stay there for more than one or two days I would have went crazy. The food both catered at the conference and at dinner in the lounge was very good. I stayed for a conference so the rate was reduced, but the regular rate is just ridiculous I would never pay.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: JenniferChaffin
Reviews.Content: I would ideally give this hotel 3.5 stars, but decided to round up. The service has been very warm and attentive. The hotel is also very beautiful with a rich history. For it's age, it is well maintained. As every other review stated, the rooms are a little small and the bathrooms are down right tiny. That said, the location in excellent so you won't spend a lot of time in your room. My husband requested a king bed, but upon arrival we were told that they didn't have one available. The hotel is booked full this week which is expected in Boston in the fall. They did give us a room with two double beds, but put us on the top floor with a view. We had dinner at the Parker House restaurant. The service and dinner rolls were delicious. Everything else was very average and bland. Make sure you join the Omni club before staying here so you receive free wi-fi and coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF, GREAT RESTAURANT”
Reviews.Author: KALKAY32
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to Boston Common and the Freedom Trail (If you walk all the way down to Bunker Hill take some breaks and rather than walk all the way back call a cab; it won't cost very much at all), the staff are very nice and helpful and their restaurant is really quite good. Be sure to get the Boston Cream pie at some point in the trip. They have valet parking which is good given the narrow streets in the area. Also try Ernie's Pub down the street for lunch or supper sometime. And, for you coffee/caffeine fiends, like me, they have an on-site Starbucks bar in their gift shop (which is also very nice) and there is a full-blown Starbucks one-half a block away that opens at 6 am (except for Columbus Day). Also, given the construction in Boston add thirty minutes to your destination and ONE HOUR to get to Logan airport. Also, if you rent a car and are returning it in Boston pick a rental agency that has onsite pickup and return - DON'T rent from Thrifty as their site is some miles alway from the terminal and you are at the mercy of shuttle buses.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location, and Amazing History.”
Reviews.Author: LMotto
Reviews.Content: Ciao all, My wife and I stayed at the Parker House ( Sept.26-29, 2011 ) and had a great time. We worked with Kate C. in the concierges at the Parker House. Kate was extremely helpful with arranging our nice room. Also, she was nice enough to have a sample of the Parker House Boston Cream Pie and a History book of the Parker House delivered to our room. THE BEST BOSTON CREAM PIE WE EVER TASTED....... Thank you Kate. The Hotel is in an absolutely great location to walk to the Freedom Trail, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill, and North Boston. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff at the Parker House were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you, Louie & Vera.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: e_wire
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m certainly not impressed by the hotel. Check-in was terrible and they blamed it on the system being down, but waiter at the restaurant said itâ€™s because they have large groups and delay checkout these days. The front desk people offered no alternatives. Rooms are very small and the ventilation is very noisy. Walls are thin; I could hear very clearly a couple arguing from 3am till 5am. Even earplugs didnâ€™t prevent the nuisance. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisatgg
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive in stayg in the oldest hotel in US but was pleasantly suprised but the charming decor in the room, albeit a little small. Love the bed but the shower space is tight. Service was great and location was fantastic. We stayed four nites & totally love it. Would come back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant -Quite old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: DBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Although not staying at the Hotel, we dined at the Omni Parker House Restaurant - The dining room has an old world elegance , which is only to be expected given the history and age of the hotel. The service was quietly efficient and the food was good I had the scrod which was funky fresh & tasty whilst my wife had the scallops also delicious and of course we had to finish with the house signature dessert of Boston Cream Pie which was surprisingly light and tasty. A little bit pricier than many other restaurants and portions were not huge but overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; good service; aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan-GordonSF
Reviews.Content: The Parker House has a great location for exploring Boston and staff was generally good Biggest downfall is the tiny bathrooms (older hotel) so if that's not an issue for you, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jrzollz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights this summer. Our room was perfect for us, in our mid-twenties. We had a nice view of a courtyard and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was nicely modelled. The best part for us was that the hotel was pet-friendly so we were able to bring our dog with us on our trip, which was a nice perk. All of the employees that we encountered were friendly and professional. Upon arriving, my door was opened and the valets assisted with our bags and parked the car. The Front Desk Staff were all very polite and helpful. At breakfast, our server was of the highest quality. We were given attention when needed, without asking, and left to enjoy our meal the rest of the time. The location of the hotel made it easy for us to come and go during the day. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay down town.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm”
Reviews.Author: cch64
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good area of Boston. Very polite and helpful staff. Lots of variety at breakfast. Disabled room facilities in room - very large shower room though the tiles and seat in the shower were very slippery when wet. Two very comfy double beds with quality sheets. I found them too high but my husband liked them. Charm of the hotel was just a little faded but still good condition,

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful building, good location.”
Reviews.Author: mirandayork
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the start of a touring holiday around New England. It's a lovely old building and our room was good. A very large bathroom and reasonable sized bedroom with more than adequate storage space. We ate breakfast in the hotel as there's not much close by. Having the full buffet breakfast is $22 each + tax and the inevitable tip. Not as cheap as we'd expected in America but the food was good. If I want to be picky, the bacon was a bit fatty and the potatoes were tasteless. Service was excellent - no waiting for refills of juice or coffee. The concierge here was very helpful - providing various free maps and giving any advice we wanted. We'd stay here again if in Boston. If you come for a few days as we did, do use the Old Trolleybus tours. We did over a full circuit + the seaport loop, on our first day, to get our bearings - getting off in a couple of places. Then on the next day we used it more as a means of getting to where we wanted to be. The drivers provide running commentary with lots of interesting information and most are amusing as well as informative. If there was a downside to the hotel it was the outlook - none really, just a tiny inner yard surrounded by other rooms. But as we didn't spend much time in the room during daylight hours it wasn't important.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pete614
Reviews.Content: What a great introduction to Boston,great welcome,great staff,great food.We will definitely return to this Historic Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: LisaandStuEllis
Reviews.Content: A beautifully classic hotel that shows its history without feeling out of date or antique. It does make life feel that little bit more luxurious. I can't help, however, compare it to the Mayflower Park Hotel in Seattle where the rooms were bigger and better but the location not so. That said, you can feel the Omni Parker House's significant history oozing out of it. Our room in the Omni was smaller than we expected but clean and very comfy nonetheless. We were in the 12th floor and had a nice view. The staff, from start to end were excellent. We made the mistake of sitting in the lobby when the ghost tour came in and we found out the it's one of if not the most haunted hotels in the north east of the USA! I shall avoid rooms on floor 3 and floor 9 in future! We've debated on rating four or five for this but have settled on four just because of the cramped deluxe room and cramped bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “great location, awesome bellhops, clean and historic”
Reviews.Author: courtchick54
Reviews.Content: my two friends and i stayed here for a long girls' weekend in november. the location can't be beat - within walking distance of subway station, great irish bars, and restaurants. yes, the room was quite small for 3 females (a sports arena would probably still be snug), but overall it was very clean and lavishly furnished in period pieces. the lobby and restaurant are gorgeous and comfy - we stopped off for a late night boston creme pie and enjoyed the people watching in the bar. bellhops were very personable and gave us some great recommendations for nightlife. a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindzngreg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Parker House and I have to say it was awesome. Now there are a few things that you will need to know before you decide to stay here. Yes ... the rooms are small, however, the hotel is 156 years old and unfortunately they cannot update the shape of such an old hotel. Although the rooms are small they are very cozy ... the beds were amazingly comfortable and the shower had great pressure. The tv's were updated to flat panels and they had a radio alarm clock with an aux cable for your ipod. I just want to remind everyone that when you are on vacation how much time do you actually spend in your hotel room??? not much!!! so why does it matter how big the rooms are? Unless you are trying to fit a family of 8 in one room this hotel and it's room sizes shouldn't affect your decision. The history alone that this hotel has is enough to want to stay here. I do recommend signing up for the Omni rewards (you get free wifi, beverages and newspapers) ... it's free to sign up and if you don't you will have to pay for wifi. The location of this hotel is right on the freedom trail and it's about a 5 minute walk to Quincey Market. We were able to walk to Newbury Street and Fenway from this hotel and it wasn't that far. The service was 5 star!!! We arrived at the hotel at 10am and although check in was not until 3pm ... they had a room ready for us. The bellhops and the front desk clerks went out of their way to make our stay an enjoyable one. They found out it was my husbands birthday and they sent us up some complimentary champagne and boston cream pie (which were delish). They also held our baggage upon check out so that we could go to the Bruins game before we had to fly out (at no charge). Overall, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. Rooms are small, but cozy, however the location and the service make up for everything. I would stay here again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Only for history fans”
Reviews.Author: amir z
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, and it's the longest continuously running hotel in pretty much this side of the galaxy. But at the end of the day, after a hard day of meetings, I don't care. I want everything to be modern, convenient, efficient. Which this hotel is not quite. The whole place smells old. And it's pretty dark too with all the wood and carpets. And overall, they've done an amazing job taking a 1000 year old hotel and planting all the features of a modern hotel inside it, but the age shows-- in the layout (labyrinthine), in the rooms (really small bathrooms), in the way the AC is installed (not complaining, just not used to it being on the floor). At the end, it boils down to taste. It's just not mine.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: BizM0m
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Omni Parker and would love to return soon! The hotel is one of a kind and perfectly situated for a tour of Boston's highlights. Our room was extremely large with a sitting area and vanity table area. The bathroom was small, but to be expected in this historic hotel. Special thanks to Seamus for his kindness to us! No ghosts were sighted, but we enjoyed learning about the history of the hotel and its former guests. Ask the front desk for the list of ghostly sightings. We highly recommend taking the Orange and Green Trolley Tour - an easy walk from the hotel - which allows you to get on and off the trolley all over the city. Would not hesitate to return to the Parker House. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Historic Hotel to experience”
Reviews.Author: collectingcoke
Reviews.Content: It is definitely something to experience, rich with history. The size of the rooms are small but I expected that. I was not impressed by a view of a block wall, when I requested a view when I booked it. it is a great central location to all tourist sights. It was something to see once, but probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - great location”
Reviews.Author: Limshang
Reviews.Content: For a short layover in Boston, my wife and I staid in the Omni Parker House in downtown Boston. The hotel is in a landmark building right on the Freedom Trail. It is really in the heart of downtown Boston so location is extremely central. We had a very good experience and the staff was very friendly and did what they can to make us feel comfortable. We normally prefer newer modern hotels over classic landmark hotels, but we both must admit the Omni Parker is an exception to this. The interior is very well kept and maintained. The lobby is very well kept and feels very classy. We had booked a traditional room which is very small. It was not a problem for us as we were only planning to stay for a night but I can see it being an issue if you decide to stay longer. The bed is small as is the bathroom although we feel that they make good use of the available space. There is a free wifi if you sign up to become a member of their loyalty program, which we did. All in all a good stay with warm and friendly service in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: tennistraveler87
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Omni Parker House. Pros: Location - ( 3min walk from T, 5min to Faneuil Hall / Quincy Mrkt, 10 mins to North end). Beautiful hotel very ornate old style. The room was small but clean, and the bathroom was also small and clean. Signed up for Omni rewards and got free room service beverages in the morning. Booked on Hotwire for $145 including tax per night!! Cons: Room was very small, maybe 3 ft all around the bed, small desk. Ceiling in the room was cracked with paint chipping. Bathroom looked like the original bathroom from 1900's (clean though). If you're paying full price, a bit expensive in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “And I thought New York rooms were small...!”
Reviews.Author: 232sally
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel. The lobby and communal areas are grand, but it stops as soon as you get in the lift. Rooms are clean and functional, but so small! The bathroom was so tiny, I walked into the toilet when I turned around from the sink! Also, the beds are not usual doubles and are so high, I could have one with some steps! Couple of hints though, sign up to their member scheme. It's free and it means you get free wifi - that's the only reason we did it. There is also a delicious and very chic cupcake shop called 'Sweet' at 11 School Street. They are seriously divine!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Sc0tt
Reviews.Content: Straight the the points... Dirty sheets (!), peeling wallpaper, chipped paint, fruitflies all over the room(!), poorly positioned bathroom shelving (my toothbrush went into the toilet!). No mouthwash. No fridge. Loud annoying AC. And best of all, I was late for my meeting because the stupid shower didn't work. Just dribbled water on me. This is an Omni?? I stayed here for a convention on Sep12. They may have given me a rarely-used room (maybe it was a handicap room?), but it doesn't excuse the conditions. I let them know about it and while the did fix the shower, making it barely usable instead of non-functioning... they didn't address the other items at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mmarte215
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in August - dropping daughter off at school. Nice size room, but the bathroom was tiny. The concierge team was very helpful and the price was great (less two hundred $). Location was good - near the Commons and the "T" (subway), and Starbucks in the lobby ;) Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great lobby, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gopher2003
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to spend very little time in the room, or you are travling alone and don't mind tight quarters, but location is your priority- this is the place for you. Parker House is on the Freedom Trail, located next to everything historical and mere blocks from three different subway stops. You absolutly can't beat the location. That being said, the room is one of the smallest I've been in. It was clean, tighty and comfy if you don't need a lot of room. Also, its historical so translate that as thin walls.
