Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tarheel420
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly. Only negative is that the rooms were small.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: SiwA84
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Omni Parker Hotel, in September. The service was impeccable, they made sure that I got free wi-fi and coffee every day, and the concierge helped me with experiences that made my stay even better. I did not try the hotel restaurant, but I had a meal in the hotel bar, and it was very nice. The only negative thing was the size of the bathroom. if the door went outwards, it would have been ok, but it didn't, and it felt just a little bit claustrophobic. But overall a great experience and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “TINY bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: kv_and_sv
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business... hotel has a older/historical feel to it but I was very dissatisfied w/ the bathroom. It was extremely small and there was no counterspace at all. Didnt use any facilities or eat at any of the restaurants so cant comment on those. Staff was friendly though...

Reviews.Title: “Good service during the hurricane”
Reviews.Author: HappyWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed during hurricane Irene and so were confined to the hotel for most of the day. The hotel kept most of their services running (restaurant, starbucks) so we didn't go without. The rest of the stay was enjoyable, staff were friendly and breakfast was a plentiful buffet. The location was really good for being able to walk most places. There were plenty of restaurants nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for some R&R”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler30
Reviews.Content: I asked my 4 year old what his favorite part of our recent trip to Boston was. The Duck Tour? The Blue Man Group? No, it was the hotel. The Omni Parker House had all that historic charm that made my romantic heart flutter, but amenities that made it a lovely stay for the whole family. For example, my son received a backpack full of goodies (frisbee, crayons, twizzlers, etc.). While we were at dinner, an elf snuck in and turned down the bed, left bottled water for the adults and milk and cookies for my son. We had the buffet breakfast in the restaurant and the selection was bountiful, with fruit that was fresh and delicious, and the wait staff was pleasant and solicitous. Of course, we made time for afternoon tea to try the dessert that was born at the Omni Parker, the Boston creme pie. I heartily recommend taking a break from the freedom trail and indulging.

Reviews.Title: “40th and Family in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Shan319
Reviews.Content: Wonderful huge suite. Perfect location. Best place for Boston Cream Pie. When we arrived the children each got a great treat bag. Perfect family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelchicks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker house for a few nights in Sep. 2011. Great room with plenty of room. Old and historical hotel but very clean and comfortable. Would stay here again anytime we return to Boston. All staff were very helpful and hotel was very quiet. Slightly expensive but everything is in downtown Boston. Location was the very best we could have had.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: devin57
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip to boston. we chose the parker house for it's great ratings and superb location. we were not disappointed. i loved the location - i did a lot of sightseeing by foot and the freedom trail is literally right outside the hotel's door. the lounges and restaurant were nice and the rooms very comfortable. i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston stay”
Reviews.Author: CynthiazMequon_Wi
Reviews.Content: Wanted to share a tidbit to the traveling public in Boston. BEWARE of the location of the Omni is ideal BUT there are SO many beggars and undesirables in the vicinity-Do not stray! I also wanted to warn you-my purse was stolen at the Starbucks a half block away. The Starbucks people said, "It is a horrible location for that!" Omni is lovely and ideal but just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: getthegetters
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni Parker House was everything I expected. We were lucky enough to get a room on a very busy September long weekend, it was pricey, but no more than any other local hotel and maybe even a little less. We had a delightful corner room, queen size bed and the room itself was just fine with a view of the Old City Hall. The bathroom is very very small, but to be expected in such an old hotel. We did join the loyalty program, but did not inform the hotel until our arrival, so the services associated with this were a little slow in coming. I recommend you do this ahead of time. Our check in was also a little delayed because of how busy it was, that was disappointing - but I understand these things happen. The staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming - we did use the valet service, a tad expensive, but the local parking garages were very full with the long weekend. The location of this hotel could not be more perfect and although I would not hesitate to return to this hotel, I also like trying different places too!

Reviews.Title: “Omni staff very giving”
Reviews.Author: Christie R
Reviews.Content: The hoteln loyalty program is free and offers a lot of help. The loyalty ambassdor went out of her way when our fight got delayed. She made sure the Parker house restraint was expecting us and up graded our room. Every staff m ember made us feel special. The location is good for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher H
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel grossly overpriced, they could care less about you as a guest! I used their Valet service during my stay in September 2011 and my vehicle was damaged by their company. They decided to forge the valet ticket saying the damage already existed on my car which is a complete lie! When i gave them my car, there was not damage, and when I get it back there is damage? And they refuse to pay for the repair??? This is NOT the way to run a hotel. I will NEVER stay at another Omni hotel and I will make sure my friends and everyone I talk to knows about this terrible experience with them.

Reviews.Title: “my retiral trip to Boston.”
Reviews.Author: janeg1950
Reviews.Content: this was 5 star all the way, beautiful hotel service was great and despite a hurricane the entire holiday was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dan P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent our wedding anniversary in Boston and stayed at the Omni Parker for one night. We were pleasantly surprised that the front desk clerk had a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries sent to our room upon knowing that we were celebrating our anniversary! Our stay was enjoyable and the hotel was centrally located to all of our activities. My only regret was not being able to enjoy the lounge, as I had heard many positive comments on it. But our limited time did not allow for it. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matilda2Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night recently. The hotel is conveniently located a couple of minutes from Govt centre subway stop which will take you to the airport in a few minutes. The hotel is old in style but nice and spacious in the common areas. The rooms however are very small and we looked out of our window at a wall. The bed was really comfy and we weren't in the room that much so the lack of space or view didn't really bother us. The door into the room must have been really light though as a few times during the night i could hear people talking, starting to wonder if that was the ghosts now,hadn't read about that!!! The hotels location is great, with Boston common and Quincy Market minutes away and it's on the freedom trail. Paying for wifi does annoy me and you have to pay here, however we noticed after if we had filled in a members form we would probably have got this free.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive 2 nights in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jangeoff
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker Hotel is superbly located in Boston . It is an upmarket hotel but even by Boston standards expensive. By my standards it is a bit "over the top" -too many uniformed bell boys etc standing around looking for a tip-I am a very independent traveller! No breakfast was included in the over $300 with taxes room -the other 6 hotels I used in USA/Canada provided breakfast. Lack of a public internet system is a big negative in a hotel as expensive as the Omni Parker-the only internet availability was in the "business centre" attached to the cofffee shop-at the exhorbitant cost of $14 for 30 minutes. Early checkin was provided (a plus for a weary traveller) , the room was excellent -but this hotel is more for business purposes than a casual visitor to Boston

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a lot of personality”
Reviews.Author: Rstoner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House on business. The hotel is on the smaller side, but it is well kept, and they have preserved the history of the building. The rooms were tiny, but the bed was sooo comfortable and there were some modern upgrades in the rooms. While I have heard of ghosts populating certain floors on this hotel, I myself did not encounter any. The location was surprisingly convenient, and there are some great hidden jewel restaurants near by. I don't know that I'd be able to fit my family comfortably in these rooms, but for business or couples this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ghosts”
Reviews.Author: volleyballMom
Reviews.Content: Seriously. Ghosts. If you ask at the desk, they have a list of reported ghost sightings and ghost stories about this grand old hotel. I found out about this the hard way when I discovered that my room on the 3rd floor was supposedly haunted after taking a late evening "Ghost Tour" of Boston. More on that later... I stayed there in October 2011 for an education conference. My "haunted" room was one of the very small single rooms with a window that faced an air shaft. It was nicely appointed with a decent sized walk-in closet big enough to keep my ironing board up. Bath was really, really small, but pretty typical for an old downtown hotel in a large city. As part of the conference, we had breakfast and lunch buffets in the hotel for three days. Every meal was delicious. Service was good, but the servers seem to be highly trained with excruciatingly good etiquette. I have pretty good manners, but I was actually corrected a couple of times by the banquet staff when I was about to use the wrong coffee cup or fork. Wine list was amazing. The location is perfect. Right on the Freedom Trail, very near Boston Common and lots of shopping. Boston is a very â€œwalkableâ€� city and I felt perfectly comfortable walking around in the evening alone or with a few other women. Now about the ghost. The hotel is on the â€œGhost Tourâ€� which was a very entertaining nighttime tour of old graveyards and sites of gruesome things like Boston Strangler murders. The hotel is on the tour and the guide explained about a guest that was found dead in my room. I thought he was put up to it by my travelling companions, but when he found out I was in that room, he turned dead serious (couldnâ€™t resist that one) and told me to ask the desk for the list of ghost stories. The front desk happily turned over the list and my room absolutely was on the list. Staying there alone, I would liked to have known that earlier. Fortunately, the cigar smoke I was supposed to smell from the long departed guest never materialized and neither did the ghost. If you arenâ€™t wild about ghosts, ask for the sheet upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: akr1_10
Reviews.Content: We went with a toddler and I was a bit afraid this business hotel will not fit small kids. I was quite surprised. They provided packn'play (eventhought we had to ask for extra bedding), the service was quick and friendly. The walls are a bit thin...so you can hear exactly what your neighbours are doing..... The greates thing about this hotel is it's location - just min. away from city center, near all the relevant attractions. Although it is a 4 star hotel - it is a bit pricy for waht you get and always try your luck on priceline.com to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “It was an experience full of history and intrigue!”
Reviews.Author: Travel0vr
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up to this hotel, I wasn't sure what to expect. It was obviously some type of historical site due to the cement structure and being right in the middle of everything. However, there was no parking and when the valet came for the car, I was impressed and knew it must be pretty fancy! (smile) Walking into the large open lobby, there was so much character and detail and then when I walked around and saw all of the JFK memorabilia in the showcase, I knew we were in for something special. The room was so elegant and pretty. I had read online that the walls were very thin and that our stay might be noisy, but we were definitely pleased to find out that wasn't the case at all. The history is that this is the site where JFK announced his run for office and also where he proposed to Jackie O and another shocking fact was that Malcolm X was a bellman here! There was also this mirror on our floor that we were told that if you stared hard and long enough, you could see the image of one of the famous authors (like Charles Dickens or someone like that) that had stayed there - kinda eery, but you better believe that we got right up close and looked deep into it BUT no sighting! LOL!!! That would have probably been our early check-out indicator... The decor was beautiful and the beds were so darn cozy. The atmosphere was wonderful and the location was close to everything - we even walked to CHEERS from here and it was a wonderful stay! (Stay tuned for photos...)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: sve114
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful. Our room wasn't ready and they were very accomodating. They stored our luggage, gave us dinner on the house as well as 4 vouchers for breakfast buffets. The rooms are small but tastefully elegant and comfortable. The location is perfect. Walking distance to Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, the Aquarium and Little Italy, as well as shopping. Also very close to Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. The food in the restaurants was delicious! Must haves: Boston Cream Pie, Parker House rolls and lobster rolls. I am a huge fan of the Omni Parker House and fully intend on being a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time in Boston At The Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: Patagandia
Reviews.Content: Grand historic hotel perfectly located on the Freedom Trail and across the street from the Granary Burial Ground. Three different Subway stops very close. Hotel dining room has great food (scrod, Boston Cream Pie and Parker House Rolls invented there) and is elegant. About a block away is Beantown Pub, which is a locals place good for lobster roll and burgers, etc. The coincierge service at the hotel was very helpful recommending places to eat and directions. A nice surprise for my birthday: The Hotel sent up champange and chocolate strawberries! In the North end be sure to go to Pizzeria Regina (get there right at lunchtime opening to avoid the crowd). Modern Pastry makes great cannolis and other delights. A walk around Beacon Hill is a delight. The Art Museum is excellent and is free on Wed's after 4 p.m. (open to 9:45 in a safe neighborhood.) Cambrige is terrific to wander around. Visit Harvard and don't miss the Havard Coop and Harvard Bookstore. Disappointed by Salem: Hoakey Witch Museum. House of 7 Gables good, but not worth the trip up to Salem. Rooms are a little smaller at the Parker House, so ask for a King Room with a King Bed. Clean room with a very comfy king bed. Some noise from adjoining room(s), but otherwise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, excellent amenities.”
Reviews.Author: westcoastcook
Reviews.Content: There's no better place in Boston for the first time tourist or business traveler. Situated right on the Freedom Trail and within walking distance to all of the historic sites, it's ideal for families or single travelers. The double room was rather small, with a tiny bath, but well appointed. The dinner in the Grand dining room was excellent. Booking ahead and paying in full, on-line brings the rate way down and actually made it a bargain, compared to other hotels. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: travveller95
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location! Just a short walk from the T, right in the middle of historic Boston. The staff were friendly, the room was incredibly comfortable - great shower, fluffy pillows, and cozy bed. I slept like a rock. Concierge parking was fast and easy. There are lots of inexpensive places to get a sandwich nearby, and, of course, Quincy Market is just a stone's throw away. You don't stay here for the view - which is outside!

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Vjnitti
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Boston landmark hotel for a conference which I attended. The service was impeccable at this hotel. The staff was highly attentive and yet unobtrusive. The hotel's restaurants had wonderful old world charm and the menu items were both varied and appetizing. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: SoaringDuo
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House is famous for creating Boston Creme Pie and Parker House Rolls. Our stay was like lifestyles of the rich and famous meets the glorious past! We loved this hotel - staff were very friendly and informative about the hotel and attractions, especially Concierges Joseph and Seamus! We breakfasted next to the table where John F. Kennedy proposed to Jacqueline. The individual pots of jam and bottles of pure maple syrup added to the wonder of the buffet breakfast which included fresh omelets and croissants and other baked goods, lox and bagels and fresh fruit. Everything was so classy, but the staff were so down to earth, yet determined to make our stay special. The maids were wonderful so our room was always perfect. The hotel has so much history and is located right in the middle of town so everything is really close and fun to walk to. The trolley/subway/bus stop was within walking distance and will take you right to Harvard University/Cambridge. The three restaurants/bars serve delicious food. The New England Clam Chowder was the best we'd ever tasted. My husband and I have had problems with other hotels in the past, so we were amazed that our stay was so perfect. It is well worth the amount they charge for rooms. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: residivist
Reviews.Content: Great location. Beautiful lobby. Others complained about small rooms, but ours was large and reasonably priced. For the oldest hotel in the USA, she sure has held up well! Nice gym with free weights, lots of machines and a basket of fruit for those inclined to work out. The service at the hotel was the only let down. Our bags never made it to our room... I went down to collect them after waiting for 20 minutes, only to find the bellhop engaged in a conversation with one of the patrons. He didn't even notice me grab my bags and carry them away. The staff behind the reception desk just shrugged their shoulders. Service was similar over the next couple of days for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a queen!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth539
Reviews.Content: Fabulous, stately traditional hotel in a great location close to many historic sights. The staff are all so welcoming and helpful. Very calm haven on a hot August weekend. Join up to the rloyalty program for free WiFi and room service coffee

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lot of history”
Reviews.Author: SwatiRathi
Reviews.Content: Very close to quincy market and the wharf and a bunch of good eating joints and pubs. Rooms are big and clean, bathrooms are a little small though. Parking at the hotel is about 40 bucks a day with valet and wifi in the room is free. Overall, worth staying here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: MollyAnn510
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is wonderful hotel in the middle of downtown Boston. The moment you walk into the beautiful lobby you are greeted by management asking if there anything they can do for you. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary during the trip and when we returned from dinner the hotel had sent up Champagne and 2 indivual Boston Cream Pie deserts accompanied by a hand written card from the manager wishing us a Happy Anniversary. This hotel is full of history and we received a complimentary book detailing it's long history. It is the longest continuously operating hotel in America. Both the Boston Cream Pie and Parker House Rolls were first created at the Omni Parker House restaurant. The location is wonderful because it is right on the Boston's historical Freedom Trail. Also less than 5 minute walk to the closest train station. The rooms are small but that is the case with most older hotel rooms but very well kept and clean. When I return to Boston I will definately plan on staying at the Omni Paker House again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lingraldi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker for 2 nights in August 2011. My mother in law recommended the hotel as a place to stay in Boston from her stay in the 80's. I am appreciative of historic buildings and this hotel did not disappoint. The lobby was beautiful with dark ornate woodwork. We used the express check in online. We walked up to the desk, got our room information and went to our room, less than 3 minutes after we walked in the building we were in our room. The room was just what we needed. A king size bed, a desk, a flat screen tv to watch after countless hours walking in Boston. The concierges were very helpful with directions. We would definitely stay here again if we have the opportunity to return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Become a member!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineStateGuy1776
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and in a wonderful location. Join the membership rewards program! You get free drinks in the morning (hot and cold) and several other benefits. There is no cost and it is a MUST! :-) One of the better deals in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: steffery01
Reviews.Content: The day of check in the hotel was able to let us check in early. Olivia @ the front desk was fabulous knowing it was one of our birthdays she made sure we had champange and boston cream pie! The traditional room is a great price and big enough for 2. The location is supurb, we walked to everything. The only bad thing is my truck was damaged in the valet garage. Not a little ding a huge dent!!!! But overall the Omni parker is a great place. We will stay here every time we visit Boston. Just to update...the Valet manager called today 9/11/11 to appologize and he was very nice! It means alot to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room was ok”
Reviews.Author: evansvuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location if you want to walk Boston. Close to historic attractions, good restaurants, and good night life. The hotel is very nice. The lobby is gorgeous. Nostalgia fills the air and you can imagine poets and writers meeting here for a drink and a debate. The hotel bar closes early though so if you want to have a last drink after a night on the town....do it before midnight. There is a little coffee stand in the hotel store but there is also Starbucks a block away. So skip the limited selection and head down the street for your morning coffee. The room was small, oddly shaped, and the bathroom was wheel chair accessible....however apparently people in wheelchairs don't need to store their items anywhere b/c there wasn't any place to put a a travel bag or a towel except a very narrow windowsill. With so many hotel choices in the area, I am not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Rathleane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near everything you need to get to in Boston.The new bicycle rental scheme and T tram service is just a 5 minute walk away.All the top shops are also within walking distance.The hotel staff are most helpful.The rooms are very clean and comfortable although are a bit on the small side.It is a quiet hotel and you do not hear any outside traffic.There is no rush to check out at 12pm as published if your flight is later which is helpful.You can print your boarding card in the Business Centre at no cost.I would recommend this hotel when visiting Boston

Reviews.Title: “If you like historical luxurious reasonably priced accommodations...this is the hotel for you!!”
Reviews.Author: Donderblix
Reviews.Content: We, my mom and I, came to visit some of the historical highlights in Boston and to do some whale watching. I am a Red Sox Fan also and so I came to see a Red Sox game as well. The hotel has an awesome Red Sox package that I recommend. The seats we were at for the game, were in the 4th row, right behind the bullpen and we got to see Jason Varitek who is my absolutely #1 FAV! The location of the hotel was perfect ! You are within walking distance to everything, such as Boston Commons, Boston Harbor, Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market to name a few of the places we saw. The hotel was extremly clean and the staff courteous. The rooms were roomy enough and the beds were so comfortable that we didn't want to get out of them!! We will definitely be back and recommend this to everyone!!! They also say its haunted. We loved hearing some of the stories attached this great place, however, we did not have any haunting experiences, much to our dismay!! But I do look forward to the our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Not truly a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: writergirlTn_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The night we got in, we were led to our Premiere Suite only to find that it reeked of cigarette and/or cigar smoke. My fiance is HIGHLY allergic to smoke. Called the front desk only to hear, " Sorry, it's the only suite we have left." They said they could send up an ozone(?) machine to get the smell out, but by then we were both coughing, and it appears the scent probably was imbedded in not only the air, but the drapes and upholstery. I asked for the manager, who was the ONE person ONLY who was pleasant and helpful the entire trip. Jeff said that he would give us two adjoining rooms for that night, and then tomorrow offered to set us up in not only a Premier Suite, but one that also adjoined to an Executive suite. WE actually had an "apartment," for LESS than the price we were going to pay for only ONE suite! That was great. (However, there was a lot of honking horns where we were in a corner room, not to mention outside jackhammering at night. We were on the 11th fl. so it was not TOO bad. It did get on my nerves after 4 days.) But MY bathroom was so small, it was the size of a closet- and a small one at that. I had to put my makeup on, by placing all of my stuff in the SINK, just to get to it without dropping everything all over the floor. And to blow dry your hair???? Forget it. Nothing else need be said. It is true I am a pretty picky person about rooms, because I travel alot and stay only in 4 star - or 5 star--hotels. Furnishings were very nice, but I noticed a few small places of mold in the shower. Not great. I called housekeeping for turndown service and they never came that night, and at least one other night. We are members of the Omni Select program, and were supposed to get a daily newspaper. Had to ask for it TWICE. The concierge people knew absolutely NOTHING about directions to anything. Got us so lost that we finally gave up even asking. We did not eat a lot at the hotel, but the salad we ordered was surprisingly good... one of the best during our Boston stay. Nobody was friendly at all-- but that might just be Boston. It was my first time there. This was actually a 3 and 1/2 star hotel, based on the poor service, unfriendliness, etc. Jeff, the manager, however was great---helped us out a lot with the room problem.

Reviews.Title: “Everything fine, nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Vail2Italy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House in Boston with my two sons in early September. I paid $180 for a room with one queen bed and $259 for a room with two double beds with parking. My room was really, really small and had a view of a brick building about 20 feet away. My bathroom was so small that it was not possible to stand in the room and look in the mirror with the door open. The toilet was one foot from the bathtub on one side and two feet from the sink on the other side. Not a great set up. My boys' room was bigger, but a lot more expensive too. This is an older hotel. It has been updated, but the rooms are nothing special. The noise in the hallways could be heard in my room throughout the night, which made for a restless sleep. The beds were very comfortable. They charge for internet, but if you sign up for their free loyalty program, then they comp internet. They also will bring you a free beverage in the morning with this program which arrived on time and was just what I ordered. Overall, a very average experience. You could probably do better for the money in Boston. Location very good, right near the Boston Commons and easy walk to Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Lots of History”
Reviews.Author: nunce1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married recently up in New Hampshire at the Omni Mt Washington hotel so when we had occasion to stay a couple nights in Boston, we decided to try out another Omni because we were so happy with the hotel and service up in Mt Washington. They offered a great military rate, which helped bring the cost down to a very reasonable price for Boston. The location is FANTASTIC! The place itself is very ornate and well-built - typical for an old hotel. You can tell it's been updated over the years so the rooms are fairly modern. The bathroom is tiny, but I doubt many hotels in Boston have super large rooms/bathrooms. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is just that there are some parts that look a little neglected. The hallways to the rooms look a little worn out and in the dining room there is a ton of dust, for example, on the ornate crown molding at the top of the pillars. Not a big deal obviously, but one of the things we truly appreciated at the Omni Mt Washington was the service and attention to every last detail. So it was surprising that little things like this would go unnoticed by the staff. Old glass windows between parts of the restaurant were dirty - little things like that. The breakfast was delicious (though pricey). The bar was great for a few drinks and the staff all very friendly and helpful. The place has a lot of history and we would definitely recommend checking this place out! By the way, parking is very VERY expensive at $40/night but we've stayed elsewhere in Boston and it had the same parking rate. So that may be the price of staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelz08
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, no doubt- just be aware when booking through any other site other than the hotel itself (I booked through a third party whom I think is best to remain nameless for this posting)- if you want to change your room from the "Traditional" room (which has one queen bed that felt like a double), it will cost you extra. We were initially told we could have a room with 2 double beds (or 2 queen's can't remember) and it wouldn't cost us extra. The next day we inquired about this and we were told that it would cost $50 extra- this is because we didn't book through the hotel directly. We decided not to opt for this, but were disappointed that a hotel of this standard and caliber wouldn't give us a room with 2 double beds (I personally do not call this an upgrade- 1 or 2 beds in a room are standard at most hotels). If the Omni Parker House believes third party booked customers not worthy of the same treatment as other guests, then why even use a third party at all? It could be our luck and others may say this has not happened before at this hotel, but it was a little disappointing to me and my friend. Other than that, the hotel itself is very nice and located right on the freedom trail close to the Boston Common, Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market and the waterfront. A tip- valet parking is $42 a night, so we parked at Center Plaza and from Sunday to Tuesday it only cost $60. Go to the Central Parking website and print off a coupon to save on parking! Besides the small rooms and slight disappointment with the information provided by the front desk, the hotel was great and and the staff are super friendly. The Boston Cream pie originated in this hotel and it's really good! I would consider staying here again if I came back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamagacci
Reviews.Content: Great price $200. per night plus $42 per day for parking in the heart of downtown boston. Getting the car to the valet parking was a hassle, because the street is so small where you drop the car off, I would reccomend getting there early and leaving your bags. Everything was within walking distance to the hotel, or we used the trolley system. I had asked for a room with a view on a high floor which was not a problem. The beds were very comfortable room was clean a spacious . We joined thier reward program and got free internet, plus the kids recieved a little backpack with gifts, and milk and cookies the first night which was a surprise. I ordered room service to try the boston cream pie, I was not as impressed with the pie, it wasn't what I w as expecting, but it was OK. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, but make sure you bring plenty of cash for tips. we usually stay at hotels where we can carry our own luggage and park the car ourselves. here it is impossible to do this. they don't allow guests to use the luggage carts on the elevators and of course the valet guys park your car , the porters take care of your luggage. Although it is very nice to be waited on like this, it is not something we are used to. We would definitely stay at the Omni if we visit Boston again. I would also recomend looking into the go boston card, it saved us a ton of money and gave us the flexibility to do things we probably wouldn't have done if we didn't have the card.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Historic, Great Location...Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is well situated amidst all the historic and tourist sites in Boston. It's very close to Logan airport too ($25 cab ride from Logan, $18 back). The hotel has great history and many stories. The rooms are pretty well updated - the small size of the room is to be expected from such an old hotel. Unfortunately our room had a view of a wall, so it was dark, but we weren't really in Boston to spend time in the room, so it didn't matter too much. We also enjoyed the large hotel gym in the basement. Despite all the good things we can say about this hotel, we were struck by the poor and seemingly stuck up service provided by the front desk and concierge staff. On the other hand, housekeeping and maintenance staff were always kind and considerate. When it began to rain when we were there, we noticed people outside walking around with umbrellas provided by their hotels. Probably about 8-10 different hotel brands on the umbrellas and many of lesser quality brands than Omni. So the next morning we asked the concierge if we could use an umbrella for a couple hours. The answer was a simple "No, we don't have many and they go quickly". Did that mean they don't have any left today? None left because they went earlier in the season and were stolen? Hotel staff didn't order enough? They were reserving them for others? When we asked where we could get one, we were told that there are many stores in the area that will have and maybe the gift shop. And then she moved on to other business. We were somewhat surprised by this terse response, but went to a nearby store and purchased one anyway. On our final day, we had an afternoon flight and asked the front desk for a checkout of 12:30 instead of 12. Again, a terse response albeit simple: "No, we can't do that". We were told that the hotel was fully booked and despite it being a part of the Omni Select service (and a general offering that has never been refused to us....ever!). We questioned the gentleman to try to use logic to explain that it really didn't make a difference if we stayed 30 min longer since not everyone was staying later, so there would have been ample time to have the room cleaned before the next batch of guests checked in at 3. He said no again. We asked for the manager to explain further and within minutes the same gentleman came back and said ok with such a negative attitude. No explanation, apology or anything else to say. By the way, the reason for our delayed checkout - we were spending an extra $75 in their own restaurant! Personally we would not stay at this hotel again based purely on the attitude of staff, but at the same time we would still recommend the hotel for its history and location if you can get a decent price. There are other great hotels nearby to check out too and that's what we'll do next time we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “What a bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisS88
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here in August 2011 (two room) and the hotel was a big let down. The hotel is very shabby and stale and needs complete renovation. For $300 + per night we was expecting a bit more. Our rooms were the size of cupboards with only a small window ( virtually above head height) for natural light. I would not be exaggerating to say this was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. There are plenty of other hotels in the center of Boston available at a comparable price and we wish we had chosen one of those. All I can say is that if you stay here, prepare for disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great look, staff, location, but small room, and expensive”
Reviews.Author: clpjr2000
Reviews.Content: The Parker feels plush and looks fantastic. Classic high end hotel, with if the walls could talk vibe. Has modern conveniences, but not designed for them. Room with 2 double beds is small, with tiny dresser and desn crammed in. Small bathroom with doll sink. Clean, very comfortable beds, perfect location, centered around all the big attractions and walks. High price does make you think twice at $250, but Boston not cheap anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Many older food and bar service personnel were obnoxious”
Reviews.Author: Al H
Reviews.Content: The old waiter at our function literally threw the butter patties at plates and gave guests an angry look if they were in his way. He also removed food before guests were finished. when his behavior was reported to the older woman in charge she said he had a schedule to keep and she wasn't concerned. Apparently she wanted to get home as early possible as well. The lady who ran the bar was just terrible, when a guest asked for another drink for his companion just after he ordered, she said he should have asked for it when he ordered and he was forced to get at the end of the line. In the Last Hurrah, an older heavy set waiter simply refused to wait on some guests until finally a younger waiter came to their rescue. Apparently, the older wait staff run the hotel for their benefit, not the guests. finally, the angry older chef headed heavy set guy who was making omelets was just nasty and looked mad at anyone who asked for one. They whole place needs some undercover observances from real management or maybe the union runs the place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: AnitaD2009
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Only a few blocks from the train and cabs and buses are easily accessible. The room we were in was a bit small but, the bed was amazingly comfortable. The hotel gave us free snacks and champagne or wine every afternoon as we were returning back from our day of exploring Boston at about 5pm. Everyone at the hotel was exceptionally nice and helpful. The room was exceptionally clean and we enjoyed our stay. Great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Often before but never again - creepy service”
Reviews.Author: JJWLW
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times before, but this was the last time (and if my wife has her way, the last time for any Omni). Used online checkin, they promised room would be ready at 1. It wasn't even ready two+ hours later, apparently because my frequent guest profile requests a feather-free room (one of the choices they claim to offer). Not to worry, they said: "we'll put you in a feather room for now, then swap everything out while you're out at the game." Returned from game and dinner only to find out no one had bothered to do anything, Desk manager then lied about how quickly he'd fix the problem, and apparently it's never ok to call them on their service failures (the first guy who showed up at the room had zero pillows to swap out the 8 that were being replaced, which someone dampened my confidence).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: gmhaggis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this grand old hotel in the down town area on a recent vacation trip to Boston. Immediately on arrival, impressed by the grand looking lobby area. High ceilings, clearly old and faded, but still well kept. On check-in, staff were prompt and friendly, no waiting around. Originally booked a "petite single" room, but was given a complimentary upgrade to a queen. Room was still fairly small, but more than adequate and high standard of cleanliness. Bed was very comfy, and the pre-requested non-feather pillows and duvet were provided on arrival. Bathroom was tiny and definitely showing its age, but again more than adequate and clean. My only minor complaint about the room was the AC unit was very noisy. If you're a light sleeper this could be annoying during the summer months. The breakfast buffet was very good, with good selection of fruit, cereals, pastries and hot food. Also made to order omelettes on request. The breakfast was a bit pricey. It was included in my room rate and not so sure I would have paid the extra. If coffee and bun is sufficient, there is a Starbucks literally a stones throw from the hotel, down School Street. Location wise hotel is great. If your doing the tourist thing, then situated right on the Freedom Trial. A few minutes walk from stations for the three main subway lines... Government Center, Park St, and State. A taxi to/from Logan Airport was about $25 and this included tolls and tip. If carrying luggage then much more convenient that using the subway. I booked my stay through the British Airways site and got a very good rate (incl, Breakfast), much better than offered directly by the hotel and other third party hotel booking sites. One tip: make sure to join the Omni Hotels loyalty program (from hotel web site) before arrival, as this offers several immediate complimentary services - free wifi, free morning beverage and free morning newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a Boston break, affordable comfort”
Reviews.Author: Banksy63
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by very friendly reception staff and porter. We stayed in room 1143 which was a deluxe king size room and worth paying the extra for (as we stayed for 7 nights). The bed was massive and very comfortable. The room and bathroom were also big (possibly designed as a disabled room). Ice making machine was also great, but wouldn't want to be in a room next to it due to the noise of the chiller and delivery. There was limited sound insulation between rooms, so you could hear conversations next door. Large flat screen TV with lots of channels, some HD options. Well worth joining the free Select Membership scheme as you get free wi-fi, breakfast tea or coffee and a newspaper. The hotel has a bit of history, apparently the oldest hotel in USA and where JFK proposed to Jackie. It is centrally located for a walking tour of Boston with many restaurants and coffee shops within a short walk. Would recommend this hotel as 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: I booked via hotwire.com, did not where I was going to end up and was very pleased to see that I was given the Omni. I paid $108 plus tax incredible value. When I arrived I asked the desk clerk to put me in a NON-hotwire room, he said â€œthe traditional rooms are all the sameâ€�. If this is true I would have been very disappointed if I had paid the going rate of $260 for a double bed, small bathroom which has no room for your toiletries. I must warn in my opinion the traditional room is suitable for only one person. When traveling, I am a stickler for a clean quite room with a comfortable bed. The Omni met and exceeded my requirements, the staff was friendly and courteous. The hotel is located in an excellent location for business and leisure. The Omni is easy walking distance to the waterfront, Faneuil Market, North End, Financial District & Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, unacceptable and appalling behavior from staff”
Reviews.Author: Court7
Reviews.Content: Got a room for resturant week with a friend so we could enjoy drinks and not worry about driving. We were hardly in the room AT ALL, and we were notified that there were noise complaints coming from the room (which we barley were in since we enjoyed a night out and a nice dinner??). We returned to the room at 2:30am. After talking to front desk we were informed of a guest posing as a security guard knocking on other guests doors. They did nothing about this security issue..we became nervous and the hotel employeess were verbaly agressive towards us (2 women in mid 20's). They kicked us out at 3am in the morning with no place to go. If you want poor treatment, this is your hotel. Clearly unconcearned for the saftey of their guests. I am outraged. WORST hotel i have ever stayed at. Unknown charges to my bank account from the hotel as well. POORLY run establishment. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “worst possible choice, don't go!”
Reviews.Author: Badhotelhater1234
Reviews.Content: As we walked in our room (1041) I noticed the room is very small. I can understand that as the oldest hotel in the US (perhaps) this is normal. Although I noticed that this room assigned to us is a handicap accessible room so the bathroom is very large, almost the size of the room. given that the room is a 240 SF size room, it lefts very little room in the actually living space. Also, my wife and I also brought our 8 months old son with us so obviously we need a crib in the room as well as a fridge. This is why I actually contacted the front desk before our trip to Boston to ask if a room with fridge and a crib available. The answer was yes so we came. However, with the crib and the little fridge, the room is packed and there is even no room for us to walk. The only place to put the crib is either block the door or right by the AC unit. The AC is quite noisy and it is too cold for the baby. Given all the difficulties my wife went downstairs talked to someone at the front desk and asked if there is a room that we can switch to. She was told that all rooms are sold out and the only option is we just wait until the next day. I thought it was not reasonable since it is really hard for us to manage so I went down again to talk to the guy at the front desk. I was a bit frustrated with the situation so I expressed my frustration to this gentleman. His answer was: well, as we are the oldest hotel in the US, we would like to keep the historic characters to it so even though you think this room is small, sir, actually we already gave you the largest room possible in this class. It is 240 SF, and normally it is less than 200 SF. blah blah blah, none of these helps my situation. He then told me that if we wait till tomorrow we "MAY" get an upgrade to a dulex room but not promised for an additional fee of $50. I thought this is not reasonable so I asked can he just cancel our reservation and get a refund. He said: Sir sorry I cannot do that, you do know that you booked from a third party right? If you booked from us directly I can just let you go right now. but you can also choose to talk to your third party agent I cannot help. I felt pretty offended but in order to get our situation improved, i tried one more time to explain that we do need to switch. He then searched again and said that he found a room of 295 SF at the same class but not cleaned yet. I asked when we can move he said that he can give me a call. it was at around 1pm and it is already late for our schedule, and our trip is not to just stay in the hotel, so I have to just compromise to this. I thought we could get the room before or at around 3pm as 3pm is the check in time for most of the rooms so we changed our plan and waited for about 2 hours in the hotel since we cannot just leave and come back and move to another room. But nothing happened at 3pm.We cannot wait and left. I forgot when but very late I got a call and said this room is ready when we were away from the hotel in Cambridge. The voicemail basically told me that i need to verbally agree to hold the room by 6:30 otherwise it would be released. However when I got the voicemail it is already 7:40. So I missed it. When I came back and talked to someone at the front desk and they told me sorry they cannot find anything any more. I didn't argue and just left and dealt with our situation. In the end, we didn't get any decent sleep as the baby was just not comfortable so we have to move the crib into the bathroom or by the door. The baby also got a terrible cold from the AC unit in the room. Thursday night when I got some food back to the room, because it was so small and nowhere to sit, I had to eat my food on the toilet. I hope you can imaging my feeling at that point. This trip was a disaster and I don't even want to mention this trip again. Thanks for your kind email and I do understand the small rooms but I do not understand why there is no consideration of a family of three especially I got a handicaps accessible room. That's the worst possible choice unless you think putting the crib in the bathroom is a good solution for a "4 star hotel". By the way, I think the 4 star in this case is very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: KatCu
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms during our stay. The hotel is very old and therefore some of the rooms are small and there is no air conditioning in the hallways. However, what is lacking in modern hotel layout/amenities, they make up for in service. Also, the historical nature of the hotel is tourist location in itself and you may even see a ghost. There a several "T" stops, restaurants and tourist attractions near by and the hotel is on the Freedom Trail. Great Location! We had called to make our reservations and all of our preferences were met upon check-in. Also, we contacted the loyalty ambassador prior to our arrival to arrange for room service to celebrate a special event. Not only was everything delivered according to plan, but was complimentary. One of our rooms ordered room service that was delivered later than usual and was given complimentary. However, it had only been a half-hour and the guests didn't even considered it late. Also, there was an issue with another hotel guest doing inappropriate things in the hallway. One of the guests staying in the rooms we booked saw the event and contacted the front desk. Even though there was no way this could have been prevented, nor was it the hotel's fault, they guests were offered free breakfast vouchers and all of their previous room service was waived. They went above and beyond the expectations for our stay and we greatly appreciated it. We loved Boston and hope to stay in that hotel when we visit again!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in down town boston”
Reviews.Author: MikeDimelow
Reviews.Content: Built in 1857 and tastefully restored this hotel is a cool place to bring a family - I write this note from the hotel bar ;-). We chose this place because virgin atlantic cancelled our flight home, due to the evil "irene" storm come hurricane come tornado. I would definately return but next time minus the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Old world excellence.”
Reviews.Author: ducs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1268 for five nights in August 2011. The room was large and quiet and the air conditioning worked great. Saw some of the reviews saying small rooms and tiny bathrooms so paid a little extra for the executive room and it was worth it. Very spacious room with two double beds, two nightstands, desk with chair, three person sofa, arm chair, foyer, and good-sized bathroom with bathtub, but only one sink. Pillows were not good though. This room is also all the way at the end of a hall all by itself so it was very quiet. You can't expect views in a downtown city hotel, but we got them anyway: a view of the Prudential building and the old and new John Hancock buildings. The hotel is gorgeous and elegant, yet not intimidating. Every staff member was friendly and helpful (except one waitress in Parker's Bar who would just run past our table and I had to call out what we wanted). Even though Boston is a great city with great restaurants, you would never have to leave the hotel if you didn't want to. Beautiful and elegant restaurant; sports bar (Parker's) with views of King's Chapel and Old City Hall; and a more elegant bar (The Last Hurrah) where you can sip a cocktail and people watch as this one faces the street. A bonus was that the bars served Plymouth Gin which is very hard to find. The food was excellent and reasonably priced (at least in Parker's Bar where we ate and restaurant week was going on so you could get a three course meal for $33 in the restaurant). My husband and I split a clam chowder and each had a lobster roll that came with an abundance of crispy french fries which he couldn't finish and I didn't touch as we were stuffed. Much more reasonably priced lobster rolls here than any other place we went (and better than Neptune Oyster House in my opinion). Highly recommend the clam chowder, Parker House rolls, lobster rolls, and Boston Creme Pie (different than the traditional, lighter). We felt like royalty when the hotel left a Boston Creme Pie and bottled water in our room on our first night and delivered hot coffee every morning along with the newspaper. All at no charge as we had joined their loyalty program. There was a coffee maker in the room as well. If it is not being used for a private event, grab a drink at one of the bars, go up to the 14th floor, turn left out of the elevator, up the stairs and all the way to the back of the small cocktail lounge where you can go outside and enjoy your cocktail under an awning with tables and views of Fenway Park and the Charles River. Or just take a peek out there to see the view before you go out into the City. Beautiful hotel, great room, delicious food and drink, wish we could live there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: Located on The Freedom Trail, the hotel is very close to many attractions. The bed was a little too soft for my liking, but other than that the room was great. We stayed in a suite with a separate sitting area with sofa bed. It was nice to have the extra space. Very clean fitness center with well-maintained, quality equipment. St. Charles River is just under a mile away - beautiful running path.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius-Paganini
Reviews.Content: First the hotel staff is great and very kind. The hotel is very well located. It is like 1 block of 2 subways stations that you could acess almost all the subway line (green, orange and blue). Besides, it is very close to Quincy market with some bars and restaurants, close to Hard Rock Cafe and close to New England Aquarium. It is possible to reach all this by foot. The hotel style is classic/antique, because it is in a historic building, and not old like some said, because everything is working fine. The one who like more clean and modern hotel might not like this hotel because it is a diferent style, but no doubt it is a beautiful hotel. As I wrote before, being part of the loyalty program, the Select Guest, is a great choice. You pay nothing and get some benefits like free wifi acess and beverages in the moorning. I think is the only hotel loyalty program that is ease you get something even if you don't stay so much in this hotel. Again the staff is really great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Carol-on-the-Go
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, attentive and friendly staff, beautifully appointed rooms, and a perfect location just minutes to the Boston Common and Quincy Market and on the Freedom Trail. The hotel was luxurious and well-priced given Boston real estate. Dinner at the Parker House was excellent and much more than just a hotel restaurant. The historical ambience and nouveau-prepared foods made lingering over dinner a memorable experience. I would definitely return to the Parker House for more of that gracious Boston hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: snowbird_joe
Reviews.Content: As a reward member you get treated like royalty and they don't forget comments you make on previous visits. We once had to request a bath mat and I commented on how quickly one arrived afte we requested one. Our next visit the following year, we were welcomed by the manager in the key package along with "and we've taken special care to see to it you had a bath mat since we know it was a concern of yours last time you were here." How's that for customer service?!!! The location in a block away from the city hall parking which is only $ 10 on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it...”
Reviews.Author: AudgeSanAntonioTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business...My favorite part of walking in and checking in was that they were having an ice cream social with homemade ice cream! Things to be aware of about this hotel.....it is not super fancy....it is pretty old....but it is super nice. They offer free wifi if you sign up as a select member....which is totally free, so why not? Their lobby is beautifully decorated. If you like clean and simple, you will love this. I would definitely stay here again and it is in a perfect location....Starbucks is right around the corner...And they have a nice restaurant next store that is connected. The only thing I wish was better was the pillows...they were small and too soft. I am a picky pillow sleeper, so this might not pertain to you. I just have to have a firm pillow. Let me say that the staff was really, really friendly. The front desk attendants went above and beyond to make my stay better...kind of a long story but we were scheduled to stay there in May, but our flights were canceled due to inclement weather (tornado's) so we had to post pone our trip until July...They allowed us to just reschedule and were super cool about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: rocky190
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Omni Parker House and was impressed by the consistent service and courteous staff. Well located in downtown Boston close to all emenities and sight seeing. Parking was expensive but this is common in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the tourist trail in a piece of history”
Reviews.Author: MrMagee_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part of Boston's history and on the Freedom Trail of "must see" sights in Boston. For tourists and travellers our family found the location was a very good starting point for walking to most of the places we wanted to see in Boston. It is an historic building, so the rooms were smaller than anywhere else we stayed on our tour of New York and New England. The front of house service was good - friendly and helpful people on the desks and concierge. The food was very good and priced at a level I'd expect in a city centre hotel of this class. Having said that, on the night we booked dinner, the menu we were presented with at dinner was different (and more expensive) than that we'd seen when we'd reserved a table an hour and half earlier. The big downer was the noisy room - the garbage collection vehicles arrived between 2am and 5am, so after two nights we asked for a room change which the staff were able to do (and gave us complimentary buffet breakfasts).

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: the_rover_syracuse
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, one for my parents and the other for us. The rooms themselves were small but not cramped. The decor was beautiful. The rooms and beds were clean. The service was first rate. The hotel offers a restaurant and a Starbucks to its guests. The location is fabulous. It's walking distance to the aquarium, quincy market, and harbor, ten minutes drive to the science museum, right on the freedom trail, and surrounded by great restaurants and coffee shops. Our duck tour guide pointed out our hotel as a historic site and we couldn't stop grinning! The entrance is opulent and takes you back in the day of Dickens and Hawthorne.

Reviews.Title: “just back from an 'unexpected' 2 night stay in Boston thanks”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessDublin
Reviews.Content: to work !... last time I was in Boston, I stayed in the Sheraton on Dalton St, however on this occassion it was full so I looked at the map and booked the Omni Parker.. EXCELLENT location, could not ask for better, around the corner from Boston Common, and a few min walk from F. Market Sq and the Harbour. From the bell boys, to reception, to the bar/waiting staff ( of which there were plenty in all areas), the attention to guests was superb !... Down side was the size of the room (which I expected after reading the reviews) but the bathroom had to take the biscuit, you all probably know the saying 'to swing a cat' but you couldn't even get a cat into the bathrom, let alone swing it!!!!!!. lack of storage space also meant that the hairdryer was hanging (in a bag) on the back of the bathroom door. Also found the mattress on the bed extremely soft and I personally prefer a more firmer bed but still had a good nights sleep. Also liked the fact that there was bath robes available in the closet in the room but USD7 for a 1lt bottle of water was a bit excessive !.. Really enjoyed the buffet breakfast and the dining area was 'olde world', you could almost picture grandur times. Ate at Parker's bar and enjoyed the food, preferred eating in the hotel as I was travelling on my own and found it easier just to bring my book down, request a nice glass of chardonnay and something to eat !... Requested a late check out and got 1pm which suited me fine... If I have the pleasure of returning to Boston, I will definately be looking at a stay in the Omni Parker but will request a room with a view of something other than a brick wall !...

Reviews.Title: “Downtown location with historic charm”
Reviews.Author: intlwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip in August. My company selected the hotel due to its proximity to our meetings that week. The lobby is lovely, with gorgeous fresh flower arrangements that are changed daily. One concierge, Joseph, went above and beyond to ensure I had a good stay and deserves special mention. He is great and, on the whole, all of the staff were polite, efficient and courteous. Kudos to all who work so hard to make our stay pleasurable. My room was a larger room (I became an Omni member to get a larger room, free wifi and free beverage in the am - I recommend this), and the bed was extremely comfortable. The wifi worked fine and my room was absolutely suited for work. The negatives. My room was directly across from where all the room supplies were kept - sheets, towels, water, etc. and there was non-stop foot and trolley flow back and forth as they worked from dawn til dusk. It was a big downer and I would strongly recommend people ensure they are not located in this spot. Also, the hotel is very big and often hosts parties, weddings, meetings, etc. The lifts were often very full and I found myself in a perpetual holding pattern to either go up to my room or come down. I think one day a wedding, meeting and party were all occurring simultaneously at the hotel. It took me 9 minutes to exit my room and come down one day, as I had to wait for a lift that wasn't full to capacity. I definitely prefer the smaller, boutique places that aren't quite so chaotic. My overall assessment, I'd recommend it for business, especially if you are a heavy sleeper, but I wouldn't want to spend a vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Package Deal but watch check your bill!”
Reviews.Author: beth8520
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a two night weekend get away and purchased their Duck tour package which included the breakfast buffet each morning and the duck tour. It also included a kids back pack for each child and milk and cookies on the night you arrived. We did have to ask for the backpacks for our children, they were not offered. They also have a back pack with books and games that the children can borrow to use in the hotel and my youngest child really liked that but again it was not offered we had to ask. We had a premier suite which was located on a front corner of the building. The rooms were an adequate size, definitely not large rooms but this is an old historic hotel so it was what we expected. They were nicely decorated, they did have an odor of air freshener which I did not like. The air conditioning units kept the room very cool and provided nice white noise so we did not hear any of the city noise. The bathroom was small as many have said but it was nice and clean and had a shelf to keep your make up bag and other items on. One complaint about housekeeping- our ice bucket was not emptied after the first night and the milk bottles they delivered with the cookies were still there after the room was cleaned. The elevators were often full in the morning but since we were only on the fourth floor we took the stairs. It would have been more of a problem if we had been on a higher floor. The breakfast buffet was nice, well stocked with fresh berries and fruit and the usual breakfast foods as well as an omelet station. The wait staff was very friendly and very nice to our children. Coffee and juice was refilled before you even noticed it was empty. Concierge was helpful and the duck tour was easy to book through them. My big complaint would be that the buffet was part of our room rate and we ended up having a charge from each morning on our bill. I had to call once we were home to get it removed. They did remove it but I find it frustrating to purchase a package rate and not be billed appropriately. Overall a nice stay in an old historic hotel and we booked on their site and received a very competitive rate for our package deal. Just be sure to check your bill.

Reviews.Title: “The standards and service expected of Omni”
Reviews.Author: Luna2006
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay and ate in the restaurant twice and used both bars. With exception of a hiccup with the bags being delivered to our room (took. Around 45 mins) and had to be chased, this was a great stay. Yes the rooms are not the biggest, we couldnt upgrade due to the hotel being full but the room was ok and we were happy for three nights. This hotel is the most ideal positioning for the city, we walked everywhere we could. Also recommend the cycle rickshaw and trolly busses. We couldn't get a late check out beyond 12.30 but were able to leave luggage with bell captain so we were able to get the most out of our last day. Thoroughly recommend the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - hotel not so great”
Reviews.Author: SFWOxford
Reviews.Content: I was here for 9 nights as part of a business trip to the US. When I checked on I was given room 759 which was tiny, very dark and cramped and looked out onto a brick wall. It was also very noisy. I asked if I could move and was given room 1028 which was almost twice the size, bright and airy with a view towards the harbour and much quieter. The room itself was fine but the public areas of the hotel are dark and dowdy. I know the hotel is old but it just feels lacklustre. There are coffee makers in the rooms and if you sign up to the loyalty programme you get free wifi and a choice of drinks delivered to your room each day with a newspaper. For a few extra dollars you can have a bagel, muffin or croissant which is a nice touch. I found the food in the restaurant to be bland and expensive. There are some amazing restaurants nearby which are much better. The location of the hotel is brilliant. 5 minutes walk from Quincy Market, 10 minutes from the Harbour and 2 minutes from Boston Common and the Park Street T stop - brilliant! There are other hotels nearby and I would probably choose one of those in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: lenaNatchitoches_LA
Reviews.Content: The Omni lived up to it's expectations! Courteous , attentive , knowledgeable staff and concierges. Great location to access Freedom Trail, and Old Time Trolley. Historic, immaculate lobby, and the deluxe room we stayed in was yes, small, but very well appointed with all of the amenities-- fine linen, towels, bathrobes, and extremely clean. Suggest staying on at least the 6th floor for better views. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: JoeWhazou
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my wife with a trip to Boston for our 10th anniversary. In doing research on hotels in the city, I settled on the Omni Parkerhouse. We love historic buildings and, being in Boston, we chose to stay at the Parkerhouse. It's the oldest continuously operated hotel in the country. It has a fantastic story and many claims to fame, being home to the original "Boston Creme Pie" just one of them. Beyond all that, its location couldn't be better. It's situated right in the middle of the theatre district, across the street from Boston Commons. Boston is such compact city with so much to see, most sights and attractions are well within walking distance of the Parkerhouse. The staff was increadibly pleasant and helpful. Knowing it was our wedding anniversary, they sent a complimentary bottle of champaign and chocolate covered strawberries to our room shortly after we checked in. We aren't drinkers, so they graciously took the champaign away and brought us a selection of soft drinks instead. Very nice! The last night of our stay, there was a water main break somewhere in the city. The entire area was on a boil order. The hotel staff quickly responded to the situation, bringing extra water bottles to our room at no charge and allowing the use of the water from the mini bar at no charge. If we needed more, all we had to do was go to the front desk and ask. The suite was beautiful, well appointed and spacious. The bathroom sink area was just a free standing pedistal with very little countertop space. Understanding that this was such an old hotel, I wasn't bothered by this. Some of the other rooms are on the small side, but again, it's the oldest operated hotel in the US, and things were built differently back then. The one disappointment we had was the view, or rather the lack of a view. I was hoping to have a room overlooking the park or the skyline. Ours looked at the side of hotel itself. It was literally 4-5 feet from our window. Not great, but we didn't go to Boston to look out the hotel room window! All in all, it's certainly not the most modern hotel in the city, nor the most luxurious. It's charm is in it's history and its staff. I highly recommend a stay here while in the city, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well equipped hotel in good location for tourists to Boston”
Reviews.Author: NickKosky
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night for excellent price in large single room; comfortable quiet hotel, well appointed, very traditional - maybe a little staid . Don't expect a young or noisy crowd. In room dining and entertainment good. Perfectly pleasant and a very good location for old Boston. Suit adults travelling alone or in groups, or families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Scarab-eight
Reviews.Content: Excellent location downtown Boston. Efficient and quick service. Good quality breakfast Restaurant is elegant and quality is good. As a family of 4 adults we were given a too small room. After the first night they readily gave us a larger room with no additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: QTravelMayo_Ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location of sight seeing and alot of the main attractions. You are minutes walk to the retaurants in the italian quarter aswell as many bars. The hotel itself is very busy, great atmosphere, clean and the service is very good. Free wifi in the lobby which is good!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: RobandMargie
Reviews.Content: Apply to become a select member and you get free internet, newspaper, morning drink and other things.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever”
Reviews.Author: J1Scarlett
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House was definitely one of the top 10 hotels I've been to. The location was convenient to nearly everything you would want to see as a tourist (and the Red, Green, Blue, and Orange stops are all about a block away if you want to go further away). The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was exactly what I asked for (2 double beds, had no issues nor was asked to pay extra for it). Parking at the hotel would be expensive, so I suggest you all park at the Central Parking Garage at Center Plaza about a block away (paid $33.00 total for Friday night-Sunday afternoon).

Reviews.Title: “Grand Landmark Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ILuvLexie
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a great spot if you are visiting Boston for the historical sights. It is located right on the Freedom Trail (and is part of the tour) so everything you want to see is within walking distance. The lobby is grand and worth a visit in itself. Our room was well appointed, spacious (we are a family of four) and the beds are very comfortable. However, don't expect a five star hotel. It is a convention sized, very busy, well-oiled machine. The staff move fast...including the housekeepers. I didn't feel the room was dirty it was just not cleaned carefully. Our shower could have used a good scrubbing. The hotel is well situated a few blocks from the park and from the subway. Everything you may need is close by. Stop by the gift shop and pick up a slice of the Boston Cream Pie. It is made fresh every day and this is where the pie was first created. Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: padiecake
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay while in Boston. Central location, easy to walk to all the historic sites. People very helpful and friendly. Rooms were nice size and the beds and bedding were fantastic! Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Toight
Reviews.Content: After looking long and hard on various discount reservation websites, we found the Omni Parker House to have a competitive price in the higher end lodging options. That its location was smack dab on the Freedom trail was a bonus. The hotel is located within easy walking distance from the Park street subway stop and surrounded by restaurants and shops. From the hotel, it is a 10-15 mins walk to the entertainment district (check out Shear madness, hilarious murder mystery play with improv mixed in, highly recommended) and Chinatown (check out the noodle house, forgot its name but there's always a line-up). Now on to the hotel itself. Upon entering, you notice the great woodwork and subdued yet elegant feeling of the lobby. Front desk and concierge were both very helpful when we needed them. We got a room on the 7th floor, overlooking another building, not the best view but it certainly was quiet. The rooms are smallish but this is to be expected in an older hotel. Not to say that the hotel looks old, far from it. The furnishings in the room were top notch and the bed (queen size for us) was very comfortable, at par with the Westin's heavenly bed in my opinion. Bathroom was a bit small (can't quite have 2 people at the same time in there) but that was no issue for us. Climate control inside the room was efficient. The room comes with Wolfang Puck coffee, which was a nice touch. Hotel has a quite a big exercise facility, mostly cardio and Atlantis-type workout machines. 2 public computers are available, internet is around 7$USD for 15mins of use, but black & white printing of up to 4 boarding passes is complimentary which is a very nice touch. Wifi is available in the rooms at 10$USD for 24 hours. All in all a very nice hotel with a great location and very reasonable prices. ps. The hotel restaurant, The Last Hourra, invented Boston cream pie... very cool!

Reviews.Title: “A good value choice at the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Housed in a historial building with an impressive lobby. The room looked dated but clean. Price was reasonable at under $200 per night in March consider its perfect downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Beauty”
Reviews.Author: exptravelor
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Boston on a family trip and want to stay in the heart of history, LOOK no further. Granted this is not the Ritz or Four Seasons but you really can't do much better for location and a slice of history. The freedom trail is outside your door and Sam Adams is resting in peace acroos the street. Great rooms, wonderful lobby and good friendly service. Tough to beat for the money and a great spot for a Boston visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JohnM44881
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House for four nights in June. Quite expensive but our Expedia Deal including airfare helped. Excellent service from the minute we walked in the door and a perfect location for sightseeing---close to subway lines and right on the Freedom Trail. We would stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: svoluse
Reviews.Content: The location and the history of this hotel was fantastic. Easy to walk to the North End, Quincy Market, etc., and if you are venturing further out the Park Station T stop is really closeby. We had an executive room with a king bed.
