The room itself was a good size and we had plenty of room to spread out our luggage. The bathroom was small but functional and windows looked out on the top of a roof and towards another building, no big deal since we really only slept in the room. The lobby and the hallways of the hotel really gave you a picture of a previous era. The service in the restaurants and bars were great. As was the concierge who helped us book the Duck Tour, highly recommended. I have no complaints at all about this hotel but do think it was necessary to know what to expect prior to arrival. You are paying for a great location and a piece of history.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location & exceptional service and touches”
Reviews.Author: westlean807
Reviews.Content: We had an above expectation experience with exceptional service and special touches. Everything from booking to check out was easy and absolutely flawless. I was celebrating my birthday and appreciated the unexpected complimentary delivery of champagne and Boston creme pies to the room, along with being placed in my 'birthday room' - 807 for August 7th. I love that the loyalty program included complimentary morning beverages and wireless internet. The location was fantastic for walking to Boston Commons & Gardens (where we got engaged during the stay!) and the Freedom Trail, and a short cab ride to the waterfront. I cannot say enough good things and would absolutely recommend this place to anyone staying in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LLMac16
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. We booked a Freedom Trail Suite which was enormous. We had a double bedroom (with the thickest, most comfortable mattress I've ever seen), a large living room area, and a bunk-bed area with a bathroom off the living area. The decor was great, very high quality and stylish. A nice touch was that there were games in the bunk-bed area (Monopoly, Sorry etc) which kept our teenage boys occupied later on in the evening. Only downside about the room was we had absolutely no view (literally a brick wall 3 feet away). However, we were mostly in the room at night so this didn't particularly bother us. The lobby is spectacular as well, very ornate. We had dinner in both the Last Hurrah and Parkers. Found the service in both to be excellent, and the food also good. The real stars of the show were the cocktails in the Last Hurrah though (fabulous - especially the Boston Cream Pie cocktail!). The hotel is very centrally located - 50 yards from the main crossover subway station (Park). We bought a 7 day subway ticket for $15 which was great value. We even used it to get to the airport when we left, saving the usual big taxi fare. It's right on the Freedom Trail and 15 mins walk from the Aquarium. Lots of history about the place as well, it's a tourist attraction in its own right. I've heard the standard rooms are very small - treat yourself and get a suite. If you have kids the Freedom Trail Suite is fabulous. They even brought round complimentary cookies and milk for the boys every night. Also if you join their rewards programme (free to join) you get free high-speed internet access for your stay and free morning drinks (tea/coffee/juice) delivered to your room. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Kaeri
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and has a fantastic location in walking distance of a lot of Boston's highlights. The hotel breakfast is amazing and the bar serves a mean cosmo. History oozes out of this place. My only gripe and the thing that would deter me from coming back is the size of the rooms- they are uncomfortably small. They are smaller than rooms I have stayed in Japan ! I certainly can appreciate that this is an historic hotel but one wants to be comfortable and I struggled here.

Reviews.Title: “Best people inoston”
Reviews.Author: khamil1
Reviews.Content: I visited July-Aug 2011, first on business then for pleasure. The Parker House is charming, in a great location and, best off all, has the best staff anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably comfortable sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tracy121
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House was a super choice for my recent stay in Boston. Unfortunately I only stayed one night though and could have stayed forever. The feeling of history that surrounds you in this hotel is unmatched. The check in was quick and easy, I was given a call on my cell phone when my room was ready and was upgraded to a deluxe room on the top floor. My room overlooked the graveyard at the Kings Chapel. It was great. The room was pretty small with the 2 beds, but speaking of the beds, oh my, I have never slept in a bed that was so comfortable. My friend could not stop talking about the bed, the sheets, and how extremely comfortable of a night sleep it was. I got a surprise knock on the door and recieved two pieces of the famous Boston Cream Pie and two bottles of water and a book about the history of the hotel all served on a beautiful tray. The treat was so unexpected and delicious. This hotel is so conveniently located to all of the historical downtown freedom trail sites and is a two minute walk to the T station. Breakfast the next morning at Parkers was nice, expensive, but very tasty and lovely. Everyone in Boston was so nice, and helpful. I definitely want to get back here to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “bed too small”
Reviews.Author: frequentfahrer
Reviews.Content: The bed in our room is considered by the front desk to be a queen but because it is a historic hotel the queen is smaller than a normal queen. The bed was a little bigger than a twin and is so high off the ground we are a little worried we will fall off in the middle of the night and break our neck. We'll see .....I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: steveday21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very historic and depending on which room you get--might be very small and cramped, cracked paint, dingy bathtub and poor lighting. For the rate that I paid, I expect a lot better. Waited 30 min. for front desk to move me to another room. I have to say the next room was a lot nicer. Twice as big, bigger window, larger bathroom-very nice. Staff is friendly enough. Was in the city for a convention and the location of the hotel is excellent. Plenty of bars and restaurants to walk to so there was no need to rent a car. All in all, not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chloe014
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location where it is within walking distance of most of the historical sites. Overall, the service was nothing short of excellent, but the hotel rooms,beds and bathrooms were small and felt "historical". We enjoyed the location of being in the midst of all the area attractions but were a little disappointed with the small rooms, bathroom and beds (double).

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Packinmyclubs
Reviews.Content: Historic usually means, older furnishings, and smaller rooms, which is true here as well. In this case, old does not mean â€œbeat upâ€�, everything was very well maintained. I personally prefer a more modern look, but this is a fine example of a hotel built in the 20â€™s. As mentioned, the rooms were small, but well appointed with a flat screen TV, walk in closet (our corner room did anyway), desk and a chair. The bed was extremely comfortable, good linens and toiletries, but a somewhat noisy air conditioner. Bathroom was a pedestal sink, so space was at a premium, but they had a multi-level shelving system over the toilet. The two things that set this apart for me was the people and the location. Everyone went out of their way to help, and they had enough staff to avoid long lines. They put us in a nicer room as it was our anniversary, and called to make sure we had everything we needed. As for the location, itâ€™s right along the Freedom trail, 10 minute walk to the North End, a block away from two T stations, Beacon Hill is down the street, PERFECT LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: JMMinCT
Reviews.Content: The Good: Lovely, lovely hotel, right on the Freedom Trail, convenient to just about everything. The T station is right down the street, literally a 2-minute walk, not even. Many trolleys have a stop close by, maybe a minute further. The lobby is gorgeous, with plush, comfy chairs and couches. We booked an executive room, which has a separate living area, and it was more than big enough for me and my daughter. The beds were comfy, the a/c worked great. The bathroom was tiny, but everything worked just fine and, in addition to the separate living area, there was a roomy alcove where the closet was that had a vanity table with mirror and chair, where we would get dressed and dry our hair, etc. Room service staff was fantastic and wake up calls were cheerful and on time. Parker's restaurant was amazing - awesome food and service and our server, John, treated my 10-yr old daughter like the grownup she thinks she is. Checkout was convenient and timely. The Bad: As a loyalty program member, I should have been brought my USA Today in the mornings, but it never came. The wait for elevators is atrocious - allow extra time to get out of the hotel or back to your room, as we waited a ridiculous amount of time for elevators. Our view from our room was of the brick building next door. We had to keep the shades drawn at all times, so no one could see into our room. But then again, I didn't ask for a nice view, so c'est la vie. The Ugly: Check in was unacceptable. We did arrive 30 minutes prior to check in time, so that half hour is totally forgivable. However, when our room still wasn't ready an hour after check in time, I started to get very testy. My daughter and I were forced to wait in the lobby after a long drive and we really needed to get to our room and get ready and get back out, as we had plans that evening. We were repeatedly told that our room was dirty and there was nothing they could do. They refused to give us another room because they said it would screw up the milk and cookie turndown service for the next night, which I thought was ridiculous. We were offered an appetizer to help make amends, but I wasn't going to hang out in the bar with my 10-yr old so I could have a free appetizer. That certainly doesn't get me in my room any quicker. We weren't the only ones, either - there were so many people waiting in the lobby, clutching their luggage, there wasn't anywhere to even sit. And we observed the same thing the next day, when we happened to be going through the lobby about 90 minutes after check in time. They seriously need to get their act together on this issue. But, even though I will not go back due to the check in issue ( I refuse to go through that again ), it was a very nice hotel and I do recommend it if you have the patience to have to wait for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Caskar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is historically beautiful! And it can't be beat for the price and the location. Check in was so easy! Literally, just walked up to counter picked up my keys and went to my room. We could walk around part of the Freedom Trail then stop in the hotel for a brief rest then head back out. That's how centrally located it is. The free Boston cream pie ice cream was wonderful during our breaks from the heat. Hotel room may have been a bit on the small size but it did not bother us. We did have a beautiful view of downtown and below us was King's Chapel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: bisousMH
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at The Omni Parker are extremely rude and condescending. We booked through price line and were duked. Buyer beware their standard room has a double bed( not a queen or king). While checking in we discovered an upgrade for a standard room which should have a queen bed and doesn't (was a fifty dollar upgrade). After trying to get a refund from price line which is impossible we were stuck staying there. Which was not the hotel's fault it was price line policy. Don't be fooled this is not a 4 star hotel my any means. It is historical with a great location but it is dirty and is in desperate need of renovation. The staff are rude especially the people at the front desk. Apparently most price line customers are disatisfied because of the bait and switch that occurs. After reading reviews most price line customers are only charged $20.00 for the upgrade. The fifty dollar upgrade was really not issue it was the way the hotel staff deal with the problem. Don't bother to ask for a manager they are even more rude and condescending than the people working the front desk. We dealt with Luis O. assistant front desk manager who told us we were so fortunate that they could accommodate us and we were so lucky that it was only 50 dollars I wasn't asking for a bigger room just wanted to sleep in the same bed as my husband. He never apoligized or showed any kindness or professionalism during are interaction. I wanted to just leave and go to another hotel and just forget about the money because I felt so disrespected and humiliated. Unfortunately my husband did not support this and we stayed and things got worse. Housekeeping woke us up twice despite the "Do not disturb sign on the door". There were bugs in the bathroom and the sheets were stained. The bartender at Parker bar overcharged me and was rude to us. When I questioned her about price of the wine she said the menu was old and she gave me the large glass of wine which looked to be about 3 oz, I was charged $20.00 for a glass of house Malbec the price on the menu was $11.00 The valet's at the hotel most go through a different training because they were all polite and professional. We normally stay at the Seaport and love it there. We have never used Price line before and weren't sure if this is why we were treated so poorly. This is the first negative review I have ever written. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: susanincanada
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful! My husband, 11 year old daughter and I stayed at the Omni Parker for four days. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The service is top rate and the rooms are beautifully done. We had a Premier suite, so we had a large bedroom and bathroom and a sitting room with a pull out couch. The staff was very attentive. We ate in the main dining room and at the two bars as well. My family especially enjoyed the original Parker House Rolls and the Boston Cream Pie. I had some sort of problem with my left foot swelling and I ended up going to Massachusetts General. The staff were great about directions and offered helpful advice. A bag of ice for whenever I needed it. We would absolutely stay at the Omni Parker again and highly recommend it to our friends. Boston was a great trip for our family and the hotel was one of the best parts of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Samharts
Reviews.Content: Being in the heart of Boston is great! Love the location of this hotel! However the rooms are really tiny, mine was dark since the only window had an ac unit in it and face a brick wall, and it was impossible to find free plugs to charge my laptop and phone. Make sure to call the front desk for a powerstrip! If you are driving beware parking through the hotel is $42 a night.

Reviews.Title: “most expensive bottle of water ever!”
Reviews.Author: LIZYorkshire_uk
Reviews.Content: Nice decor,well located but watch prices in minibar; charged 9.46 dollars for 2 small bottles of water - queried price with desk clerk as couldn't believe water was so expensive - it was correct! Lesson learned,check prices first

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak100
Reviews.Content: Great location! Clean room! Good Service! Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherW1989
Reviews.Content: Love, love, LOVE this hotel!!! I was a little concerned to start staying in a double bed room with 2 adults and 2 kids, as we usually book a 2 bedroom suite. Of course we usually go to Orlando or some other place where space is not an issue. This location has to be the BEST in Boston!! It is located in the center of everything! The room was small but remember you are staying downtown, I am sure all the rooms are small. We have been fine in our room. The beds are super comfy and the rooms are very clean. This hotel has so much history, Boston creme pie, Parker house rolls, and many more amazing things. The concierge are AMAZING!!! Helped me with a great running path, down Beacon street, next to Boston Common, the capital, Cheers, and down by the Charles River. It was fantastic!!! Also recommended all of our restaurants every night. Sorry tripadvisor concierge at Parker House is better!! :) This is a great place to stay with kids or a couple. They actually do have some rooms with bunkbeds for kids, if the double bed room is too scary for you. Do not look elsewhere book here NOW! I promise you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location - our pup loved it too!”
Reviews.Author: Cmp67
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Omni Parker House and had our mini dachshund with us. The hotel was in the perfect location - easy access to all historic sites and right up the street from Boston Common - our pup loved the daily walks there. I would definitely stay at the Omni on my next visit to Boston. Free Boston Creme Pie ice cream was a hit with my girls!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of history”
Reviews.Author: gordonmaximus
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed in June 2010 but drop down dosn't allow entry. However, this very quaint hotel steeped in a bit of history is the perfect location for reaching all the places you want to visit. The lobby is like going back in time, not your ultra modern decor. The hotel is right near to the start of the history trail (red bricks in the footpaths) buy your own guide book and you can walk to all the points of interest right up to Bunker Hill. The hotel is clean staff very friendly, We felt the restaurant was a little expensive for what you get and the price of drinks, well typical hotel prices, there is a bar open to the public but you won't see many customers due to the prices, especially when you can walk a few yards to a friendly and reasonable priced bar. There is an irish bar nearby and the food is superb. The real good thing about the hotel is its location and I really mean you can walk everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpo
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this location if you are going to Boston. Right on the freedom trail, walking distance from all the attractions and great restaurants. Also you feel all the history around you in the us oldest operational hotel site. The staff was exremely attentive to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sjk0284
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and was pleased both times. The hotel is wonderfully historic and is the place where Parker rolls and Boston Cream Pie were invented. Easy walk to Quincy Market and the harbor. Lots to do in the area including a great Eddie Bauer outlet and a major Borders book store.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel to explore downtown!! We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: TammyS61
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is in the most perfect location! Only about a block from the train station, which conveniently you can get to from the aiirport. And it's within walking distance of the wharf shops/restaurant area, tons of historic buildings and only a couple of blocks from many of the trolley stops. The hotel is one of the oldest in the country and they say it's haunted! The room was small, but very practical and had everything we needed. The beds were SO comfotable and the concierge desk was wonderful! We will definitely go back to Boston and will choose the Omni Parker House!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Justin7
Reviews.Content: This is a great location near Faneuil Hall. Easy to get to pretty much everything. The rooms, however are tiny. It's an older hotel and so it's to be expected. Also, I would rate this three, not four stars. Things are chipped and cracking, paint off, baths are ok, not fabulous. If you can get a good deal, it's a good place to stay, but if you are looking for something luxurious or traveling with a family, I'd find a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grand hotel with comfortable beds in great position”
Reviews.Author: jandono
Reviews.Content: Very grand and very old. Lovely rooms although a little small but comfortable beds and good air con. Great position to see everything in the city

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, rooms were just okay”
Reviews.Author: JimJensen3
Reviews.Content: The lobby, location and history of this hotel were great. The rooms were pretty small as was the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean and Splendid Service-they went above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: pangakat
Reviews.Content: Definitely become a select member as it gave us some free perks. When you call to make your reservation they can do it for you. We were treated like royalty from the valet to the conceirge. We ate breakfast where JFK proposed to Jackie(our Hostess told us). The room was immaculate. I know some reviewers mentioned noise and small bathrooms. While the bathroom was small it was modern. It is the oldest continuously running hotel in the country. We didn't mind the size. Noise wasn't an issue. While I heard conversation from someone in the middle of the night it didn't disturb us. With the concerns of the staff for guests to enjoy their stay, I am sure they would have gone out of their way to adjust our room if we needed a quieter one. We loved being on the freedom trail and the closeness to the North End and the market place. We stayed with the Discovery Package and it cost us $203 per night and kids ate breakfast free. They also got milk and cookies in their room the first night and a backpack of toys. Boston Cream flavored Ice cream was free from 3:30 to 5:30.

Reviews.Title: “Loaded with History and Charm”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBumpkin
Reviews.Content: The room was nice size and as old as the hotel is, it was amazing how well the plumbing and air conditioning worked! Upon check in I learned this is where JFK proposed to Jackie AND where he had his bachelor party. Tried a Boston Cream Pie which was good and the service was friendly at both the Last Hurrah (Joe at the bar) and the Parker House Lounge. This is a very nice hotel, they do turndown service and include water in the rooms. The workout facility was nice and clean too. The only drawback for me was the room was somewhat dark, the view from the window was terrible and the bathroom was very small with no counterspace. I would stay again though because those are not high priorities. The location of the hotel is very prime, a minute away from Boston Commons and more.

Reviews.Title: “History, Location, and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LoveNPs
Reviews.Content: We chose the Parker House because of its location right on the Freedom Trail, and I'm so glad we did! We stayed in April when the prices were more reasonable, and the location allowed us to easily manage all our sightseeing without a rental car. Most of the popular tour trolleys stop a block or two away, and we were able to buy a pass at the hotel lobby, get on with our receipt, and get the actual ticket once the trolley made the loop to the main ticket offices. On top of that, the staff at the Parker were just amazing! We normally do not stay in upscale places, because I've found you often don't really get what you pay for (luxury places aren't any bigger in roomsizes, aren't any cleaner, and often nickel and dime you with fees compared to the more-competitive chains) but this was a genuine exception. I would strongly suggest becoming a (free) member of their loyalty program in advance, because the staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. Definitely worth spending more to stay here than a cheaper place that will only prove to be a hassle with sightseeing. I did a lot of homework in advance of picking this place, and it really paid off. It was quiet, it was convenient, and it was so cool to stay here and learn about all the famous things that happened here (such as JFK proposing to Jackie in the restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely enjoyed the hotel and it made our trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: cynthia0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an historic landmark since 1855. There is a charm and beauty that make you feel like you just stepped into a very special place. There are beautiful crystal chandeliers, bronze doors, and oak-paneled walls to admire. It is the place where the Boston Cream Pie and famous Parker rolls were first created. You must have both during your stay. The hotel has two great bars ..the Last Hurrah and Parker bar. They are a mohogany and stained-glass haven to enjoy. They have a really good selection of beers on tap and wines. The food at the Parker Restaurant was superb as well as their brunch in the morning. The location of the hotel is the best. It is central to everything including the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall, Beacon Hill, Boston Common and the Public Gardens. The T line is accessible a block from the hotel and you can use the Tline to get from the airport to the hotel.It is a ten minute ride and you get off the T a block from the hotel. The rooms are small about 200sq ft but are very well appointed. There is a rich and authentic decor that gives the room a feel of calm, beauty and comfort. The bathroom is very small but very functional. There is a flat screen TV and very comfortable chair for relaxing, a work desk, chair and access to WIFI. The beds are very comfortable . The hotel also has a well equipped fitness center 24/7. The staff are very friendly and helpful. You feel very appreciated. Every afternoon do try the free Boston Cream Pie ice cream..delicious! The concierges are very knowledgeable and eager to assist you with your every need. We truly enjoyed our stay at the Omni. It made our trip more memorable and enjoyable. We appreciated the outstanding service and hospitality. We will be back..

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: This_too_shall_pass
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Omni Parker House on business three (3) times so far in 2011 and hope to be back at least two more times this year. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Boston. Location is ideal - financial district, on the Freedom Trail, blocks from Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market in one direction and the Boston Common in the other. This hotel has history: Charles Dickens lived there, JFK proposed to Jackie there. Boston Cream Pie and Parker House rolls were invented there. This is a beautiful, classic property. Polished wood paneling throughout the lobby, ornate elevator doors and chandeliers. Rooms are not huge, but are well-appointed and very comfortable. Some offer outstanding views of the city. Hotel staff are very solicitous, caring and professional. Dining is a treat at any of the three restaurants or by room service. Nice exercise facility is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JoBos
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip to Boston and made our reservations before the Bruins won the Stanley Cup. But it worked out great! The hotel was right on the parade route. Even if there hadn't been festivities that weekend, the hotel's location is just great. It's close to shopping, restaurants, historical sites and tourist attractions - everything that makes Boston a great city. The front desk and concierge folks are very friendly and helpful with everything from hotel information to local news. (Thank goodness one of them let us know that Saturday's Red Sox game at Fenway had been moved to a night game.) The hotel itself is beautiful, very majestic. The hallways are long, with plenty of turns and amazingly quiet at night. The rooms are not really big but are very comfortable. The only drawback is the view out the windows. That is, there isn't one. Dining at the hotel makes it convenient for a light meal or a night cap before turning in for the night. However, the service we had a Parker's Bar was sloooow. But the food was just fine and the atmosphere very nice. Next time we head north to Boston, we'd definitely like to stay at the Omni Parker House again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pharmdoc-1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit dated but it was in the middle of everything. Getting the trolley was a 2 minute walk. Quincy market was about a10 minute walk and so was the harbor. Everything about this hotel's location was perfect. We stayed in a suite which was very roomy and clean. Since this was our first time to really tour Boston I was clueless as to where to stay. The Back Bay hotels are a bit displaced from everything and you will need to hop a cab or a trolley to get to the fun places. We are headed back to Boston in August and unfortunately I cannot get a room at the Omni. I am a little disappointed but Boston in itself is just beautiful in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, extremely helpful, we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: teensandtoddlers
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel on a trip to view local colleges with my daughter and her best friend and we couldn't have had a better experience. The rooms are clean, and comfortable, but the best part of the accomodations was the staff. From the time I pulled the car up to the valet until we pulled away 5 days later we were thoroughly impressed with the staff. Every person that we came in contact with was kind, considerate and very helpful. I had never been to Boston and was not sure how to navigate the city, but each person on staff was more than willing to assist us and even went so far as to recommend their favorite locations in the city that were not on the usual tour stops. All of my return trips to Boston will be with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located for walking the city!”
Reviews.Author: English-Rose01
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location, just a short walk round the corner is Union Oyster Bar, a must for everyone visiting the City, even if, like me, you don't eat fish or seafood! It's got a great atmosphere in the Oyster Bar, loved it! The hotel fire alarm went off during the night, so we had an un-scheduled run in with the Boston City Fire Dept. even though it was a pain having to get up, the meeting with the fire dept. was worth the hassle!Hasten to add, all was well, and it was just an automatic fire alarm going off, nothing dangerous was happening! The hotel staff were very friendly and the decor was tasteful, and although a large hotel, it did have an intimate feel!

Reviews.Title: “Historical and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: happygolucky090
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the late 1990's and again this past December as a member of a friends wedding party. The wedding reception was held on the hotel's top floor, which had an amazing view of Boston. The hotel has very intricate and ornate decorations in the lobby. The rooms are nicely appointed with modern amenities, but thier decorations are tied to an early 1900's style-which I enjoyed. In addition, the hotel has great service. The hotel's restaurant and bar are also worth a visit. The hotel has a long history of historic figures that have stayed there, to include former presidents and world famous artist. If you consider this when taking into account the nightly rate, the price just might be worth paying a little more than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decently priced”
Reviews.Author: ninny13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Freedom Trail, and is within walking distance of Fanueil Hall and the waterfront. Rooms were clean and comfortable but not large. I felt this was the best bargain in this part of town. Would definitely stay here again. My only regret is that I did not get to try the Boston creme pie (it was invented at this hotel way back when!) Parking is by valet only and is not cheap. If you will be using your car frequently, it might be an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good”
Reviews.Author: polishmisia
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline and was given a very very small traditional double bed room. Not only was it super small but the room was dirty. There was a huge stain on the ceiling, stains on the rugs, and one lamp did not work. They went through a renovation in 2008 but obviously missed this room. We also tried their famous boston cream pie but there was nothing famous about it. It tasted like a piece of cake that you can buy at BJs or Costco. Will not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “The Past meets the Present"”
Reviews.Author: teacherTexas
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House combines the historic old world charm with all the modern necessities. The staff was always helpful and friendly..........everything was as we had requested. I highly recommend a stay here........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: LoisBr
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House is well located. We walked everywhere! It's very safe to walk at night too. The hotel is just beautifull! You can feel history inside there. The room is not large, but very comfortable. The staff is very polite. I subscribed for the wi-fi internet and when I was checking out, the front desk told me that if I subscribed the loyal program, the Internet would be for free!!! :) I'd definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character, great location, welcomes kids”
Reviews.Author: didyouenjoyyourstay
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently with our 2 young (4 and 6 yo) children. The room was a little small, which I think is par for the course in the north east, but it was well set out and we didn't feel cramped. The beds were fabulous, possibly the most comfortable I've slept in. Omni seem to be doing a push to family travel over the vacation, and it's great. At check in the kids were given little backpacks with toys and games, and milk and cookies were delivered to our room in the evening. Apparently a rolling case with books and games was available but we didn't need that. Kids have their own menus in the dining room, and could join an adult for free at the breakfast buffet. The buffet was really nice, worth the price. The location of this hotel is great. It's 2 blocks from Boston Common, which in addition to being the start of the freedom trail is also home to a great playground that includes a water spray area. Within a block or so are also a pharmacy, Starbucks, and a bagel store (and a McDonalds) - all very handy places for traveling families. The ferry over to the USS Constitution is about a 10 minute walk, as is the aquarium, and most sites on the Freedom Trail (apart from the Charleston side). We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely consider it if we go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: kdrake
Reviews.Content: The room was elegant and with wonderful views of the city. Stately and elegant. The Parker House rolls were everything they were reputed as - buttery, soft, moist, yum! We didn't venture out of the lobby because the bar had everything we needed - no need to leave the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice historic hotel, walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: LikesCats3
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Omni Parker House. We were there for the second half of a 50th birthday celebration and it was a great hotel. Upon arriving we were met with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries and that was so nice of the hotel. The room was very comfy, a great bed, slept like a rock. The hotel is on the older side but has been updated and it was very modern and comfortable. If I had a complaint, it's a tiny one and that's the tiny bathroom. Otherwise, the room was very nice. The hotel has a lot of history associated with it and the lobby ceiling is gorgeous. I suggest you go to the sportsbar/lounge and try the world famous Boston Cream Pie, it was excellent. The staff was also very friendly and happy to answer any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff, kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Elrhino1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an overnight getaway, and loved it. Kids liked the kids Package and the walking tour was a good value. Walking distance to T stop, Fanueil, Common, harbor, aquarium, duck tours...everything you want to see in Boston. When the bellman heard we hadn't had the Boston cream pie, he went and got us two to go for the ride home. The breakfast was elegant and comfortable, not noisy even though all the tables were full, and roomy. Food was excellent, miles ahead of what passes for breakfast in a lot of places.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DawnVee
Reviews.Content: The room was very tiny but the beds were super cozy after days of sightseeing. The location is very convenient for shopping and sightseeing; we will definitely stay again. The only issue was the cost of the Internet at $10.00 per day PER device.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for historic sites”
Reviews.Author: Cinder6681
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for walking to major historical sites. If you join the omni select program, you get free internet. Room sizes do vary ..our king bed room was roomy but a friend had a much smaller room with 2 beds. Bathrooms are small but updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great for History Lovers”
Reviews.Author: LSC06
Reviews.Content: This Omni is a beautiful historic property in a fabulous location. It is right on the Freedom Trail and it is only a short walk to the North End, the Wharf, the Boston Common & Public Gardens, Beacon Hill, and even the Back Bay. We were greeted warmly, but initially given the wrong type room. This was immediately corrected. The bellman who brought up our luggage was very knowledgeable and said he has worked in this hotel for 25 years. Our room had a nice view toward Kingâ€™s Chapel and was small, but furnished well. Nice beds, a good TV, and excellent bath products. We were also given two bottles of water. Being a member of the loyalty program helps by providing free Internet access and morning beverages. This is my second time staying in this hotel and I love it. However, the bathroom was extremely small, and this bothered my husband, and the rates here are quite expensive, plus all of the add-on taxes really drive the cost up. I do know that small bathrooms are to be expected in historic hotels and that many hotels in Boston have even higher rates.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: Jessandphoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this amazing hotel for my 30th birthday. The hotel is centrally located to The Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and the T (the subway the can take you all over Boston). We flew into Logan Airport and for $1.70 a piece took the T to the hotel. We only had to walk 3 minutes and we were there. The lobby is gorgeous... dark wood and rich colors... very Boston. The staff is very friendly, Rebecca at Concierge was outstanding. She recommended great meals, mapped out how to get there and made our reservations for us. She went above and beyond what was expected. The room was beautiful, quiet, very clean and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. We didn't take advantage of the restaurants and bars in the hotel, but heard great things about it. I can't think of anything negative. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in terrific location, we will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: bg2935
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House was recommended to us by friends who visit Boston frequently and we are glad we listened to them! The hotel is a classic older building in a very convenient location walking distance from Faneuil Hall, Long Wharf, Boston Common etc. All the hotel staff were extremely friendly and professional. We ate breakfast every morning in the Parker House restaurant and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Tip: Join the Omni Select Club (free online) and select the bed and breakfast package with your room. You also get free Wi-Fi and free coffee or tea delivered to your room each morning. Our room, a corner unit was very nice and the bathroom was smallish but workable. Tip: Book any room bigger than the entry level and you will be fine. Hotel gym is very well equipped and modern. We stayed Fri., Sat. & Sun night and will be back on our next Boston trip.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute trip to see the Stanley Cup Rolling Rally... Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: rpilk210
Reviews.Content: Being big Bruins fans I didn't want to miss the parade so I looked at rates on Tripadvisor in Boston and found the Parker House really competative. I called the hotel directly (which turned out to be a smart move) and made reservations. They have a lot of room types and the reservation person took me through the petite, traditional and deluxe (plus the suites which I didn't need) and was really upfront about the small size of the petite rooms. The deluxe wasn't much more money and seeing there was still some rooms left I gabbed one. I asked about being in a room that overlooked the parade but they couldn't promise. At check in I asked again and got assigned a perfect room. The parade was great, the hotel is very classy with a great lobby and the area was close to just about everything. I hope to return before the Bruins win their next Cup!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location with great service!”
Reviews.Author: JonandSal
Reviews.Content: We're just home from our stay at the Omni Parker House and had a wonderful experience. The staff were wonderful - letting us into our room several hours before check-in - and provided us with wonderful recommendations on how to get around the city and places that are "must sees" and best bets for dining. We truly appreciated the time that Seamus (hope we spelled that right!) spent with us. While the rooms aren't huge - they were clean, comfortable and exactly what we expected for such a hotel of its age. The location was within walking distance of Beacon Hill, Back Bay, TD Gardens, the North End and down by the waterfront. Be sure to go to The Black Rose for a bite to eat and a pint - great food and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - everything else lacks”
Reviews.Author: Jenn5mith
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, incompetent staff and crazy-expensive parking. Nice bed, graffitied walls and a wall outside the window. I can check staying at this grand dame of Boston off my list and don't have to do it again - so many better options are available.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experienceâ€”Should not be allowed in Priceline”
Reviews.Author: capo99999
Reviews.Content: Like others here, we purchased what was supposed to be 4-star room for 2 through priceline, and couldnâ€™t have been more disappointed with the tiny non-standard size bed, room, and absurdly small bathroom the Omni provided. We even did the $30 upgrade and still found the room to be one of the worst experiences we have had in Boston. All of the other hotels we have booked through priceline in Boston delivered a 4-star experience. The Omni may be a 4-star hotel, but for priceline customers, they definitely do not deliver. They should not be allowed to participate in priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PutMeOnABeach2011
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston, so we wanted to stay close to the freedom trail and downtown. We couldn't have picked a better spot! We were right outside the old city hall, and pretty much everytime we walked out we saw a band playing there; so cool. Great access to basically everything, and anywhere we wanted to go in the city was no longer than a 15 minute cab ride. Very easy to get cabs in this city!! Yes, the bathrooms are small. If you are traveling with a lot of people, this may not be the place for you. However it was only my fiancee and I so we didn't care. Beds are amazing! Can't beat it! The hotel staff was always friendly and eager to help! Great stay; I can't wait to go back to Boston and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Travelhelper
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, helpful staff, great location for touring the city, particularly the colonial history. Don't really understand the few semi-negative reviews I've seen of this hotel. Walls are a bit thin, but that has never caused us a big problem. We've stayed here 5 nights on two separate trips. Lovely, old hotel situated right on the Freedom Trail. Very short walk to the old State House, to shopping, to tour bus stop, Boston Common, coffee shops, quick food, Faneuil Hall, etc. Short 15-20 minute cab ride from Logan Intl Airport. Join the Select Guest program - you can get a better rate and you get some nice extras, like free in-room WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Property”
Reviews.Author: LindaLee50
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Parker House! It is an absolutely beautiful historic property. The staff, without exception, was exceptional. The location is perfect for visiting the sites including the Freedom Trail. Our suite was excellent with comfortable attractive decor & very comfortable bed. The bathroom was small but adequate. Breakfast at Parker''s was really tasty with a wide variety to choose from, everything we tried was well done & the service was great. The Seacoast Benedict made with crabcakes was delicious. The hotel is pet friendly for smaller dogs, which was wonderful for us as we were traveling with our little buddy. It's great to be able to stay at a nice property with our litte dog in tow. Paying $42.00 a day to park was the only downside but is typical of the cost in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Snobbery”
Reviews.Author: LovePlanAndTravel
Reviews.Content: We are Omni Select members and usually prefer this chain in other cities over others for attention to details and welcome kids program. This time in Boston they ran out of suites and we decided not to stay there (although less expensive but smaller rooms were widely available at the hotel). Accustom to typical good service standards at other Omni hotels, I stopped by a concierge desk to ask about a nearest ice cream place. At other cities, the staff of this hotel group is extremely professional and helpful but not in Boston. The concierge gave us an address of a closest place - 131 Tremont Street. The sign on this building says - Boston Visitors Center... Never expected this from an Omni employee. Despite our Planitum level, we'll have to leave the program. Totally unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Gotto
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful trip to Boston made more wonderful with our stay at this hotel. It is right on the "Freedom Trail" so walking to most of our attractions was easy. The hotel itself is elegant yet comfortable and the staff were very accomodating. Our Concierge was beyond helpful in giving us information about eating places, directions to our attractions, and even got us tickets to Fenway. The room was charming and functional. Not overly large rooms, but with the age of the hotel we were not expecting it to be. The bed was a little too soft for our taste. A good value for the location of this hotel. I could not imagine staying outside the city and taking the subway in, or worse, trying to navigate the city by car, very busy!

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience”
Reviews.Author: CocoTia
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed in the Freedom suite. It was 634 sq ft. or so with an alcove with bunk beds. There was a map of the Freedom trail, one entire wall of chalkboard, dress up clothes, milk and cookies the first night. We booked this room through our Entertainment book. It allowed us to pay $267 per night instead of over $500. Very convenient to attractions. Just a few blocks from the Commons. This is the oldest hotel in the city(maybe even in the country). JFK proposed to Jackie here. Inventor of the Boston Creme Pie (although I didn't care for their version, plus it was $8 dollars for a round slice. I would suggest finding it elsewhere). Other stories too. Our rooms had a modern/new feel to them. However, very tiny bathroom. That drove me crazy with no room to set things. Anticipate being able to hear noise through the walls. Our room faced a wall. Not excited about that, but definitely cut down on the city noise. Not my favorite hotel, but if you like a hotel with history this is a good place. We ate at a deli and The Hungry Traveler. Hungry Traveler was across the street and down an alley. There are a lot of shops etc. down alleys around the city, so don't be afraid to check them out. We also took the Freedom Trail guided tour. The tour guide is dressed up in time period clothing. We felt this was very helpful for details about people and events. The gravesite has famous people buried there. Worth going back to look more at the tombstones. The oldest we found was 1679. Recommend doing the Freedom Trail. You just have to follow the red line around the city. Didn't feel Paul Revere's house was worth the money. Very small house and I think you see 3 rooms and you are done. However, definitely go back behind it through the gardens and see a statue of him. Boston is not nearly as busy as New York City. Sidewalks can be narrow at times. People are very nice. It is illegal for them to cross a crosswalk if a pedestrian is there, so lots of people allowed us to cross, even if there wasn't any crosswalk. It is supposedly illegal here in MN too, but no one is usually that nice. Use the T when you get tired, We bought a 7 day pass, even though we were only there for 3 days and it paid for itself when we were tired from walking. To be honest, the city looks big on the map, but is actually very doable on foot. The T is hot and smelly. We ate at Sail Loft with friends the first night. It looks "well worn" from the outside. But, we had great food and sat on the water. Best Boston Creme pie on the whole trip. We ate twice in the North End. Fabulous food. So many restraunts, so little time. Fun to walk around. We were told to avoid Salem street. Many side streets to choose from. We never made a reservation, just walked in. This was a fun trip. Wonderful to show your kids the history. Might be better for older kids, so they can stay concentrated and absorb the info. Don't bother renting a car while in the city. You can easily walk. Plus, it would be crazy driving around there. Please, try to make the trip up to Maine. It is only 1-1 1/2 hrs. to York where we stayed. Skip going along 1A through New Hampshire, which is along the ocean. It took us an hour and 1/2 to go 7 miles. Make it more than one day in Maine. You will kick yourselves if you don't, like we are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amazing Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: SCFisher81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here while visiting Boston. The hotel is right downtown with a great central location. Boston is truly a walking city, and The Omni Parker is right in the middle of it all. It's right along the Freedom Trail. Staff was very friendly and helpful, upgrading our room upon request. The conceirge suggested fabulous places to eat. Parker's Bar within the hotel was great for dinner and open late. Our room was spacious and clean with a view of the city. The bed was amazing!! Made it very hard to get up early and walk around town! The Omni Parker is a great place to stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Old Bostonian Elegance...”
Reviews.Author: Pesapenny
Reviews.Content: ...really old! Don't get me wrong, the Omni Parker house is a historic Boston location which has maintained it's old-school vibe and opulence and it's great for that charm. However, it does feel very heavy and stuffy, with dark oak, rich reds and gilded touches. If you're looking for a modern vibe, this isn't it. To be honest, the hallways creeped me out a little- they looked like the hotel in the Shining. JFK did propose to Jackie O here, and the Boston Creme Pie was invented here as well. Check in was pleasant and quick, however the bellhops were a bit too pushy and too inquisitive for my liking. We were on the third floor and were placed in a very spacious room with two beds which were very comfortable. It was an inside room, with one window facing a brick wall, which made it feel very very dark. I live in Boston, and I was here with my mom who was visiting, so we didn't care at all, but if you're traveling here for a vacation, I'd request a room with a street view. The Omni is in a great, safe and accessible location. It's right off of the Freedom trail, steps away from the Commons, the State House, Faniuel Hall and the North End. Location does not get better than that! It is a large hotel and the lobby had a crowded and frenzied vibe. While it's a nice hotel, I'd prefer to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: LetTheG00dTimesR0ll
Reviews.Content: We did Priceline "name your own price" back in Feb for a stay in June. Recognizing this is conference season, high travel, and graduation season, $175 a night seemed within reason. When we arrived we discovered we had a Traditional Room, this is one double bed. We have 7 nights book and our 12 year old with us. I offered to buy an upgrade, they gave us an upgrade to a two double bed room, classified as Deluxe Room; a VERY KIND above and beyond gesture from the front desk staff. The room however was so small, as most historic hotels are, however, three people could not stand and walk in the room at the same time. We had to take turns walking in the room to the bathroom. We joined the "Select Guest" program to save money on free wi-fi. Found out about all the other benefits, such as the complimentary beverage service, on the last day when I inquired about this. Information was not offered and staff didn't have a consistent understanding of the program. For example, housekeeping kept bringing us USA today, even thought Select Guest benefits state we can get the paper or our choice. They said one day we weren't at a high enough level to request this and this was incorrect, I would call every morning and have to ask for the paper. So $2000 spent at the hotel in a week and I am reminding them of their loyalty program benefits they offer to "Select Guests" and haggling over a NY Times. What kills me is the room being so small that any luxury could have offset that experience and they didn't offer information about how we could have gotten the most out of our visit at the hotel and staff didn't know the details about the loyalty program they offer. This is a good hotel for a couple, who can pay for the premium rooms. The location couldn't be beat. Hotel staff were very nice and the Last Hurrah a beautiful old bar.

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lesliebauman
Reviews.Content: Grande dame hotel home to parker house rolls, boston cream pie and where jfk proposed to jackie. We have stayed here several times and will again. We stay in a suite. Bathroom is tiny but room is, large and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Extremely Comfortable Place.”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Booked a special through Omni Select Guest website, got great deal on 2 night weekend stay with breakfast for $215 per night. Most TA reviews have it correct, rooms and bathrooms are small, but it's an old historic hotel, and the place is spotless. We had 210 sq ft King room and it was fine because we knew it would be small, we did have a nice view from the 6th floor facing School street. If you check the fire escape map on the inside of your hotel door you will see most of the rooms are the same size, with the exception of the single rooms which must be really small. The free beverages for select guest members is a nice touch and arrived on time both days. Had breakfast at Parkers, all Omni hotel buffets are a step above a Hilton or Marriott's. The restaurant staff is extremely friendly. Self park your car at Garage at Post Office Square, it's a 3 min walk to hotel, cost only $9 a night on weekends. Also bought a Charlie Card for the T, rides are only $1.70 and T stop is 1 minute away from Omni. Had great burgers at Marliave Restaurant around the corner, and the fries are addictive.

Reviews.Title: “Do not come with Children”
Reviews.Author: Happam
Reviews.Content: Here with husband and 14 yr old son. Husband attending conference here while my son and I sight see. Son is sick with low temp, stuffed ear, congested. Concierge gave us urgent care phone. We called, and they only see adults. Conciierge has no pediatrician to recommend. I spent an hour calling places I found online after paying $10 for hotel wifi (who charges for stinking wifi ? It is free at Panera Bread for heaven's sake!). Every pediatrician was wrong number, out of town, or no answer. Tuft's children's hospital did not even answer! Hotel room had two double beds, comfortable, but room was ridiculous small. No room to set a suitcase. We are small people, and could not maneuver the room. No drawer space. Restaurant is awesome. Exercise room very nice. Had to check out at 12:30 because rooms were booked. Sat in lobby while I wrote this review and husband finished conference and son laid on couch. Room was loud, too. Could easily hear conversations from nearby rooms and hall. Just felt under served with our son's illness.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and beautifully historic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug_jma
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: Close to subway, very easy to get to from airport via public transit, walking distance to Boston Common/Quincy Market - FANTASTIC! Beautiful Hotel: Classic and beautiful details and rooms were comfortable. I felt like I was staying in part of Boston's history Tips: Sign up for loyalty program to get FREE wireless internet (awesome!). They also have 2 free juices for members every morning which was a very nice treat. Cons: The walls are a little thin so you can hear your neighbours if they're a little loud & I found that the temperature of the room to be inconsistent (AC would be set at 74F but then it would get REALLY hot in the middle of the night). We also found a couple of wood bugs on the bed spread so that was weird. Overall a decent stay and is perfect if you plan to be out and about for most of the time anyways.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel with real character and history”
Reviews.Author: AnotherEnglishman
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is the oldest continuously operating hotel in America. Don't be put off by it now being part of the Omni chain, because Omni management clearly understand not to mess with what's good. This hotel has old Boston style; it feels like the set of a 1940's movie, and you half expect to see Fred Astaire tripping through the foyer. By modern standards the rooms are small, with a shortage of power sockets etc but I don't care! This hotel has got character! It is comfortable, classy and the staff are brilliant. I thought I might be being a bit biased, swayed by the free upgrade to a suite that came with being the organiser of an event that booked 30+ rooms, but actually everyone in my party said the same. This is a great hotel, and if you want to visit Boston and get a great hotel experience, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: divin1
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great, central Boston location. The lobby of the hotel is elegant, creating a warm welcome. Service was fantastic from the bellmen to the desk personnel, concierge and hotel operator. Whenever I called with a request or question I was addressed by name and quickly taken care of. Since this is a very old hotel, the rooms are a bit on the small side but they're well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. I did have a problem hearing my neighbor's very loud TV through the wall one night so I called to report it and the issue was quickly addressed. The location of this hotel is great for walking everywhere and we did - to the waterfront, little Italy, Boston Common, Cheers and many pubs, shops and restaurants. Tip - the hotel restaurant serves a pre-theater dinner which is a 3-course meal for $35. Great food and a bargain! We sat at the table where JFK proposed to Jackie!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SGMANN
Reviews.Content: Check in was very quick and the porters helped us with our bags to the 14th floor. When we entered the room, all of us fell silent....amazing view, but the room was tiny. We were 2 adults and 1 child with 3 large suitcases. There were 2 double beds...but nowhere to put luggage. You could only just pass the end of the beds! The bathroom was tiny too. I went back to reception and explained that we were here for 4 nights and the room was simply too small. The lady offered us another room, but it would not be available until the next day. I offered to pay a supplement for a bigger room and we were offered a suite for an extra $50 a night, but she did a deal for $25. It was so much bigger!! So we were much happier. As a select guest (which is free to join) you get in room wifi access free along with lots of other treats. We had drinks and food in Hurrah's bar which was lovely. Breakfast at Parkers was great too with a huge selection at the buffet. One thing I found about this hotel was the staff were lovely. They seemed to be happy in their jobs which reflects to the customer. Nothing was ever too much trouble. The management are doing a great job and I would highly recommend staying here. The location is great, plenty of restaurants etc locally. There is a really good bar/bistro opposite the hotel called Scholars, great for food and atmosphere, seems to be the 'in' place to go. The rooms were clean and the beds so comfortable. Just make sure you don't get one of the small ones!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: billyray1usa
Reviews.Content: We took a long weekend (four nights) at the Omni Parker House in Boston. The hotel was old world elegance. The staff was courteous and helpful. The size of our room was inflated a bit, but it was a very nice two room suite. I would certainly stay in this corner room again. The Parker House Restaurant (in hotel) breakfast buffet was excellent. I highly recommend it. We did not have lunch or dinner at the hotel during our stay. We also enjoyed coctails at the hotel's corner bar -- can't remember the name. Service and ambiance was outstanding. Finally, the Omni parker House is centrally located in the city and directly on the Freedom Trail. It is a short walk to Beacon Hill, the large downtown park, the capital building, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DistanceTraveler
Reviews.Content: Went to the Omni Parker Hotel for business recently. The good: water in the fitness room, friendly front desk, housekeeping did a good job, quick check in/check out, excellent location (Walk to Gov't Center for T to Logan). The bad: ran out of loaner umbrellas on an unexpectedly rainy day, room is a bit worn, room was super small--crazy small (think the Lucerne in NY), sound travels into room from halls, bed was way too soft. Note to other parents with children. Please do not allow your children to run up and down

Reviews.Title: “Beware Booking Thru Third Party”
Reviews.Author: Johnsherrillsford
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Priceline, I got a good price but when you arrive the hotel tries to put you in a double bed. I mentioned I called the hotel after booking and asked for a king bed nonsmoking If available. Upon arriving a supervisor told me that they could put us in a king room only if available, and she said we have one but would be a 50.00 up charge.(I thought she said if available she would put us in the room) Asked to talk to manager. He said would let me into a king room for 20.00 so I layed a 20 bill on counter and he took It, Way to go Ryan Hotel Manager great customer service. Beware of this hotel they penny pinch. Parking $42 day, wireless in lobby only. Charge to use business center.

Reviews.Title: “Small, sparse room but great location.”
Reviews.Author: SummerTripper16
Reviews.Content: The Omni is located right on the Freedom walk, as well as minutes away from the Boston Common. Walk everywhere - North End, historic sights, waterfront, dining, parks. Lobby is impressive but room was average and looked like someone stole the furniture that should have been there. Queen bed very comfortable. Air conditioner was loud but effective.

Reviews.Title: “OMNI PARKER- Wonderful Accommodations, Platinum Service made for a luxurious graduation weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Malakeh79
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for our graduation weekend and everything was just wonderful and impeccable. OMNI hotels in general have completely impressed me with their outstanding, top-notch customer service, but this hotel never fails to disappoint me. This was about my 5th time staying at this hotel. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL, with these lovely gold elevator doors that are particularly my favorite. I am a platinum select guest member so we enjoyed a wonderful room upgrade to an executive suite. Other wonderful perks were... quick service....anytime you asked for anything, they were at your door within minutes. There is also free internet, free morning beverage, and free upgrades and late check-out (the latter two for their platinum/black members). Two small minuses: - They could not keep us in the room for our entire stay so we had to change from a suite to a regular room on our last night - Ive always had free pressings at OMNI hotels.. Called to have my mother's graduation attire pressed, and unfortunately they sent her clothes off to dry cleaning instead when she had no dry cleaning form filled out and we had clearly said it was a complimentary select guest pressing and put it in their laundry bag. She had to go to Marshalls the next day to buy an emergency outfit to attend graduation. They gave us a substantial discount off our stay that more than made up for this. HOWEVER, Incredible unexpected SURPRISE Plus: I think I only mentioned my graduation to Kate Casey, the loyalty manager, once briefly when requesting a room upgrade because of my platinum status... and we returned to our room graduation night to find a just LOVELY assortment of chocolate covered strawberries and champagne with a hand-written congratulatory card by the loyalty ambassador. It was the most wonderful, unexpected gesture I have ever had at a hotel, and the fact that she noted that I was graduating, and delivered it on my graduation day (I didnt tell her the day so she must have looked up my school's graduation day) Everyone is just super friendly. The hotel is lovely, old, and charming. The service is outstanding. The value/price is great. I love OMNI Parker House!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great area, great staff (Seamus!) & even better clam chowder!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LindaAnnVahl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tip O'Neil suite and it was great. The hotel met my every need not only for myself & family but all of my business associates who also stayed for meetings and social events. In a great neighborhood in which you could walk everywhere. Ask for the historic ghost tour with Seamus. And have Parker rolls.

Reviews.Title: “If your idea of customer service is no to every request, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write a review while still at a hotel, but I have grown so frustrated over the course of my stay that I didn't want to wait until I get home. Thankfully, I am checking out in the morning. My most basic problem is that every request of mine was answered with an abrupt no. I am a seasoned traveler who spends over 50 nights a year on the road so I think I know what a reasonable request is and mine were reasonable. I was here for a conference and upon check-in asked for a room with a king/queen bed as opposed to two doubles - the answer was no. So that's fine, I understand, it is a busy week. Now when I was given a room on the 4th floor I asked for a higher floor, again, the answer was no. I was concerned about traffic noise at night and my concerns were justified as everything from trucks to two-stroke motorcycles roared outside my window each night. I know this could have been accommodated because a colleague who checked in after me (with no elite status either) was asked his preference for a high or low floor. I checked in on a Monday evening, Wednesday afternoon the hotel's digital television stopped working and is still not back up as of Thursday night. All guest rooms were given a notice that it is due to "system upgrades" and a reminder that PPV TV is still available. Now I've never heard of a 36+ hour system upgrade, especially when the hometown Bruins are in the Stanely Cup and unavailable on any analog staion. So I called the front desk and suggested that guests be offered one-free PPV movie to compensate for the trouble, of course, you guessed it, the answer was no!! Those are the big things, but there were also little. I asked the concierge for a dinner recommendation one evening and she obliged, but indicated I may not get a table unless she went ahead and made a reservation for me. I let her make the reservation only to get there and see every table open. She clearly only wanted the tip, which she got, but I felt that was very disingenuous. The rooms are indeed small and the bathrooms smaller, but I knew that going in so could have overlooked it if the service was better. And just tonight my hamburger that was ordered via room-service came undercooked, but I don't care at this point to send it back and ask for a credit because I know the answer - NO!! There were a few positive notes. The location really cannot be beat for either business or sight-seeing in Boston. There are some nice Select Guest Perks, like free beverages in the morning, turndown service in the evening and free wifi. Although the wireless printing does not work and the hotel was no help (had to call 3rd party tech support). So I really hope the Hotel Manager does not respond and only mention the few positive remarks because I was overwhelmingly disappointed and will not be returning to this property. I know my Platinum status at Marriott does get me a certain level of service, and I did not expect that here, but I did expect some common courtesy at the very least.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Boston- plus good extras for Select Guest members”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last 2 weeks(a 6 night stay and a 1 night stay) , booked a suite months in advance and got it for a great price during a special for Select Guest members- the suites are absolute luxury and located in the corners of the building so you have multiple windows (and nice views from higher floors).The suite consists of a lounge room and a bedroom, they are really spacious- the bathrooms are quite small but very nicely appointed. If you join Select Guest (it is free) you get free internet, complimentary early morning beverages delivered by room service and you can earn free nights ,plus other benefits like access to room upgrades and late checkout.I am a member of a number of hotel loyalty programs and this one is quite generous. The breakfast buffet is around $22 (eggs made to order) and is really good plus no lining up by the toaster here- they make the toast and deliver it to the table-the restaurant itself is beautiful as are all the public areas of the hotel. Location is very convenient- -close to the Park St T plus easy walk to many key sights. Also ate lunch in the "Last Hurrah" bar which was very nice. I have stayed here a few times in previous years and this year overall I thought the staff were more accommodating, friendly and helpful , and focussed on going that extra mile to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Way overrated and way past its prime”
Reviews.Author: JBCinSD
Reviews.Content: My room at the Parker House was so small that there wasn't space enough to open my suitcase anywhere but on the bed. The space between the bed and the desk was too small to get my suitcase through. The bathroom was barely large enough to turn around in. I asked for another room and was given one specified for handicapped (which I am not), but at least it had sufficient space for a wheelchair to turn around. While I appreciate the hotel's history, I do not appreciate a room that might have been modern and sufficient a century ago. On the positive side, the location is excellent, although there are many other hotels in the area. Service was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: formerfed
Reviews.Content: Although the Omni Parker is recognized as the oldest operating hotel in the country, the accommodations are extremely clean and comfortable with a feeling of luxury. The standard rooms and bathrooms are smaller than most of the newer hotels but quite adequate. One of the great features is that it is within walking distance of many of the main attractions such as Boston Commons, Fanuiel Hall, Quincy Market, the Old State Building as well as the new State Building, and other historical landmarks. Also, excellent service and friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “I don't expect a hotel to be the highlight of a trip, but this place was just that.”
Reviews.Author: tedbo
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the only thing that could have made it better was an additional day or two. I had planned to stay at the Raddison or the Millennium Bostonian, but changed my mind when I saw the holiday weekend special which was offered. We booked a room with a king bed, around 300 sq ft I believe, which was great. It's an older hotel with a smaller bath, but plenty of room and well maintained. The staff are top notch and very professional, you can see that they pay attention to details because everything is first class. As for location, you can't find a better spot for a central hotel with a short walk to the Common or the North End, as well as the market area. Valet parking was a competive rate and our vehicle was returned in perfect condition. Honestly I can't find anything to be critical of at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller5
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the lobby is impressive, and the hotel has great history, but it's not as glamorous as it seems once you get to your room. The doubles are truly tiny and have very small beds and bathrooms. They're clean and nicely decorated, but are cramped and very dark. Our room had a single little window with a view of a brick wall. Internet is $10 a day, which always irritates me. On the other hand, the executive two bed room, where other family was staying, was a very large. The annoying thing is that there wasn't a big difference in the room prices, booked through Expedia. It's always disappointing to feel like a sucker! The worst part of our stay was that hotel staff recommended a truly dreadful tourist trap restaurant for our dinner the first night. Don't trust their recommendations - they must get bribed to endorse places.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional hotel - good but not for me”
Reviews.Author: angus s
Reviews.Content: This is one, if not the oldest hotels in Boston and if you want heritage and tradition this will not dissapoint (the entrance, lobby and restaurant are all very grand). It also doesn't do anything badly - the rooms are pleasant and comfortable, the breakfast plentiful, the service also pleasant, but it didn't do anything especially special.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame Needs Some Polish on Her Employee Hospitaliy”
Reviews.Author: katrinalady
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this "old girl". Was excited to be staying here as I have heard so much over the years. The impression changed when we pulled up to the hotel and had to drag out own luggage from the taxi while the bellman watched. It wasn't any better when we got to the front desk to find they had overbooked and we were now in a handicap room with a cot instead of a deluxe king. Spoke with many other folks in the hotel who had the same problem. Our view that was confirmed on our confirmation was of the old church and rat infested alley falling down next door. We enjoyed the extra space of the handicap bathroom, but wondered what the poor handicapped person was staying in. Hotel did send wine, but it still wasn't a King or even a Queen size bed. They expected my husband and I to be comfortable in a room with one double bed. Well, we decided on an early dinner on 2nd night in Parkers the restaurant. After we were put at a back table in the empty dining room at 5:30, we complained to the waiter who informed us they would be busy later. My lobster was mediocre at best and definitely overpriced and the service was great. We had breakfast there the next morning, and the waiter we had should be promoted to dinner service as he was the friendliest person in the entire place. I went to the gift shop to purchase a gift and was told I had to pay in cash as the credit card machine had been out since the day before. Not the type of service I expected

Reviews.Title: “traditional style hotel, excellent location close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: BLRvisit
Reviews.Content: excellent location, most comfortable bed, all tourist spots within easy reach. Important to get a room with good views Parker restaurant excellent food, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sail788
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Boston this past weekend in large part to the Parker House. The hotel staff could not be more helpful. The location is perfect - right in the heart of everything. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in; and the complimentary morning beverage delivered to the room is a great little extra. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: NataleeK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Boston and miss the city already! We were there for three nights for a convention but got to explore the city as well. Omni Parker House is in a prefect location right on the Freedom Trail. The bed at this hotel was the most comfortable and we slept well every night of our stay. The room was clean and everything was lovely througout our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston. Very easy to find and located near the trains if you are coming from Logan Airport. The loyalty program is worth signing up for, they bring you a newspaper and morning breakfast beverage plus free wi-fi. It was nice having fresh coffee brought to us each morning while we were getting ready and then heading to one of Boston's many Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks to start our day off.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: jlittlehales
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the Boston Marathon! Perfect place, right across from Boston Common where you line up in the morning.
