Beautiful room, very reasonable rates, easy walk to the North end. Not to far from the finish and easy to access on transit, and we walked to north end for pizza after the race. Great place, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRose416
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. My husband and I just recently went to the east coast for our honeymoon. The first part of our trip was Boston so we decided to go all out and stay at the Omni. We had a gorgeous suite with an awesome view. When we arrived everyone was so kind and helped us with our bags. When we got to our room they had their famous Boston cream pies, chocolate covered strawberries, and a bottle of Champagne waiting for us. The next morning we got room service which was really yummy. My husband joined some kind of member club for free (we did our reservations online months in advance so he didn't know it he did it). With that we got choices of fresh coffee, juice, or hot tea brought to our room each morning. All we had to do was leave our choices hanging on the door the night before. The location is superb! It is right next to everything and the subway is only a block away which made it so easy to travel from one side of town to another. I would highly highly recommend this place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor night sleep a/c goes off/on all night.”
Reviews.Author: SRRF
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Great service. We stayed at suite and ,except for bathroom size, it was comfortable. The only problem is the air conditioning. No matter the settings you use,it keeps turning on and off all night.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melanocyte
Reviews.Content: For a recent quick trip to Boston, I chose the Omni Parker House based on its location; the hotel is in the heart of downtown, within just a few blocks of Boston Commons and the Public Garden and in walking distance of such classic Boston neighborhoods as Back Bay, Beacon Hill, and the North End, making shopping and dining easily accessible. Of note, my taxi rides to/from the airport at off-peak times were about 15 minutes in duration, though public transportation is nearby, as well. As such, the location was ideal for my brief spring weekend getaway. I found hotel staff universally friendly and helpful, from the bellman who eagerly welcomed me to the hotel upon my arrival to the housekeeping staff who greeted me with a smile every time I passed them in the halls. My room itself was rather small, with a view that primarily overlooked walls of other buildings. Perhaps because of the location, I found the room very quiet, with the only noise audible a phone conversation from an adjacent room. (A note to Verizon subscribers: possibly because of the location of my room or age of the building, I found cell service very spotty in my room.) The bathroom was even tinier, with little counter space but a surprisingly spacious and attractive shower. I tend to be fanatical about cleanliness, and I could find nothing- save a bit of dirt on the back of the bathroom door- about which to complain. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in, and much to my satisfaction, my request for foam pillows (feather allergic) was noted and fulfilled before my arrival. I would have no hesitation about returning to this hotel on future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fab historical hotel and make sure you join the loyalty program”
Reviews.Author: Kami4
Reviews.Content: The service was pleasant, housekeeping was great , the rooms are neat, clean and cozy. Bed was comfy but next time we will book a king size bed. Nice location 4 stops to the airport on the blue line. It was my OH birthday and we could not believe when we came back from lunch they left us a small bottle of champagne and a delicious Boston cream cake with a card in our room. This was really a nice touch . You must join the Omni Select Guest program , the beverage in the morning was great and the free internet is a bonus. We did ask for a room on high fl and was allocated one on the 14th, cant go higher than that, we did not have a problem with noise but we could see that it was very busy at the weekend. Overall we enjoyed our 6 night stay in this hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel, but had Priceline issues there I have never had before.”
Reviews.Author: KeepingRoadsWarm
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel but did have a Priceline problem I had never had before. As all Priceline users know, the room is only guaranteed for 2 adults. Apparently there are places where two adults can sleep in a double or full size bed! I have just never stayed in such a place before. But my friend and I are both small, so when we heard about the $50 upgrade price, we said no, we would just sleep in the same bed since it was just for one night. We got to our room and it had two full size beds, so we thought maybe the desk clerk had jus been confused about what type of room we had. We were shocked to get up the next morning and find a $50 charge stuck under the door for a "upgraded room". Had to catch a flight very early so we didn't stick around to argue, but I have stayed in MANY Priceline bid hotels and never been offered just a double bed. It has always been either King or two double or even two queens. So Priceline bidders beware. I thought it was a nice hotel, small rooms and bathrooms as to be expected in a old hotel. The staff were friendly, but we obviously had communication difficuties. would still be willing to stay there again, even with the issues, but I would book directly with the hotel. Very close to the Transit line and on Freedom Trail. Parking is a nightmare in Boston and especially in this area. Paid $40 for self parking across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Discriminatory against Priceline customers.”
Reviews.Author: kat7hy_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received terrible customer service during last night's stay at the Omni Parker House Hotel in Boston. To preface, I have never written a complaint before and over the years I have used Priceline for many of my hotel reservations. The experience that we had so greatly contrasted anything we have encountered before as in the past, every hotel we have booked through priceline has been wonderful - accomodating, nice room, and most importantly, the establishments' claims of the room offered being able to accomodate two people, per contract, has been absolutely upheld without question. We stayed at the Back Bay Hotel in Boston April 30th-May 1st and could not have been happier - wonderful room, staff, etc. - since it was my husband's birthday weekend (May 1st), we decided that we wanted to stay in the Boston area for an additional evening. We bid on a room on Sunday, and since we had never stayed at the Parker before but have stayed in other 'four star' hotels in the city, were thrilled when our bid was accepted and were anticipating another wonderful stay. From the initial call to the concierge to the greeting from the doorman, we were thrilled - friendly and kind, the staff overtly indicated that they would be making sure our stay was wonderful for his birthday. When we got to the front desk, the attendant even looked at the computer and said, your room is not quite ready, but again, happy birthday and we are making sure that you have one of the larger traditional rooms. He asked that we wait and give a cell number so they could call when our room was ready. Happily, we waited and then checked in and went to our room. Upon walking in to our 'larger' room, it was clear that something had gone wrong - not only was the room tiny, but if anything it definitely was probably one of the smallest rooms in the 'traditional' group at the omni and overall one of the smallest rooms we have ever stayed in ever. Now, I understand that it is an older hotel and the rooms may be smaller, but what was disturbing was that the Omni was clearly not fulfilling their end of the priceline contract. They gave us a 'full' sized mattress which lengthwise looked even smaller than a traditional full. No hotel has ever had the absurd audacity to even try to offer a room that is clearly only comfortable for one person and try to pass it off as contracturally sufficient to 'accomodate two people'. This is when things went from annoying to outright insulting and we feel, discriminatory to us as priceline customers. We called the front desk and really, because of the sheer size of the mattress, we thought an error had been made. We told the attendant that we had mistakenly been given a mattress for one person and there had been an error. Immediately he said that the full mattress was sufficient for two adults and that if we wanted to have a bigger mattress, WE would have to pay a 30 dollar upgrade fee. Again, after the years I have been a priceline customer, I have never encountered such an absurd or insulting situation nor asked for an upgrade fee for a normal sized mattress. It was as if we rented a standard mid size car and we had a rental company trying to give us a clown car trying to convince us it was a standard size. Further, we have had instances of a couple of less than up to par rooms (dirty bathroom for example) in other hotels, but the difference here is that they switched our room without any complaint or complications. I asked to speak to the manager and she was condescending to say the least and repeated that with priceline, they had given us what is ''required" for two people. She then went on to say, they can't just 'upgrade' every priceline customer. At this point, I was in tears and have never felt so insulted. No hotel has ever made me feel like a less than average guest just because I am a wise consumer who uses Priceline discount services. Ironically, this is supposed to be a 'four star' hotel. I have stayed at two star hotels with better customer service. I said to her, "We are NOT asking you for an upgrade. We are asking you to fulfill our contract. We have paid for a room that is supposed to accomodate two people. It is absurd that you would even think this tiny full sized mattress is sufficient for two adults to sleep in.' She responded (and in a canned way that more than led me to think that she has had this conversation before) that we can either take the room or pay an upgrade. Which would it be? Unbelievable. At that point, we had to pay the extra 30 simply because we would not have been able to fit on that bed to sleep and a cot was not even offered. To say that this left a bad taste in our mouths is an understatement. It is not about the amount - even if they said 10 dollars it would have been about the principle of the matter, and the glaring difference between their behavior and anything else we have ever encountered from any hotel, ever, whether it was a two star of a five star. The Omni Parker is acting discriminatory in my opinion to their guests who have chosen to bid through Priceline. We will be alerting the Omni Parker management of the situation. My husband's company works with many managers in the Omni group and it is important for them to know that this is happening. It goes without saying that we will never stay there again, and are disturbed if Priceline continues to endorse this hotel who are treating people this way. I am glad that I have been such a frequent Priceline customer over the years, because I have so many experiences (good) to compare this to to further see what a glaring injustice this was. The fact that it was my husband's birthday made it even worse. We are two professionals who travel very frequently and we have never been made to feel this way by a hotel. Later, we did get a bottle of champagne and a 'famous' cream pie in our room and we thought, 'Hmm, you nickel and dimed us for 30 dollars - how much did this cost you?' So, priceline customers, just know that at the Omni, their 4 star philosophy is that if you dare try to be a smart consumer, your standards of a hotel stay and mattress sized should be much lower than the average guest. What I found amusing is that aside from the history, and the ornate lobby, I have stayed in countless hotels that far surpass their facade - from the worn down rooms and old bathroom fixtures to the paper thin walls. Get over yourselves and thanks, you can keep the boston cream pie.

Reviews.Title: “Parker House Staff - Charming & Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: Meenanall
Reviews.Content: Attending a meeting at the Boston Convention Centre and stayed at the famous Parker House. From the bellstaff to reception, my first impressions were extremely positive. Was walked to my room by bellman and informed of all hotel amenities and offerings. Wireless through Omni Guest was awesome whether in food outlets, lobby or room. The staff was so nice that it really made my stay lovely. I spoke with other hotel guests about their experiences and they too said that they were blown away by the kind hospitality of the staff. The Parker House location can't be beat. Close to historic sites, Boston Common and the Park Street "T" Station, getting to the Convention Center via the Silverline bus connection was really easy. Obviously, the Parker House has a world famous restaurant. Room service consistently took less than 30 minutes. THAT may be a world record! Always with a smile, piping hot and delicious. This hotel is a must for those that like charming historic hotels. Might be best business stay I have ever had. Thanks Parker House!

Reviews.Title: “nice value for Boston, GREAT STAFF, great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelerjp98
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker house hotel is well priced for the location. The staff was great, really great. The lobby was beautiful, but the rooms were small. The bathrooms tile was cracked in some places.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bose2
Reviews.Content: If you want a true historical hotel stay in Boston, this is it! The service was pleasant, housekeeping was great (our housekeeper was a super nice), the rooms are neat, clean and comfy, the bed is superb, very comfy and luxurious! The Omni Select Guest program is amazing, you get various benefits; like free internet and free beverages in the morning to name a few, how cool is that?! I booked a few weeks in advance and got a great rate, so check the Omni website often. Can be a little noisy when the hotel is fully booked or on the weekends, but understandable and expected. You can't really go wrong here unless you want a spacious room & bathroom, with the petite or the deluxe room, it will be tight in most rooms. Don't come here and expect a large suburban style hotel room. If you decide to pick an executive room or suite, you will have ample living space. The public areas are beautiful, very historical and classy, possibly one of the most beautiful hotel lobby in Boston. They don't make hotels like this anymore. Location is perfect, near everything and located next to (2) subway stops (Government Center & Park Street) and (3) subway lines; the blue line, red line and green line. It's a quick 15-20 minute trip to Logan Airport via the blue line. There is a large CVS in front of the Government Center station (3 minutes from the hotel), it's convenient for last minute things & snacks. Enjoy this landmark property and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tarheelUS
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! The staff went out of their way to talk to our young kids and make them feel welcome. Great location-was easy to walk to Aquarium, Quincy Market, and Freedom Trail.

Reviews.Title: “the most comfortable nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: haze73
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most comfortable beds we have ever had in a hotel! This hotel feels like old Boston and is in the best location between Boston common and Quincy Market. We had a huge corner room, which was clean and lovely. On our first night here we even got cookies and milk for the kids as we returned home. so nice. Staff were so helpful especially the doorman. Must try the Boston Cream Pie, Yum. Would definately recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You gotta love the Boston Omni Parker Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mightymouse076
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel - I had stayed there in 2007 and really enjoyed it. Its located right on the Freedom Trail and not far from Quincy Market where all the action is in downtown Boston. Also very close to the Underground stations, The beds are exceptionally comfortable, and the rooms well equipped. Notwithstanding its age and interesting history, everything is modern and works well. Rates are a bit pricy, but in my view well worth it. Staff were very helpful in recovering a mislaid bag with important docs inside, inadvertantly left at reception on check-in. We would definitely recommend this venue for a stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: willow
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Boston with my husband who was attending a business conference and our college-aged son. This was our first stay at the Omni Parker House and it won't be our last. As others have mentioned, the location just can't be beat. Great restaurants nearby, Quincy Market, the Commons, an easy walk to the subway. We love this City and have, quite honestly, always stayed in the Copley Square area. Not anymore though! The hotel itself is a lovely historical hotel. So elegant went you walk in, it's truly impressive. Customer service is so obviously important to them - we were greeted and treated so well. Though we didn't eat or have drinks at the hotel, the bar areas and restaurant were lovely. We will definitely check them out next time. There are other reviews that mention tiny rooms -- that confuses me a bit and can easily be avoided. Go right to their website and check out the room sizes before you book them. The descriptions are accurate. We paid just a little bit more and with the AAA rate, were more than pleased with the Premier Suite. Absolutely lovely and a corner room. Plenty of room for us and so comfortable. The bed and bedding was heavenly! Yes, the bathroom was small -- but who goes to Boston to stay in the bathroom?! I must mention that we did have an incident Friday evening with the room next door to us. A group of women were having a party with loud music, way too much alcohol, yelling, obscene language, very out of control. We politely asked them twice to please quiet down because it was so loud we couldn't even hear our television! After no cooperation from them, it took 3 calls to the Front Desk and Security before it was resolved. We were disappointed with the turnaround time resolving the issue. Guests should not have to tolerate or wait significant amounts of time in a high quality hotel for resolution. That being said, I would agree with others that the walls are pretty thin. If possible, perhaps ask for a room that isn't next to a group. It's the only issue that makes me consider other options in that area of Boston and the only reason the Omni Parker House didn't receive a 5 star rating from me. The walls can be thin -- but it's how disruptions like this are handled that create impressions. All in all, it's a lovely hotel. Read the room descriptions and spend just a little bit more for the beautiful Premier Suite. You won't be disappointed. Where your walking shoes -- there's so much to see and do all within easy walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel at Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: ngrowena
Reviews.Content: With reference to other travelers' review here and price comparison, I picked this hotel and it's really a good choice. Both my friend and me loved its classic style and big comfortable bed. Yet, the washroom is a bit small. And I found some dust along the window. Well, a 4-star hotel should spend more effort on it. Location is excellent. Several Freedom Trial spots are just next to the hotel. Don't forget to join the membership and enjoy free internet connection. The membership is free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: capeck
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We had a great price on the room, and when I joined the Omni rewards program, had hot and cold drinks delivered to our room every morning which was a wonderful touch. It's a historic building in a fabulous location. The beds were very comfortable. Room was a little tight on space (especially the bathroom), but hey it's an old building. Fitness center is great.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: waking2dream
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an historic part of Boston, close to Boston Common and within easy walking distance of many landmarks and the Freedom Trail. The hotel is large and a popular conference venue so there always seemed a lot of people milling around the lobby. While the service was good, the rooms were disappointingly small and could have used sprucing up a bit. I couldn't unpack my small carry on luggage without obstructing the whole path. There were two great things about the room. The bed was among the best that I have slept in in a hotel. It was firm and very cosy as it was made up with two duvets which I loved. I slept very well but there were noise issues from the suite next door. I also liked having a real coffee maker with Wolfgang Puck coffee sachets in my room and not just a kettle and instant coffee. Considering the price of the room, it was very disappointing to learn that there was neither breakfast, free internet (at 9.95 per day), nor a complimentary newspaper. No matter how nice the bed, I ended up feeling that the room was poor value. Free internet should be provided as standard in all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Freedom Trail Suite Great with Kids”
Reviews.Author: JeffS_from_LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Freedom Trail Suite with our two girls, ages 6 & 8 for 7 nights. It was great. Our girls say that this was their favorite vacation ever because of the room. They loved the bunk beds, dress-up clothes, paper dolls, and giant chalk board wall. I think they were the perfect age to appreciate the room. The suite was pretty big with a separate bedroom for the grown-ups. My only complaint about the room was that there is only one very small bathroom. I didn't hear any noise from other rooms but the hallway noise did carry into the room. I've never stayed in a hotel where this wasn't an issue. We ate room service a lot. I had the salmon, chicken pot-pie, filet mignon, and pizza as well as the Boston Cream Pie. Everything was good. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant every day. We had the breakfast included in our room so we could only get the buffet. It was fine but got repetitive. The staff (front-desk, restaurant, room service, and housekeeping) were all very helpful and friendly. The hotel had a great location, on the Freedom Trail and near multiple subway lines. We originally were going to rent a car so that we could take side trips, but instead just rented a car from Avis across the street. Not only is a car not needed most days, but parking is really expensive. This saved us a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - but you could probably do better”
Reviews.Author: Flange_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review on this hotel in June 2010 about lack of customer service I received over the phone. My husband and I had made a reservation for July 2010. After visiting the hotel, I can say that our stay was pretty average. There were some definite perks; the express check-in, historic nature of the hotel and location are great. Nothing about the customer service particularly "wowed" me, although staff were friendly and bellhops responsive. I would recommend this hotel if one is interested in its history or if a reasonable deal is being offered. If a potential guest is looking for exceptional customer service (before and during your stay) or great value for money, my guess is you could do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the BAD”
Reviews.Author: Shiffled
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni Parker House came with some good, but unfortunately also some bad. The GOOD: Overall we felt the counter, lobby, house cleaning staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The lobby was beautiful and the rooms were more spacious than expected...although still small for two double beds. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and we had no problem sleeping. We only ate one meal at the hotel...breakfast which was good... so I really can't comment too much on the dining experience. Now THE BAD: the bathrooms were extremely small and the toilet was positioned in a very strange position. The bathroom was also very small. The room was not very sound proof and we could clearly hear every noise from out in the hall. We could also hear the room above us. We also experienced a very unpleasant incident at the hotel which will likely keep us from coming back out of principle. My wife and I were coming back from restaurant when we were caught in a heavy rain and sleet storm. We luckily found, so we thought, a side entrance to the hotel that was clearly marked as an entrance with the Omni overhang and lighting. We ran for the door, entered the building, only to discover a very indifferent Omni employee that stated the entrance was for employees only. I explained that we were guests of the hotel, that we were cold and getting soaked, and requested to cut through to the lobby to avoid further bad weather. The employee refused and sent us back out into the rain/sleet; even after I told him that there were no signs prohibiting us using the entrance and since it was not marked for employees only. Heck, the overhang and logos were ornate and similar to the one at front and other side of the hotel. Anyway, we ran back into the rain/sleet and to front entrance which was a long ways away. I subsequently spoke to the evening on duty manager who apologized but said that the entrance was in fact for employees. He didn't appear to care that were upset and unnecessary water logged guests... and even admitted to guests being allowed to enter the hotel under similar circumstances in the past. We had been to a casual restaurant and were wearing jeans....makes me wonder if I was in one of my nice suits if we would have been granted access. Anyway, I strongly feel this incident shows a strong indifference by the hotel to customer service and to going the extra mile for their guests; as well as a lack of service oriented training for staff. I was appalled with how we were treated and I doubt that I will ever stay at the hotel again as a result. So keep this in mind if you decide to book this hotel...as there are a lot of others to select from in the beautiful historic area of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Best Turkey Club Ever!”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Omni Parker House every March and it gets better and better. The other reviews have covered what a great hotel and great location it is, so I thought I would mention that it has the best room service turkey club ever made. It is also reasonably priced as well. If you stay at an Omni, make sure you sign up for the Select Guest Program. You get free Wifi and morning beverages delivered to you room. Also at the Omni Parker House you get the pleasure of working with Kate Casey, the Loyalty Ambassador. I would agree the parking is pricey, but the hotel makes it clear how much they charge and there are other options in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice- even with kids”
Reviews.Author: ttoo
Reviews.Content: When reading other reviews of this hotel I kept seeing the theme of small rooms/bathrooms but we booked an "Executive room" for $129 a night and had plenty of room to spread out with a 13 year old and 10 year old. Only con was that we were on the second floor and had no view (unless you consider looking into someone's work office across the alley a view). Separate living area with couch (sleeper) and two chairs and two double beds. Bathroom was small but there was a separate dressing table and area so there wasn't a need for doubling up in the bathroom. Furnishings in the room and the bathroom were in great shape. No issues with noise that others noted. Definitely sign up for free loyalty program before you go for free wi-fi, free paper, free hot and cold beverages delivered to room each day, and other goodies. No downsides to that! Patrick at the front desk gave my 10 year old a free backpack of goodies at check in and cookies and milk first night which he really appreciated. Old world charm and kid friendly kept both the adults and kids happy. Work out room was very large with nice equipment. Location is a BIG plus.....easy walking distance to most neighborhoods, right on the Freedom trail, and all the T lines run within a block of the hotel. We had no issues taking our luggage via the Blue T line to/from airport. Food and bar options EVERYWHERE. Front desk helpful when asking if they could print an email for us. Peeked at rooftop ballroom and staff there were gracious as well. Fire alarm going off one morning made for an interesting story for the kids to tell their friends....glad we were on the second floor then!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Champurbresident
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while in Boston for a conference. Although the conference was in a different hotel, I chose the Omni because of its lower rate. I enjoyed my stay there a lot. The hotel has character and it is very conveniently located near two T stations, stores, restaurants and attractions. The hotel staff were super-friendly. My room was on the smaller side (petite single) but clean and comfortable. I appreciated the printing my boarding passes for free. Overall it was a very pleasant experience. However it did seem like the management needs to pay more attention to maintaining the condition of the building. The hotel is old and some walls and ceilings -including the one in my room- looked worn out.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, conveniently located hotel, with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Scotch_Advisor
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel both because it was very conveniently located near to a Conference I was attending, and also because I thought the price was competitive - I paid in advance so got an internet advance pay deal of $151 per night for a single room. The room, on the eight floor, was nicely decorated and had a comfortable double bed, with a nice view over Old City Hall in central Boston. The room was quiet, and I had two nights of good sleep. Because I also joined the Omni hotels Select Guest Loyalty Program (free to join, I recommend doing so), I had free wifi internet access in my room (you have to pay otherwise, $10 a day, which is perhaps a little mean, though there is free wifi in the lobby of the hotel). The refreshments in the room were a little pricey ($22 for a half bottle of wine), so I wouldn't recommend consuming any of them, but the prices in the bar downstairs for food and wine were reasonable (and the two barmaids who served me were very friendly). The hall porter even went out of his way to find out the translation of the Latin motto over the hotel door when I asked him what it was, which I thought was a nice touch as he didn't need to take the trouble to do given he was pretty busy. Overall, I found the hotel clean and comfortable, with a good standard of decoration (appropriate for what they charge) and friendly staff. Plus the location is great for central Boston. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL !!!”
Reviews.Author: DEBRALondonU_k
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from weekend trip to Boston. Omni Parker Hotel was fabulous.. Upon arrival we were upgraded to an Executive Suite, which was so lovely.. Hotel is real old world charm..The staff could not do enough for us - special mention to Patrick on the Front Desk !!! Weather was great fri,sat & sun.On monday we had snow and rain for most of the day.. We still were out and about.. Had breakfast one day in the Parker Restaurant - which was very nice. Hotel is in such a good location.. We walked most places, did go on the subway up to Harvard.. Also booked Old Town Trolley - which was very good..Some of the guides were a bit over the top !! Spent quite a bit of time in the Last Hurrah Bar in the Hotel, although more expensive than nearby bars we just thought this bar was fab.. Lovely comfortable seating and great staff.. My only criticsm of Hotel was that the bathrooms could do with upgrading. When I return to Boston I will definitely stay at the Omni Parker Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: mwilld
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our trip to Boston in March. Everything was great (with the exception of too soft of beds). This is truly a 4 star hotel, and you are in walking distance to everything. My wife and I are always budget travelers; we purchased this plus airfare for 4 days from Dallas for under $1000 (which is a deal) through Priceline. We did upgrade our bed arrangement from a full to two full which cost a little extra but was well worth it (we knew about this before we left). Another nice thing they did was get us a room with a great view (I called in a couple of days early to do this). The Parker House is the home of Boston CrÃ¨me Pie and Parker House Rolls, both are great. Getting there: We were able to take a free bus to the Subway terminal for the Blue line. After we purchased a 7day link pass ($15 each) we took the Blue line to government center (this is inbound), then it was just about two block away. Hints for Boston: Bring a compass (it is easy to get turned around). Get a link ticket Look at taking the ferry from the Aquarium to the Constitution and bunker hill (your link ticket will work on this). See the public library (it is really pretty) If you have a rainy day or days consider the city pass ($48 for 4 or 5 attractions). Skip trying to use the busses. Check out the skywalk, but bring gum, the elevator is express and it is hard on the ears. Go to Quincy Market to eat. This is for the most part regular prices and a lot of choices (imagine 200 yards of food courts, but with a local style). Go to Mikeâ€™s pastry in the North end (near Paul Revers House). The freedom trail is of course the main attraction here and you will spend a day walking through it and all of the buildings on the way. Skip going inside Trinity Church. This is I think $7 a person and all you see is the Sanctuary. Go to Harvard to the Museum of Natural History and see the glass flowers (these are incredible life like replicas) and the Whale skeletons amount other items.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, beautiful, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: unstoppable-2
Reviews.Content: I was so appreciative for this hotel's service, allowing me to check in very early after a red-eye flight AND allowing me to check out quite late because my plane was delayed. If you're a member of Omni's Select Guest program (free), they bring juice and coffee to your room in the morning. The hotel is convenient to public transportation and historic sites, clean, attractive. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Parker House is the best place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: skimaine
Reviews.Content: First and foremost - this hotel is perfect in every way and is a great value. We were able to get a 2 room suite at a great price by booking and paying in advance. The entire experience at this hotel is all about service and location. If you need brand spanking new rooms then this isn't the place for you...it is the oldest continuously operated hotel in the country after all. The entire property is beautiful, clean, and renovated as-needed and they paid very close attention to detail to maintain the original style. If you want a decently priced 4-star hotel only steps from the aquarium and Quincy Market then this is your place. Before you go - join the Omni loyalty program. I can't say this enough. It's free and the perks are awesome. Free wireless, free drinks in the morning delivered to your room, a 'secret' room service menu with much lower prices than the 'public' menu, cookies and milk for the kids the night of arrival, express check-in. The program is free to join and they stay true to their promises. I read all the reviews and based on the number of complaints about room size we opted for a "premier suite." The room (2 rooms really) was HUGE. My wife, 2 kids, and I had plenty of room. King bed, pull out couch, 2 tv's, decent sized bathroom, plenty of plush chairs (4?) and a large desk. For a few dollars more it was most definitely worth it. No other hotel (we stay at A LOT of them) has ever made our children feel so welcomed. A man at the front desk ran out back as soon as he saw them at checkout and handed each of them a bag filled with neat little toys. They LOVED the little flashlights and other trinkets. What a great way to treat kids! Some hotels we stay at seem like they would rather not even have kids as guests and the OPH went out of their way to let us know they are valued customers too. It is obvious that the management has instilled a 'culture' of great customer service in the staff and it is very much appreciated. Also, the crib we requested at booking was in the room when we arrived. Very rarely (if ever) does that happen, we usually need to remind them at check-in or call down when we get to the room and see it is not there. Very nice touch. There was ALWAYS someone standing in front of the elevators greeting guests and asking if we needed help or asking questions. What a great service. We always had a dumb little question of some sort (where is the workout room, which way is Quincy Market, where is the nearest Starbucks...) and we were always treated to a smile and a knowledgeable answer. The fitness center was top notch. Brand new equipment, rolled up towels, filtered water. One thing others may want to know is that the valet parking is $42 a day which is about what we usually pay at similar hotels (we paid $65 a night in NYC once..). We love valeting the car since we have small children and it is so convenient but there is a public lot around the corner if you felt inclined to use it you could probably save $15 - $20 a day. I'm not sure what else to say. The staff was great, the hotel is beautiful, the rates are fair, and the location is absolutely perfect. Bravo OPH. The management deserves a pat on the back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, great location, friendly, polite staff, readily available amenities.”
Reviews.Author: rlee76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a Friday afternoon to Saturday morning. This is a beautiful, old hotel. Check-in was easy and they upgraded my room to a nice deluxe. The room is small, but I already knew this from other reviews, and as the hotel is pretty old, I know they try and keep the original rooms plans, so I again had been expecting that. The furniture/bedding/style of the room is gorgeous and classic. Plenty of mirrors and a pretty big TV. The bathrooms are small, but I also had been expecting that. The tub is very comfortable and they provide a variety of towels and toiletries. The towels are huge! They provide 3 huge towels and the mirror in there is gigantic and oh! They also have a hair dryer, a small closet with an ironing board all ready with an iron and plenty of hangers and the dresser is very beautiful with lots of drawers. My view was really, really nice. Could see the Charles River from my room and when I woke up the next morning, I pullied up my nice stage-curtain-like shade and gazed out on downtown to a beautiful sunrise. If you're not too keen on noise, ask for a top floor room - but make sure you ask for one that's nestled into the corner somewhere because the walls are thin and you don't want to hear much off-the-elevator convo from fellow guests. Overall, a lovely stay and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, as always, they charge an arm and a leg for the mini-bar and refreshments in the room, but they do come in handy for overnight snacking. Wish I had ordered some room service, I'm sure that would have been delicious. Definitely will stay here again next time. If you're reading this, Mr Manager, please know that you run a very beautiful, old-world-style hotel that really delivers!

Reviews.Title: “Boston in style”
Reviews.Author: Montreal1642
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Omni Parker House just place us in a relax ambiance after our stay in N.Y. Luxure, attention service, good restaurant in the hÃ´tel and near by. Just on the other side of the street, you'll find the best steak house on the East side of Norh America. No, I'm not joking, go and try RUTH'S CHRIS STEAK HOUSE. It worth the detour.

Reviews.Title: “Good location poor housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation using my iPhone unfortunately my arrival date was for the next day. Front desk was able to accommodate me no problem. The room was small, bathroom tiny. The rug in the room was frayed. Went to the Celts game after the game went to retire for the night and pulled down the comforter. The bright white sheet was loaded with hairs. Sceeved out bug time. Upon further examinatiion it doesn't look like the matress sheet was even changed. Very disappointed I almost exclusively only stay in Omni Hotels for the reward benefits. Unlikely to return here really grossed out.

Reviews.Title: “The most awesome family suite ever”
Reviews.Author: Ausmale
Reviews.Content: We have only just arrived at this amazing hotel today and after reading some negative reviews I just have to comment! We have been totally impressed with everything so far, starting with speedy check in, our two five year olds got a back pack full of toys, and if that wasn't exciting enough, we arrived in our family suite.......this is huge! The kids nearly passed out with excitement when they saw their bedroom nook, just off the large living area. This is the best family suite we have EVER stayed in. The kids have a fantastic bunk bed, a play table loaded with coloring books, crayons, drawing paper, toys, bean bags, a massive full wall chalk board....and old colonial dress ups. They now don't want to leave the hotel and keep saying " this is the best house ever, and we're staying for ever and ever". We have travelled a lot with the kids since they were born, and this is without a doubt the best hotel family friendly suite we have stayed in. We now can't understand why other hotels don't do this type of accommodation. We can chill out in our very comfortable king suite bedroom off the living room, kids are sound asleep from all the excitement of the room, the bed is so comfortable, as everyone else has mentioned. We went for a walk this afternoon and it is so close to everything, however we had to come back, as the kids wanted to play dress ups! . There are books for us to read, wifi is great ( we joined the loyalty program, it's free and you will not be disappointed), room service is really prompt and the kids got a cookie and milk as well. Every member of staff has been helpful, and just so friendly. As we have been traveling now for five weeks and moving often, this is such a welcome respite. We can't wait to tell everyone we know about this little gem. Even though we haven't finished our stay, I'm sure we would have even more good things to say after our six days, but I want to make sure I capture this amazing place so others know about our positive experience here.

Reviews.Title: “When can I come back.....”
Reviews.Author: Anna27-2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a four night stay in this wonderful olde world hotel. We arrived in Boston on February 28th - a cold and wet evening and it was such a pleasure to walk into the warmth and comfort of the lovely wooden lobby and be checked in by the very friendly reception staff. Our room which was on the 12th floor was a king room, good sized and very clean and comfortable. We had signed up for the Select Visitor programme and we therefore had free wi-fi in the room, but otherwise it would cost circa $10 per day, though there's free wi-fi in the lobby area. I did see into some other rooms while we were there and some of them seemed very small, but not so small that they'd be uncomfortable. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and we had no problems with noise etc. The hotel is very well situated beside Boston Common and on the Freedom Trail, there are lots of very good restaurants and shops nearby, and the subway is only about 100 yards away. As I said before, the staff are second to none and nothing is too much trouble to them. The concierge, Joseph, was more than helpful to us both before and during our stay - before, as I contacted the hotel the week before we arrived to enquire about shopping outlets in Boston, and he organised that for us and had everything ready when we arrived, and during the time we were there we found him to be very knowledgable and informative. All in all, our stay in this hotel was a very pleasurable experience and I would heartily recommend it to anyone thinking of visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Small But Nice Rooms, Public Spaces Frayed Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: Because of business I stayed at the Parker House for the first time last week. The location is excellent- walking distance to the theater district, restaurants of the North End, the Financial District, Charles Street, Beacon Hill and the Flat of the Hill and Newberry Street. The room (upgraded) was priced right at $ 179 (with taxes etc it ended up being $ 212). Internet was in the $ 12/day range. For Boston (in this hotel class) the rate was a real bargain- probably something to do with time of year (raw to the extreme as it gets up here a this time of year. My room was small but nice (European size) with a VERY small bathroom (standing sink, toilet and tiny shower with curtain. It makes European bathrooms look large! Other than that the room was very nice- equal to a Marriott with about the same decor and feel. I sleep with ear plugs- so it was no bother to me- but without them my second floor room was noisy- so if you have no problems with heights I would go higher. Public areas have a faded "old glory" look. Carpets (still on the edge of beautiful) are fraying and look old. Dark wood paneling in the lobby, bar and PArkers (restaurant) are scratched and worn. From a distance still beautiful in a formal 19th century manner. Breakfast and lunch at Parkers- service was great- old world- pleasant but formal. The bell staff and front desk were nice, helpful and friendly. Nice work and glad to see this in a Boston hotel. Health Club was great- surprisingly modern and equipped withe great equipment. Location superb!

Reviews.Title: “great location but very small room”
Reviews.Author: purplehusky
Reviews.Content: Got the room through priceline bid for one night. Great location with easy access to many places in the area. This is one of the oldest hotels in Boston and it has a variety of types of rooms. If you stay in its "traditional room", you may not like it. The room is very small and feel uncomfortable and difficult to move around. The bathroom, the bed ... all are very small. Expect what you pay for what you get if you bid through priceline.

Reviews.Title: “very nice historic hotel perfect for freedom trail sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: GwenParmer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were delighted to come up from the subway station and look right across the street to see the Omni Parker House Hotel. It is literally steps away from the beginning of the freedom trail route next to the State House and Boston Commons. The history of the hotel is so interesting-make sure you read it and have a piece of their famous Boston Creme Pie! SOOOO worth the $8! The hotel is convienent to shopping, subway, dining, sightseeing and has all you need! The rooms were very clean and quiet and the beds really soft and comfortable. We did only have a double bed and the room was a little small compared to newer hotels but if you look at the convenience, price, and history of this hotel--it is not a negative! I wanted to sleep close to my hubby anyway so it wouldn't have mattered if we had a king! I will stay here again when we return to Boston! Oh and the staff was wonderful! helpful, friendly and even let us check in early! Thanks OPH!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can mix business with pleasure here”
Reviews.Author: TurboTourist
Reviews.Content: I finally had business actually in the USA (hooray), so I did something I do not ever do â€“ I took my family. The Omni Parker House had larger rooms for families, so it seemed the right choice. Here are some comments on our experiences as a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 younger boys): Hotel: â€¢ A bit dated or classic, depending on what word you want to use â€¢ Our family room was huge, coffee table, TV, etc. â€¢ Our room had a horrible view, but who cares. We were seldom in it. â€¢ The beds slept great/perfect â€¢ Staff was incredible, especially one lady at the front desk with our boys â€¢ The Doorman / Valet never called a Taxi one day. We waited a LONG time until he finally arranged one. We were late for business meetings due to this. â€¢ Restaurant was OK. We had good pizza and our boys loved the Boston Cream Pie â€¢ I am in the Omni Select Guest program â€“ it gets you a get kit for your kids to play with plus milk/cookies. Join before you go; it is free. Location/Area: â€¢ Location was good for exploring, on foot in particular â€¢ As others have said, the Freedom Trail literally runs in front of the door â€¢ As a family, we had a rental car and valet parked â€“ parking service was fine â€¢ There are enough small shops nearby to catch something quickly to eat, pharmacy, etc. o Brueggerâ€™s Bagel Bakery down School St is nice o There is Starbucks right down School St o Our boys favored Dunkin Donuts, just off Tremont Boston Tips: â€¢ Many other sites cover this stuff, so just specific things: o Take the cheap public ferry to complete the Bunker Hill/USS Constitution portion of the Trail â€“ Donâ€™t walk the bridge with kids. The ferry is right by the aquarium â€“ it is not obvious, so just ask someone. o The Bunker Hill monument can be climbed by a 7 and 8 yr old boy o Eat at Mama Miaâ€™s in Plymouth, it was good pizza and you can sit outside and watch the ocean. BTW, there is a Mama Miaâ€™s in Kinsale, Ireland that is also good â€“ they are not affiliated (I asked) o While in Plymouth, find the National Monument to the Forefathers â€“ HUGE and cool o Walk the Trail and stop to get some pastries â€“ a kidâ€™s dream o The swan boats are totally fascinating for a kid o Whale watching is what you make it â€“ we only saw parts of a whale, but we built it up as a huge deal and my boys liked it

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TuckerHost
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at the Omni Parker House; I use it as my preferred place to stay when I have an overnight connection at Logan Airport. The hotel is just 4 subway stops away from the airport so it's a great alternative to the dull airport located hotels that are close to nothing but the airport. It is a classic old hotel and some guests will be disturbed by the size of some of the rooms and bathrooms. But if you look beyond that to find the vibe of the grand old hotel, you can have a great historic experience. Make sure your a Select Guest (free) member and you'll get free internet and in room delivery of free morning coffee and juice -- no one else does that. Their bedding is always luxurious, the fitness center is modern, well ventiliated, and has individual TVs on all the cardio equipment. Don't miss the Boston Creme Pie either -- no better pre-bedtime indulgence. Get to know this Omni Hotel, it will captivate you.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and unhelpful service”
Reviews.Author: AAtravelstheworld
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the Omni Parker House Boston with my other half in February. The hotel is in a great location and the room rates were good for a weekend stay. Close proximity to a number of "T" stops and a selection of restaurants, coffee shops and stores within walking distance of the hotel made the location of the property its greatest asset. The lobby, rooms and staff are formal. The staff were cold and aloof. From the concierge, check-in staff and even the bar tender I did not feel like we were welcome guests. Our room, which according to the front desk staff was an upgrade from their basic room, had everything a business or leisure traveler really needed except space. I understand that this is a city-center, historic property, but even in Europe I have never stayed in such a small, cramped room. You could not wheel a carry-on bag between the end of the bed and the dresser with the TV on it. The bathroom was clean but equally small and lacking any counter space (just a pedestal sink). I would not stay at this property again. There are too many other hotels in this section of Boston that offer more space and better service in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great building, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyCat32
Reviews.Content: First the good: Location is excellent, the building is beautiful (though lacking things like pool and having tiny rooms) it is steeped in history and is great starting point to explore Boston. Bed is small, but extremely comfortable. We had no noise issues, other that hearing a person talk in a hallway outside the door a couple times. On the bad side: Service was minimal. When we checked in, I was told that WIFI is $10 a night and nothing was mentioned about joining a loyalty program to get the stuff for free. Cleaning was non-existant. When we moved in, the room was decent, but the next day and thereafter floor was not vacuumed, table was not wiped. Only replaced towels and took out trash. On the ugly: I needed to look good for a meeting and went to iron my shirt only to discover that the iron had a stain on it. I called to get another iron, 30 minutes later I got one, with a stain that was worse. I told the guy who brought it and he disappeared, 20 minutes later he brought another iron that looked great. I started ironing only to smell the cord on the iron melting. Called again and was offered a free pressing. Had the suit sent down with precise instructions. Called next morning because the suit was not back only to be told that they have the suit but no instructions. They pressed it and brought it up to me. It was looking worse than before the pressing. They did bring a good iron and I was able to iron it at this point (noon the next day). Fortunately, my meeting was not until the day after. That said, if any of my friends can book the room for 2 star price and have these service expectations, I would actually still recommend it for the location and the history.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ka-duncan01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House over Valentines weekend. The hotel lobby was beautiful, check in was a breeze. The gold elevators are beautiful and you really feel like you are stepping back in time. Past that not so hot. The room that we had was soooo small. We had two double beds and they were so small we could not sleep comfortably. The wallpaper was peeling and paint chipping. The rooms are in desperate need of updating. If you stay here you have to pay for a bigger room and hope that you get it, not so great! We had the sunday brunch and it was good but not $22 a person good. I do not think I would stay here again unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, well positioned for the historic sights.”
Reviews.Author: Col839
Reviews.Content: An old, formal hotel in appearance but with high standards and good quality service. Well positioned in the centre of the city and close to most of the historic sights. Good service but a little expensive for extras not pre booked, for example breakfast and meals.

Reviews.Title: “Better pack your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: dkelly27
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying my husband and I have stayed in numerous hotels in the Boston area and other areas of the country so I have a lot to compare this hotel to. I booked the Omni through Priceline. We use Priceline a lot and have never had a problem or been disappointed with our hotel room or location. Upon check-in, I was informed that we were to be put in a room with ONE full size bed. When I mentioned that I booked through Priceline and that they guarantee a room with either 2 doubles, 1 queen or 1 king, I was told that the hotel was "completely booked" because of the Valentine's weekend. I said one full size bed was unacceptable and that I would call Priceline immediately. I was than informed by the woman that Priceline buys blocks of rooms with 2 full beds and that's it. (so why are you trying to stick me in a room with ONE bed?) The classic "bait and switch" was taking place here. Even though Priceline buys blocks of rooms with TWO beds, they were trying to put us in a room with ONE bed and only after I told her I would call Priceline, did she miraculously find a room with 2 beds. Another woman at the front desk said "our full beds are larger than normal". NOT true. I was than told we could "each sleep in a bed". I told her we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and didn't want to sleep in separate beds. Isn't that romantic? I had phoned the hotel on Monday the 7th to request a room with a King bed and was told that "shouldn't be a problem". The woman at check in told us to "go see the room and decide if it was acceptable". We already paid through Priceline, so our hands were tied. There was no apology, no offer of "have a drink on us", nothing. So disappointing. The room was small, barely enough room to walk around the beds, the bathroom was even smaller. There is little to no drawer and closet space for your clothes. We were in a corner room (526) so the bathroom wall is cut off at an angle. It reminded me of a cruise ship bathroom. How this hotel is given a 4 star rating is beyond me. The walls are PAPER thin. Other reviews about this are NOT exaggerating. I've never stayed in a hotel with such a lack of privacy from room to room. There were 4 guests in the room beside us and we could hear their normal conversation....CLEARLY. That evening they came back to their room about midnight. We were awakened by loud laughing and carrying on. After about an hour of this, I banged on the wall and they're response was "what the @#$! was that" and than they continued to party loudly. Finally I phoned the front desk at 2 a.m. and told them what was going on. They sent security up. So here I am in one bed, while my husband is in the other because there is no way that 2 normal size adults will fit in one of these "full" size beds. And as I'm lying there listening to the people in the next room, I'm thinking this is no way to spend our anniversary weekend. Do not book this hotel if you want a romantic weekend with your significant other, because all of your neighbors will hear exactly what's going on in your room. I'm shocked that this hotel is rated 4 star based on this alone. There are ways to fix this problem but obviously the Omni doesn't feel the need to guarantee their guests the privacy they deserve. So basically, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I'd like to thank the management at the Omni for ruining our weekend. The Omni has a lot to learn when it comes to satisfying their guests. I am left with such a bad taste in my mouth about this hotel and I'll be sure to tell everyone to avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RCM_11 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully positioned on the Freedom Trail in the heart of downtown Boston, this hotel oozes charm and sophistication. As other reviewers have noted, you wouldn't describe the rooms as spacious but they do the job. Very friendly and helpful staff. Sign up to the loyalty programme beforehand for free wi-fi and other goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonydowntownnyc
Reviews.Content: Great room with all amenities including plush bed, sep. mini fridge for your own use, internet, flat screen TV, free beverages and paper left at your door in the morning, free clothes pressing & extremely attentive staff. -- Hotel Lobby is early 20th century glamor in mint condition - Hotel room sizes were on the "cozy" side, but who cares when all else is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elschka
Reviews.Content: As I am writing this review I am still at the hotel. I have come from Albuquerque to Boston for surgery and am booked for 7 nights at the Omni. I have been to Boston before but never stayed at a hotel in the city because our daughter lives outside of Boston and we have stayed there. I travel a lot and I am amazed by the service this hotel provides. Front desk courtesy, service at Parker Bar, housekeeping, concierge etc. etc. all have been amazing! They go out of their way to answer any questions you have. The hotel is just beautiful and its history is amazing. Its location could not be better. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston”
Reviews.Author: catcamx3
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay. Lots of character. Plush bedding. Very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this Hotel, Love this city!”
Reviews.Author: LisaP090310
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days 2 nights at The Parker House as a pre-wedding stress-free getaway. And it was! We parked at a garage just down the block for something like $35 for the weekend and walked with our luggage down to the hotel. The lobby is magnificent and really makes you feel the history of the hotel. We arrived at 11am and was pleasantly surprised to find that a room was ready for us! The lobby staff was outstanding and friendly, from the lady who checked us in to the gentleman who suggested where I pick up some quick take-out sandwiches for lunch (Sam La Grassa's). Our room was small, but this being the oldest continuously operating hotel in America I wasn't expecting modern day huge. But it made up for its size with a nice desk (the hubby has to do some work while here), most comfortable bed, and cozy bathroom. We signed up for their rewards program - and utilized their free internet and drinks delivered to our room in the morning. Their exercise room is very nice! We had breakfast in their restaurant and after-dinner drinks and Boston cream pie in their bar - both were delicious! The location of this hotel can not be beat. Located on the freedom trail this hotel is within 15 minutes walking distance of EVERYTHING! We saw it all and never took our car, a cab, or he subway! When we go back to Boston we will absolutely stay here again, and have recommended this hotel to anyone considering going to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB customer service-close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: LovingTheOpenRoad
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Omni Parker House and I'll continue to come to this location when I pass through Boston again! Customer service is TOP NOTCH on ALL levels from the front desk staff, managers, and wait staff personnel. I had a minor issue that was IMMEDIATELY resolved from a manager and I felt that I was treated as a valued guest the entire stay. Rooms are quaint and 'typical' Boston. Another plus is this Hotel is close to a LOT of center city attractions, restaurants, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place in every sense of the word!!”
Reviews.Author: alburch20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything someone would want and more! My fiance' and I stayed here for a weekend getaway from January 28th to the 30th for my birthday. First off anyone that says the rooms and bathrooms are small are obviously looking for a big chain room. If you want that style room, go book one! The room was plenty big enough and so was the bathroom with a nice sized double bed and full bathtub shower. The hotel is the location everyone dreams about. Only 2 blocks from any "T" stop and walking distance to just about anywhere you want. The decor of the interior really makes you realize of how historic and how much this hotel has stood the test of time. Everyone was really friendly and eager to help with anything we needed. Sleeping at night was very cozy and we both slept like babies on the awsome beds which were among the most comfortable I have slept on in a hotel. I would however recommend parking in a nearby garage and walking the couple blocks to the hotel, which is what we did. It's a lot cheaper than paying for the valet. I am a frequent visitor to Boston and I will surely be looking at the Parker house for my next stay in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel- Definitely a Hotel I'll Always Come Back To”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Texas50
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I was so excited upon first walking in and seeing the amazing hotel I was going to stay in. The old wood paneling, amazing historic detail, and unrivaled class and elegance impressed me from the first second I walked in. Not to mention, the location really is superb. Having lived in Boston before, but coming back as a "tourist" this was the perfect place to stay. The room was pretty small- but I assume that's what I get for booking a package on travelocity on one the busiest weekends in Boston (graduation weekend for several of the Universities in the area). But it didn't matter- I had a big walk-in closet, good size bathroom, and comfortable bed. Not much of a view (alley) but again, I knew what I was getting into booking a package deal. But for those who want old world sophistication, dealing with a friendly and helpful staff, and perfect central location, this is the hotel to stay in. In fact, I'm heading up to Boston in a couple months and am staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The concierge - Joseph - help make the trip Memorable!”
Reviews.Author: ilovepool
Reviews.Content: We loved this historic hotel. We ended up here after a winning bid on Priceline.com Pros Location â€“ on the freedom trail â€“ grab a map and do a self guided tour. It was also great for getting around the city if you donâ€™t want to have you nose stuck in a map. We just followed the red trail to and from dinner with no problem. Concierge â€“ Joseph was fantastic! Ask for him when you arrive. He really made our trip memorable by showing us the best restaurants and entertainment. We highly recommend purchasing the tickets for the Boston Trolley from Joseph â€“ it was the best way to see the city! He saved us from having to wait outside in line in the cold. Parking â€“ EASY â€“ if youâ€™re super lazy, they have a valet or use the self park around the courner - it's called the PI Alley Garage (about a 5 min walk). Room - My husband loved that he could easily control the room temperature. He used the little coffee maker every morning. The beds were comfy and had several different pillow options. The mattress looked new. Room Service â€“ Arrived fast and hot. At the time of writing this review if you sign up for the Select Guest Program you'll receive Free Wi-Fi, Morning beverage delivery, pressings and a shoe shine!! http://www.omnihotels.com/Home/SelectGuestProgram.aspx Cons The hallways do look a bit tired. Overall, we plan on booking this hotel next time we stay in Boston. The staff is what really made this a great hotel stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: twopeasonepod
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here via Priceline, and enjoyed our stay. The historic hotel is very lovely. I liked how they gave a little card with some of the hotel's history on it. I thought it was interesting and a nice touch. Our room was small (but well organized) with a double bed. The bed was very comfortable. I wish we had gotten a bigger room due to the length of our stay, but with Priceline, you get what you get! The location was great for using the T- it was just a little down the street, a huge plus in the dead of winter. The only real complaint we had was the walls are very thin. We could clearly hear our neighbors talking or turning on the tv- and they appeared to be talking with normal voices. I woke up several times during the night because of it- but what can you do, it's a really old building! If you sign up for the select program (I think that's what it's called- their frequent stay rewards program), you can have free turndown service, free wi-fi, and daily beverages and newspapers. We only received a newspaper on one day though.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a friends house!”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni was fantastic. The front desk staff made me feel warm and welcome, upgraded me to a bigger room upon arrival, brought up packages that had been delivered to me on a daily basis and even called up to the room to see if everything was to my satisfaction. The room was spacious, clean, well decorated and had everything one expects in a 4star establishment. The only remark is I could hear voices in the neighboring room one night. I was chilly and raining one evening and I stayed in and ordered room service. Despite all the extra charges typical of room service, for a total of $25 I had an amazing lobster roll with fries and coleslaw. It was fresh, delicious and very generous. Also, if you register for the Omni Select Guest loyalty program, you get complimentary hot and cold beverages delivered to the room every morning and complimentary wi-fi, daily paper, shoe shine, garment pressing and more! I can't say enough great things about this hotel and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lumpy Mattress”
Reviews.Author: T34IFR
Reviews.Content: Location is great for sightseeing. The bar has below average bar food. Service was erratic. Lots of other dining/drinking options in the area. Room was very nice, except for the awful mattress. Elevators were fast. Great checkin. I didnt park, but I believe its $42/day! Geez, like Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is walking distance”
Reviews.Author: chaliekwok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel rooms were clean and nice. Well worth the price we paid ($85 via Priceline Bidding) Walking distance to Quincy Market (3-4 blocks), the Aquarium, Downtown Crossing with tons of shopping, Chinatown. You name it, you can like walk to it. But if not, there are 3 separate subway stations located within 1-2 blocks of the hotel. We went to a Celtics game, a theatre show via Bostix.org (50% off show's tickets).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Excellent Location, OMNI magic”
Reviews.Author: Malakeh79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over New Years Eve. This was about my 4th time staying at this hotel. The staff are extraordinarily friendly. The hotel and rooms have a lovely old classic charm. While the hotel is dated, it is impeccably clean and renovated, and the age gives it a nice character. It has the OMNI magic all over it and what keeps me coming back to this location. The security was tight over NYE and they made sure all persons entering the elevator were guests that evening, which helped me feel safe. You get a great room for a great price, while receiving impeccable customer service. Make sure you join select guest so you get the free internet, free pressing/shoe shine, and your favorite beverage delivered to your room every morning! Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice amenities, good value”
Reviews.Author: phillygal39
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Boston, room rates are a great value. Nice airy room, very clean with some nice touches. Great bathroom. Public areas are very nice, very inviting. Cozy tavern. Fitness area open to guests. Great breakfast, included with room price.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms with a great location”
Reviews.Author: LisaLPharmD
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better location than the Omni Parker. We were right in the middle of downtown Boston, within walking distance to a ton of bars and restaurants, historical sites, and even Fauneil Hall. While the hotel was clean, it was old and a little "shabby" as far as having old carpets and such. Also, this was the first time I've been in a hotel that didn't have free wi-fi in the rooms in years. Also, the size of the room was ridiculously tiny. We actually started cracking up as soon as we opened the door. If one of us wanted to stand or move, the other one had to either sit on the bed or go in the bathroom. We could barely squeeze past the area between the bed and the television. There was no closet to hang anything in. ALso, I could not seem to find vending machines anywhere, to get water and snacks from. The parking was valet only and the fees were outrageous - around $42 per night, but I hear that everywhere in this area is very high. Security in the lobby was good, and the employees were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: jo_hearts_holidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for valentines day 2010 and boy was it cold in Boston, even the river was frozen. Anyway, I read the trip advisor reviews about small rooms with no view before going and e-mailed the hotel to request a bigger room (if possible) with a view. Whilst I am not sure I got my bigger room we did get the view which I thought was good of the hotel to oblige. The Omni is great value & has a fantastic location. I do appreciate its a historical building but in some parts of it you can tell (although generally well looked after). The room is adquate (though the bathroom looks as outdated as my nans) and has all of the facilities you would expect. The bar is a great place to relax after a day of walking miles. Boston itself I absolutely loved. Try the Oyster House, do the trolly bus tours, try legal seafood walk the freedon trial, climb the monument. I would go back to Boston tomorrow but not to the Omnbi Parker.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - lovely and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Northen_Monkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights at the start of our honeymoon. The hotel has decent sized rooms in European Standards albeit the bathroom was rather small - (the same size as the walk in wardrobe. The rooms were immaculate and although the corridors do appear a little dated with cheap looking room doors, the room itself was great. We only had breakfast once (christmas day) - definitely best to head out to one of the numerous coffee shops about, much better value. So easy to get around Boston from this location, 4 mins from the T (subway) and cabs are always available from outside the hotel - although we found we walked most places. On a separate note - if you are non-US and get a chance go to a Celtics game do it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience.......”
Reviews.Author: Joshadam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic getaway with my girlfriend and I was NOT disappointed. The room and this hotel far exceeded my expectations. First, there are many comments about room size in the reviews that I read. We stayed in a Deluxe King and it was perfect. The bed is as comfortable as it looks on the website and you feel like you're in a classy bedroom at home vs. a hotel. The bathroom is small but nice with a pedestal sink and clean shower/bath. The staff was very friendly and very well trained. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant is a bit pricey ($52 for 2) but worth trying out at least once. The gym is adequate. The location is superb. Easy access to great bars/restaurants, shopping and the "T" of course! I highly recommend the Omni Parker Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent established Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginnysails
Reviews.Content: Easy walking to Faneul Hall, Quincy Market and around the Boston Common. A very central location. Staff was friendly and helpful. The receptionist was particularly nice and took trouble to be sure I got the room I wanted. I checked in very late at night and was concerned I might lose my reservation, but no problem. Room was not large, but clean and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel- package deal made it even better”
Reviews.Author: crazydogs
Reviews.Content: We booked a special package rate for a few days between Christmas and NYE for $119. Given a choice of any type of room, we opted for the king executive... wow! Very large and comfortable for two people. Couch was a pull-out, so you could sleep even more. Location is spot-on for getting anywhere in Boston. Staff was so friendly and helpful- all of them (especially the housekeepers)! Nice touches all around. Opted for breakfast on the morning of checkout. You don't go there for cheap breakfast- plenty of places within a few blocks for that. $22 for the buffet seemed the best "deal". Pancakes, sausage, bacon, eggs (omelets could be made to order as well), baked goods- including Parker House rolls, bagels/toast, oatmeal, cereal and lots of beautiful fresh fruit, prosciutto and salmon. If we can ever head back to Boston and can get a similar deal, we'll definitely come back to the Parker House!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Old Style Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaphneInnes
Reviews.Content: Great location, safe, and central to many area attractions. We walked to TD Garden and dined directly across the street at the highly rated Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. We were immediately upgraded at check in to a deluxe room, no extra charge. The entire staff was friendly, and service orientated. It was 2 days before Christmas during our stay and the lobby was beautifully decorated. The rooms were clean and quiet and outfitted with luxurious bedding. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful 'old world' hotel”
Reviews.Author: natashacampbell77
Reviews.Content: Old, glamourous hotel in excellent location, beautiful big room, with the highest, snuggliest bed! Beatiful lobby, with friendly doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great service but standard rooms.”
Reviews.Author: UnkleMac
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay (4 nights) af Omni Parker House. The location is perfect for exploring the city. Very helpfull staff. The hotel has a nice bar. There wasnt breakfest in the rate, but there are cheap and good options around the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Priced Elegance”
Reviews.Author: karmathecat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and accommodating staff made our stay very enjoyable. Winter bargains rates made it a definite value for what we ( our our company! ) paid. The breakfast buffet included in our rate was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for travelers”
Reviews.Author: jenyzh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with third party and got a great deal on price comparing to other hotels in downtown area. We also joined their select guest program which included free wifi and morning drinks/newspaper. The location for tourists is great! There's everything you need nearby. We haven't had experience with bar/restaurant since there were so many interesting places to try. The rooms are average, be sure to ask for one with a view at least onto the street. Overall, nice hotel, but wouldn't have paid full price.
