Reviews.Title: “Vastly overrated”
Reviews.Author: DWOtruth
Reviews.Content: It is hard to believe that a hotel with double occupancy 125sq foot single double bed rooms could possibly be rated as Four Stars. It questions the validity of the entire star rating system. For the Omni chain, a chain generally associated with upscale accommodations to associate itself with such a hotel is mind boggling. This is a hotel that is clearly stuck in the ninteenth century. Any modern four star hotel evaluation includes the designation "spacious room"; not here. This is really a fraudulent use of the star system and an embarassment to the Omni chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Roadwise_10
Reviews.Content: This historic and beautiful hotel is located on the Freedom Trail in the heart of Boston. From the moment you step through the revolving doors and into the expansive, ornate lobby, you'll know you have chosen the classic hotel experience. The plush colorful carpet, heavy comfortable furniture and and brass elevator doors contribute to the elegance that is the Parker House. We chose a suite with a sofa bed for our son and a very comfortable master bedroom overlooking an historic church. The crisp white linens and heavy upholstery were inviting and the bath was clean and well-appointed. The concierge was most accommodating and the maids were invisible. Just the way a hotel should be staffed. The restaurant was the only disappointment during our stay. Not that it wasn't good, but not on par with the rest of the hotel. Not to worry though, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse is right across the street. And speaking of the street, one of the best things about the Parker House is its proximity to some of Boston's best attractions, including Faneuil Hall, the waterfront, Boston Commons and much more. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Stung with tips”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireLass80
Reviews.Content: Arrived via taxi - staff quickly helped unload our bags and said they would help us. Checked in with a friendly helpful lady to find our bags off the trolley and left behind where we stood with a man waiting for a tip. On picking them up to take to our room another man appeared and loaded them onto a trolley and insisted on taking them to our room. Had tipped the first man assuming he would deliever to our room and then forced to shell out again. Our pocket was much lighter despite having only been there 5 minutes! Room was small but clean. Bathroom, even for a small lady like myself was a tight squeeze and quite claustrophobic. Room was noisy with street works outside. No facilities to make a cup of tea, only coffee machine. In room safe. In room mini-bar available but costly. Free wifi in the lobby was well used although drafty. Excellent well equipt gym. Tried the famous boston cream pie although didnt rate it! Ten minute walk to station so saved on taxi fare when leaving and walked making up for our expensive arrival!

Reviews.Title: “How does Priceline rate a tiny room with a double bed four stars?”
Reviews.Author: artroadshow
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to find out that I had booked a room at the Parker House though Priceline. The Traditional room I was given was tiny with a double bed for two guests. While the room was probably "within the letter of the law" the accomodations were far from four stars. Rating these accomodations four stars is misleading and deceptive. Shame on Priceline and Omni Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Boston Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: markwr99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a fall colors trip that began in Boston. We chose the Omni because of it's dead perfect location for historical sightseeing and its proximity to everything. Our room was very clean and reasonably priced compared to other properties. You definitely pay a bit of a premium for location. Even though the hotel is old, its has held up quite well and the history within and outside the walls added much to our trip. We would recommend anyone to stay there if you want historical Boston within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: thefracks
Reviews.Content: Great central location, Friendly staff, easy check-in&out. Very nice room; a bit small, but expected with the age of the hotel. Lots of history here; more interesting than the newer hotels. Very comfortable bed, but didn't like the pillow. Incredible value compared with other overpriced hotels in the area. Delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kell113
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 7:30 AM in the morning and had booked the Harvey Parker Suite and connecting room for a girls getaway trip. To my complete surprise, the connecting room was available for us to check in to and freshen up. Shortly later, the main part of the suite was available as well. The Parker suite is on the 14th floor with views of Boston Commons and Bunker Hill. With the connecting bedroom, we had 2 bedrooms, 2 1/2 baths..dining table that seated 8, two couches with plenty of space! It was beautiful! The master bedroom had a jacuzzi tub and dressing area. The service at the hotel is the best! EVERYONE was incredibly friendly and helpful! Jackson, the head doorman, was super helpful! The location of the hotel is perfect and it's easy to get around town from here. There is a wine shop not too far from hotel with very reasonable wines to enjoy in your room. We took the Duck tour and loved it! Affordable ($30) way to see all the historical sites! We also did the Haavard Tour ($10 PP)...given by students. It was the best! Highly recommend it! AFter the tour, we went to Mr. Bartley's Burger Cottage in Harvard. WOW! Amazing burgers....! (no beer) Go early for long lines form to get in! We also toured the USS Constitution (free) and that was very interesting. We went to Lucia's for dinner. Reasonable. Walked to Mike's Pastry after that...a must! Please skip the Foundation Room at House of Blues....ZERO service and our biggest mistake. Last night went to Howling At The Moon dueling piano bar,,,,close to hotel. Go early....show starts at 6:00 PM. You want to be there by 4:45 or 5:00 to get a table otherwise HUGE lines! Very fun! Went to Beantown Bar, around the corner from hotel, for drinks and loved the atmosphere. Casual...and looked like they had nice bar food. Enjoyed Boston Cream Pie at the hotel ! The best I have ever had! Don't miss strolling Newbury Street! So beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated, liked it.”
Reviews.Author: Writerwriter
Reviews.Content: This is a historic hotel with a lot of character. It's very well situated in Boston, and we were extremely comfortable here. We learned a little about its history, and enjoyed using it as a base for a couple of days looking around Boston. The rooms were rather small by US standards (but quite reasonable by European standards) but this did not bother us. We had one meal there which was very good. The room was well maintained and everything worked.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect introduction to wonderful Boston!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FPSmiths
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, excellent location, Nice rooms, well worth the money. We really enjoyed our stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: apmcpm
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Omni Parker House. The room was clean and comfortable and I really enjoyed the morning beverage service delivered to your door. The staff was also unfailingly friendly and helpful. Despite was some others say, given the great location in central Boston, this hotel is a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, small rooms but this is a city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: culruaIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located at the start of the Freedom Trail, near restaurants, shops, sights, etc. The lobby and Parkers Bar has a lot of character but are very busy. The bedrooms are small but there are very few (older) hotels with character in city centres throughout the world that differ. The rooms may be small but are tastefully decorated and very well equipped. We had two rooms and both had extremely comfortable beds. The biggest complaint I would have is the size of the wardrobe, barely enough space to hang any clothes. The bar and restaurant were very good, the restaurant a little formal but the two bars very pleasant and comfortable. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and the staff were very pleasant, especially those on the front desk. I have read a number of reviews stating this hotel is expensive I would disagree as there are a number of rate options. I was one of the unfortunate people that booked through 1800 hotels and lost the cost of both rooms, as flights had been booked we decided to still continue with our visit, I rang the hotel explained the situation and they agreed to honour the rate which had been agreed with 1800 hotels. The hotel were under no legal obligation to do this, as we had received an extremely favourable rate and the hotel rates had increased quite substantially during the intervening period. Even though we had paid 1800 hotels and again had to pay the hotel (paid twice for the rooms) it still worked out less expensive than if we had to pay their October rates or those of any other hotel in Boston. Thanks to the Management taking this decision we were able to enjoy our stay in Boston, I know that others caught in the 1800 situation in other locations were not as fortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel, very cramped, not a good value”
Reviews.Author: celicagtlover
Reviews.Content: The lobby is amazing, the location and bed were nice, but beyond that, we wish we would have stayed elsewhere! It was very cramped and we had a view of bricks 10 feet away out our "window." Too expensive for what we got!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationDude
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. The extras they give you as a Select Guest member are incredible. They make travelling on business easy. For example, you get a free bottle of water, free internet access, free pressing of 2 items, free shoe shine, free morning coffee, paper, etc.. Also, they're express check-in is a breeze. No standing in line, just go up and grab your room card. The location of this hotel is ideal. It is a stone's throw to the business district downtown, and within sight of many popular tourist attractions. The staff was very accomodating, and I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The guy working the omelet station went above & beyond to ensure my breakfast was to my liking and that I was able to find everything I needed. The rooms are small but this is Boston, so let's not fault them for that. They're small in NY and Chicago, as well. Toiletries are nice, but they only stock the typical stuff like soap and lotion. If you forget something, like a toothbrush, just ask for it. I only have very small complaints. First, it would be nice if they gave you slippers with the robe. Second, they could have explained how the bed & breakfast package worked. I had to inquire as to where to go for breakfast and what was included. Again, not a big deal, but it should be clearly spelled out for guests when they arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, great decor”
Reviews.Author: wilkinsons95
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous. Full of character. Although the front desk staff were really friendly and polite, the same could not be said of the concierge and the gift shop staff. Breakfast was really good and the staff in the restaurant were great. The room was small but we had read previous reviews and were prepared for this.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped & High Volume”
Reviews.Author: Atul1998
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in Boston, no frills. Incredibly cramped rooms and bathrooms (at least the room i was in) situated in an endless corridor that went on forever - a warren of rooms on every floor...had a separate old school HVAC unit from the 80's (or even 70's) effective but noisy and probably not as efficient... Had a late evening, and back from a chilly evening, craving something hot/warm to eat, called room service to be told that they had no hot/warm items! Went to bed with a can of pringles and a bottle of water...and could'nt wait to check out in the morning. The gym was basic, 2 of 3 treadmills were out of order! The only plus was that the staff is very very courteous. And if you join their loyalty program there are a bunch of little perks including free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, small room”
Reviews.Author: rickoutdoors
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference at the Boston Convention Center. It is not close to the convention hall, but there was shuttle provided for conference attendees. However, for everything else in Boston - the location is terrific- near the Commons, nightlife, and sightseeing. The hotel is dated and old, but it looks like it was renovated fairly recently.

Reviews.Title: “No ghost to be seen”
Reviews.Author: kiwigal
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a week. Everyone was talking about how small the room were and i had read this in many reviews. I was VERY surprised to find our room was HUGE I literally danced around it ballerina style to show off how big it was. The bathroom was small but functional which was all we needed. The room was very dark but didn't bother us as were were not in there much but sometimes it was hard to know if it was daylight or night time. We tried the Boston cream pie (I think that was what it was called) the one made famous by the Omni Parker hotel and it wasn't to bad. Room service was great and fast. One night we ordered cheese/fruit platter along with some buffalo wings and the meals were huge. we could not finish them all. Hotel is very close to quincy market and Boston common all the great historic sites are there to see. Boston Opera house is close by to see shows which we saw wicked. Only complaint is that we did not have a lap top with us so had to rely in the business centres computers which cost to use it was about $15.95 for 15 mins which is total rip off. The staff in the coffee shop/gift shop were also very unhelp and rude at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ColCat86
Reviews.Content: I would recommend for the great location and it really is a nice historic hotel. However, we had a Deluxe with double beds and it was so small there was really no room to walk around. Room should have had only had 1 double or 1 queen bed. Beds are comfortable though. I would have given the value as poor, but I think you are going to pay a high freight most places in Boston. Plus $42/night in parking. I would recommend for location. It is right on the Freedom Trail and centrally located to all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for location but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: lovingmyholidays
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm.... on the plus side I got a great rate on the day for $169. The location is brilliant (right by the common) and very good for transport. It is an historic building with characterful lobby. But is age counts against it. Miles of dark corridors painted in a depressing cream First room I was shown to was minute (and looking at the chart on the door, this was standard for most of the hotel). A queen sized bed with just ennough room to squeeze past the end of it. TV and desk and just room for an armchair shoved against wall. Tiny bathromm with small tub- marble but dated and a bit mouldy looking. I complained as there was a connecting door and was given a room in another (older?) part of the hotel. Much more acceptable in terms of size and very high ceiling - really quite elegant. But bathroom was miniscule - just a tiled shower - very 80's and it only dribbled really. Wash basin was tucked in alcove so small you couldnt dry your hair without elbows hitting the sides. Other plus is very comfortable but not king sized bed. Sleep spoilt by rubbish collection in alley at 3am... Stayed at Nine Zero a few years ago and it was far nicer though rooms not much bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself the expensive ticket to London”
Reviews.Author: solanaceae
Reviews.Content: For those looking to extend the London simulation that is Boston to extra lengths, the Omni Parker makes a perfect home. Old, dank, smoky, and moldy - just like your favourite West End hotel. Plus, depending on the night, you may be able to spend the usual 200 GPB for the honor of staying. I am not kidding - even the front desk agent who checked us in was from the UK. The best part comes when you try to open the window a crack in the room to let some air circulate to no avail. After consulting with the management, we were curtly told this was a "city law". After checking in across the street at the wonderful Ames Hotel for the same price, I was able to finally open the window. Somebody call the cops - the Ames is in violation of "city law". For those not anglophiles, stay at the Ames, next door at the wonderful 9-0, or in Copley/Back Bay at the myriad of business chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, nice atmosphere and good service!”
Reviews.Author: highlife-aficionado
Reviews.Content: Everything a reputable hotel should be. We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. All positive elements of a historic hotel with all the modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, centrally located hotel but thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: ATLATTY
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Boston for work. I enjoyed staying at this historic hotel - it reminded me of the Drake in Chicago and the Peabody in Memphis. Great location in central Boston. The front desk folks were nice. The bar and breakfast areas were cozy, elegant and great wait staff. Room service breakfast was generous but 10 minutes late. The rooms - especially the bathroom - were very small. That is to be expected in a big city. While I was traveling solo and had enough space, I think it would have been too cozy with even 2 people. Don't even think about families unless you upgrade to a suite or something. Wonderful linens on the bed. Really, the only complaint I have about the hotel itself were the thin walls. It was SO LOUD! I could totally hear the "action" going on next door at 1:30 a.m, including the preceeding conversation. :O I recommend this hotel, but bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and its pretty!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustvtg
Reviews.Content: I tagged along on my husbands work trip and had no idea where we were staying before we got there. I was pleasantly surprised by the Omni. The building is beautiful, the staff was helpful and the room was nice. Yes it was small, but it's an old building and coming from a small apt. in New York I'm used to small spaces. The location can't be beat. We were within walking distance from everything. We were told we had to have the Boston cream pie at the restaurant and it was amazing. On the flip side there is only internet in the lobby and I feel like in this day and age a hotel of this kind should offer free internet in the rooms. My husband was able to sit by the window and pick up the free internet from across the street. Also our room faced the office building beside the Omni. It was very close and we could easily see the people there and they could probably see us. So we had to keep the curtains closed the whole time. That is pretty much the only reason I cant give them 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Durggy
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to this hotel because of our prior excellent experiences at other Omni hotels in the USA. However we were greatly disappointed with both the service and facilities. The hotel bedroom was tiny to say the least and it had a view of a brick wall, when the suitcase was put down on the floor it blocked all access to the rest of the room! Breakfast service in the restaurant was inattentive and the hot buffet was cold! Altogether a mediocre experience! We felt this hotel was trading on its historical legacy. The high price this hotel charged bought us a far superior experience in a nearby modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: stravels181983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House this past weekend. What a great location. We were able to walk to a show on Saturday. The front desk staff were very kind and helpful in pointing us in the right direction for dinner. We enjoyed a beverage at Last Hurrah which had a great atmosphere; we wish there was a small menu served late night. Overall our stay was wonderful and I would recommend this place to any of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with loads of character”
Reviews.Author: Gail35
Reviews.Content: This was the best place to stay in Boston. The location is unbeatable. Right across the street from Boston Common and on the Freedom Trail. There is so much history in this hotel. We enjoyed the award winning clam chowder, the historic Parker rolls, and the ever popular Boston Cream Pie. All were phenomenal. Our room was spacious and the queen bed was very comfortable. The hospitality desk was extremely helpful, arranging tickets on the trolley which turned out to be a better experience than the Duck Tours because you get a two day pass to get on and off the trolley any time you want plus a harbor cruise. We enjoyed it all. They also recommended the long-running play Shear Madness. That was a hoot! The managers roaming the lobby were what we appreciated the most. They were always available and full of helpful tips. So glad we stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and history”
Reviews.Author: CantStayHome10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parker House for our first time weekend to Boston. The location was great and allowed us to walk to all of the sight-seeing tourist attractions. Per other's reviews, the room was small (built in 1855), but I knew that when I made my reservation since I read the hotel's room description when I was purchased it on the internet. The hotel has great history and a lot of character. It was very clean and convenient. I would definitely stay here again. I also recommend the Old Town Trolly Tour.

Reviews.Title: “American elegance”
Reviews.Author: BHMom_10
Reviews.Content: My 17 year-old daughter and I loved this hotel! The lobby and public rooms have early 20th century elegance - lots of wood paneling and warmth. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable and spotless. Best of all was the Parker House food. The best clam chowder you will ever eat. Even breakfast was incredible. Especially if you are visiting from another country, you should stay here to see the historic sites and enjoy the best of New England dining.

Reviews.Title: “Location trumps closet-sized room”
Reviews.Author: Kitsilano
Reviews.Content: Liked: Location, bed comfort, window that opens for fresh air. Disliked: Awkward furniture placement in minuscule room; dim lighting - no where and no way to read.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service outweighs small room size”
Reviews.Author: jayne0206
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 9 year old daughter for two nights in July. We are frequent visitors to Boston and have stayed at many different hotels throughout the city. The location of the Parker House is second to none. It is a SHORT walking distance to so many great venues - Quincy Market, the North End, the Commons and Newbury Street shopping, plus Downtown Crossing and many key Freedom Trail sites, plus the T. Beyond the location, the hotel is very child-friendly, with a welcoming kit for kids with goodies and trinkets, plus milk and cookies delivered to your room! The concierge desk was helpful and knowledgeable as would be expected in a hotel of this caliber, and the business center offered internet access and online flight check-in. In short, everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The rooms are small and the walls thin, but it is a historic hotel in a historic city after all - besides, they are well-appointed. And, we found a great deal on the nights we stayed - under $150. Highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay and easy access to almost anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: JeMiKaSe
Reviews.Content: Location..location...location. The Parker House is a beautiful hotel in the heart of historic Boston. The Freedom Trail goes right past the front door. Boston Commons is a very short walk away. Hotel parking is very expensive but if you are visiting during the weekend, consider the nearby Commons Garage where you can park overnight on weekends for $11 per night. The Omni rewards program offers free internet and morning beverages, so sign up before you go to get the benefits of this great reward program. Be sure to visit nearby Faneuil Hall and enjoy the many street performers that frequent the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-VERY Pretentious!”
Reviews.Author: dbondo1206
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful but the rooms were VERY small. No room between furniture, tiny rooms. The staff was pretentious. Parking was comparable to other 4-star hotels in the downtown area. We stayed here and at the Hyatt during our visit, DEFINITELY recommend the Hyatt over the Omni. They cater to a high clientel. Weren't exactly friendly...we felt out of place as tourists.

Reviews.Title: “great history and location”
Reviews.Author: mollyd202
Reviews.Content: nice hotel and reasonablly priced. located close to main subway that will take you anywhere in Boston. Bagel shop close by for morning breakfast.very comfortable beds, just small bathroom. Boston creme pie originated here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: cdpils
Reviews.Content: Whilst the room was a bit small, the location is perfect for visiting Boston, since the Freedom trail runs along the pavement directly in front of the hotel. The bed itself was large and very comfortable. Furthermore the staff was really friendly and helpful. If you go there, join the (free) VIP membership, since you will receive some free stuff (e.g. morning drinks in the room) with that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a first visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: paulhuntterry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni Parker House from September 6th-10th 2010, and used it as a base to explore Boston. The hotel is right in the middle of all the tourist attractions, with Boston Common 100 yards away and Faneuil Hall a 5 minute walk. The Beantown Trolley stops at the Hotel for city tours. Our room was a Deluxe with two beds and was a good size, but the room our friends had was three foot narrower and cramped despite being the same type. I felt the rooms were clean and well maintained, and the size was understandable given the age of the hotel. Both rooms were on the 14th floor, and were quiet. We all ate in the Parkers restaurant one evening and found the food to be good, with a two course meal and drinks costing $50 per person. Parkers shares dÃ©cor with the rest of the hotel lobby area, lots of brass and dark wood panelling. You don't stay at the Omni Parker House for big rooms or lots of hotels facilities, but what it has is history, with a long list of famous guests. Remember this and you won't be disappointed with your stay. I would also recommend joining the Omni Select Guest Program, it's free to join and you get free internet access and free drinks delivered to your room every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: roiseal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in September and would highly recommend this hotel. Stylish, comfortable, clean and friendly, plus only one block from Boston Common. We were celebrating my wife's birthday and the hotel left a free bottle of champagne served with strawberries dipped in chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vlohokie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel last week and had a wonderful experience. It was my first trip to Boston and was looking for a hotel that was close to the historic sights and restaurants. I read some earlier reviews on Trip Advisor and was concerned about the room size but I was pleasantly surprised. While we had a corner room it was not upgraded or any type of deluxe accomodations but was more than adequate as we really did not spend that much time in the room anyhow. The bathroom was very small but served it's purpose. For a big city hotel the room size was sufficient and much larger than many New York City hotels I have stayed at. The staff at the Omni Parker House was wonderful - very friendly and helpful with dinner recommendations and for assistance in Subway (T) stops and directions. There are three T stops very close by. I chose this hotel in part because it was on the Freedom Trail and it's location is one of the best in Boston. It is close to Boston Common but also a short walk to Quincy Market and all the shops there. We also walked to and from a dinner in the North End Italian Restaurant. It is easy to learn your way around the city and very convenient to be so near everything. The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous and while we did not eat any Boston Cream Pie in Parker's Restaurant we did stop in Parker's Bar for an after dinner drink and it had a very nice atmosphere and attentive wait staff. We only stayed there two nights as we moved out to Brookline partly because of price but mainly to be closer to Boston College as we were attending the BC-Virginia Tech Football game but wish we had just stayed at the Parker House. Price is high but not nearly as high as some other hotels I looked at. Had a great fitness center that I never did see being used and we were too busy to get there but looked very well equipped especially for an older hotel. Enjoyed our stay at Omni Parker House and would defintely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: lbznyc603
Reviews.Content: Such a great location and beautiful hotel. Stayed in one of the premier suites and enjoyed it very much. Only set back was the bathroom was fairly small and you had to go through the bedroom to get to it. Wished it was off the living room so it was more conveinent for guests sleeping on the pull-out sofa. Must try the boston cream pie which was first made at this hotel back in the day - was so delicious. Such easy walking from this hotel to all touristy spots. Would recommend it for the location alone and for the great staff. Definitely worth the few extra dollars you were hoping to not spend. Spendi t!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: SASNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker house for two nights while on a business trip. The hotel is in a great neighborhood and close to many of Boston's attractions. I booked an "executive room," and it was large, much larger than the standard rooms, from what i understand. Maybe not the most modern or luxuriously furnished, but it is an old hotel, after all. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was small, but again, this is to be expected in such an old hotel. I liked the fact that if you join their loyalty program, they waive the internet charge and bring a free breakfast beverage of your choice to your room each morning. The lobby is lovely, and a real piece of history. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was good. The standout for me in this hotel was the service. From check-in to check-out and everything in between, the staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: First, I will state that I normally stay at Marriott & Hilton properties while travelling for leaisure and business so I have a nice status with those chains. I wanted to try out the Omni chain while in Boston plus the rate was reasonable for the weekend. The hotel is in a great location. Close to the Boston Common and T lines. You can easily walk the Freedom Trail from here or walk over to the North End for some dinner & pastries! Some issues witht he hotel: It is an older property that they have done a decent job keeping up over the years. Rooms are very small. There is a smell in the lobby that tells me they are trying to cover up the aging building. We stayed on the fifth floor and you can hear everything. Elevators are very loud and people come in at all hours of the night from partying. If you want good sleep then don't stay here. Front desk was friendly but they tried to charge me for internet connection which is free by joining their loyalty program. I gave the Omni chain a chance and they failed. I will be staying back at a Marriott or Hilton property going forward!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice place”
Reviews.Author: SherryL48
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, historic hotel. Very interesting if you're a history buff. My room was lovely although a bit cramped. If I'd had to spend alot of time in the room or there had been several people this could be a bit difficult. I was attending a conference and breakfast & lunch were included and catered by the hotel. The food was excellent. The coffee was EXCELLENT (nothing worse than being stuck somewhere with bad coffee!). They've done a good job of being up to date considering how old this hotel is. The location is perfect - within walking distance of all the historic sites, the harbor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ozne1990
Reviews.Content: The public areas of this hotel are a beautiful piece of Old Boston history, service is mainly great, the bar lovely, and if what you want is not nearby, the MBTA's Red, Green, Orange and Blue lines all have entrances nearby, which makes this location perfect. The room had robes, hairdriers, coffeemaking equipment, a comfortable bed, nice towels, fridge, safe, ironing board, etc., etc., and we would stay again... However, the room was very small. We had things to do and weren't in it that much, but that could be a problem for some. Also, (and for us this WAS a problem) no wifi in the rooms (in the lobby, yes). There was a cable in the room, but when we had a problem connecting on the second day, the concierge desk connected us to their remote internet help desk -- and that person was not familiar with the set-up in the hotel. As a couple with 2 careers/laptops, we would have liked to connect at the same time, and that was impossible. Overall, we still liked it.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is showing its considerable...”
Reviews.Author: YankeeEagle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is showing its considerable age. The lobby is gloomy. Considering the price of the rooms, guests should expect the place to sparkle, but it doesn't. "High speed Internet" in our room meant wired Internet; you're out of luck if you have an iPad without 3G service. Room service was excellent. The people were fine--the building needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsteel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel for 6 nights. We had passed through Boston on a few occasions a number of years ago and had always talked about actually staying for a few days and exploring the city. Before arriving, I was a little concerned reading previous reviewsabout the hotel, especially regarding the size of the bedrooms as we had booked just a double room. However, the room was more than adequate. Yes, the bed is high and I am not a tall person so had to "climb" onto it at night. From our window we also looked into another room and so had to keep the blind down so as not to embarrass either ourselves or the people in the room opposite. However, everything else was first class. The room was cleaned every day and towels replaced when requested. I had joined the loyalty programme before arriving at the hotel mainly so that I could have the complimentary internet access from my room. I was a little concerned that I was asked each time when logging on to agree to a payment of $9.95 per day so I checked this out with the Receptionist. She was very obliging and checked my account and told me that although I was listed as being a member of the loyalty scheme because I had booked through a third party this had not been recognised. She immediately changed the record in my account and charges already incurred were waved. It was a very hot and humid week when we were there and coming into the lobby of the Omni Parker House Hotel was like walking into an oasis sometimes! Yes, it is a very busy hotel but the staff always have time to be polite and everyone is treated exactly the same - whether in the business suit with briefcase or shorts, t-shirt and flip flops!!! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough - we had a wonderful time in Boston - it lived up to everything we hoped for. The situation of the hotel is ideal for exploring the city and I would advise anyone who is going to be staying for a few days to purchase a "Charlie" ticked for the subway. Excellent value for money and makes it so easy to move around the city. Thank you once again to all the staff for making our stay in Boston so pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “History lives at the Omni Parker!”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be the oldest, continually operated hotel in the country. As such, rooms are tiny! The hotel recognized that I would be staying for a week, so they offered me a larger room. I never saw the smaller one, so I'll take their word that I got a larger one. The room was still small! However, given that, it was very nice. All the amenities are packaged and tucked away in accessible but out of the way locations. Minibar, flat-screen TV, bowed-out shower curtain, lots of pillows all made the stay nice. Internet access is free if you join their loyalty program - which is also free. Otherwise, it costs. The loyalty program also provides free morning beverage - I chose to receive both a cup of hot tea & a glass of orange juice every morning - that was nice. Finally, you get the newspaper. I would recommend joining the loyalty program online prior to arrival. Food was very good. I attended several conference events where breakfast and lunch was served and everything was great. The bar is nice too. The hotel lobby seemed forever crowded with people coming and going or taking advantage of the free internet service. Service was excellent across the board - from the front desk (which I had to visit repeatedly when my room key would inexplicably stop working), to maintenance (who I had to call to get a cot when I had a guest one night), to the catering and waitstaff. As long as you keep in mind that the rooms will be small and adjust your expectations accordingly, I think anyone would enjoy this ornate, old-world hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Max155019
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. As is typical for older hotels, the rooms are fairly small and some do not have very good views, ie looking out onto another room. However, the location is great and within a 10 or 15 minute walk of everything, right on the subway line, etc. The service was excellent and staff very friendly and helpful, would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful historic hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Annie24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for sightseeing. It is right in the middle of things, walking distance to Quincy Market, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill and more. The hotel is beautiful and rich in decor and architecture. Being an older hotel, the rooms are quite small, really. But the linens and quality of the bed make up for the tight space. Don't expect a luxurious bathroom either... it is smaller than most powder rooms ! Overall, a beautiful place to stay, with extremely nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Service & Staff in Boston...another OMNI Grand Slam”
Reviews.Author: unclestones
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews and complaints about this hotel, I was so glad we made the Omni Parker House our choice. I have so many great things to say about this place: 1.) Got E-Mail from Katie to make certain we were on our way 2.) Rooms were upgraded without any request...along with anniversary gift. Hotel lobby was fantastic 3.) Doorman and bellmen were very polite, fun and very helpful 4.) Sister in law fell on Freedom Trail and hotel provided wheel chair for weekend...Staff assisted without hesitation 5.) Last Hurah was a great spot for food, drinks and people watching. 6.) Hotel on Freedom Trail 7.) Rooms real nice...great beds Overall, we could have not had a better time with the exception of Hurricane Earl

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: Jessep666
Reviews.Content: We pulled up in a cab at the hotel and was gestured by a doorman to use the front entrance - with swift gestures and shouting "no!no!" Which was a wonderful greeting. We entered the lobby which felt slightly reminiscent of a hunting lodge and waited to check in. Check In staff very helpful and accomodating, we were back to being a bit more impressed. Room however small, pokey,and beds unusually high. Me being only around 5ft found myself having to clamber on. For a twin room there is little room for moving around / packing/repacking- and with such high beds for a heavy suitcase I found it difficult to maneouvre. The shower dial in the bath was back to front - after 20 mins of turning to hot and not getting hot water i turned to cold and miraculously hot water appeared - a silly and frustrating inconvienience. Window looked out onto someone's office in a close proximity which made me feel a little uncomfortable having only discovered this AFTER a bath and wondering round in a towel simultaneously watching someone make a call from their desk. Bath uncomfortable and small. To top it off My friend was sure he'd lost his bank card in the hotel room , and had left it on the nightstand. We called and were told it was not there. Fair enough, we may be wrong. We asked if someone could just check behind the night stand for us just to be on the safe side and eliminate this as an option. They promised to do so and we arranged for a call back the following day which we did not receive - I might add we were still in the U.S.A so it was not a case of not being able to make long distance calls. Despite giving our new hotel and room number and cell phone number nobody bothered. Although I accept fully that the lost bank card was not their fault/ problem when a call back is agreed at a time by themselves, you'd expect them to honour it. We weren't bowled over by the hotel for the points above. I wouldn't stay again, and won't be recommending to my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: stansrb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House simply because we like the Omni line of hotels. It turns out that the location is excellent for visiting all of the different areas of Boston and is convenient to a few different T stops. Even though it is not as "up to date aka brand new" as some of the newer versions, this hotel was still excellent. We had a Deluxe King Room which was plenty big enough for two travelers. The beds were comfortable and gave a good nights sleep after walking the town. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about the city and always had a cheerful attitude. The only negatives I have about this hotel are that the elevators are noisy and lack of in room wifi. Our room was across a hall behind the elevators and we could hear the constant turning and squeaking of cables. It was not enough to wake us up but it was noticeable if you were lying down trying to rest or relax . As to the wifi, if you are a member of their rewards program you can use their in room internet for free. These negative would not keep me from staying again however!

Reviews.Title: “They could not have made my 5-night stay more difficult. I can't believe this is a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tsphilli
Reviews.Content: Where do I start... -upon arrival, Internet network cable was not in room. I called down for one and it was delivered 10 minutes later by a man that did not say a word to me but gave me quite a creepy smile. Turns out it was the wrong cord, I then had to request for someone to bring yet another cord. -no wireless in the room -a piece of plastic came shooting out of the hair dryer the first time I turned it on and burnt my finger to the extent that it blistered; I asked for a new hair dryer TWICE and never had one brought to my room. -baseboards are coming away from the wall. -There is literally ZERO counter space in the bathroom. I seriously had to put my toiletry bags on the floor in the bathroom. A simple table would make a world of difference. -"Traditional room" is a Full-size bed. This is not even a Queen. Read the fine-print, I certainly did not expect this. -room is about 300 square feet. Felt like I was in New York. And I was staying in the ADA accessible room which is apparently larger than the regular traditional rooms. -I requested an upgrade and they understandably did not have one. They refused to put me on an upgrade list and instead told me to check at the front desk every morning to see if one came available. -Snooty concierge; this one loses BIG points for me as I rely on concierges and tip well. When I asked for a nearby florist where I could pick up a $15 bouquet, he scoffed and told me most places have minimums that are larger than that. Give me a break. -Again, when I asked the concierge for a healthy dinner recommendation in the neighborhood from the concierge, I was handed a pre-printed handout of nearby restaurants. -walls are paper thin, I could hear conversations in the hallway and someone working on the plumbing in the service room outside my room at 11pm. -Doormen were consistently busy and I had to hail my own taxis -Airline boarding pass printing interface was not functional; I reported the error to the front desk and the manager graciously called back and had it printed for me. - After about the 5th disappointment in my stay, I called the front desk and made a formal complaint; there was no follow-up from a manager or any offer to improve my experience -Parker's Bar staff were inattentive to coffee refills during Breakfast hour; I had to flag down a different server to get a refill. PROS -I was able to snag an umbrella from the concierge for the duration of my stay -breakfast buffet has great food and friendly chef -Bar staff was friendly and crab cakes were delicious. -maids do a nice job of tidying up the space. -there is a great full-length mirror. Overall, I would NEVER recommend this to any friends or colleagues. It seemed they were intentionally making my life more difficult and not very service-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “will most definately be back”
Reviews.Author: lockwoodini
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review as reading the previous reviews played a massive part in deciding upon hotels. This was our first time staying in Boston and the hotel is in an excellent central location and we had no problem finding our way around. The hotel is very clean and well maintained and the staff were extremely friendly and always on hand to help. We have subsequently recommended this hotel to many friends visiting Boston and will be staying here again next year on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Classic but Cramped”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Audrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights related to the RIMS conference in Boston. Location was good and had what you would expect from a historic hotel, quality of furnishings, TV and bedding you would expect from an Omni. My main complaint was that room was very small and bath was tiny. This was fine for one business traveler gone most of the day but would have been crowded with two people for a weekend. Service was good and room service ordered came in a timely manner and was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Biscuit2
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived at the Omni Parker Hotel, things were great! We were greeted by friendly staff willing to help us with any question we had. The location of the hotel is perfect to see much of historic Boston. Many great places to eat nearby and the subway station is just a block away, which allowed us to take the subway over to Fenway Park very easily. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is quaint, but rooms are poor”
Reviews.Author: CruelFox
Reviews.Content: I was put up in this hotel by my company, and so had no choice in the booking. But I've advised them not to use the hotel in future. I requested to be moved to another Boston hotel for a return trip a month later. The reception is quaint, and the bar/restaurant is nice. But the room I stayed in was tiny and badly kept. Not good for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Room Not Clean”
Reviews.Author: ramblin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights room number 1114 August 3 - 8, 2010. The bathroom was not very clean when we arrived; there was mold and mildew on the shower tiles, which only got much worse daily. The tub was not cleaned in 5 days. We used the coffee pack in the coffee maker the first afternoon and did not receive any more coffee. The first night there was ice in the ice bucket. Every night thereafter we had to get our own ice at the vending machine. The next to last day, our bath rug was simply missing and I finally went down to the main desk to speak with the manager. I brought the housekeeping inconsistencies to his attention and received a phone call in the room from the assistant Housekeeping Manager. She sent up half a dozen coffee packs, a couple bottles of water, maybe 10 pads of paper and a bathroom rug. What did we need with the coffee, paper and water the night before we left? The very worst was unnoticed until I turned the bed back myself the last night... there was a HUGE YELLOW STAIN on the reverse side of the duvet cover. That was it for my Omni Parker House experience. So much for their promise of excellence. Simply disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, and upgraded for free”
Reviews.Author: jgrieco111
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a weekend getaway, booked a suite directly on the hotel's website and when arrived was informed we had been upgraded to the presidential suite! Front desk and hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Room service slightly overpriced but food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, super staff ... super time!!”
Reviews.Author: Halibut51
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and had a great time - loads of space in our room and the location is ideal for walking around Boston. We attended Seamus's Saturday talk (free) and got to tour bits of the hotel that you otherwise may not see, including the ballroom, rooftop, the kitchen where the rolls are made, the offices with so many photos of famous people - it was almost too much to take in. Seamus was extremely informative and entertaining - well done!! We enjoyed the Boston Cream pie very much! All staff were extremely helpful and I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overhyped”
Reviews.Author: jpwuk
Reviews.Content: Very discourteous staff and tiny rooms barely big enough for 1 never mind 4.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NJ_TravelBird
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in July on our drive back to NJ from Maine. Location of hotel is great, about 2 blocks from Boston Commens and the Freedom Trail goes right past the hotel! Lobby is beautiful, with ornate chandilers and carved wood beams. Bellmen and valet parking attendents were very helpful and friendly, and were hailed a taxi right away when we needed it. The room was very small (but it's a city), but clean and the bed was like a cloud. We were on an end wall, and the plaster was flaking off and bubbling on the wall. The small room and plaster was my only complaint really. We weren't in the room much, meeting friends when we arrived, and walking the freedom trail the next day. We chose this hotel b/c of the lower AAA rate they offered. All other hotels in the area were almost $100 more per night. For price and location, this hotel is perfect! Parking is an issue in all of Boston, so we were happy with the hotel valet service. This cost $42 per day, and an additional $12 if you keep your car there after 1pm the day you check out. This was worth it for us, since we walked everywhere, and didn't have to worry about our car the whole time. The parking cost is the same for other hotels that offer valet service, and you're going to pay about the same if you self park. We were very happy with our hotel choice and the location was perfect for walking the freedom trail. We also reccommend this-you will see most of Boston in an afternoon, and all the historic Revolution sights as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: drumsix
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my grown daughters. No complaints. Booked by hotels.com no problems.Would stay there again . Great Location with alot of charm!

Reviews.Title: “Not just a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sfgreg69
Reviews.Content: First the basics: The room was large and very quiet. The beds were luxuriously comfortable. The climate control was perfect - very important for Boston. We had a great stay. The concierge was always right on the mark with our questions. The bell staff was friendly, helpful and always available. The desk was helpful and knowledgable. The lobby and restaurants had great atmosphere and kept the spirit of an historic place. The location is perfect. Subway stops a block or two away. Top restaurants a short walk away. Boston Commons and a few interesting cemeteries are practically next door. The bathrooms were not enlarged with the renovation which is unfortunate. One adjusts. The workout room is quite adequate and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS! $68.00 Family Breakfast, $42 parking”
Reviews.Author: GardenerGeek
Reviews.Content: This flea-bag is way overrated. It is in a good location, but the rooms are very small and most of them have a single double-bed. Our first room was so small that a crib would not fit next to the double bed. We had to ask for two cribs to get mattresses for our children and it took from 10:00 until midnight to get them. There are better views from most prison cells. The rooms have loud window air conditioners, so you better have ear plugs. Worst of all, I had a serious bug bite two nights in a row and my daughter had a bad bite also.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Crashed427
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married in Boston a few weeks ago! It was fantastic! We probably would've had a great time no matter what,but the Omni really went out of their way to make it special for us. It was just the two of us, no big ceremony or reception. They were so friendly and nice. When they found out we were getting married, they were so excited for us. We came back to our room that night and found that they had decorated our bed with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. They gave us a late check out even though they were booked the next day and needed the room . Overall,one of the best hotel experiences Ive ever had! Also,it's close to everything and we walked everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WldHrt60
Reviews.Content: Nice to stay in well kept historic hotel in the heart of Boston. Lobby is beautiful and staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great beds, great staff ; a classy old hotel with charm”
Reviews.Author: TiffinTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Parker House and really enjoyed the hotel. Teh staff could not have been more helpful from the curbside staff, managers monitoring the comings and goings of the guests, housekeeping etc. The location was superb. We used the metro lines and the hotel was close to stations, along with being close to many places that we walked to. Highly recommended. Thanks for a memorable stay at a very classy and historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in the oldest hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: EssexAviator
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the oldest hotel in America. The room was very well apportioned and equipped - with real coffee making machine. The hotel was well located for walking to various tourist areas and the sevice from everyone we met was excellent. The room rate was good value. The restaurant was superb. If we return to Boston as we may - will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MiMIFlorida
Reviews.Content: was very impressed with the staff, room is small and bathroom is really small but I love the cozziness of the room. The main thing that impressed me was the aircondition stayed on all night did not turn on and off that drives me crazy; and it stayed cool not like the other hotels I have stayed at. Slept very well the bed was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I did not just like the Omni Parker House Boston I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FroggySmith
Reviews.Content: This is an old fashioned hotel by W standards. The rooms are not large, but well appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable. I asked for a "quiet" room and was given 1064, which was far from elevator lobby and faced an alley. Since I always want quiet over view, the room was perfect. Ate dinner and breakfast in the Parker Restaurant and both were excellent and price points very good for hotel. One outstanding feature is the staff. They could not be more helpful. If someone does not like old standards playing in the lobby and restaurant, this is not the place for them. By old, I mean 30-50's standard ballads. Location was great. Within a block of Beacon Street which borders Boston Common and three blocks from T station with red, green and orange lines. Hotel guests were a mixed bag of foreign visitors and fairly well heeled US guests. No one during my stay was in the lobby screaming into their cell phones. Wifi is free in hotel lobby, which is where I am sitting now. All in all, a great place to stay, at a price that can't be beat. Paid $261 a night, which included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60763Nick
Reviews.Content: I was here on my business.I liked this hotel,great hotel.Stuff is very friendly and polite and helpful. When I applied to a housekeeper with my request, everything was done immediately. I even remember this girl Anna K (as far as I remember from Russia). And if the stuff is so polite and helpful as this girl,well,the hotel shiuld be proud of its stuff. Rooms are convinient and beautiful,everything is great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: GenieMM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Omni Parker House in advance for our honeymoon. I guess we booked early enough in advance to get a room with a fantastic view! We could see the skyline of Boston from our 8th floor window. We didn't use all the amenities of the hotel, just the room and concierge service, both of which were excellent. Many people complained about the size of the room, but our King bed room was big enough for us. It wasn't a suite, but it was comfortable and nice. All the workers were helpful, well informed, and nice. The hotel is PERFECTLY located on the Freedom Trail and near two convenient Metro stops. If you don't feel like driving in Boston (I'm so glad we didn't!), this hotel is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room in a classic comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotelBlogs
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a few days on a business trip. Unfortunately, I messed up on my stay duration at the hotel I booked originally and the hotel found me a room 2 hours before check in at the Omni Parker House Hotel. There was literally one room left at 240$. The receptionist processed my check in very quickly and warned me that the room I was allocated was a little small. I am glad I was warned but I didn't have much choice anyway. Because of the basketball playoffs, the hotel market place around the stadium was fully booked. This room was really tiny. You couldn't basically walk around the bed. The bed was actually a little larger than a single bed. The shower room was of decent room. Anyway this was for one night only. There wasn't any WIFI available in the room (paid or free). Because of the jetlag, I ended up to be in the lobby at 530am to catch up on work but again the free WIFI working close by the reception. Try connecting further and you would be out of luck to get a connection with the WIFI. The breakfast was a good quality at around 25$ with a great buffet. I believe the room I was given can't make my opinion on this hotel objectively. At the same time, I can't help thinking that in a 4* hotel, you shouldn't really sell these rooms, especially at 240$ (even on a busy period). Maybe these rooms should be reserved exclusively for air crew staff. In the morning, a pilot walked in my room as he was given this room by the receptionist. So the reception messed with my late booking the night before and the early arrival of that guest.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but could be better”
Reviews.Author: eaglebac
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful lobby and is located in a perfect area of Boston - between the Financial District / Faneuil hall and Boston Common. The arrival was less than grand, with an understaffed door/valet staff. There are only two heavy doors and a small staircase immediately upon entry - certainly not easy with luggage in hand and no assistance from a bellman. The rooms are small but comfortable enough. Fitness center in the basement is well-equipped and the hotel restaurant/bar are popular. Anyone looking for a nice view will be terribly disappointed - you will get either the inside of the building or the next building across the street. Valet parking is overpriced ($42), considering how long they make you wait for your car and the attendants weren't knowledgeable with directions. Overall, not a bad choice if you get a good deal and want a convenient location, but there are many nicer options in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Old Hotel GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: RHSBMF
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while business traveling with wife. The hotel location is great across the street from the Granary Burying Grounds. Hotel staff were nice hotel was decorated very nicely. Be prepared though rooms are small much like most of Omni historic hotels. Great overall stay, plenty to do in the area. A must stay hotel if you like historic properties.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the FINEST hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: palosverdesgirl
Reviews.Content: This place has it all. If you are looking for a great location,an elegant,beautiful and charming historic property, then the Onmi is right for you Our room was large, nicely appointed and very comfortable. The hotel dining room is beautiful and the food is wonderful. The staff is great, very warm, welcoming and helpful. Boston is a fascinating city full of cultural and historical attractions. For a memorable stay in a fascinating city stay at the Omni

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel located at the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: gueoriva
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker is one of the oldest hotels in Boston. It is a historical monument and you need to at least go in and see the lobby. If you want to book it, look for the suites which are very spacious and the beds are great. The hotel is very centrally located - from here you can walk very easy along the freedom trail or if you want you can do some shopping, as most shopping areas are in walking distance. There are very good restaunts in the area and also the Faneuil Hall Marketplace is also in a walking distance (7-10min)

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnneG
Reviews.Content: My 15-year-old son and I stayed at the Omni Parker House for 3 nights in early April. The staff were very accommodating and the hotel location couln't be better. As it was Easter Sunday and we weren't interested in the hotel's brunch, our concierge directed us to a marvelous restaurant for our Easter meal. Previous literature commented on the rooms at the Parker House being small, however I found them to be average in size and perfect for us. The overall room accomodations and hotel location were excellent! I'd stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Old world glamour”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 4 nights recently. The hotel itself is very beautiful, keeping lots of ornate details and old fashioned decor. The amenities are modern enough. Flatscreen televisons, coffee machines and mini bar - however they should include some room in the overstocked mini bars for your personal items. There were no inroom safes, which is disappointing. The bathrooms need an update in my opinion. The decor of the room is very rich and glamorous, but the bathrooms are not inline with that and are just one thing - old. There was a robe available which was good. The staff are helpful and attentive, however there was issues with getting my room serviced at my selected time. I had to make too many phone calls and they would never give me a reassurance that it would be done, even though I gave them huge windows of time. The room are small, but it's an old hotel and spacious enough to be comfortable. The only main complaint was that they shut off the service lift after midnight to take you down to the gym. The doors to access it were also locked. I complained but was told that the lift wasn't in operation. After reminding them it was a 24 hour gym, an employee took me out some back way and through a kitchen. Inconvenient, but helpful in the end. Good range of equipment and very clean. I found the breakfast options disappointing, however this is the case with most American hotels that I stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service”
Reviews.Author: sb_osobailiando
Reviews.Content: The Parker House has the perfect location for touring Boston. It is directly across the street from the red Freedom Trail, and just around the corner from Boston Common and the Old State House. It is a historic hotel, which means that the rooms have most likely been reconfigured multiple times, and the hallways meander and in some places, are different widths. The result is the rooms are all different, unlike the "cookie cutter" rooms in modern built hotels. I was disappointed that the rooms have window units and not central air. For the first few days of our visit, it was quite warm so the A/C ran continually, which was a bit loud at night. Also--and this is a pet peeve of mine-- I would expect a hotel that averages over $225 a night would have better towels. Ours were like sandpaper. I've stayed at $69 a night chain hotels that had better quality towels! Another result of reconfiguration is that some bathrooms are almost microscopic. Our deluxe category room was very spacious and comfortable, but the bathroom was so small it could only house a pedestal sink, and had no counter space at all. A curved shower curtain rod had been installed, which caused the shower curtain to extend out into the middle of the room. We didn't spend too much time in the room except to sleep, so these shortcomings didn't affect our overall delight with this property. The staff is excellent and the property is spotless and well maintained. Even if you don't stay here, you should definitely do a walk-through of the beautiful lobby.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star in name only - go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: frezz
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through a 4 star bid on priceline. We paid $200, which was just $40 less than another 4 star hotel on expedia. We should have spent the extra $40/night. I have never, not even in NYC, been given a room with 1 double bed. I asked to be switched but the hotel was booked that night and, to quote the front desk person "well it was a priceline bid so...." The room was the slightly bigger than the bed. There was a desk with a chair, but the chair could only pull out enough for you to climb into it to sit at the desk. It couldnt be moved out from the desk bc there was not enough room between the bed and the desk. You can assume that the under the desk had never been cleaned. The bathroom was so small you had to walk in and stand between the sink and the toilet in order to shut the door. Again, I am used to small hotel rooms, but this was the worst. The history of this hotel is the only reason it is a 4 star hotel. I am angry that I paid for a 4 star room and was given something so horrible. I could have spent less and stayed at a hilton with at least 2 double beds. I will not be returning when we go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaylac_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the oMNI chain as we love the loyalty program. This hotel is right smack in the middle of town which we liked but however, the hotel is not up to par as most of the OMNI's we stayed at in the past. I'm sure when the economy turns around they will freshen the place up, but for location and customer servce (especially the concierge Shaymus who was great and knowledgeable, there they hit the mark. I'll come back when renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, take advantage of their Select Guest program!”
Reviews.Author: Milan54
Reviews.Content: We were able to receive three nights for the price of two through the hotel website, so we upgraded to a bigger room. We had read reviews about the small bathrooms - and it's true! But the bed and room size were above expectation. I recommend signing up for their free 'Select Guest' program before making reservations as this will provide you with free in-room internet (if you bring a computer along) and free drinks every morning. Because of this program they were also aware that it was a celebration weekend for us and surprised us with some room service our first night there. This hotel is along the Freedom Trail and very close to the subway for things that aren't within walking distance...which isn't much!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: dreamer3825
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal on Priceline and really enjoyed this hotel. The location is great, staff very nice, and room also very nice. Yes, the room is kinda small, but really? People complain too much!!! You're in Boston, how much time are you really spending in the room? The double bed was fine for us - very comfortable. I appreciated that the staff held on to our luggage after we checked out, so we could walk around the city some more. The only complaint I have is the constant knocking from the maids, who knocked every half hour it seems. Next time, I will put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door.

Reviews.Title: “Room Disaster”
Reviews.Author: greigScotland
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Omni nine years ago we instructed our tour operator to arrange a four night stay in a king bed. When we arrived we were shown to a traditional room with a double bed which was pushed against the wall with no room to walk around. There was no wardrobe space and the window looked out to a narrow dirty alleyway with very little natural light. On complaining to the front desk I was informed that there were no king rooms available and that the room allocated was as requested. I disagreed with this and was offered the option to view other tradional rooms on the basis that they would upgrade me after two nights. We moved to a slightly better room and lived out of suitcases for two days with no wardrode space. Our trip to Boston was excellent but was spoiled by the Omni. Their staff were helpful but I still do not believe that they did not have one room available in the whole hotel. Our problem was that our room was prepaid so we could not try another hotel which we will do the next time as we very much enjoy Boston and its surroundig area. Next time Omni treat your clients with five star service to match your publicity profile

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Historic hotel with super staff”
Reviews.Author: pansburg
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel...just beware that their standard room has only one bed in it. The staff is so great. They bent over backwards to make us happy. Don't forget to try the Parker House rolls and the Boston Cream Pie (both were invented there). Location is terrific a few blocks from Quincy Market and easy access to the "T".

Reviews.Title: “Inauspicious Beginnings - Unimpressive Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Flange_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Truth be told, I haven't even stayed at Omni Parker House yet, but have already had a sketchy customer service encounter with them that I wanted to share. My husband and I are planning to stay there in a few months' time for a wedding, and our friends have booked a block of rooms under a group rate. It was brought to my attention that Omni is offering a promotion of "A Free Weekend Night When You Join Select Guest." I chatted online with an Omni representative regarding this promo, but was informed that I would not be valid for this promotion due to the group booking. I asked if I could change my reservation to take advantage of the promotion, and I was advised that this was not possible. When I asked if there was any other way they could allow us to use the promo, the answer was still a resounding no. As a brand new Select Guest member, I am already disappointed with the lack of service I have received. I was surprised at the inflexibility of Omni to help me, or provide options for my reservation - specifically, in reference to the special promotion being offered. I'm a member of numerous hotel loyalty programs and can tell you that the customer service at the others is outstanding, by comparison. While other hotel chains go out of their way to provide excellent customer service (Starwood, in particular, comes to mind), it seemed like the representative I dealt with was not interested to help me at all. If it were not for the request of our friends that we stay at this specific hotel, we would definitely be looking to cancel our reservation. It will be interesting to see what our stay at the Omni Parker House will be like, given the very unimpressive service we've received thus far. I'll be sure to provide an update!

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Parker House - It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: Rich01Cards
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled to Boston for a weekend stay on our way to Cape Cod. We had friends who highly recommended the Omni Parker House so even though the rate was steep we booked our stay at the hotel. Without question this is the most centrally located hotel in all of downtown Boston to see the sights. You simply can't ask for a better location. The Parker House is a very nice old hotel with lots of charm and history. It has some modern amenities in the rooms and while our living area was spacious enough the bathroom was tiny. The beds also seemed small and the noise outside with the trucks and other commercial traffic was very loud in the early mornings. The view was an alley and a brick wall of another building. Still we had no complaints about the room. If you happen to have a car use the self parking down the street which will save you about $25 per day compared to valet parking. Park your car and don't even think about using it during your stay. Traffic and parking in Boston is crazy bad so use the great public transportation or better yet use your two feet to see the sights. Once again, that's the best thing about the Parker House is the location to all the attractions. You'll see so much more if you just wear some comfortable sneakers and walk the town.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, great location”
Reviews.Author: theworldover
Reviews.Content: Booked this on priceline for $100- we stayed for only 1 night- it was enough. Such a small room, such a small bed- yes, great sheets, duvet etc- but I would not stay here again when there are no many other options in Boston! Window (not plural) did not open and the loud AC/Heat unit on the floor was inconsistent and bothersome. I guess when I was younger and my husband was thinner(!) a double bed was fine, but now it feels akin to a twin. The location was really great and we could self park for $18 a night- but still not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Poor result”
Reviews.Author: peterfry
Reviews.Content: We went to check in on the 14/6/10 but we had made a mistake & booked one month prior & paid in full for 2 nights (total $426 Us),The young reception first replied they had rented room out .. So they made double rate.... ?? The reception mgr said bad luck & offered only one night at an increased rate =she rang the Holiday inn which was helpful. They offered same price per nights as Omni. When we checked in we told them of our problem & they were fantastic dropped the room price by $70 per night & gave us a free breakfast each... Well down holiday inn but would never recommend the VERY COLD reception from the Omni = I do realise it was`our mistake but very very cold reception & poor result ????? Looks`like they only care about the money not the customer..

Reviews.Title: “Great location for history buff”
Reviews.Author: Chris3504
Reviews.Content: I joined a large group of friends at the Omni Parker house for a bachelor party. The hotel was absolutly beautiful. Clean rooms, great service, and beautiful decor throughout... the lobby took our breath away! I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to stay in the heart of Boston. walking distance to the waterfront and the freedom trail goes right infront of the hotel pass a cemetary where many historic people are burried. Looking for nightlife? Boston has many great bars with history inside. This is a great choice! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable room with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double for three nights at the end of May, getting a fantastic "name your price" deal through Priceline. Though the room was small -- often mentioned by other reviewers -- it was by no means too small for two people; and we found it to be larger than many where we have stayed in Europe and in New York City. The double bed was comfortable and the room spotless and well appointed with new fixtures. Our 12th-floor location gave us a very distant view of the Boston Harbor. We appreciated the fast elevators, which always seemed to get to us within a few seconds of pushing the button. The room's big drawback was the air conditioner. We found it impossible to adjust to our liking and thus we were either too cold or too warm. The windows couldn't be opened. The hotel's location by the Freedom Trail was perfect to enjoy Boston's history -- near Beacon Hill, the statehouse, Faneuuil Hall Marketplace, Boston Common, etc. There are many restaurants in the area and many places to find a reasonably priced breakfast. All staff stood ready to provide excellent service with a smile, and the concierge service was absolutely phenomenal, far exceeding our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: usatraveller11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker house for 7 nights from 06 June. The hotel is perfectly located to enjoy all that Downtown Boston has to offer with other locations within easy walking distance.
