The hotel is also conveniently located between two subway stations which give access to other areas of Boston/Cambridge. We booked a package direct with the hotel which included museum tickets and full buffet breakfast each morning which was excellent value for money. The hotel is lovely and full of old world charm with very friendly helpful staff. If I was lucky enough to return to Boston in the future I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Erding
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and mentioned that this visit was a special occaision (wedding anniversary). The hotel took notice and made special gesture for us on arrival to the room. (In our room we found a bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries). The hotel is in a great location, it's 4 or 5 stars, and while pricy is well worth it. The room was very confortable, and the hotel have beautiful decoration. The only negative side of the hotel was the view and breakfast- we had a terrible concrete wall in front of us and breakfast is expensive and not appealing at all......:( we didn't try dinner or any other meals....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but don't plan to use community computers”
Reviews.Author: Mrstewart
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel overall. Great bar inside (Last Hurrah), great staff, clean and attractive. But they charge $8 to use 15 minutes of internet time. Maybe that is normal these days but I have never had to pay at a hotel for internet use. It was a bit disappointing given the cost of everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: AJMick
Reviews.Content: So, I traveled w/the bf to Boston when he had a conference last month at Omni Parker. Overall, the hotel was fine; it wasn't the best or worst we've ever stayed in, the rooms were small but clean, the location was perfect for roaming around the city by foot, and the beds were very comfortable. The room was fairly small, we had no view to speak of, simply the building across the way, and the bathroom was tiny with limited counter space for bf & I to fight over. For a historic hotel it seems to be well maintained, the lobby is a bit dark, but on a positive note I had no problems with noise from the halls and other rooms. The staff didn't seem to go out of their way to be helpful, which is interesting considering that everyone else we encountered in Boston was friendly and eager to make our stay a good one. I would recommend this hotel mainly because of the ideal location and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: markmary95
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! We came to Boston for the history. The Omni itself is part of that--in operation since the 1850's, invented Boston cream pie & Parker House rolls--and is literally located on the Freedom Trail, the red line that connects the city's historical sites. 3 minutes to Boston Common, 5 minutes to the Old State House, 8 minutes to Faneuil Hall, right at the foot of Beacon Hill. The room was small, very nice, very clean. Could've had cleaner windows that I could get open, but as they looked out onto an alley, not a huge loss. We signed up for their preferred guest club & got free Internet (wired), and free beverages (2 each) delivered to the room every morning. Added some bagels to that, and a nice continental breakfast for 2 for $10. The desk had two 110 AC outlets built into its side. As an older hotel, the AC is a retrofit--big unit stuck in a window--and was as noisy as these always are. The strike plate on the door was not real solidly anchored to the door jamb, and the door itself didn't fit snugly--light came in from the hallway. The honor bar fridge only cooled down to about 60 degrees, so we improvised an ice chest to hold leftovers. The hotel lobby and restaurants are beautifully done in dark polished wood, the lobby is spacious. The hallway (second floor, anyway) had a nice wallpaper. The room doors may be old, but had laminate on the hall sides, and looked sorta cheesy. We'd have preferred older-looking doors. And the transom windowes are still there, I think, but all sealed shut. Staff was cordial and very attentive--4 offered to take our bags up to our room! And on checkout, when I asked where the express dropoff was, a bellhop took the keys from me and handled it. We ate dinner in the hotel twice. The first night we ate in one of the bars, and I ordered a club sandwhich which turned out to be almost as big as my head. Very tasty--even the next day (see leftovers, above). Exquisite French onion soup. The second night we ate in the main dining room. Again, excellent food. We paid $200 per night over Memorial Day weekend, which seemed average. The value was in its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic history, TINY rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mammyof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker for a Memorial week-end break. We arrived late on Friday night after a trans-atlantic flight and were very impressed by the Reception area - opulent furniture, glistening chandeliers, uniformed staff. But our room on the 11th floor was really, really small. The bed was over-sized - and the television was huge - but neither were in proportion to the room. Having said that, the bed was very comfortable, but perhaps it would have been just as comfortable in a smaller size which would have allowed more space to move around in. The hotel is very central both to the tourist centre of Boston and the financial district - and its own history makes it worth a visit in any event. Just be warned - if you plan to spend any time at all in the room, it is not for the claustraphic!

Reviews.Title: “only positives - historical and good location”
Reviews.Author: aghealth
Reviews.Content: Besides having historical points of interest and an excellent location (walking distance from everything), I would not likely return. Unfortunately, our room was teenie though it was not the cheapest available room - over $300/night with tax. Also, our room a/c was not working properly. It ran constantly and never got below 74 degrees. My biggest concern was the fact that the room was not cleaned appropriately. The linens were never changed, and new towels were not provided. The maid didn't even remove the old wash cloths from inside the shower. She must have presumed we wanted to reuse them. The in-room coffee was nice (the only freebie), as was the 24/7 fitness center which had all the necessary equipment. We were able to print boarding passes, but all other internet access cost $$$. The biggest disappointment was the restaurant and bar. The drinks were poorly mixed. They didn't even offer free pop refills for me - a pregnant lady. The dinner was not edible, and they didn't question why I didn't touch my food after 1 bite. I would not recommend the "pumpkin" gnocci that tasted more like chewy dough with no flavor. A clean room with working a/c and reasonably decent food would take away the "shock" of the tiny room. I would definitely look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed!”
Reviews.Author: PensacolaPensacola
Reviews.Content: At best a 2 star. You can't call it a four star if it needs to be gutted. New drapes, fairly decent bed and new carpet do not cut it. Great location but many better in the area. They catered more to the wedding than the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Smallish rooms, but great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Kanaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights off of a Hotwire deal. Upon my request, the hotel was kind enough to put us in a room with two separate beds at no extra charge. The location is of course fantastic, close to everything you'd want in Boston. In the large and popular lobby, the concierge was always ready to help with directions, mailing postcards, etc. And the attached bar, The Last Hurrah, was surprisingly cozy for a hotel bar. On the downside, the room and the bathroom we got were on the small side, but still very comfortable. Extra points for providing mouthwash. I'd recommend the Omni Parker House for anyone looking for an upscale experience in the heart of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “We had a WONDERFUL stay!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandPam
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for a little one night get away. The valet met us at the curb and unloaded our "luggage". The lobby is spacious and quite elegant. The people at the front desk checked us in quickly and sent us on our way with directions to our room. The room was very comfortable; we had a big bathroom, sitting room with couch and TV and a small bedroom with TV and VERY comfortable bed! If we didn't have places to go I could have napped all day in that bed! The room was clean and comfortable and we had all the amenities we needed. We ordered room service which was brought up to the room on a little cart set up like an elegant table (we ate delicious rolls, juicy hamburgers and crispy french fries..the mini bottles of ketchup were sooo cute!) I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Boston for any reason. I know we greatly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJHillsdon
Reviews.Content: We got assigned this hotel on Priceline in the 'Name Your Rate' section. I put down 2 people (and ignored the 2 children I would have)....what a mistake! They placed us in a room that had ONE double and was the size of a walk-in closet. View was awful as well. Called and asked for a cot & crib - they wouldnt fit together unless we didnt want to open the door. It gets better though - staff said that was unsafe (duh) and upograded us to the sort of room you're accustomed too (two doubles/queens) which is usually a $50 upgrade/night. This room was spacious (even with the crib) and had the charm the hotel was aiming for (old-school Boston hotel). Lobby is gorgeous and staff was friendly. PHENOMENAL location. RIght next to Downstown Crossing & Government Center & Park Street/Boston Common. Would recommened hotel ONLY if you got a room with two beds - otherwise its way too claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck if you want to sleep well - invest in earplugs”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: From the moment the person in the room next to you gets up, takes their first phone call of the day or their alarm goes off, you will also " enjoy" EVERY word/sound through the paper thin walls and corridors. What a pity as the rooms are gorgeously furnished (but small and with tiny bathrooms too).I was unlucky enough to have a room with an interconnecting door which probably did'nt help with the noise transmission issue.Unfortunately no amount of ambience and historic atmosphere can overcome lack of sleep. The select guest program is a must join- free and gets you a complementary morning beverage and free internet. I had another stay at this hotel earlier in the month but booked a suite for a good deal- this was a far superior experience as the suites are corner rooms -spacious,quiet and delightful.Unless you can get a suite I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly and filled with history”
Reviews.Author: jazza1957
Reviews.Content: I chose the Parker House because of its location on the Freedom Trail and because of the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed,. The room was very comfortable, I had excellent food from room service and a delightful member staff who delivered it, and on a tour of the Freedom Trail was fascinated by its history. I was extremely impressed that staff at the reception desk remembered my name given the hotel was full. Oh and of course the Boston Cream Pie was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and history - would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: desmoinesdan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for those wanting to walk the freedom trail. The hotel is over 150 years old and has the all the classic charm with modern amenities. We really enjoyed the onsite bars and restaurants - enjoying our first Boston Cream Pie (it was invented in this hotel) and the exensive Scotch selection. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a get-away of small proportions!”
Reviews.Author: AJoyM25
Reviews.Content: I took a shot in the dark in choosing this hotel as I had never stayed here before, but was drawn in by the great package deals that they offer (we went with the Double Bubble Romance package!). My boyfriend and I had a remarkable stay and were treated like royalty! We enjoyed eating from the Parker restaurant within the hotel and were mostly impressed with breakfast yet were quite disappointed with the lighter fare we had after returning from a late show. We recommend that if you're going to eat there, you should definitely splurge for something a bit more high quality (i.e. the filet mignon). Although the room was a bit on the small side, it was perfect for just the 2 of us and the special touches they gave the room made it very comfortable! Stay away from purchasing the movies on t.v. (just about the same cost if you bought a copy @ Wal-Mart) as well as the mini-bar items (a $4 Snickers bar) as there's a 7-11 about 4 buildings down from the hotel. The staff was incredible from the concierge who knew everything about the city & how to get there to the sweet gentleman who took our bags so we didn't have to tote them around while we went sight-seeing before checking in for the night. Absolute worth the money, especially if you buy a package deal! Perfectly located in the heart of Boston- a quick trip to anywhere via the T. Clean room and environmentally conscious and definitely the best sleep I've had in a long time despite some construction noise on the street below!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rjs996
Reviews.Content: Only 20 min by the T from the airport,for$ 1.70 with Charlie Card(purchased at the airport)5 min walk to hotel on level ground.Hotel 5min walk for all T lines.Hotel on the Freedom Trail,only 10 min to North Church and Little Italy.Great bed ,pillows,very quiet,good nites sleep.Friendly and helpful staff,couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Oldest Hotel still great”
Reviews.Author: GratefulHAG
Reviews.Content: If you use a AAA or senior discount here you can have a nice room at the Parker Omni that has old world charm at a reasonable rate. Ours had a decent view of the city as well. Sure, it was not huge but plenty large enough, beautifully decorated and pristine. The hotel is conveniently located in walking distance from Boston Common and Gardens, Theater district, Newbury Street, Charles Street, Quincy Market and the waterfront. The staff was extremely helpful. But don't be in a hurry for the freshly made breakfast omelettes. The line was long and only one cook. We chose to park in the Boston Common underground garage rather than the more expensive hotel facility. We saw others pulling suitcases across the common which suggests it could be a popular choice.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better...”
Reviews.Author: jurysout10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni last year with my boyfriend on a 4-day trip to Boston. The whole trip was amazing except for the hotel. If you end up wanting to stay here, my advice is to book the hotel DIRECTLY with them. Because we booked our entire trip through Expedia, and then when we got to the hotel, were told that our request for a king-sized bed wouldn't be honored because they don't "have to" honor requests via third-parties. They were going to put us in a room with two twin beds until the fit that I pitched sufficiently got us a room with a queen bed, still not our request. The hotel certainly has some charm and history, and the location is great, which are really the only upsides. The walls are very thin. You can hear people in the hallways and vacuuming by the maids at all hours. I know that we got a good price to stay here, but for us, it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the OPH May 3-6, 10th floor...”
Reviews.Author: smfjetfuel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the OPH May 3-6, 10th floor, Executive Room, everything was great. After reading many of the reviews, I am still suprised that anyone who pays Priceline $$$ for a 4-star hotel expects a perfect experience, wake up, this is America, ain't gonna happen. We got what we paid for and were happy. The Omni Parker House is a fine hotel in a great location. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - but not a true 4-star property”
Reviews.Author: mjf7378
Reviews.Content: The good: Best location in Boston...easy walk anywhere in the city. Got a good deal ($85) on Priceline. The bad: Room was TINY. View of a brick wall. Check-in clerk was very unfriendly. Breakfast buffet was mediocre at best. The only thing saving the Omni Parker House is the location. I have usd Priceline to book so-called "4-star" hotels all over Boston, and this was the first time that the Omni accepted. And unfortunately it does not live up to other properties in the same 4-star category. This hotel does not live up to the standards of the more modern 4-star properties in the city. It's just a very old hotel. If you prefer "character" or "charm" over amenities and space, then this is the hotel for you. Room #879 had barely enough space to walk around a DOUBLE bed. I'd be surprised if it was 150 sq. ft. in total. Luckily we only stayed one night and weren't in the room for very long. When we checked in at 4:30pm on a Friday, I asked the desk clerk if there were any king-bedded rooms available, and without even a look at his computer screen he said the hotel was sold out and this was the only room available. First of all - I got the room on Priceline the day before...I have a hard time believing they would be giving rooms away at that price if the hotel was anywhere close to full. Secondly, just take a second to look! Even if the hotel is sold out, I'm sure at 4:30 there are plenty of folks who have not checked in yet. The simple courtesy of trying to fulfill a guest's request is expected of a "4-star" property. Anyhoo...all in all, the Omni served it's purpose for a 1-night stay in the city. But I would never pay full price for this hotel when there are so many other great choices in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pros: location, Cons: service & cleaniness”
Reviews.Author: stephietoronto
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is top notched, within easy walking distance of 3 transit lines stops and several tourist sites. However, overall I had a bad experience. First of all I should preface this by saying I'm not a picky hotel guest and I've stayed at hotels of less stars. On leaving, here I was a petite female carrying a large luggage down the entrance steps, plus a laptop bag, my purse, and 1 other small bag. Two managers stood and stared as my luggage flipped over and did nothing to help. The bellboys are outside, so no help until I get down the stairs and get through 2 sets of doors. Outside, a captain hails a cab for me, and openly asks me for a tip! Wow. Also, since I was a select guest I was given a free pressing, so I took advantage of it. I got the garment back in my closet, and didn't take a close look. The morning of the conference, I checked and it was so badly ironed I had to redo it, making me late. If you're going to do a bad job, then please don't offer complimentary pressing. It is an older hotel too so it does look a bit worn. But that's ok, sometimes that's charming. Here in this case the room (1415) smells a bit like urine. Sheets had what looks like either lipstick or old wine marks on it. I was located right by the elevator and walls are thin in an old hotel so beware, you'll hear the bell sound as the elevator arrives on your floor. I left with a negative experience. Travellers Tip: if you are going to stay here, sign on as a Select Guest online at the Omni site before booking, and get some complimentary perks like free beverages every morning, free internet usage (which I think actually in 2010 should just be free, period, $9 a day for non-select guests is making a killing!), free shoe shine and free pressing (more about that later).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: dadean
Reviews.Content: After reading what some of other reviews stated about the room size I was pleasantly surprised. The room were comfortable and very clean. The bed was amazing! Our room looked out over the Old State House. The hotel is within walking distance of the North End, Chinatown, the Public Gardens and of course right on Freedom Trail.

Reviews.Title: “Who cares about the little stuff...the beds were incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: klynnega
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston for business and stayed at the Omni. Loved it! Yes, the rooms are a bit small, especially with 2 double beds. But unless you plan on hosting a bunch of people or need to do aerobics..who cares? The beds were absolute heaven!! Pillow top mattresses, big cozy pillows and glorious down comforters. You sink into them and it's complete heaven! I travel on business weekly and stay in all sorts of hotels and so far the Omni is my favorite by far just for the cozy bed at the end of the day. Because we were traveling on business and had several rooms, we had free internet and complimentary coffee and juice in the morning. Service was great! I was waiting for a package and they had it delivered to my room so it was wating for me on arrival. It's a block away from a Barnes and Noble (or Borders...can't remember) with a coffee shop. Also near a 7-11 for late night snack run (very safe walk and about 5 minutes) for fruit and diet coke. Around the corner were several chain restaurants as well as a Macy's, TJ Maxx, Marshalls and several shoe stores. If you forget anything..it's all right there. Across the street is a Ruth Chris steak house. Everything is in close walking distance and only about 5-10minutes. Can't wait to stay there again next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “internet....agreed...”
Reviews.Author: lori1979
Reviews.Content: just saw the internet review and was totally agreeing.. we satyed 2 nights and had similiar negatives... internet, beuatiful view of a brick wall, bump in price for extra bed... oh and this was weird, they came in and made the bed but left the empty bottles/ cans and garbage... i recycle at home but are we supposed to look after this on vacation as well...??..

Reviews.Title: “internet charges...c'mon!!”
Reviews.Author: jay-lonb
Reviews.Content: couldnt believe these guys are still charging for internet... (super 8 doesnt even do this).. since i was travelling with a pal we needed 2 beds, well some hotels accomodate but the omni stings you with an extra 50 bucks per night.. all in all nice older clean motel ... great location... oh another quick tip, dont bother calling home while you are there, i think the hotel jacks the long distance up to about 10 bucks a minute..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: tobHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Omni Parker House is a nice historic hotel with a great lobby. We enjoyed our stay, one slight minus was the sleep quality, as a constant noise level just outside the hotel was disturbing. I am not a complainer and usually sleep well, but the noise level was always there. It surely depends on the location of your room. Still, a nice place in a perfect location with friendly staff and good services.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Friendly Staff and Great location”
Reviews.Author: obeethree
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the tasteful decor and very friendly and helpful staff. Great central location within easy walking to many of the attractions of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but beware of the tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: maggsfriend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for one night in oder to catch an early flight out of Boston. Prior to booking, several websites listed the hotel as "4 star." While the lobby area is beautiful, and the location cannot be beat, I would not give this hotel 4 stars. Our room was absolutely tiny. Maybe only 100 square feet. Smaller than many of the hotels I've visited in Manhattan. The bed barely fit two average size adults. It was smaller than a double, but bigger than a twin bed. Although the furnishings were very nice, the room felt claustrophobic, and definitely not 4 star. A 4 star hotel, in my opinion, means that all the rooms are a decent size with king beds when there is only one bed in th rooom. We looked at the fire escape plan, which also provides a rough estimate of the size of the other rooms. They all seemed bigger than ours, so maybe we just were placed in the smallest room on the floor. We did book through Priceline, so perhaps it was the hotel's way of punishing us for paying the cheaper rate. If I returned to the Omni, I would definitely not allow them to put me in this same room. I am marking "yes" on the recommend tab only based on the assumption that the other rooms are bigger than the one we were given.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel right in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lincoln242
Reviews.Content: For this hotel, it is all about the location. It is right on the freedom trail within a five minute walk of the Boston common, the state house, and three metro stations. The hotel itself was very elegant with a historic feel to it with wood paneling and chandeliers covering the lobby area. The rooms are very small and quite noisy, however it was only a small price to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: plunger1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located . They could not do enough to make your stay a pleasure. Seamus the hotel greeter/ security was very helpful. You pull up with your car and they take over. Forty bucks for parking but you can go and come as many times as you please. Rooms were not large but very tasteful and clean with all the bells and whistles you could need. I probably couldnt afford to stay here but got a great rate from travelzoo for the weekend at 129.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: Each time we stay here it gets better and better. You can't beat the location and their rates on the weekend are very competitive. We have been upgraded to a suite on our past three stays. Check-in and check out are easy and the valet parking is a breeze. I have stayed in a variety of hotels in New York and Boston and I put the Omni Parker in the top 10% of the hotels I have stayed in. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the help I received from Kate Casey, the Loyalty Ambassador. She was big help with our room and any arrangements we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker-- Overall a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hunterdog6
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Omni Parker Hotel in Boston with my Husband and Daughter (3 1/2). The hotel lobby is very nice, and the room was fine. The size of our room, which had 2 full size beds was spacious enough for us-- and it seemed clean. The hotel gave us a backpack with toys for our daughter when checking in-- this was extremely appreciated, as she had a good time playing with the contents. Also, the milk and cookies she received before bed time was also a nice suprise for her. The only drawbacks I have found is that the walls are seriously thin in that at 1:30 a.m. I woke up to hear the bachelorette party going on next door. We also ate in the Parker Bar, which was medioacre at best. I would stay here again if a fantastic rate was presented to me (our stay here was a seriously good deal at only $113 with taxes).Overall the hotel suited our purpose a place to sleep inbetween going to the Children's Museum and the New England Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duke3434
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we thought we would only make the one visit to Boston and decided to treat ourseleves We booked an executive room which was huge- at least five times bigger than the NY hotel room we had a few days earlier. Without doubt our time spent at the Omni Parker House was central to our enjoyment.and we concur with the superlatives in other reviews, from the Staff to the food. One aspect that might be overlooked is that every Bostonian seems to know the historic Omni Parker House and it proved a great conversation opener. We have already decided to return to Boston, and this hotel is at the top of our personsal list

Reviews.Title: “Historical and Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: kay2222
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was absolutely delightful. Very helpful staff and beautiful rooms. The location was perfect, in walking distance to the subway, and many restaurants and pubs. A 10 minuet walk to Quincy Market. This was my first trip to Boston, and the Omni Parker House made it great!! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni Parker House!”
Reviews.Author: judynrich
Reviews.Content: Once again the Omni Parker House provided a great getaway. This lovely, historic hotel sits in a prime sightseeing location with many great sites and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel takes great pride in customer service that you experience with every staff member you encounter. The rooms are small, but beatufully decorated and wonderfully comfortable beds. The hotel restaurant has a great early bird special (they call it "pre-theater menu") that had great selections and was more than we could possibly eat! I will always stay at the Parker House when I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, opulent and the best located hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: NicSiSi
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this gorgeous old hotel! I stayed there back in 2006 and since then the rooms have been renovated. Flat screen tv, an iPod dock and a gorgeous high comfy bed that is the best we've ever slept in. Admittedly the views from the were of another room but honestly we were there to sleep, not to gaze out the window. The lobby is old-world and incredibly beautiful. There's a restaurant and a bar which always seemed to be full and the location of the hotel is so close to Boston Common, The Freedom Trail and Fanuiel Hall. We cannot imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT small. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: GoneTrippn
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I expected a shoe box. But I just think many of us have gotten too big (homes, cars, waists.) My room was small and had no view, but it was comfortable and the location was a block from Boston Common. My walls were thick, I banged on them. I rated it average only because they do call themselves four stars. I guess one would expect larger rooms these days at four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelworldnow
Reviews.Content: Found the Parker House to be as advertised. A great location for seeing the sights of Boston, walking distance to the North End for great meals. The staff are very attentive and get it. We lost a bag in transit and the desk offered emergency supplies to get us through till the bag arrived. The beds are to die for say my two daughters who love to sleep when not shopping. Rooms are not large, and the bathrooms are tiny, but what do you expect in an older classic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room”
Reviews.Author: LeonW
Reviews.Content: Located smack in the middle of Boston - great location. Close to all the touristy things. Room was huge, clean and lavishly appointed. Hotel has loads of history to absorb. Bathroom was small though - barely enough room to open the door, but functional and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great charm and comfort in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Wex37
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days with colleagues on an educational trip to Boston and found the hotel to be well worth a return visit. Wonderfully elegant, reminiscent of older Eurpoean Grand Dame hotels. Rooms very comfortable and breakfast is not to be missed. Staff were all genuinely welcoming and courteous with the exception of one waitress in the Last Hurrah bar who seemed more interested in ensuring she was left a substantial enough tip rather than doing anything to earn it!

Reviews.Title: “Only the price is luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbee71
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small. Originally we booked a standard room, but we had to upgrade to a deluxe room, since the standard room comes only with a full size bed. The upgraded room was tiny and so was the bathroom, which was squeezed into a corner. There was no granite in the bathroom, it just looked blah. The view was nice so. $ 40 for parking is way too expensive. I did not feel welcomed here and it was a disappointing experience for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ec2010
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in the Omni Parker House in Boston. Rooms are small but then again we had a lot of luggage. The bed is unbelievably comfortable and the room was very quiet so we great sleep. All in all, a gorgeous hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: aespins18
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised to see so many positive reviews for this hotel. I am hardly ever one to complain but after having just returned from a two-night stay at the Omni Parker House for a special Valentine's Day weekend with my boyfriend, I truly feel ripped off and misled. I booked through Priceline and was "upgraded" from a 3-star to the "4-star" Omni, but I am sure I would have been better off not being "upgraded" at all. Firstly, the advertised pictures were very misleading. The lobby was certainly beautiful but the room itself was HORRIBLE. The first thing I noticed was the strong smell of cleaning supplies, which lasted my entire stay. Then I saw how tiny the room was, barely fitting one double size bed and some squeezed-in furniture -- extremely close quarters and uncomfortable for two adults. Now, I've stayed in smaller hotel rooms before, but at least there was a queen or king size bed and a well-designed interior to make it feel a little more open. The bathroom was also very small -- you couldn't actually be in the bathroom and have the door open at the same time. Additionally, I did not expect to have any sort of special view, but this view was atrocious. We look out onto a rooftop covered in trash and could see right into peoples' apartments (and I'm sure they could see into our window). As much as we wanted to open the curtain to feel a little less claustrophobic, closing the curtain was really the less offensive option. We then tried to connect to the internet on an iPod Touch to plan our evening. We called the front desk to ask for assistance and apparently "you have to purchase internet for $10 a day, but you could get it for free if you sign up for a rewards program but he wasn't even really sure how it worked but no matter what you have to go down to the lobby to do it". Huh? We didn't even try after that explanation. Happy to get out of our room, my boyfriend and I proceeded to get drinks in the bar area of the lobby. While it was definitely a cozy atmosphere, we could not fully enjoy it because we were flat-out ignored by our waitress. After taking nearly forty-five minutes to flag her down to pay for our ridiculously expensive beers, we decided it was time to leave the hotel altogether and enjoy the local area. We asked someone at the front desk if he could suggest any fun places around, to which he responded, "I'm not sure if I can help you because I'm not sure of what reservations are going to be like this evening so I'm going to ask you to ask someone else." I translated this as "I don't know" or "I'm too lazy to help you" or "you don't look worth my time". So we asked another gentleman at the concierge to help. We were looking for somewhere in walking distance that had food and maybe some music and dancing. Since he immediately suggested a place called "Fajitas and Ritas", we trusted that this had to be a great local spot. Following the Concierge's directions in the freezing cold, we ended up nowhere near the joint and ended up going into another hotel to ask for directions, and they quickly pointed us in the right direction. We finally arrived at the restaurant, and although it had potential to be a fun place, it was practically a Mexican food dining hall for college students. Literally, the entire place was packed with college students. We ended up having an OK cheap meal and a few margaritas but the place closed only an hour after we arrived. Honestly, I was slightly offended that the Concierge at the Omni would suggest such a place that did not contain any of our criteria. Perhaps he was not knowledgeable about the area or maybe assumed we were college students. Either way, it was a huge disappointment and totally nothing like what we were looking for. The next day while passing by the lobby we noticed two different couples complaining at the desk, having similar problems we had, particularly with the room. Our room specifically was right across the hall from the Housekeeping closet, which caused a few issues for us. We were totally unable to take a brief nap in the afternoon because Housekeeping was quite loud in the hallway, but that was understandable since it was in the afternoon. But what was really infuriating was being woken up in the morning by extremely loud chatting among the Housekeeping staff. They were literally yelling at each other right in front of our door (which had the Please Do Not Disturb sign on it) early in the morning. After about 15 minutes of this, my boyfriend had to ask them to please quiet down. They apologized but even their continuous talking at a low volume could be heard through the walls, in addition to the rustling of bags. There was certainly no going back to sleep for me. I briefly and totally non-aggressively voiced my complaints at check-out and barely received an apology. In fact, the woman at the desk seemed to get quite defensive. We left with a very poor taste in our mouths. While the experience wasn't disastrous, the Omni Parker House is certainly not half as nice as any other "4 star" hotel I've ever been in and I feel a duty to warn people not to get their hopes up or spend any significant amount of money on this hotel. Nice location, but that's about it. Not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Now that is a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LarTraveler
Reviews.Content: As part of a two week family vacation, we spent our last three days at the Parker House. My daughters are 7 and 11, my wife had never been to New England, and we were ending a vacation that included, Wash DC, Williamsburg, Philidelphia, and Boston. I had done my research, and decided to book a suite. We had the Freedome Trail Suite, which was really great and well worth the money. This hotel oozes with history, is right on the Freedom Trail, good walking distance to wonderful attractions, and had a great staff. I am aware that rooms very here. The suites are really nicely done, and the staff is great. If you like to take in history, enjoy a classic hotel...this is really the place!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Parker House! I have traveled throughout the U.S, and Europe, and PH is the best!”
Reviews.Author: howardbodine
Reviews.Content: Ok. Why do I say that. The rooms are a little small, but who stays in the room when you are sitting in one of the most historic settings in the world! Within five minutes you can walk to Boston Commons, Fanuiel Hall, Old State House (where the Revolutionary War began) , Kings Chapel, and more and more --including of course the Boston Harbour. The restaurant in the hotel -- ever heard of Parker House rolls, how about Boston Cream Pie--all discovered there. How about the historic people -- Jack proposed to Jackie, Babe Ruth -- when he played for the Red Sox stuffed himself with the steaks, and let's not forget about Charles Dickens reciting his novel "The Christmas Carol", in front of the mirror on the mezanine floor. Sadlly, the hotel and restaurant is the same place that John Wilkes Booth likely planned the murder--of Lincoln, which happened only days after his stay! If you don't like history, or fabulous food, or comfortable surroundings --and a wonderfully pleasant staff -- do not go . I have stayed there at least twenty times in four years, with family. I highly suggest staying at the Parker House.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Molosso
Reviews.Content: Service was very good and the hotel is very elegant, with a majestic foyer. Our room was on the small side and it overlooked an internal courtyard, with other room's windows directly in front of ours, so had little privacy and kept our blinds down. Location was great, right on the Freedom Trail in front of the Old City Hall. Didn't try breakfast or the restaurant as they seemed quite expensive. The great plus is location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncalitravelboi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this historic hotel for three nights. Before I traveled, I joined their select guest program online and would recommend doing so. It entitles you to free morning beverage service and discounted breaskfast service and free wi-fi. When I arrived they upgraded my room to a king bed at no charge. Service was very good. The rooms are not huge, but to be expected in a historic hotel. The recent renovation was well done and rooms are well appointed. The bed was very comfortable and the linens good quality. The fitness center was fine, nothing great but adequate. On the downside, the room was drafty - could feel cold air coming through the door jam(!) and on one morning, room service missed my breakfast order completely. Other than that, the food service in the hotel is quite good. Overall a very nice experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great service”
Reviews.Author: Jibster
Reviews.Content: The rooms are indeed small, and the one window did look out to a brick wall, but we were only in our room late at night, and the service more than made up for it. We have preferred guest privileges, so our Internet was free and we received complimentary beverages each morning and turn-down service at night. Initially we had issues connecting to the Internet, but their tech. support was eventually able to get us up and running. The Omni chain is old-school, if you are looking for a "new age" hotel with grand views, look elsewhere. If you're looking for a comfortable bed, close to the action, this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me???”
Reviews.Author: techshield
Reviews.Content: 22 years as a road warrior could not prepare me for the disappointment that followed me into this hotel room. It immediately sucks all of the life right out of you. Tiny window, tiny room, tiny bathroom, panoramic view of a brick wall. Don't get me wrong. I can certainly appreciate history but not to the point that I'm willing to churn my own butter every morning. There are certain things that you expect to find when you check into any hotel. Most importantly is the ability to turn around, be able to put your luggage somewhere inside the room, and have some expectation that things will be quiet at least during the night. None of these are available at this hotel. I booked two nights and paid in advance. I am so disappointed in this property that I have decided to check out early, find another hotel nearby, and leave the second nights charge as a partying gift to the Omni chain. It's the last time they will ever see me. Do yourself a favor. If you are looking for charm, there are plenty of properties in Boston that offer that without ripping you off. Do your homework. But more importantly, recognize that no matter how many of these reviews bring up room size as an issue, you can not adequately prepare yourself for the utter shock and disappointment that will follow you into these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Service and History”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveller0001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House and it was one of the best experiences ever! Although there are no views (it is a downtown hotel), the service and ambiance truly made up for it. When I checked in, I was offered a map and the bellman introduced me to the lobby and emergency exits before settling me into my quaint room. The is complimentary internet when you sign up for their free Select Guest Membership. I will certainly be back the next time I have meetings in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Bad - Keep away”
Reviews.Author: UpAndUp
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Tiny rooms. Bathroom is the size of the closet. This once grand hotel with grand suites has been cut up into tiny rooms to earn an extra buck. The rooms are grim. The walls are dirty and thin. You can hear other guests talking. The window view is the brick wall of the opposite building. They put the contents of the minibar on the table to try to seduce you to use it. Internet is not free. (Nothing is free in this hotel). The staff are polite but not helpful (the concierge even gave me wrong directions) This kind of hotel gives Boston a bad name. This is not a good hotel. It feels like it is money making off unsuspecting tourists.

Reviews.Title: “oozes class”
Reviews.Author: topfox39
Reviews.Content: stayed one night in the omni parker on our way to north conway. travelled from wales in the uk. there was no need to stay there but having stayed there two years ago i had enjoyed myself so much i had to go back for one more night. the hotel was just the same-like going back in time-just oozed class-friendly staff and people. the dinner at the hotel again faboulous-the best steak i had during my stay in the us-believe me i had a few. rooms a bit on the small side-but the bed was comfortable-and you don't visit boston to stay in your room. will definetely return again one day for a longer stay. does anyone know if they hold a new years eve ball at this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AussieAwayFromHome
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker house is a Boston Icon and having stayed there, I can now appreciate why. My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights on a trip through America and we got quite good rates online. The hotel can only be described as opulent. They Foyer is breathtakingly beautiful and the rooms are nicely appointed. The beds whilst feeling a little weird to start with (the seem to feel like a dome type shape) resulted in an amazing nights sleep. The rooms were a little on the small side, but given the age of the hotel this is to be expected. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant was delicious and there is free we-fi in the lobby. The staff were always helpful and the hotel is in the perfect location, only minutes from Boston Common and Quincy Market. I can't wait to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: myfivesons
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Freedom Trail suite with hubby and our sons, suite comfortably sleeps 6 and true value for money. Make sure you become a select guest before staying at an Omni property. We love the ambience of an old world property; If you are looking for modern don't stay here as you won't appreciate what this Hotel offers, which is old world class. Staff go out of their way to make your stay effortless. There are no views from any windows but that did not bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanted”
Reviews.Author: LesGentilsCanadiens
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely lovely stay. The hotel is charming and ideally located. The staff bent over backwards to be of service. The room was small but cozy, tastefully decorated and immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, awful room”
Reviews.Author: wikedloki
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a room at this hotel via Hotwire. We got a great deal on a room at a very nice hotel. I was immediately impressed with the lobby, helpful staff and hotel location, however, the room we stayed in was cramped, located next to the ice machine, and on a floor (2nd) with very disrespectful guests. Our room came with a full sized bed (not big enough for two men), which, with a night stand on one side, hardly fit between the walls of the room. I literally could not have rolled out of bed due to the wall being 2 inches from the edge of the bed. Our window opened into a derelict dead space in the middle of the building which comprised of several old air conditioners, a massive amount of bird droppings, rotting wooded and rusted steel walk ways, and just a hint of sky. The room was located right next to the ice machine, so all night, I was awaken to the sounds of ice buckets being filled. Additionally, my fellow hotel guest, staying in rooms off the same hall, were highly disrespectful of sleeping hours. The first night, I was awaken on several occasions to drunk men in the hallway yelling, banging on doors, and getting ice. The next night, teenage girls talked on their cell phones just outside my room. The last night, a family, which seemed to be departing, did so quite loudly. Aside from that, the room was very clean and well maintained. The bathroom was small, yet usable. The closet was, compared to the room, very large and came with a safe. The hotel staff was super friendly and the concierge was quite helpful. I would stay at this hotel again, but next time, I'll pay for a better room and avoid the Hotwire special.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonJimmy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a great first trip with my girlfriend to Boston, staying in two different in hotels. I spent the first 3 nights in the Omni Parker.... Notable points below ROOM/HOTEL: +Room was cleaned regularly +Nice tv, but not a great channel selection +Great location near Faneuil Hall +Very nice hotel bar -Was given a room with a view of walls with virtually no daylight -Rooms and bed quite small -Hot water seemed to run out by the evening STAFF/SERVICE: +Check in staff were very polite OVERALL: I had a decent stay at the Omni, the location is great and within walking distance to most places. The rooms are not the most luxurious or comfortable, but that is compensated by the polite staff and the great location of the hotel. All in all, this was a good value stay, and would recommend to those who rate location among their top criteria when looking for accommodation. If you are looking for comfort and luxury however, I think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “be careful which room you get. carpet filthy and view of berlin wall”
Reviews.Author: aeromasspilot
Reviews.Content: all this talk about millions of dollars in renovations at the parker house and i just didn't see it. carpet needed a serious steam cleaning. if you book this hotel through orbitz or travelocity and get a good rate, you'll most likely get one of thereally small 12 x 12 inside rooms with no view. the location of this hotel is what makes up for the rooms. so where did the 30 million dollars in renovations go? maybe structure support of the old building.. who knows....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- Great Stay to see the best of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Gracey-Lou
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to Government centre T station for the train to/from airport. Close to Boston COmmon, Fanueil, New England Aquarium, Newbury Street, Prudential Centre- Great staff, Concierge was beyond helpful. Room was clean, spacious, wonderful stay, would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: claudette
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I stayed in a petite double room and was pleasantly surprised that the room was as spacious as it was. There was a very comfortable double bed with a down comforter, a desk and chair, and one easy chair. It was perfect for one, it might have felt a little cramped for a couple. The bathroom was modern and had all the amenities you could ask for. Based on other traveler's suggestion, I joined the select guest program (free) and received a newspaper and coffee and one other beverage free each morning. My room had a nice view of old city hall (now a Chris's Steak House), that was nicely lit at night. I did not eat at the hotel, but there are lots of cafes nearby. The hotel is conveniently located right on Boston Common and near a T stop. The hotel is only about a 10-15 minute walk from the North End. It is also only a 10 minute walk from the theater district. I got a great internet rate of $95 per night. I think the inexpensive rate added to my enjoyment, but I would happily stay at this hotel again even if I had to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: CMSK
Reviews.Content: While the location and price are good, this hotel badly needs a face lift. Carpets are stained and worn, common areas are dingy, and overall look is quite frayed. The roms are tiny, you cannot turn around in the bathroom. Wonderful history here, oldest functioning hotel in America , in the middle of freedom trail. They should spend some money making it the showpiece it can be. That said, the price at 150/night was best in boston - you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “in need of reworking”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House for 3 nights, and I wasn't massively impressed. Really, I can't go on without mentioning the size of the room. Some other reviewers have noted that the rooms weren't substantially smaller than anything else they'd experienced in US hotels - I'd strongly disagree - my room was so small that I was extremely grateful I was on my own. If I'd been with my girlfriend it would have been a nightmare - the bed was so small it was barely bigger than a twin, and the bathroom was miniscule. The room itself was largely taken up by a desk, the bed, and an armchair and there wasn't much room to move otherwise. I honestly could not believe my eyes when I saw it for the first time. As another reviewer has also noted, the walls were really thin, and you could hear people talking to each other or on cellphones. Luckily none of my neighbours made louder noises, but you could quite imagine that if they had, you would hear in graphic detail. Positives - I joined Omni select guest while at the hotel and as a consequence got free internet, and two free drinks delivered every morning, which was great. I also thought it was a really nice touch that their business center allowed free printing of boarding passes. The building is obviously a nice old building too, and the lobby is nice, but I didn't really think that spectacular. Location - I couldn't really decide whether it was bad or good. It's only a $20 cab ride from Logan, which was nice, and you could walk everywhere, or go down to the subway a few blocks away. It was also very near Boston Common. But it's also very near the financial district and that becomes very deserted at night. I felt safe at all times in Boston but I can imagine some people becoming unnerved by how quiet it can be around the hotel. Personally if I was to come to Boston again I'd aim to stay in the back bay area, which is a bit more lively, and the hotels there are nearer more shops and restaurants, although Omni Parker House is near Faneuil Hall. So basically this wasn't a bad hotel and I wasn't thinking, get me out of here, but I wouldn't go back unless the price dropped significantly or the rooms were massively enlarged. I should add that I had a very small window in my room also with a view of someone's office.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_Casey
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the Omni Parker in Boston. Recent renovation. While rooms are more narrow than chain hotels in the US, the room is more than adequate. Bathroom was small but adequate. Perfect location. 2 blocks from the subway. 4 blocks from Fanieul Hall (shopping, dining) 10 minute walk to the North End for great restaurants. All staff were very pleasant and helpful. Beautiful lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Debradex09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and in a great location situated in the heart of the Freedom Trail. However, our living quarters at the Omni Parker for 2 nights for my sister and I were less than we had expected for $220/night. We were crammed into the tiniest room possible. The bathroom was inadequate for setting out make-up and hair products due to the tiny pedestal sink and no vanity or counter space. The walls were so thin we could hear the person in the next room talking normally on his cell phone. Upon returning home from our trip, the Omni Parker had charged my credit card for a mini bar purchase which I had to refute. Skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: KNDNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parker House this past weekend on our first trip to Boston. We were immediately greeted as soon as I opened my car door. The front desk was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and had a view of the street and Ruth Chris Steakhouse. Within an hour of being in our room, the front desk called to make sure the room was okay. It is located in the perfect spot and we walked everywhere without ever getting a taxi. We will definitely return on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant birthday / anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: This place gets the full five stars from me for impeccable service, beginning to end. I became an Omni fan when I first stayed at the Omni Charlotte for a conference and joined the excellent Omni loyalty program. They have one of the best loyalty packages out there! After three nights in Charlotte for a conference, I was already due for a free night with a paid night at any Omni property. I chose Boston, since I'd never been there, and we made it into a birthday / anniversary celebration trip. I was already in touch with a number of their hotel staff because of their very well-run Twitter feed. When I got there, a Flip video camera was waiting for me as part of their Omni Flips summer package. The room wasn't quite ready, but the staff more than made up for it by giving both my fiance and I a free trip to the bar while we waited. When we got to our room, I was met by birthday balloons. That night, while we were out, the staff delivered a champagne bucket, chocolate covered strawberries, and a signed birthday card. When our internet cord turned out to be too short, a longer one was promptly brought up. The concierge was wonderful and courteous and gave us excellent suggestions for things to do. The room was a bit small for something termed "junior suite," and the property shows some age, but we wanted for nothing, and the service made up for the slightly cramped quarters. Had a wonderful birthday and anniversary, and will definitely return to Omni in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: JNC73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a week. On arrival we were allocated a room with a bed that was only big enough for one person. They seemed to think that the booking was for only one person, which it wasn't. They then allocated us another room which was even worse and had a bed the same size as the first one. The receptionsit we dealt with had disappeared (perhaps conveniently) when we returned to complain for a third time. We were eventually allocated a third room (a Queen room) which still wasn't very big but was better then the previous rooms we had been allocated. Why couldn't they have given us that room in the first place? The hotel itself is in a good location. It's got an impressive lobby area when you enter it but there were far too many bell hops hovering round like vultures waiting to pounce on you and your bags. I'd like to have the choice of whether I not I carry my own bag before some tip-seeking member of staff grabs hold of it. There was far too much noise at night. You could hear conversations and TVs in the adjacent rooms and lots of door banging in the corridors. The breakfast was unimpressive and very expensive (about $30 a head). I wouldn't recommend it. The Boston cream pie is a big selling point for the hotel, but at $8 a go (even from the coffee shop at the front of the hotel) it's a total rip-off. There are better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Badexperience065
Reviews.Content: First, our room, at a value rate of $281 per night, overlooked an alley and was smaller than some people's bathrooms. The service was weak at best on our arrival. No one helps you with your luggage until you have lugged it into the hotel. The security is a joke. We reported a serious disturbance in the room next to ours - fughting screaming and hitting. Serious dysfinction going down. We have to call security twice before they dealt with it. The capper - we obviously wanted to remain anopnymous - for all they (the assault coupple) knew we could be across the hall, on the other side etc. All was well until in the middle of the hub bub, the manager comes to our room, thanks us for our call to security and assures us all will be ok! Gee, thanks for that! You just fingered us as the squealers! Spent all day and night on pins and needles. ComplEtely unprofrssional, overpriced and uterrly disappointing and further foul ups followed. Have never complaiend or posted a comment about any hotel, but gosh, people beware.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic, and a prime location.”
Reviews.Author: Grandma51
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is truly a beautiful piece of history. The location, right on the freedom trail, is great. This was our first trip to Boston. The Parker House is easily within walking distance of most of the sites we wanted to visit. The rooms are on the small side, however, we had two very comfortable beds, and a quiet room even though we were right by the elevators. The Last Hurrah Bar and Restaurant was a fun place to have a drink and the famous Boston Cream Pie. You can even have a martini called Boston Cream Pie. Note: if you want Boston Cream Pie after 10 PM, you have to get room service!

Reviews.Title: “good view of the alley from a shoe box”
Reviews.Author: spooge031
Reviews.Content: sorry but for 177/night and having to pay extra for EVERYTHING i dought my wife and i will be staying at omni parker again. first they charge for internet and it's not wifi in your room who charges for internet anymore? then dish out the money for snacks 4.00 for a stale candy bar and 7.00 for a bottle of water all left in your room to take and be charged for ,yum!! we had a great view though ,of the alley and roof of the next buildings, then room, woah! what a room! my bathroom is bigger(about 12X12) and only a double bed!! for that kind of cash (very hard earned and saved for our anneversary) i expected a better room not one next to the linen closet and electrical closet especially when i booked it they were running a special for 179.00/nite for a suite VERY dissapointed !! HOWEVER the people whom greeted us and took our luggage, parked the car etc... were excellent just wish i could have tipped better, but the room took all i saved up, Boston was a great time, the room not so much

Reviews.Title: “the One of the better hotels”
Reviews.Author: Beefcurry
Reviews.Content: I haved booked into the omni Parker every year since 2005, Need i say anymore. It,s obviously one of the better hotels otherwise i wouldnt choose it. I travel from Ireland and can safely say i have never found reason to complain or find fault with this establishment............Its location is second to none as is staff. Be back for more of the same in 4 week,s please god ...........Celia Blake Palmerstown Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: magicsmom
Reviews.Content: It was a Hotwire.com booking, the price was reasonable even with a $50 per night upgrade to a King room. Joined the Omni select guest program, that was a waste, never received the perks. But the hotel is beautiful and the staff is very competent, the rooms are small, but it is an old hotel. It was quiet, and our bed was great. We only went to the Parker Bar on one occasion, our light dinner was great, it was casual, that was what we were looking for after a long day of site-seeing. The location is great, you step out the door and you are on the 'freedom trail'....We were completely satisfied with our stay

Reviews.Title: “1-star service from a supposedly 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachgirlRI
Reviews.Content: Ordered a room with two double beds which was confirmed the day before. Received an extremely small room with one full-sized bed. The hotel was full, but they still refused to refund our money to allow our group to find another hotel. So, we had to squeeze a cot into the room. In addition, this visit started with the valets telling me that the ski rack on my Subaru wouldnâ€™t fit in their garage and that they were too busy with the incoming wedding to park my car in their back-up garage. So I had to park it myself and walk 10 minutes in the pouring rain. I was completely unimpressed. There are much better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Opulence and Location Combined with History”
Reviews.Author: Spotsmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister at the Omni Parker House the weekend of October 9. The reception we received was warm, professional, and very courteous. We were able to check in early (around 11 AM) which was a terrific and unexpected bonus. The room (a standard double) was a bit small, but well-appointed. Linens were of high quality and the mattress was very comfortable. There is a wall mounted LCD TV to save space. The mini bar and snacks are crazy expensive so it is best to curb those munchies. Bathroom is on the small side, but very clean. The room was very quiet, as we overlooked a side street. We did not eat at the hotel, but did enjoy an evening drink in the lounge. One note: the hotel is indeed supposed to be haunted, with the 6th and 10th floors seeing the most supposed paranormal activity. The location was terrific; practically across the street from the Granary Burial Ground, and close to the Common, and T stations. The hotel is on School Street, directly across the street from Old City Hall which is now a Ruth Chris Steakhouse. It is a quick walk to Quincy Market and other tourist-related destinations. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is opulent without being stuffy, and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but over-rated”
Reviews.Author: travelagentTexas
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at Omni Parker House in one of their premier suites. Price was high for what we got. There is no door separating the bedroom from the living area. Since we had someone sleeping on the sofa in the living room, this was an inconvenience from a privacy standpoint. The sleeper sofa was uncomfortable. The bathroom was small, but clean, with shower and nice amenities. We had to walk down a small stair in the hallway to access the suite, which was difficult with our luggage. Rooms are noisy - older hotel with lack of sound-proofing. There are few views out the windows and must draw your curtains as you are looking right into other buildings and offices. The hotel is very well located in the city. The buffet breakfast was mediocre and pricey - $20 per person - unfortunately, the famous Parker House rolls on the buffet line were stale and hard. A disappointment for their signature item. The Last Hurrah Bar was very accommodating and the drinks were good. Staff in Bar was helpful and attentive. Bell hops and greeters were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kjojo
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Parker House because of their famous Boston Cream Pie. The location is amazing and the staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and charming”
Reviews.Author: zvezda9
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with my trip come up at the last minute and had to get a hotel quickly. I was lucky enough to get a deal at this hotel, which was exciting, as I am a history buff and am aware of the Parker House's significance. It is true that the room was small, but it was a historic hotel and the bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was absolutely stunning. The lobby made me feel like I had walked back in time - elegant time! I thoroughly loved this hotel, in part because it brought what was an otherwise disastrous trip back up and in part because it is just a truly exceptional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: phorrocks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but the bathroom was small. There was no place to put my toiletries. The staff was responsive to all my questions. They had free internet, but you had to join their frequent traveler club.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Skibsted
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that was able to meet all my expectations. The hotel itself is filled with history. The rooms are clean and everyone were extremely friendly. The only downside is of course that it can be very expensive - look for special offers!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: sammies_dad
Reviews.Content: a bit over priced but a super nice place. Home of the parker house rolls, and boston cream pie. walking distance to almost anything you could want to see. 3-4 blocks from Cheers, 6 blocks Quincy market

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Town, and a historical feel”
Reviews.Author: nasdaqnole
Reviews.Content: Fantastic historical hotel - perfect location, 5 min walk to Quincy Market, right on the Freedom Trail and across the street from Boston Common. 2 train stops within a 3 min walk. Excellent service, cozy well appointed rooms, and every amenity you need - restaurants, business center, great gym, gift shop/convenience store all right in the hotel. Next time in Boston, we will definately be staying at the Omni Parker House again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-- not so great service and food”
Reviews.Author: timmertoo
Reviews.Content: The good: Walking distance to shoppng and major tourist areas. Area is full of revolutionary history sites. History takes place at this hotel. It seemed safe to walk to places within a 10 block radius of the hotel. The bad: Service is spotty from the doorman to the restaurants and lounges to the room accomodations. Although the decor in the restaurants is charming the food and service within them are at best just OK. We had numerous rooms rented and the most prevalant comment by the occupants was the room's lack of size including small bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Boston, MA”
Reviews.Author: MJTravelerBeverly_MA
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel..location, staff, and room. Valet Parking was great although during a busy time its very rushed to exit car.

Reviews.Title: “History and tradition - without the Disneyfication”
Reviews.Author: managementtrainer1
Reviews.Content: Having read the latest reviews (and a few others) I feel I have very little to add. As noted previously by other contributors signing up for the (free) Select Guest Programme is a must â€“ 1 hot and 1 cold beverage per room guest every morning plus a newspaper for free is a great way to start the day! And we were upgraded to a deluxe room just before we arrived â€“ not a huge room but more than adequate. Besides the likes of Dickens, Ulysses S Grant and John F Kennedy all being associated with the hotel It is literally on the Freedom trail with Beacon Hill, the Harbor and Downtown Crossing all very close and Commonwealth Avenue, Back Bay, The Prudential Centre, South End and further afield are all accessible via a short â€˜Tâ€™ ride. In fact â€˜Tâ€™ stops abound â€“ State and Government Center stations on the Blue line connect straight from the airport and are a short walk away. Yes, the rooms are on the small side but the footprint of the hotel leaves little room for expansion. Yes, the lobby is a little dark (wood panelling) and some areas could do with a lick of paint but this is not a problem as I doubt that few people are going to spend much waking time in either! There are â€˜boutiqueâ€™ hotels near by if thatâ€™s what you want â€“ but here itâ€™s old school history and tradition. The â€˜Business Centreâ€™ (two computer terminals near the gift shop) currently allows you to print up to four airline boarding cards for free. Other internet activity is charged at $7 per 15 mins (credit card) or $15 for a 30 min pre-paid card. You can save on the (sometimes astronomical) charges for telephone calls from your room by using the public â€˜phones down by the gym in the lower lobby. Also here are the restrooms but youâ€™ll need your key card to access them!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ysottot
Reviews.Content: AAA say it's a 3 star not 4 star hotel. I did priceline. Good price for the room. Very nice lobby with wireless internet. Everything is walking distance or local transit is nearby. Very convient location. Nice room. double bed was no problem. Room had pay for internet connection so we made drinks in our room and sat around the lobby for the free internet. Great resturants in area. For breakfast ask the Concierge for a list of breakfast places. the Hotel breakfast was ok but cost $25 for two. Just steps away is a place that is excellent for $10 for two.I would stay there again. I forgot a pair of shorts and shirt in the drawer. If this was a real 4 star they would have contacted me and sent them. But I still recommend the hotel if you can get a good price. Parking? find a place that is near. Hotel wants $40 a day for valet so add another $5 or more. There are pleanty of places around that are in the 30's.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel with Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week while in Boston for a work conference. It was conveniently located near the Government center, Fanueil hall, Boston Commons - all walking distance. Several subway (T stop) stations nearby. Great location. Rooms were remodeled, on the smaller side - but with great historic charm. Service was higher than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: csmclm
Reviews.Content: The good things: beautiful lobby, excellent service, very well equipped room (lovely linens, flat screen TV, refrigerator, robes, coffeemaker, easy to set alarm clock/MP3 player), central location. The bad things: no wi-fi, tiny room. Make sure you check the hotel's website for special rates (we got 3 nights for the price of 2) and DEFINITELY sign up for the Select Guest program (free drinks and newspaper delivered to your room in the morning, free internet, free bottled water). Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gordy61
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel on numerous occasions, and whilst my wife and like it and keep coming back, we are always apprehensive at check in about what the room will be like. We stayed here a year ago and the room was tiny, and certainly marred the visit. We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of September, and it was only when we showed the front desk our Omni Select Card, that we were "upgraded" to a larger room, saying that it was still small. However, saying all that, it is still a Hotel we will come back to, the Restaurant is excellent, Breakfast is really worth looking forward to, the Last Hurrah bar, is truly a great place to have a late evening cocktail, and the location is right on where you want to be for all that Boston offers.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Jepeter
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, no minibar?, noisy air conditioner, tiny bathroom that needs a remake, and no view (a wall). The quality is ok, but for the price, overall I was disappointed. The staff were nice and location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location for Touring”
Reviews.Author: macotak
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days while touring Boston. 1 block to the commons, 2 blocks to Quincy Market, 1 block to the 'T' subway. We had a very large, very comfortable 'Exec Suite' room which was reasonably priced purchased in advance. All services at the expected level of a 4 star downtown classic. Parker House restaurant food was unremarkable, but we did have great Parker House rolls and Boston Creme Pie... their originals. Right on the Freedom Trail... not a better location in town for a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Charm in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DolceMeta
Reviews.Content: This Omni is one of my favorite Boston hotels. The service is wonderful and the location is great. Close to many Boston sites, dining and entertainment. Parking is a bit pricey, but valet is convenient in the city. The rooms, specifically the suites, are nice and roomy, but the bathrooms are very small in some of them. In addition, the meeting spaces are great for Business.

Reviews.Title: “Omni re-visited”
Reviews.Author: Irelandeye
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in the Omni again as it is in a great location. As we were travelling without off-spring we opted for a deluxe room rather than a suite and it was fine for two people - do not book the traditional room if you are looking for a spacious room. Door staff attention was much improved from our vist last year - though the doors were grubby and could do with a good clean! We asked for a non- feather room and had to make three requests before this was done. Also the walls were very thin and we had to eventually complain about the noise in the next room - this was dealt with promptly - we have never had this problem before - quite obviously this is because rooms have been sub- divided. As always, we enjoyed our stay despite the few complaints - though we got no acknowledgement or apology for the room not being as requested.- we ate one night in Emmets Irish pub which was quite near and it was very nice and good value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Hellfire500
Reviews.Content: Before you stay here, you must sign up to the Omni Select Guest loyalty programme on their website - this gives you numerous benefits for absolutely nothing such as free internet access and 2 free drinks delivered to your room each morning. Staff here are very courteous (the level of service is outstanding) and the hotel location is superb - just around the corner is Boston Common / Beacon Hill / Fanehuil Hall and Washington Street (shopping). My room was a deluxe room with 2 double beds so space was not an issue - beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was pretty small. The only slight issue was noise levels - as this is an old hotel I can understand that soundproofing is not great, but one thing which was irritating was the bell of the lift - my room was very close to the lifts, so at night when trying to sleep, every few mins the bell on the lift would ring when it arrived - I would advise anyone staying here to ask for a room away from the lifts. Overall, a very nice hotel with no major issues.

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon We'll Never Forget”
Reviews.Author: maggs219
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the doors of this beautiful and historic hotel, we felt welcomed and special. All of the staff we encountered were incredibly friendly and helpful. The front desk made special accommodations for us because we were there on our honeymoon and the room we were able to stay in was so much more than we were expecting. We had views of the Freedom Trail and much more space than we thought we would have.
