The Last Hurrah and Parker House restaurant/bar were top notch and the concierge desk staff were especially helpful to us in finding our way to Fenway and the Theater district. The Parker House is within close distance of the Freedom Trail and many pubs/restaurants that we were able to walk to. The "T" subway is also nearby at the Boston Common. We can't wait until we can come back and stay at the Parker House again-it was a fantastic experience that we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: Bnthere4u
Reviews.Content: Nice decorating, lobby was atttractive, only offered Valet parking or nearby " public parking for a fee. Main entrance on School street was difficult getting to, and once you arrived the street was fairly narrow not allowing much room to pull over if you drove a car also did not have a canopy in case of inclement weather. Rooms were VERY small but did have" in room safe", internet available but only for a fee- down the block across the street from Borders book store was a cafe with wi-fi for free . Biggest advantage was Hotel is located on Boston's "Freedom Trail" for sightseers, and public transportation is very convenient. Would not stay there again when traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “grand historic hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxduo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Boston a few times in various locations - such as Westin Copley Square and others. The Parker House is in the best location by far. It is near to every place we wanted to visit.It is an easy walk to : North end to all the Little Italy restaurants; to Feneuil Hall; the waterfront. My husband attended meetings while I enjoyed exploring. The hotel is in a safe area. I walked everywhere and felt safe whilst on my own. The hotel is located directly ON the Freedom Trail.You walk out the front or side door and you are right on the painted red path. This is such an enjoyable undertaking - walking to as few or as many of the points on the trail. Get a free photo copy at the consierge or buy a Freedom Trail booklet ( 4-7 usd) at the Public Gardens info booth. Go left out the front door - 5 mins to booth in Public Gardens-the trail starts here. Read the booklet and start walking. It is delightful to check off the places that you see. I found it to be a good educational pastime.One can read a bit in the hotel room, walk to a few, read some more, explore some more. I did one or several -depending on time/mood over several days. One could do them all in a day but given the perfect location of the hotel,you can chose the pace that works best for your schedule. In addition to the great location, the hotel is from the glorious days of the big grand hotels. It is enjoyable to sit in the lobby and soak in the details of this historic building. It is the best of history and modern ammenities. The recent complete renovation was done beautifully to restore it to a grandness of another era.....with all the conveiences of modernity. Our room was well decorated and had a regal feel to it. Nicely furnished and great linens. While it was not large in size, it was not too small either. Not to worry given all the reviews in this regard. We found it to be well-laid out with lots of storage space. The only unfortunate comment about the room was that the air conditioner blocked any view out the window. Here is where modernity meets an historic building. So no problem. There was still lots of light coming in to the room and given the 90 degree heat outside, we were glad for the A/c rather than the view.Overall we were most pleased with the room. Due to the older building, there are many different layouts. So discuss your preferences on your reservation or at check in time. Then enjoy your stay. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, historic hotel in excellent location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: RR2008
Reviews.Content: Well maintained with a beautiful lobby. Rooms were small with basic tub/shower (grout needed a good clearning but rest of the room and bathroom seemed quite clean). Beds were comfortable with nice linens. Fantastic location for sightseeing in Boston. Loved the Boston cream pie - their specialty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for everything!”
Reviews.Author: nancymommydearest
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for the Chicago White Sox/ Red Sox game and chose to stay in the city. We did not have a car, and this location was perfect for public transportation, and walking distance to many of the things we wanted to do. I booked on Priceline, and it did not mention the one double bed, so I contacted the hotel manager, and she offered me a king-sized bed for a small fee per night. After reading other reviews, I am so glad we upgraded...our room was fine, not as small as people seem to say.The bathroom was small without a vanity to spread your stuff out, but we managed fine. The staff was very helpful with directions and friendly when we walked in the lobby. There is a very quaint feel to this hotel and it was a wonderful experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: campertwins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. My spouse and I do not drive and thus we need find a location at downtown which is closed to public transportation. We stayed at this hotel and we basically walked to everywhere. Very convenient place which it's step away to convenience store such as 7-Eleven, CVS, McDonald, Burger King, etc. Train station is just steps away, this is very close to Quincy Market as well. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel which is in the middle of everywhere. I bid this hotel at priceline and thus we were offered for a very small room, 1 double bed only. I guess we got what we paid for. We wish the bed is bigger though. Other than that, the hotel is very clean and staffs are very polite. There is free Wi Fi service at hotel lobby, no swimming pool at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: kiltipper
Reviews.Content: I think the title above speaks for itself. Whether you're visiting this great city for business or pleasure you can't beat this hotel for location. The hotel is within walking distance to all major visitor attractions as well as major stores for shopping, the financial district and the waterfront. The airport is only minutes away and will cost you about $30 in a cab. Boston is a city where you will not need a car unless you intend going further afield as it has excellent public transport. The hotel lobby is like stepping back in time (in a good way), full of charm and old style luxury. Let me say that this hotel has the fastest check-in that I have ever experienced. We arrived at approximately 4pm and all we had to do was show our passports, our room keys were waiting for us behind the desk and the whole thing took no more than 2 minutes. The rooms are small as is to be expected for such an old hotel, but it was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The walk in shower had good pressure and there was never a shortage of hot water. The bathroom could do with a little more shelf space. A couple of criticisms are the corridors could do with a bit of decoration/freshening up, on the Tues. night all the ice machines on every floor (I checked them all) were turned off, presumably for cleaning and there was a bit of a stale odour outside our room (5th floor), possiblly coming from an air vent nearby. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel so I can't comment on the facilities but there are plenty of decent eateries nearby. Overall I have to say I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would definitely return. And as I said earlier the Omni Parker House Hotel has THE BEST LOCATION IN BOSTON. TIP - if you want to save a few dollars take the Blue Line shuttle bus from the airport terminal to the Blue Line T (subway) station. The T costs just $2 one way. Get off at Government Centre and when you come up out of the station turn left onto Tremont Street. The Omni Parker House is about 200m down on your left.

Reviews.Title: “The Freedom Suite is SWEET!”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonMom30
Reviews.Content: We splurged to go to the Omni for two days on our way up to New England. We wanted to stay in close to all the attractions but also wanted a true suite..one that has a door to separate the sleeping areas so when the kids go to sleep at 7pm we are not forced to sleep as well. The Omni was the only one we could find with these qualifications. We splurged on the Freedom Trail suite (only available on their website) and were SO glad that we did. The kids (age 2 and 5) did not want to leave the room to go out to the aquarium or other sites ! The suite is more than as advertised. First, there is so much room compared to what others noted in the reviews! The living space is larger than our first apt in DC. The kids had a nice quality bunk bed, a table with kids' chairs, a whole wall to color with chalk, dress up period costumes (which seemd to be VERY clean much to my happiness and appeared washable), and books about the area. They also received a fun backpack (cardboard with real straps that they both wore for 48 hours straight minus bath and sleep time) with a canteen, flashlight, and a few other items at check in. They also got milk and cookies delivered to the room the first night. They were in heaven! I was very pleased with the suite because of the adult bedroom which was luxurious and came with about 10 books to read about historical Boston. So nice to read while the kids were winding down. The noise of our kids for other hotel patrons was not a problem as the air conditioners had a nice white noise effect. The hotel of course is ideally located and has all the amenities you would expect at an Omni. I was just so pleased with their attention to the kids' needs and thought our dollars were very well spent! As a note, the valet parking was costly, but easy when we arrived during rush hour. There is a garage around the corner that charges about $20 a day if you are organized and can get your luggage to the hotel by yourself (not possible when traveling 10 hours in the car with two small children and no DVD). One more thing, the view was less than spetacular (the cooling vents!!) but really did not detract at all because of the amenities in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice But a Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: T-Lock
Reviews.Content: First - definitely sign up for the Select Guest - they had everything ready when we got there - check-in was under 30 seconds. They had bottled water delivered to our room the first night and brought cookies to the kids. The rooms are extremely small but beautiful. The lobby is grand and the 2 lounges are great. I felt as if we were in a different era. The parking is expensive but we didn't feel like walking the extra 2 blocks to go park the car. The concierege was very helpful. Great location to everything in Boston. We did a lot of walking but had a great time. The Boston Creme Pie was OK - expected something really amazing but was not what the sign showed in front of the restaurant. Overall - a nice place I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location...would stay again”
Reviews.Author: IRISHGIRL767
Reviews.Content: Location...awesome. We had a suite...which was really just bigger than a regular room so you didn't feel so claustrophobic. The room was awesome. It was extremely clean as was the bathroom. Staff was so very friendly and helpful! The beds were OMG! like sleeping on a cloud. They were doubles ...so a little small for my liking, but not a big deal. We got room service for breakfast ...that was good too. and they deliver it when you ask! There is however, a $40 charge for parking...so we parked our car 10 minutes away at a friends house in Chelsea. The staff was nice enough to let us leave our car parked out on the street while we checked in and waited for our friend to meet us. They also let us leave our luggage and shopping bags AFTER we checked out so we could walk around Boston and make the most of our last day. That in itself was great. I've read on here someone complaining about the slow elevators...well they were fine for me. You have 4 elevators and 13 or 14 flrs...people just need to have a little patience. We vacation in Boston for a weekend every Aug. This was our first visit to the Omni...but it won't be our last. I plan on booking this hotel every year. It was less than a 5 min walk to Fanuel hall. There is a parking garage around the corner...I think next year we will park there instead. It's about $15/day. Oh I don't want to forget the housekeeping. Our housekeeper was so great. Saturday was downpouring and we went out anyway. We got back...soaked. Our housekeeper was cleaning our room...she left us extra towels so we could if we chose to take a hot shower and still have a dry towel for the following morning! So thoughtful! Just stay away from the basket of $3 snickers...lol and the mini bar soda! OH oH also..we rented a movie for $14.99...(I thought a bit much.) well....about the last 1/2 hr was rolling..and audio was fading in and out. I called the front desk and was told the wind was interferring with the satellite. They took the $14.99 off my bill! Great Great... Clean ..Clean Hotel. on a funny note....a drunken guest in the elevator told us that we needed to check out the "ghosts" on the 3rd floor. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pepp7091
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed a 3-day, 2-night stay here. Scored a very low price via one of the bidding web sites and were pleasantly shocked to be automatically comped with a free upgrade from a traditional room to a deluxe room at check-in. The staff was extremely helpful, the room was fairly small but very inviting, and everything was spotless. The location couldn't be beat, right on the Freedom Trail with plenty of dining choices within walking distance, as well as being close to Quincy Market. We also felt very safe walking around downtown even at night. Typical of a large city, parking was outrageous ($40/night valet) but had free in/out service during the stay. Though the exact name escapes me, there is a free program that you should sign up for during your stay. It'll get you free drinks delivered to your room in the a.m. along with your choice of newspaper and free wireless internet. We were also treated the first night with "cookies and cream" delivered to our door (it was actually whole milk and raisin cookies but it was the thought that counted).

Reviews.Title: “not a great weekend”
Reviews.Author: beachchic09
Reviews.Content: When I started planning our romantic weekend gettaway, Omni was my first choice. I felt it was perfect for our trip to explore historic Boston. As far as location goes I really can't complain on that aspect of the hotel. However, I am very dissapointed on another point. 3 times during our stay the fire alarm was "accidently" pulled twice of which was at 2 am! This of course resulted in us grabbing our clothes running, running down 4 flights of stairs. One time during a stay I can completely understand and excuse, but 3 come on! When asked about this after little to no sleep, the front desk said this wasn't common and that someone off the street had walked in and pulled the alarm-3 times? very comforting. I felt something should have been done to our rate considering this happened everyday of our stay. Yet, when we checked out nothing! Plus, we were pretty tired after the drama of it all. So needless to say I won't be staying there again, unless something changes. Our room was small, but that didn't bother me at all,compared to the alarms! All things considered, I would have recommended this hotel if it had not been for the unpleasant side of our stay, or if the manager had done somethin for us. Boston was a great city to visit, though and we totally fell in love with the play Sheer Madness-it is a must see while in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosielikestotravel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, clean, great comfy beds, very pleasant and helpful staff, and a great restaurant attached to it. We were there for two stays in August. The first stay was for 4 nights and we had a large room. Only complaint was that the bathroom didn't have a sideboard/table and we had to put our tolietries on the window sill. The second stay was for 1 night and I thought the room was a bit crowded because the King size bed took all the room but since it was one night and all we did was sleep so we could catch the plane the next day, this didn't bother us; but if it was for 4 nights, I might have asked for a bigger room. I feel compelled to write this review because we read some unflattering reviews about this hotel and almost didn't stay in it. It also is in a great location, right on the Freedom Trail, you can't possible get lost and right on the transit line straight to the airport or catch other transits about 1 block away, also easy to walk everywhere from here. Very safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel with Small Rooms But At A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: S136
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and has very small rooms.... The decor at the hotel is a little bit outdated. Parking will cost you $40+ a night..... The hotel is situated at one of the most convenient locations in the financial district though.... steps to the subway station and quincey market helped make my stay enjoyable. The room was won on [--].com for a low price (110/night on weeknights)

Reviews.Title: “A grand old gentleman in the heart of old Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fabregasuk
Reviews.Content: There was something about this place that reminded me of my Grandparents. In a good way. Perhaps it was because it, like them, was from a different era. I would like to say an age of glamour, were it not for the fact that my Grandfather fought in World War One. But you know what I mean. Perhaps it was also the homely feel of the thick carpets in the corridors and the wooden furniture - oh, and the rooms which needed a bit of doing up.. Whatever it was, this place just felt very welcoming, very old (but certainly not tired) and very peaceful. Perhaps we were just glad to get some rooms; after deciding to flee the aching dullness of the Bradford Inn in Chatham (even their no refund policy did not stop us from checking out of that place a night early - nor the 'energy charge' which we had to pay on energy which we did not actually use...) we very nearly did not get a place in Boston. We had started the holiday at the Back Bay and after giving up on Chatham, thought it would be nice to have our last night back in the City. No availability (what credit crunch?!) anywhere, but a few rooms left in the Omni. If you go to Boston, check it out, even if only to have a look at the lobby. It is a great, well maintained, example of old school decadence and luxury. The brassy lift doors are stunning, the chandelier looks like a prop from Phantom and the place just says 'this was one of America's great hotels'. Of course, now it isn't, and yes, we are spoilt for choice. But our rooms were good, clean and well air conditioned; the bathrooms were clean and had good water pressure and the staff were very friendly and full of smiles. We were also full of smiles when we saw the name of a conference which was being held there - I think it was 'communication skills for accountants' or something like that - anyway, it tickled us. This or the Back Bay is the question you want me to answer if you have checked on my reviews - the Back Bay sneaks it and I had more nights there so can give a fuller review, but this old gent certainly knows how to put a bit of stick about at its younger competition.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Austinite_7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location, nice people. Thanks to an earlier reviewer, I knew to sign up in advance for their select-guest program, and enjoyed the free milk/cookies and morning beverages. They also gave our daughter a backpack with little toys in it on check in--a HUGE hit with her. Our room was on the 9th floor and was a comfortable size, and beautifully appointed. We saw a room on the 5th floor and it was noticeably smaller (but typical of an older hotel room size.) I think the higher floors might all be a little larger (plus, less street noise.) Our only complaint was noise. We were initially concerned that our room was close to the elevator, but that ended up being unimportant. Rather, the noise came from the rooms on either side of us. The other guests were speaking in normal volumes, not yelling or 'being loud' and we could still hear them so well that I could have participated in the conversation. I knew they were probably gritting their teeth the next morning when our preschooler threw a tantrum. We counted ourselves very lucky that our neighbors all turned in early--truly loud/late people would have been a fairly significant problem. But, overall it was a fantastic place to stay. We booked via priceline and got a great rate. Location can't be beat, beautiful hotel, and every staff person we dealt with was great. We'd definitely stay there again if we could

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed but with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dacuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The room sizes were disappointing (much smaller than the Omni in Washington DC) but were clean and adequate. We can't fault the location - everything is on your doorstep. Upon checking in the receptionist advised us that our room had been paid for, then she asked for a 'Voucher'. We gave her the booking confirmation provided by our agents (as we had done in the last two hotels). She queried it because it didn't say 'Voucher' at the top!!. We explained that this had not been a problem at the previous hotels (one of which was the Omni in Washington DC) and she knew herself that the room was paid for. We felt uncomfortable. At this point she checked with a colleague who told her in no uncertain terms that our reservation was good as it stood (perhaps a little more training needed when dealing with clients in a hotel like this?). This didn't spoil our stay, though, as the rest of the staff were excellent and professional. Breakfast in the dining room was great. The decor is something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Boston Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: whitemtnlady
Reviews.Content: I have many clients in Boston and always stay at the Omni Parker House when in town. My rooms have ranged from a very small room with a double bed to an upgrade to a suite this past stay. If you get the chance to book the Tip O'Neil Suite, I highly recommend it. The rooms have all of the amenities you could want and it's always very clean. If you want a very large, modern hotel, then the Omni Parker House might not be for you. But if you want a beautiful and charming piece of Boston's history then you should give it a try. The restaurant is top notch as well.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Dark Rooms”
Reviews.Author: beyondthedoor
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is elegantly appointed an the common areas, but the room itself had an awful lot to be desired! The room was TINY! 2 Full size beds were crammed in, leaving less than 3 feet space from the foot of the bed to the wall! A huge amoire with an old tv was in the corner, leaving barely enough room to crawl over the bed to get to the window/huge noisy AC/heating unit which takes up the entire wall. Barely any window to speak of, giving the room a dark, dreary atmosphere. Absolutely no room whatsoever for any kind of table for eating. Had to sit on the bed and eat from a tray. Tha bathroom was peeling wallpaper and cramped. The small night table in-between the 2 beds contained a basket of little snacks, which my son mistakingly opened the jar of gummy bears, so I was charged $15 for it!!! Overpriced hotel for what you are actually getting for accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Severely Fell Short of Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: tracitrace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House hotel with a friend of ours from San Francisco, and none of us would ever stay there again! We were expecting a 4 star, charming, elegant and classic hotel, and that is NOT what we got. The parking was $40 per day! Yes, $40 per day... it's outrageous! The elevators were small and constantly packed with an uncomfortable number of people. And, our room was literally the size of a shoebox. It was nicely decorated and furnished, but it was SO small we could barely get our suitcases open! There was also virtually NO window! The entire wall was taken up by a loud, annoying air conditioner, and what was left of the wall was a tiny peephole window that was about 5 feet off the ground. So, we couldn't even see out of this window! Our friend's room was EVEN SMALLER if you can believe it! At least he actually had a small window, but it overlooked a disgusting, dirty back alley! And, he could barely move around in his bathroom! Lovely. We called the front desk requesting a larger room, and they were a little rude and totally NOT accommodating. They said they were fully booked. So, we figured we'd just make the best of our little cubicle. We had a LONG day, and we walked quite a bit around Boston, so we were looking forward to a nice restful evening. However, we found ourselves jolted out of sleep at 2:30am when some loud, drunk people staying near our room were laughing and shouting in the hallways. The walls were so thin that it felt like they were laying in bed with us! It was horrible! Then, the noise stopped, and right when we were falling back asleep again, there was a loud knock on the door! We couldn't believe it. We called the front desk, and they apologized and said it was probably the security guard knocking to make sure everything was okay. Again... lovely. And this was during a weekday! We can't imagine what it's like on the weekend at this hotel! The location of the hotel was good, but everything else was either just mediocre or poor. We would recommend staying just a few steps down the block at the Nine Zero Kimpton Hotel. You will have a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “historic, relaxing and convenient”
Reviews.Author: maine4man
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, mid-week, on a quick getaway. Hotel staff friendly and helpful (let us check out 2 rooms and pick; had a bit of trouble with wi-fi connection, tech there in 5 min to fix). King room was comfy and clean, if a bit small (hey, its an old, historic hotel in a city!). Great location - 1 block from Gov Ctr "T" sta and 2 blocks from State St sta. Easy walk to Aquarium, Quincy Mkt, & Boston Common to name a few. Hotel has JFK history and is on Freedom Trail. Lots of places with good food in the area - no need to spend $$$ in the hotel. Last Hurrah in the lobby is a great place to relax after a long day of sighseeing. Deals can be had on room rates. Free wireless in lobby, not room, unless you are a member of Omni Select (free & IMHO, worth it). Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Historic Hotel - Loved the history of the place”
Reviews.Author: Drakan
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Omni Parker House. Yes, the rooms are small and we expected that. We thought the room was very nice and I wish I could have brought the bed back home with me. We had breakfast in the dining room each of the three mornings and the food and service was excellent. They even have the famous Boston Cream Pie available at breakfast if you wish, but I couldn't get enough of the pancakes and French toast. Highly recommended. Will stay there again next time I'm in Boston, hopefully for a marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Hotel! Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: AZyoung
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Omni and were immediately greeted by Joe, one of the doormen. He loaded our bags on a cart and escorted us into the reservation desk. Check in was quick and the front desk staff was friendly. The hotel lobby is exquisite with the ambience one would expect from the early days. Ornate crown molding adorns the walls. Our room was on the 4th floor room 462; we didnâ€™t have a view but didnâ€™t need one because the view in the room itself was fabulous with two beds, a sofa sleeper, two chairs, a desk, two closets, a small changing room. While the bathroom was small it worked fine for the four of us. The bathroom was very nice and clean. We parked at the Post Office parking garage, itâ€™s in walking distance to the hotel. The cost was $9 from Saturday evening until Monday morning as compared to the $40 per day for Omni valet parking. Stop in at the Parker Lounge for famous Boston cream pie you wonâ€™t regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Dreary Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaMontreal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The Valet parking was excellent as was the check-in. Everything seemed to do downhill from there. We had booked a junior suite. We were brought up to a room that was no bigger than a large closet and very dark. After requesting a better room we were brought to another suite that was acceptable in size but was very dark and gloomy. All of the suites are on the side of the building that faces directly onto another building making the rooms very dark and there is absolutely no view ! The bathroom was ridiculously small. The room layout was incomprehensible, we tried to move the furniture around to make more space but some items were bolted down. Three times we were given the wrong information from the hotel's concierge, once about a restaurant, once about store opening hours and another time about not telling us about closures of certain sights on Mondays. The hotel location is fabulous, right on the Freedom Trail. There are many other well situated hotels in the old Boston to choose from rather than this dreary old musty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: TW66
Reviews.Content: Luckily we had only booked 1 night at this Hotel and the rest at Hotel Marlowe (great hotel). We arrived to the Hotel after a very long flight and was told at check in that the room that we had paid for wasnÂ´t available. We had booked a two bed room, and was than given a room with a queen bed. So we didnÂ´t have a good sleep in this tiny bed. The room was also very small, also the bathroom. And the wiew of the room was towards a backyard. This is a hotel I will never return to, I have stayed in 2 star hotels that is more comfortable than this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, superb concierge, small bathroom, mediocre housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: mothersfriend
Reviews.Content: Best tip for this place is to sign up for the hotel "select guest" program. It's free online and they give you free drinks (brought us 5 water bottles and hot chocolate for five every morning!!) and newspaper every morning. The water came in really handy. Don't bother with the 1 liter Evian bottles they try to sell you for $6 in the room. Go to the 7 eleven down the block and get a gallon for $1.99 and just refill the free bottles they give you in the morning with the select guest program. Another great tip is to get the packages. We did the Freedom Trail package and it was a good bargain. Room is originally $453 per night but we got it for $280 and it came with buffet breakfast every morning for 5, freedom trail tour (only for 4), backpack activities for the kids and an executive suite with 2 doubles, sofa bed, and we got an extra roll away so all the kids got their own bed. Be prepare for tiny bathroom. Only one at a time. Housekeeping is slow but once they do come they do a nice job, especially with turndown service, which again, is free with select service...you normally have to request this but they do it automatically for you if you're a select member and on the first night they even bring cookies and milk for the kids. Nice touch. Walls are thin and you can hear doors slamming and traffic outside but we were so exhausted from days' activities and time change that we still slept fine. Our bed was a little lopsided but still soft and comfortable. OH, and the table at breakfast, now that I think about it, was also lopsided. Interesting... Location was awesome. You can pretty much walk everywhere. If it wasn't summer and the heat wasn't so fierce, we would have walked alot more. Freedom trail is literally outside your door and the frog pond, marketplace, playgrounds, merry-go-rounds, and such are around every corner. Do the duck tour. Worth it to get a good overview. Do it early in the trip so you can get a lay of the land early on. Didn't have time to do the science museum but everyone seemed to be telling us to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, park the car and walk everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: trinewt
Reviews.Content: This location is great for the family. We were able to walk to Quincy Market in 5 min. The hotel was friendly, clean and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heathergill
Reviews.Content: Had two nights at this lovely old traditional hotel. Loved the luxurious ambience of the lobby and dining room. It has a fantastic location right in the centre of everything. We had booked a two bedded room but our flight was delayed by one day and it seems they had sold our room and could only offer us a suite with a sofa bed which turned ot OK but would rather have had two proper beds as booked. There was no bath - just a shower which wet everywhere. Only one bedside table and noisy air conditioning but overall a lovely experience. The breakfast is OK - service is great and dining room worth the visit

Reviews.Title: “Great price, room and location.”
Reviews.Author: Pcolafamily
Reviews.Content: We booked the internet rate room for a family vaction to Boston and were very pleased. The hotel staff were very helpful. The location in relaiton to the major Boston tourist attractions, Boston Common and subway station is great. Restaurants and shopping are within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Center of Boston.....but”
Reviews.Author: BensonVT
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is the home, so they say, to Parker House Rolls and Boston Cream Pie. In other words, this hotel is OLD, the oldest continuously operating hotel in Boston, and they take pride in that fact. Even allowing for this fact, a few things make the Omni less than a four-star hotel. Bathroom. No vanity!! The bathroom was big, well maintained, and completely devoid of any flat-place (other than the window sill) to rest a glass, makeup, or a toothbrush. Dark. No overhead lighting and the light from the lamps and sconces was very dim. Beds. High off the floor and not very comfortable. HVAC. A through the wall unit that was hard to adjust and basically ended up leaving you freezing or hot and humid. Hot and humid were also the norm for the halls, elevators, and other common areas. On a positive note, the room and the hotel were well maintained, the staff was great, and the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, Valet Parking Rude”
Reviews.Author: Ganymede77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker House weekend of July 18. The hotel was fine. Expect a small room and you won't be disappointed. We experienced a major disappointment, however, with valet service. When they brought my car around at checkout they pinned it between two other cars and were rudely unresponsive to my request to extricate the car. I followed up with a phone complaint to the hotel manager a day later. She essentially said it wasn't the hotel's responsibility because they outsource this. Nice. I'll stay elsewhere on my next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: CCCharland
Reviews.Content: Going to Boston for our 23rd anniversary, my husband and I were looking at rates online (various sites) and found some really good rates for this hotel. We have had bad luck in the past booking through online sites so we thought we would call the hotel directly and make our reservations. I spoke to a vary nice gentleman and was easily assited in making our reservation for a premier room. The gentleman tried to get us to book a suite but we decided that we wouldn't be spending that much time in the room so a premier room woudl be fine. We told them that we were coming for our anniversary and that we had ticktets to the RedSox game and were very excited to be staying there. Check in was a breeze and we were wisked off to our room. The bellman who helped us with our luggage (2 backpacks -we were only there for 1 night) told us about the hotel on our ride up to the 8th floor. He asked what room we were in and when we told him he said "that room is a very nice room, you will like it" I expected they say that about all their rooms, but... He took us down the hallway and then down a smaller hallway to a door that said "The Joseph and Rose Kennedy Suite". My husband and I looked at each other, surely they made a mistake, we didnt book a suite! We were lead into a very nice decorated room with flat screen tv, couch, chair, otoman, desk and small fridge. Off to the side was our bedroom with a King size bed - the room was much more than we expected. Like the bellman said, we did like it! Since we only had about an hour before game time, we dropped our bags and went off to find the T. Back down in the lobby we asked how to get to Fenway and were directed to the train (about a block away) - the game was ok, they lost, but it wasnt a complete waste cause hey... I was at Fenway! We decided to walk back tothe hotel since it was a nice night out and less than 2 miles away - we walked down Commenwealth and around Boston Commons (next block over from the hotel). Upon our return to the hotel we were surprised to find a bottel of Moet in our room with chocolate dipped strawberries! Next to the bottle was a card from Guest services congratulating us on our 23rd anniversary and welcoming us to the hotel! We were so surprised - we go away every year for our anniversary and this was the first time this had ever happened! We decided that whenever we come to Boston this was our hotel of choice! This hotel is so close to everything - Theater District, Harbor, Quincy Market, Boston Commons, you name it and you can do it within walking distance! We have been back since then and have had similar experiances with staff. We both highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Boston area. Oh and my husband wants all the night owls to know that after an evening out with friends to come back to the room and order room service at 2am is awesome! The chicken pot pie and steak sandwich is great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with Old City Feel and Modern Updates”
Reviews.Author: webegail27
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at this hotel for one night as part of a surprise birthday trip for my friend's 30th. After browsing the many hotels Boston has to offer, I chose the Omni Parker House mainly for it's location and price. We chose to pay the 21-day advance purchase price and believe we paid $210 for the night. We had a two double bed room on the 6th floor. We made excellent time driving up in the morning from Philadelphia and arrived at the city earlier than expected. Around 11am, we pulled over at a rest stop and called the hotel to inquire about early an check-in. The friendly receptionist informed us that while our room was not ready, we could still check-in to another room, but we would not get a room with a view. She told us our other option would be to come and check-in, store our bags and then come back when our room was ready. We decided to stop at Fenway Park (awesome) first and wait to check-in to the hotel. We still ended up getting to the hotel earlier than stated check-in time, but our room was ready. The very friendly staff checked us in and stored our car. We used the valet parking, which cost us $40. We had to pick it up by 1pm the following day, but we decided to pay the $12 fee for keeping it there longer while we did our final tour of the city after we checked out. We found our room perfect for our needs, and we were very excited that we held out for our room with a view. Our room's view was of School Street and Old City Hall. It was fun for us to look out our window and see the hustle and bustle of the busy city around us. The central location of this hotel to the touristy areas of downtown was my favorite thing about it. The walk to Faneuil Hall took less than 15 minutes. We took a trolley tour on Sunday and were amused that the Omni Parker House was one of the attractions, although our tour guide informed us we were "doomed" since the hotel was said to be haunted! :) Make sure you stop by the front desk for a print-out of the alleged ghost stories! The room itself was quaint, not small. Three women had no problem getting ready for a night out in the room, which I think says a lot! Our room had two double beds, a lounge chair a desk and a mini-bar with a nice flat screen on it. The bathroom was clean and again, large enough to accommodate our needs. We didn't hear any of our neighbors the whole time we were there and we hope they didn't hear us either! The air conditioner worked great and we cranked it up and were welcomed to a frosty room everytime we came back from our sightseeing. The beds were very comfortable with soft, clean linens and blankets. The lobby of this hotel was beautiful. My friends bought some fun stuff at the gift shop and although we were too exhausted to try it out, The Last Hurrah bar seemed like a great spot to unwind and hang out with friends. The elevators were easily accessible, except for Sunday's check-out time, but that's to be expected. We just hoofed it down the stairwell with our bags because we didn't feel like waiting. The elevators and hallways were very warm, but I'll take the warmth to stay in a hotel of this historical value. All the staff were very helpful accommodating our varied needs and everyone was very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to be in the heart of the city. All you have to do is walk out the front doors of the hotel to be in the midst of our nation's history, and it's great to stay in a hotel that is part of that!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: sicilianmum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parker House on a 10 day leisure trip to Boston. We did extensive research and comparisons of various rates, and ended up booking our stay through the Boston's Visitors Bureau. The rate for the room we wanted, a suite with a king bed, was better than the quotes we were getting at the various 'discount' booking sites. Add in our AAA discount and the rate fell below the quoted rates from the 'discount' booking sites for the Traditional rooms, which are much smaller and only have a full sized bed. In addition we received a discount card and coupons for many attractions throughout Boston for booking through the VB. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The Bellhop who carried our luggage to our room when we arrived was extremely friendly. Every day he would stop and ask us how our vacation was going and would give us great local places to visit that weren't on the 'tourist' list. The hotel was very clean and our room was beautiful. The suite was very comfortable and not tight in space. We did not feel cramped at all. It is an old building so don't expect huge expansive guest rooms, the rooms are very traditional to the period of the hotel. The hotel in whole is stunning, decorated to the opulence that was at the period it was built. They did a wonderful job in preserving the hotels ambience. We couldn't have asked for a better location. We were in walking distance to so many different sites and locations. We were also close to a 'T' (Boston's subway system) station which allowed us to venture farther than our feet could carry us. We honestly do not have any complaints about our stay at the Parker House. We are planning a family trip, this time bring the children with us since they are now a bit older, and we will definitely be staying at the Parker House again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: k8tangel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker House June 26-28, 2009. What a beautiful hotel! We received a very nice email prior to arriving from Kate, their Loyalty Ambassador welcoming us and if we needed anything to just let her. know. We had requested an early check-in but unfortunately is was too busy and our room wasn't ready until 3:00. Which was fine. They knew it was our anniversary and later that evening, we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and some chocolate covered strawberries along with a nice card from Kate. And if you're a member of their loyalty program, you get some nice perks. We received a bottle of Evian water and maid service in the afternoon. Our room was always clean. The bed was unbelievably comfortable! The staff was excellent!! Location was prime - within walking distance of most major attractions like Quincy Market, Boston Public Gardens/Commons, Fanueil Hall and Downtown Crossing. I would HIGHLY recommend staying here. Definately worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: lrm44
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House in Boston is a wonderful old hotel right on the Freedom Trail in Boston. The lobby is ornate. You are only minutes to the harbor one way and Boston Commons the other way. The rooms have been updated. We found a smaller room on Priceline for under $100. We especially enjoyed the helpful concierge that guided us each day to find the perfect activities. Overall a fantastic trip with this beautiful hotel. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Omni Parker House!”
Reviews.Author: beachloverok
Reviews.Content: I travel often and only provide honest reviews. Of all of the hotels I have stayed in, both in the U.S. and out, the Boston Omni Parker House sets a standard that will be hard to beat for a 'city' hotel. It is quite obvious that the manager of this establishment holds customer service as a priority. From the bell captains meeting us at the curb for our luggage, (on a rainy day, one offered to lift me over a puddle!!), to the front desk staff who made check-in a breeze and immediately asked what we had planned and showed us a map showing our destinations, everyone had a smile and offerings to assist in any way. The gentleman who brought our luggage to our room showed us where everything was, from light switches to who to call for for any reason. I had mentioned at check-in that our trip was to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday...imagine her surprise when we came back to the room after exploring the city to find a birthday card and chocolate covered strawberries! Their loyalty ambassador, Kate,and front desk staff are very attentive! We reserved a suite and it was well worth the extra money; the room was very large, with two dreamy beds and a sleeper sofa. Other reviews complained about the hotel rooms' bathroom size; I didn't see other rooms, however, ours was smallish but very up to date and had a large walk-in shower. So what, if only one person can get ready at a time in there; personally, I don't invite my family into the bathroom with me at home; I don't have congregations in the bathroom at a hotel either. Location: Perfect. The location does NOT get better for staying in Boston. One block down is the T station. The Parker House is ON the Freedom Trail, one block from Boston Common. The hotel is across the street from King's Chapel. Just down the street is a great bagel bakery called Brueggers. Two blocks down is Washington Street...hello Downtown Crossing shopping! A few blocks down and an intersection over...Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market with tons of shopping and restaurants. Cross the street from there...the wharf and yummy Legal Seafood. The restaurant inside the Parker House...delicious. The hotel's breakfast buffet was excellent. The staff was so friendly. (Made to order omelets from a very personable chef were soooo tasty!). To summarize......the hotel is so wonderful....upgrade to a suite, you won't regret it. The staff.....they deserve a raise....in a world that is sorely lacking in customer service, this hotel sets the standard on 'how' to do it. Oh...and I've stayed in other high star hotels in the Boston area in years past. Thanks Parker House for a wonderul stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at an old charmer”
Reviews.Author: LoriW1971
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay at the Parker House, and we couldn't have been more pleased with our experience. Knowing that the standard rooms tend to be on the smaller size, we sprung for an executive king suite. We took advantage of the Park and Stay package, which included parking and breakfasts. The room was spacious, with a well furnished sitting area, large flat-screen TV, and the most comfortable hotel bed in which we've ever slept. There was plenty of room for our son's blow-up bed, with ample room for him to play as well. The bathroom was small, but the suite did have a dressing area with a lighted vanity table that was perfect for stashing our toiletries. I was surprised to read other reviews that complained about noise; the hotel seemed rather full, but we found our room to be noticeably quiet. From the moment we arrived, the service was friendly and attentive. Every person we encountered, from the valet, to the bellhop, to the front desk staff, had a pleasant greeting for us and our young son (who was thrilled with the child's gift pack he received). Everyone was helpful with suggestions and information. At breakfast, the restaurant staff went out of their way to be gracious and accommodating of special requests. We asked that our room be made up before noon so our son could nap after lunch, and we were so pleased when we came back to a freshly-straightened room after a busy morning. Finally, the location of this hotel is spectacular. Quincy Market is just a couple of blocks away, and there are many historic sites nearby. It is just a short walk to the T station for travels further afield. Overall, we had a wonderful time, and will never stay anywhere else when we come to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: KraZ4food
Reviews.Content: For nearly 35 years I have wanted to stay at the Parker House and it was exactly as I had dreamed. We were greeted so warmly by the gentlemen valets and guided to super helpful desk staff. The porter was gracious and charming-- such service overall! Our room was small, but beautiful-- we didn't need anything different-- the furnishings were clean and comfortable--the bed was amazing--so soft and snuggly. It was very easy to order the FAMOUS Boston cream pie for BREAKFAST-- that was the best treat I've ever had! Definitely stay here if you get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room & bed, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lee01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. I booked a room via Priceline (my mistake) we were assigned a traditional room. The room was small but the real issue was the FULL size bed. When we were checking in I asked how much it would cost to upgrade and was told that the hotel was full and we could not upgrade. The sink & shower drains didn't work very well. The sink & tub filled up with water anytime you turned the water on. The room was also very dusty. The wall are paper thin. We could hear the elevator bells from our room. Its NOT a luxury hotel. The location is great and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EarningsGirl
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Omni Parker. The hotel and room were clean and amenities were nice. It has a lot of old school charm, and it was nice to have an AC that we could set / control in-room (minus the noise factor). The staff was polite and courteous, which was great to find after a long travel day. The downside of our stay was that the Omni Parker treats its "traditional rooms" as rooms for two adults -- even though they only have a double bed and are quite small. Both our room and bathroom were cramped. We're used to New England hotel rooms being slightly smaller than rooms in the Midwest or on the West Coast, but this was small even by those standards. Not a huge deal if you're not planning to spend a lot of waking hours in your room, but probably not the best if you're planning to hang out at the hotel during your trip. You can book a bigger / more expensive room through the hotel directly, but sadly, because we booked this hotel last minute on Priceline, we did not have an option to upgrade. Ideally management will stop listing their "traditional" rooms as rooms fit for 2 adults on Priceline and only use their queen / king size bedrooms instead. The location is very nice though, especially if you're planning on seeing historical sights and walking the freedom trail. it is only a 3-minute walk to the subway station at Park Street and has little conveniences (Starbucks, Bruegger's Bagels, CVS Pharmacy, 7-eleven) nearby. Because we were mainly in-town to see friends / celebrate the 4th, the good location and comfort of the hotel were worth the trade off for room size. Average for a 4-star hotel, but good overall stay -- if we could, we'd give it 3.5 stars overall.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best”
Reviews.Author: aug28
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at hte Omni Parker House, our first stay was refer by a friend in Boston. Our second stay we visited with my cousin, they enjoyed the hotel as well. We had reserved a room with one double and were given room with two doubles that was great .we were on the 10th floor view of the city front ,very nice. Bathroom are smal but good. Beds are the best very comfortable we had a nice sleep. nice staff ,lobby very historical ,flower arrangement in lobby very nice. Boston is a very nice city with alot of History. Go to little italy restaurants are the best, nice bistro all with a touch of italy .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: EdBear
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location right on freedom trail, near shops, Boston Common and T. Only 5-10 mins walk to Quincy Market for great food and shops. Hotel clean and plenty of old-style character. Very helpful concierge (Seamus). Only minor gripes were expensive hotel breakfast and internet access. Overall a fantastic choice.

Reviews.Title: “great historic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: atl_traveler_lax
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this Omni. It is on the Freedom Trail! It is a block from the T so it made it very easy to see the whole city. My family enjoyed the hotel's history. Guests included Charles Dickens and John Wilkes Booth. Former employees were Ho Chi Min and Malcolm X. The hotel was built in 1855 so it was truely unique. It is also home to the orginal Boston Creme Pie. My children had pie for breakfast! It was a memorable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel Does not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: JuliaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House with our 4 children, all who are 17 months apart ranging in age from 13 to 9. Usually such opulent hotels are not child-friendly, especailly with such a large group. We found the hotel not only child friendly, but warm and welcoming. We felt as if we were staying at a distant relatives house. Omni chain provides a lot of amenities for the younger set, this one does also, with milk and cookies at bedtime, and a rolling backpack full of games. For the adults it is plush, historic and very romantic. The concierge were helpful, knolegable and not afraid to give thier opinion of various activities about town. Food in the hotel is outstanding. This hotel is so accomodiating and friendly, Harvey Parker would be proud...and I am sure he is as he still occasionally appears to guests on the 3rd and 10th floor. This hotel's hauntings are repeatedly referd to all over the city, but don't worry, they have only ever been reported as friendly. Much to the dismay of my 12 year old son, we did not have any ghostly experiencies, only warm, friendly outstanding service at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Funning things do happen”
Reviews.Author: Jomesh
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was wonderful. The suite was very nice with comfortable beds. Our room had been updated. The bathroom was VERY small but extremely clean. Not knowing any history of this hotel. You just got the feeling this hotel had to be haunted. As we walked down the hall I mentioned this to my family. Later that night watching tv the light by the chair suddenly clicked off. I mention the light bulb must have burnt out, my husband said no it Clicked off as being turned off. Yes, I clicked it back on and it worked. Later we turned the bed light off and a minute later it came back on. My daughter and I looked at each other and just had to laugh..... My husband said it was all because I said it was haunted. It was a fun beautiful stay right in the middle of everything. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: ekerr19
Reviews.Content: After careful and considerable research we slected the Omni for a 3-night post cruise stay. We loved the location of the hotel - everything we needed was within easy walking distance. We stayed in one of their Suites, and it could not have been nicer. Because we disembarked in the morning, we knew our room would not be ready - but the staff secured all our luggage and gave us a claim check and promised to call us as soon as the room was ready. We thought the property was very nice and elegant and service top notch. I found out later during our stay that the room we were originally slated to receive had guests who did not bother to check-out on time and had in fact planned to stay another night (without checking availabilty) but the desk staff promptly switched us to the first available suite and we were checked-in by about 3:30pm - not too bad for a weekend in Boston. We enjoyed dinner in the hotel restaurant and hotel staff assisted us in getting to Fenway Park via the subway, which was a really easy way to travel. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: KateinCastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of days for sightseeing, and it was a great location. The hotel has plenty of character and history, the lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are a bit small, and my bathroom was very small, but I guess this is the price you pay for a hotel with plenty of character in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great experience at the Omni Boston”
Reviews.Author: popessa
Reviews.Content: I have finally found the time to write about my experience in May. Three things happened that ruined it for me. We went for 3 days to Boston and stayed at the Omni hotel which I had booked on Hotwire. To make a long storie short I was really disappointed by the size of the room. O am prestty sure I had a twin bed in that room , when I had specified a Queen-size bed on Hotwire. When I called to ask at the lobby, they said that The third party reservation (hotwire) was for a standard room, and that this was it. Of course they suggested an up-grade for 60$ extra a night which I declined. On the second day when we came back to our hotel room, the server on top of the desk drawer was alot fuller than the day we had arrived. I remember thinking to myself, I hope those things were not supposed to be there yesterday and that they will bill me for them later on. And sure enough, when I got my check-out bill, I had 58$ worth of junk food, snaks and drinks charged to my bill which I had never consummed. I called the front desk to tell them that this was a mistake and that the server was already empty the day we arrived. (I dont understand, we arrived 3 our earilier they sent us out the hotel cause our room wasn't ready they had ample time to make sure the fridge and junk food list were complete before they handed us the room. Anyway, luckily the nice guy by the name of Marc whom we had chated with the day we arrived, was the one working and he took care of removing the unfair charges on my bill. And lastly, when I finally got my credit card bill, they had once again charged an extra 10$ for I dont know what. All I know is that it wasn't on the final bill I agreed to, which included all the parking fees which were hi 40$ the first day and 25$ every extra day. The location was great and the lobby was nice but that was it. I wouldn't go back. Which is a shame cause I love Boston and will definetely be going back to that area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: eckythump
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of May. Booked a king bed room and was assigned a room on the 4th floor overlooking School St. Location is excellent, on the Freedom Trail right in the heart of Downtown crossing, easy to walk to Fanueil Hall, North End, Beacon Hill and Back Bay. Room was quite small but adequate, bed was very comfortable, bathroom small but functional. Room had a large flat screen tv, though no HD channels which was disappointing. Why upgrade to nice large flat screen tv's and not put any HD channels on? Make sure you sign up for the free Omni Select Guest program before you arrive. You get complimentary internet access (wired, wireless only in the lobby), newspaper, and a free beverage in the morning delivered to the room. Customer service is excellent. The worst part of this hotel is the extremely thin walls between rooms. You could easily hear conversations between people in the adjoining rooms who weren't talking at a loud volume. Thankfully we had no one who partied late or talked until the wee hours, but that could happen quite easily. I realise this is a very old hotel and when it was built wall thickness wasn't a priority, but now we're in the 21st century and for me it's a huge problem. If they could somehow beef up the soundproofing between rooms i would easily recommend this hotel. Very nice rooms, great staff, fantastic location. For me though the noise issue is a deal breaker. If that doesn't bother you then i highly recommend this hotel. Otherwise, look for a hotel where you won't hear the person in the next room sneezing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location but tiny bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: jetsetMar
Reviews.Content: Many times I have gone to Boston and passed by to purchase the boston creme pie. This time we finally stayed here thanks to hotwire ($150). We got a good rate and stayed for one night back from our Iceland trip. The hotel is very pretty and old-school, lots of Boston history. Location is right where you want to be. Since I am a member of their loyalty program I was upgraded to a deluxe king. The king bed was huge and room was clean, only complaint is that the bathroom is small and uncomfortable. I would stay here again if I ever get the same rate but there are many other hotels I would like to try.

Reviews.Title: “Tineeee rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: I remember hearing that people in colonial times were shorter than the average American nowadays. I think they kept that in mind while renovating the hotel to be historically accurate. The lobby and public areas were beautifully redone with great attention to detail. The rooms, too! However, the room barely offered room to walk around the bed. Still, great stay, seeing as you're about as close as can be to all the historical tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, love the rooms....”
Reviews.Author: TexasSharvi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely. The history and beauty of this hotel are evident when you walk thru the doors. The rooms aren't large but they are clean, comfortable and super nice. The Old City Hall is across the street and everything is right there in walking distance. The only negative, if you really consider it a negative, is that the music in the lounge was not appropriate for the locale. A nice jazz, classical or soft rock would've worked but Tool and Linkin Park (rock)?? Otherwise...the staff is fabulous and the hotel is simply beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviceTucson
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't agree that this is a 4-star hotel. When I checked in I requested a King-sized bed, but was told that the hotel is full and that all I could have was what they called a standard bed. This is essentially larger than a twin but smaller than a double, what is called a French double in Europe. While comfortable, this is very small for two people. And like what other reviewers said, this room is very small and so is the bathroom, the smallest of any 4-star hotel I've stayed in. The shower did not have a lot of pressure, but the temperature was nice. If you like old world charm (read: dark and musty), then you will be okay here. It seemed like tourist central as I can understand why they were full with their good prices (I booked on a web site where I named my own price). And the location can't be beat. I used to live in Boston, so I knew that being near the hub of several subway lines would be ideal. Their whiskey bar, I forgot the name, was very cool for a cocktail, but as most things in this area, it was closed on Sunday. Overall, this hotel is a good value and I was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review: Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gdh6513
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a last minute vacation to Boston 11-14 June. Our intent was to catch the Red Sox vs Yankees game and take in all Boston has to offer. The Omni Parker House was the perfect hotel for our vacation. The hotel is old, the oldest continuously operated hotel in the United States, but holds up amenity wise while obviously having plenty of old world charm. The rooms were smallish but well appointed and everything we needed was available. The staff is fantastic and very informative and accommodating. We got great help from the concierge planning a nice dinner at Ricardoâ€™s in Bostonâ€™s North End. If you are looking for a great historic base of operations during a trip to Boston this hotel is perfect. It is RIGHT on the Freedom Trail and the hotel itself is a point of interest on many tours. If you do a tour, use Old Town Trolley Tours...you can buy tickets from the conceirge at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustMy0pini0n
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple reviews, I was a little hesistant about this hotel. Upon arriving the bellhop(s) retrieved my luggage, escorted me to check in and waited. This person also escorted me to my room and placed my luggage on the luggage rack. This is definitely door to door service. I received a Deluxe room which was decent on the 12th floor. The staff service was nice. The only issue I had was it's always a line to see the Concierge. I needed an umbrella to go outside and had to wait in the ine because the front desk staff would not pass one over the counter. The bar staff was very nice and I loved the warm peanuts. The lobby is so inviting and I LOVED the water/flower decorations in the middle of the room. Me and my co-workers just sat in the lobby and chatted for hours at a time because it was so inviting. I saw some of the smaller rooms my coworkers stayed in. Even though the rooms were small the cleanliness of the rooms was a plus. The rooms in this hotel are like a maze. I had some coworkers who complained about having to drag their luggage up or down the stairs to reach a room location. Overall this was a nice hotel that is close to the Freedom Trail and many other sites. The door men are extremely nice with seeing you off in a cab. If you have to catch a cab from the Airport (Logan), expect to pay close to $30.00. You have to pay an extra $7.50 just to come through the tunnel and this is added onto your fare.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: LondonPisces
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights with my Mum and Sister, we attended a wedding in thehotel. The rooms were fantastic, clean, spacious as were the hotel areas. The staff from the door men, reception, concierge and chambermaids were very polite and friendly. The reception area is very welcoming and has plenty of character, the hotel is steeped with history. Will definitely return to the hotel on my next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: frenchbosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joy to stay in. Country House decor. Superb staff especially the Consieges who were always helpful with their advice with where to go. Comfortable beds, though my particular room was small it was adequate. Friends also had comfortable larger rooms facing the street. Food a little chunky 'USA' style but restaurant and bar had a relaxed atmosphere. Hotel is central to the places of interest. We enjoyed the park nearby, the trolly bus ride, theatre, Constitution Hill, Quincy's Market and 'Old Ironsides' All within walking distance but catch a ferry from the docks to get to the ship.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families, staff was amazing. Rooms are beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: skellywhg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel before and loved it, so when planning a trip for our son's 7th birthday it was the only place to stay for us. The staff made the kids feel special from the moment we arrived. The boys, ages 7 and 8, were given Omni backpacks with special surprises just for them, and when the staff found out we were there for a birthday, they had a their famous Boston Cream Pie in the room for them when we got back from dinner! Everyone from the valets to the concierge went out of their way to be helpful. They also make great recomendations for dinner! We stayed in a suite which was beautiful. It was nice because when the kids went to sleep, we could stay up in the other room without disturbing them. The Omni is in a great location, also. Close to Fanuel Hall, and the Freedom Trail, which the boys love to walk. We are planning a summer trip to Boston, and we will definitely be returning to the Omni Parker Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful History, Truly Beautiful, Fabulous Location, Great Staff, but Small”
Reviews.Author: donnaonlbi
Reviews.Content: I don' think there's another hotel with a better location in Boston. The Parker House is truly in the best location! The history and beauty of the hotel is really special also. (Oldest continuously operated hotel in America, home to Parker House Rolls & Boston Creme Pie - the best!) Plus the list of people who stayed and also worked there are impressive! The staff was exceptional! We found the entire staff to be the best we've ever experienced anywhere in the world - including compared to the Ritz Carlton and the Four Seasons! We did a lot of driving during our stay - we actually had 2 cars - and the in and out valet was extremely convenient! We had the breakfast and park package for a family of 4 and found it to be a great value. We received breakfast each morning for our family and also had in and out parking priviledges for one of the cars. The buffet breakfast was great - eggs or omelets to order with fruit, lox, bagels, sausage, bacon, pancake or french toast, cereal, rolls, danish, juice and coffee in the beautiful parker dining room. The charge would have been $20 per person, but it was free! Because of the large breakfast we skipped lunch! And the charge for valet would have been $40 - very price competitive compared to other Boston parking. (We got charged $36 for a couple hours at the Prudential Center) Also the beds were unbelievably comfortable, but small. Depending on party size and need, I would recommend staying there. As per the previous reviews, the doubles (2 double beds) are extremely small! We are a family of 4 with a 16 and 12 year old. Based on previous reviews, we tried to get another type of room, but it wasn't available. And, the room size was unbearable for us. After one night they were able to provide us with a larger double, but 2 double beds for 2 adults and 2 teens is still a killer. If they could not accomodate us with a larger room, we would have had to check out, because it was unbearable! Also, the counter space as noted by a previous reviewer is a killer! I took her advice and used the ironing board for additional counter space. There is absolutely no counter space in the bathroom - they could have minimized the problem by installing medicine cabinets! Also, outlets are tight - only 2 usuable in the room. If you bring a power strip (and maybe extension cord) from home you at least might be able to charge your cell phones, plug in your laptop(s), and maybe even get your blow dryer near a mirror so you can see when you blow dry your hair. Not an issue if you're traveling with 1 person. But if you're traveling with multiple people or a family, You cannot blow dry your hair if another person is taking a shower. If the size of the rooms were bigger, there is no doubt in my mind that this would be the number 1 rated hotel in boston! Definetely stay there if you are 1 or 2 people, but beware if you need to put 3 or more in 1 room. By the way, register as a select guest before you go - it's free and you get free morning beverage service delivered with your choice of newspaper. Robes, Check-in Choc Chip Cookie & Milk, Free room internet (or else they charge - why I don't know) and other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Service Service Service”
Reviews.Author: pickles1107
Reviews.Content: In the spirit of full disclosure, let me start by saying that I didn't actually stay at the hotel. But based on the service I received from the front desk management, I look forward to doing so. I called a few days before my checkin time to cancel the reservation. The agent told me that I didn't actually have a reservation under my last name. Strange, but then I thought about it and never received a confirmation email about my reservation either, so I thought it was just an anomaly. After the trip I received an email asking me to complete a survey about my stay, which sent red flags off. I called and they informed me that I did have a reservation and it was never cancelled. After a long time on hold, the agent at the central office told me that she had talked to the front desk manager at the Parker House and that everything would be taken care of. A few minutes later I had a call from Sarah, the manager, explaining that she would look into the situation, but not to worry as they would credit my card. In a time when the hotel industry is really hurting, it is nice to know that Omni still puts the customers first.

Reviews.Title: “Extended Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tigers78
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel & was concerned about the size of the rooms so we stayed in the one bedrrom suite. Great location. Service was very good. They have a workout/weight room but no spa or massage services. The value compared to other hotels makes it worth the stay. Bar is good and food is OK. Eat in the North End. About 200 Italian restaurants (great seaford and within walking distance of hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: seenit2
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself spent 5 days in this hotel and thought we had a really good trip. Nice room, small bathroom, nice staff. Then when we get home we discover that they charged $27 on my credit card. We never ate or had room service at the hotel, nothing from the mini-bar. We have had no answer to e-mails sent even to say what the charge was for. Whoever replies to these comments on this site, don't just respond to the nice ones, answer your e-mails and sort this problem out. There's no way i would recommend a hotel which takes money without explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest bathroom I've ever been in...and we stayed in a suite”
Reviews.Author: travlr247
Reviews.Content: I ordered a suite, the room seemed more like a standard. The couch was gone, not sure where, but there was 2 double beds, 2 small chairs, a small table that was covered with stuff/brochures, etc, so it was of no use...and a big empty space where I assume the pull-out couch "was" The bathroom was so small that I had to pull the ironing board out to use as a table for my blow dryer and toiletries....I had to close the door just to get in the bathroom...If this was a suite, we wondered what the standard room was like. The service was great and the location was phenominal...probably why they still have guests. We usually stay at the Bostonian in Fanueil hall, but wanted to try something new......we will be back to the bostonian.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: YadiDadi
Reviews.Content: I typically write longer reviews, but with the Parker House it is easy to sum up in just a few words. The location is superb (a few blocks from Gov't Center T, which is a T hub and can get you anywhere in the city). The rooms are large, clean, and classy. The hotel restaurants are fantastic, especially for breakfast. The staff is what you'd expect from a top notch chain such as The Omni. I stayed here three times for work over the last year or so and I would absolutely stay here each and every time I return to Boston. I've stayed in a lot of 4- and 5-star hotels and I would be hard pressed to put one above this one. If it's good enough for John F. Kennedy's bachelor party, then it's good enough for me. Stay here and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Boston 2nd Honeymoon before New Baby”
Reviews.Author: Lizzysmom32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed @ the Omni Parker House hotel May 8 - May 11. Right out of the taxi, we were helped w/our bags and room was ready 4 hours early. We had a double bed and asked for upgrade b/c I'm 7.5 mos. pregnant, didn't get one b/c hotel sold out w/3 weddings going on. The BEST PERSON we met on our entire trip was Seamus Murphy...not sure of his exact title but helped w/our bags, sat us down to explain map of city and helped us w/directions numerous times...this man deserves a raise. He was great!! Hotel was clean, location was right in middle of city b/t 2 Green T stops (train). Walking distance to Fanuiel Hall/Quincy Market and Boston Common, then again Boston is a walking city and we were in the middle of it all. Yes, rooms are small. Our bathroom was fine for just the two of us. Plus, if your visiting a new city, are you really there to sit in your room all day?? Nope. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. Lobby is gorgeous with old detailing and lots of charm, Jack Kennedy proposed to Jackie in the hotel restaurant. Thanks Seamus for everything!!

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: CJTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel to Boston - usually twice a year - I make it a point to stay at the historic Omni Parker House. In addition to being well located for my purposes, it is one of the friendliest hotels. The restaurants are great, and the staff go out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: faithc16
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston with my mom for a day over Mother's Day weekend. We arrived at 5:30am, and I had called the night before to try to see if they could check us in early.
