Ruth at the front desk did an excellent job, and we were able to get in our room as soon as we arrived. The location is perfect, and the bed was so comfy. A block from Boston Common, and near all the main attractions. It's about a ten minute walk to Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall, and a 15 minute walk to Newbury Street. This is the second time I am staying here, and I would stay here again. My only con was that the shower looked like it needed a bit more scrubbing but other than that, very pleased. I recommend booking on the hotel's website itself for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel we have stayed inn.....”
Reviews.Author: Edin_Hrustanovic
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have been staying in this hotel every time we have returned to Boston, on our first trip there we just fell in love with the City and the hotel, I like modern hotels, but this hotel is just amazing, such nice feeling to it, we just love it, from a morning free drinks, to the staff and the room, with their massive bed, evening turndown service, location is best, close to T, close to airport. We are planning to return to Boston again this August, and yes we have booked this hotel again, for the 3rd time. This hotel is totally different that Omni Shoreham in Washington DC, which I can assure you that we will not be going back (arranged a surprise dinner for my girlfriends birthday at hotels restaurant) week before we got there, turned up at the evening no record of reservation etc. Enough about different Omni, We are so looking forward returning to Boston and staying at Omni Parker House again, like I sad for the 3rd time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, nothing out of the ordinary for an Omni”
Reviews.Author: KrysyGT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends during the NBA play-offs to see the Celtics game. Hotel was a typical Omni, very pretty, great attentive staff and very clean. Well appointed decor. Nothing was out of the ordinary that would make me say wow, other than it was a very nice upscale hotel. Room was a bit noisy. My only beef is with the girl who confirmed my reservation. She told me I had a double room and two beds, turns out a I had a single with a double bed. The check in lady did her best to accomdate me but the hotel was booked solid. We wound up with one person sleeping on the floor. A bit of an annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, offsets smaller rooms :) Long review, click MORE”
Reviews.Author: VLOML
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights.. After reading here, we got a suite and booked through hotels.com. One potential problem was that the reservation through hotels.com said we had a suit with a king size bed. I called to make sure this was correct and was told that it was NOT and that we would get (2) double beds. Always call in advance to be sure... A lot of discussion and finally the on duty manager agreed to change my room to a King. One other note (unlike some other online booking sites) Hotels.com allows you to change/cancel your reservation before the Hotels "own deadline" for cancelling without penalty. I would have cancelled if I couldn't get a king room as my reservation said I was confirmed with. Also the Hotel said that your room type isn't actually confirmed until you arrive. This isn't convenient when you are flying 800 miles to stay in a city like Boston :) The hotel: As others have noted, a suite is the better route to go as the regular rooms are small but understandably due to the age of the hotel. The suite isn't a "suite" as you may normally expect (little awkward design, bathroom very small etc.) but it was very well kept and clean! The hotel is very nice, lobby etc. are very historic feeling and charming. The location CANNOT be beat. Right on the freedom trail, walking distance to nearly everything you may want to see/do in Boston. Even the "T" is 2 blocks away at Park Center. In my case going to the Red Sox/Yankee's game at Fenway was only 5 stops away which was the furthest we really ventured away from the center where the hotel is. If you get a moment go to the "M" level and walk the hallways of the hotel (near conference rooms) there are a bunch of old restaurant menu's framed and other historical pieces hanging on the walls that are VERY interesting. I am so glad I got to see this information as it made me personally admire the hotels and the history of the hotel even more! I hated that this stuff wasn't more prominently displayed in the hotel so that ALL guests had an opportunity to see the excellent pieces of information. The hotel bars (both) are very nice as well and had good offerings. Only gripe about them is that they were not open very late on Friday or Saturday night as we may have wanted to have a drink and unwind after arriving back at the hotel. We ate breakfast room service (2) times and both times while expensive, the food was excellent, hot and delivered in a timely manner! Also would mention the king size bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was very dark with the blinds closed. In the absence of an alarm we slept in one morning past 10 a.m and we both are normally 6-7 a.m risers :) Last point.. the room we had and at least (2) sides of the hotel view from the windows of your room is going to be of a wall 15 feet away. So there is no real view of the city. Of course if you have been to Boston you already know this isn't really important anyway as being on your feet in the city is what it is all about :) Other complaints about noise levels here on Tripadvisor, I never heard a peep while we were there and the hotel was nearly full. Concierge services were also excellent.. used them for several things and they were great! I would stay here again in heartbeat. Not because it is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at (probably not even in the top 50) but it was very cozy, very nice and clean and the location was fantastic. Also worth noting that all things considered it was also a great value on those traits alone.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay at The Omni”
Reviews.Author: 012910b
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the Omni from 23 April. I had read previous reviews that the rooms were very small, but was pleasantly surprised to find that ours was fine. It was very clean & well appointed, however, the bed was only a double & I found it quite uncomfortable as the mattress seemd to dip in the middle. As stated in other reviews, that the walls are very thin. The noise of the maid banging in her store behind our room every morning was unbearable & we were unfortunate enough to be on a floor where a party took place on our last night. We were awoken at 2am by ridculous noise that carried on for alomst an hour even after intervention from the hotel staff. On the upside, the hotel had a lovely buzz to it and the service and food in both the bar & restaurant was perfect. Would I return? Maybe....

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bseaside
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is an historic Boston hotel. Right on the Freedom Trail and a block from Boston Common and the Metro. Very convenient. We booked after reading the Trip Advisor recommendations and couldn't be more pleased. Recently renovated, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The concierge, James, was so very helpful in obtaining dinner reservations and making suggestions. The rooms are small, reflecting the time when the hotel was built. Clean and comfortable. We were lucky enough to book through the hotel's website where we were able to get a good rate for 2 nights with a third night free. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “When in Boston.......”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie56
Reviews.Content: My aunt & I went to Boston to celebrate her 70th birthday & I booked us at the Omni Parker House in a suite. The lobby is beautiful, the service perfect & everything was spic & span. We ate dinner in the restaruant which was fabulous & reasonably priced for a restaruant of its quality. The location was ideal....right on the freedom trail & walking distance to literally everything. And EVERY staff member was friendly & polite & professional from the housekeepers to the concierge to the reception to the waiters to, well you get the picture. The only problem we had is that it is an old hotel & the walls are thin, very thin. The people next door to us were talking loudly & had their TV quite loud & we finally had to contact the front desk at 3:30am (& security did immediatley come to their door) & again at 4am (& again it was instantly addressed!). Also, the room was decorated OK, but nothing special..... but the beds were VERY comfortable. When I go back to Boston (which is a GREAT city so I will be back) I will absolutely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: rovingrebel
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Omni Parker Boston. It's in an excellent location for seeing the different sights in Boston. The room I stayed in wasn't huge but was very well kept and spotlessly clean. The staff were very helpful with planning trips and booking tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: leilah
Reviews.Content: My experience with the Omni chain did not start off on a positive note. I had reserved a premium suite for 3 nights through their web site. The cheapest rate was quoted under a 21 day advance nonrefundable booking. Rather than being able to cancel and get my money back if I were unable to make the trip, I chose to lock myself in and risked losing my payment in exchange for what I assumed was the lowest rate the hotel had to offer. Several days before departure, I checked the web site and saw that the rate with the same conditions had gone down for same days by a bit over $100. I called the Omni swithboard and asked for the lower rate. The lady I dealt with was quite rude and condescending and kept saying my rate was non refundable. I said yes, but one relies on the implication that if you risk losing your money with a nonrefundable 21 day advance its because that is the lowest rate ever and it's not right that had I not given you my money 21 days in advance, I would now be free to cancel and rebook at the cheaper rate. It went on and on until finally I hit upon a technicality. My e-mail confirmation said I could cancel until the day of my stay in the year 2011. Obviously a mistake. How could one cancel two years after they stayed there, but I grabbed on to the cancellation language and it was only then that she put me through to a supervisor. He was very nice and agreed to credit the difference in price. We laughed about the 2011 cancellation language and he said it was glitch and hoped I would not hold them to it and cancel. I said no way, that I was satisfied with our results. Omni people: Do not ask a guest to give you nonrefundable money 21 days in advance unless you gauge the market better to make sure that the price offered is really the lowest price possible. After all, why else would anyone accept these terms when you can otherwise book and cancel at anytime? If you do need to drop the price, be gracious and credit the guest. You do not have to refund a nonrefundable deposit, just credit the difference so that the guest doesn't feel she locked herself in just to lose out. Enough said. As to the hotel itself, I liked it very much. We checked in around 1 p.m., I approached the desk and stated I had a reservation. Before I could give my name, the lady said "you must be Ms. ...... " Now this is a big hotel and she must have had a lot of people checking in so I was very impressed that she knew my name. How she knew it I don't know. Maybe I was the only party of three with a child, but it was impressive. My room was not ready and she immediately tagged my luggage so we could walk around. She asked for my cell number and called me as soon as the room was ready. Not a biggie since we were walking around way past check in time. When we did come back, she saw us and before I even made it to the desk she quickly came to give me the keys and said she'd have the luggage sent up. The whole time addressing me by name. She was so nice and gave such personal service that I felt like a movie star. The entire staff was great. The bellmen, housekeeping. Always asking what they could do for you. Our room was extremely clean. Nothing old or dated looking. Nice new looking fabric for sofa, cushions. I know because I had curtains made in my home with the same fabric as the cushions and it was material that had just come out less than a year ago. Only issues were that the bathroom was really, really small and for a suite we had a not so great view, but nothing major. That night someone came to the door with cold milk and a big chocolate chip cookie for my son. Another nice touch. Yes, I had heard stories about the hotel being haunted. No, I did not encounter anything. The guy who sold us trolley tickets told us that there was one room which was supposed to be haunted and because of this the hotel had turned it into a supply room. He gave us the room number and everything. Was he pulling our leg? I don't know. I have had experience with 2 other hotels which also claimed to have some haunted rooms so I was curious, but as I said nothing happened. However, our room had a painting of a man in 17th(?) century attire who had these black piercing eyes and my DH and I had a laugh when I told him the guy freaked me out everytime I looked at his eyes. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants, except for getting some Boston cream pie one night for dessert. Boston cream pie was supposed to have been invented at the hotel, so of course, I had to try. I had the pie and my son had a chocolate cake. Both were kind of small and I thought it kind of pricey since without tip both came to a bit over $17. The pie was not that good either. I had another Boston cream pie the following night at Legal Sea Foods and found it much better, although I do not recall the price. The last point is the hotel's location. You can walk to almost anything, although at night I did not like the area. We encountered many drunk/drugged out people. The first night going to dinner we encountered this man approaching people with kids saying he wanted to buy the kid. When he got to us, he started yelling to give him our son and he'd pay $200. He kept following us yelling he wanted my son and then he left. Normally, one does not pay attention to these things, but my son is autistic and became quite alarmed to the point we had to coax him every night after that to leave the hotel because he though the man who wanted to buy him would be waiting. The last night as we walked to Legal Sea Foods, we heard this horrible crash. Turns out a guy had kicked in a glass window in a commercial building. This was on the opposite side of the street maybe twenty feet from us. The guy then crossed the street towards us and he was obviously drugged. My DH says that's what you can expect in any major city, but I disagree. I have been to many major cities and this seemed to be worse, although that is hardly the hotel's fault. Overall, they made to feel special and very welcome. I would definetely recommend this hotel, just keep your guard up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fading old world charm”
Reviews.Author: tito_nyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for the Easter weekend. The hotel is in a great downtown location, close to things. We stayed here the year before, so were not surprised by the tiny "Deluxe" room, but we were mostly unhappy with the restaurant service. The first morning we waited 20 minutes to be seated for the breakfast buffet, only to find that the food was mostly gone, with only cold muffins left. On Easter Sunday, we were really looking forward to the grand brunch. They had a great buffet style brunch last year. Then we saw a sign by the restaurant doorr saying it was breakfast only service which ended earlier at 10.30am. We were very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience - will return again!”
Reviews.Author: giac6fam
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a six night stay at the Omni Parker House, and our trip couldn't have been better! The staff, amenities, and location are all superb - I much prefer this location to any in the downtown area. Close to the "T", the North End, and an easy breakfast at Starbucks - we will definitely book another stay when we return to this amazing city. Boston is a very hospitable city - we loved it! The only downside was the construction in the alley below, but that is temporary.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return! So romantic! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jazzjunkysue
Reviews.Content: Ok the rooms are small, so, if you're with kids, maybe you're better off in a newer, larger place. But it can't be beat for romance! The beds are high and so comfortable and well, you just don't want to leave! The details inside are all done since the renovation, and it's all luxurious. The parker house restaurant is wonderful. But the best thing is sleeping right in the heart of old Boston. Everything is within walking distance, so, you don't need the T unless you're going to the fine arts museum, which I highly recommend. The prices are so good, too. I just wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - TINY room with one double bed for two adults!”
Reviews.Author: zedo
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation through Priceline and got placed at this hotel. Wrote to request king room after receiving reservation. Arrived and was given the only room left: a TINY room that could barely fit one double bed (a queen bed literally would not have fit in the room). I had made a four-star reservation for two adults; this room would have been claustrophobic for just one person, let alone two! The room had a foul odor and the one miniature window looked out into an almost fully enclosed ally/sewer. This is the WORST four-star hotel I have ever seen. The "historic" decor is just a euphemism for horribly outdated and worn; there is little "historic" class or charm to be found here. We canceled our reservation and stayed at a friend's place; Priceline refused to refund our money. There are dozens of other more worthwhile hotels throughout Boston. This place is a Priceline "partner" hotel. Perhaps the other rooms are more acceptable, but this was an absolute scam. So much for a romantic weekend... my girlfriend and I were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Old Boston”
Reviews.Author: AussieBenean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the oldest in Boston and has a lot of history. Rooms are clean but older styled, this is the only hotel I stayed at which felt creepy and it wasn't until I left that I discussed this with one of my daughters and she had felt the same way. Looking it up when we got back we found it has a history of hauntings, we weren't haunted but I definitely felt like someone was around. The rooms were clean but the hotel does need updating. It's location is perfect for the old part of Boston and was close to pick up spots for the tourist buses/trolley buses. Staff all nice and breakfast in the dining room was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boston hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sprinkles17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Boston over my birthday in conjunction with a trip to NYC. I had not been before, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was very impressed with the hotel and the city! I heard that the rooms were very small and cramped, so I booked a junior suite (joining the Omni's select guest program gets you a free upgrade coupon,) which was very spacious and comfortable. The rooms were renovated earlier in the year and looked great! The bathroom was very small and lacked counter space, which was my only complaint, but it's easy to put up with when you're staying in a historic hotel. The beds are very comfortable, allowing a great rest after exploring historic trails and walking up and down Newbury Street. We had my birthday dinner at Parker's Restaurant and met the most wonderful waiter, Francesco, who shared with us his favorite things about Boston (including the food!) and invited us to stay past closing to enjoy some Boston creme pie--complete with a little candle on top! Overall, the stay was great, and the few staff members we encountered were wonderful. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: martyharly
Reviews.Content: We had 48 hours to see Boston, and visit colleges. We arrived on a red-eye and were able to check-in at 7:30 in the morning. Very nice since we hadn't slept on the flight. We found the Omni to be very well located. It is a a beautiful old hotel, good service, nice rooms. I would say that from seeing some of the other Tripadvisor reviews that the rooms vary in a size and qietness. Our room was large enough for my daughter and myself, though we were put in a double and really needed a queen or king. I blame myself for not noting this at the time of the reservation. The bathroom was tiny, while some say their bathroom was large. Our room was also above an alley which was noisy at night. Would recommend this hotel as we got a fair rate through our travel agent and we did like the location.

Reviews.Title: “over priced and poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: sms1Uk
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed with our stay at the Omni Parker Hotel. At first glance when we walked into the lobby - it looked very impressive. However, on entering our room (which we had paid a significant amount for) - it was tiny, with a window view of a brick wall, a small double bed, small bathroom with poor shower. Internet connection was $6.95 for 15mins, rather than complimentary. Overall, it was no way near the class of the Lenox Hotel which I stayed in last year (for less money!).

Reviews.Title: “A great experience, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katya02
Reviews.Content: The Omni name can be relied on for elegance, comfort, and great service, and the Parker House in Boston is no exception. After a hair-raising trip through Boston traffic we pulled up to be greeted by a welcoming doorman and ushered inside. Check-in was quick and easy. The lobby was elegant and understated, the decor calming. All of the staff, from reception to room service, were friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely - plenty of space, great decor, comfortable sofa and chairs. The beds were comfortable, with pillows of every size, shape and firmness. Best of all, it was quiet! No wild parties or shrieking in the halls. We had a great stay and I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: STRAIGHTFORWARD1
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Great Service . Rooms Were Very Small!!!!!!!! - I Have Nothing To compare in Boston , but overall very nice hotel with very helpful concierge. .Wouldn't recommend only because I would want a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenandWen
Reviews.Content: I can't understand the complaints that are on here. We arrived by taxi and were met by a doorman who took our cases to our room. Book-in was very quick and easy, reception staff were very helpful, what ever we asked for during our stay was dealt with promptly. Our room was large and very comfortable (ok the veiw wasn't much but I'd rather have a good room). We didn't hear any noise either day or night coming from other rooms. Bathroom was also large with every need catered for and spotlessly clean as were the towels and robes. We had tea and coffee making facilities (snacks were at a charge and VERY expensive). All public rooms were splendid (we thought) The bar was nice and relaxing with prices not too bad, the dining room was lovely as were the staff - nothing was too much trouble for them. If we had to complain about anything it would be that the food isn't hot enough and they can't make a decent cup of tea! All in all we had a great holiday, loads to do only a short walk from the hotel. We also liked the fact that Parker House has a lot of history attatched to it.

Reviews.Title: “Those Darn Thin Walls!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaRuth
Reviews.Content: Landmark hotel, fabulous location, classy lobby, polite gracious staff. Rooms were fine, beds a little high but overall perfectly ok. But the walls are really thin. We had neighbors who came in very late, well after we were asleep and were having a normal conversation, and we woke right up and stayed awake until they went to sleep. It's a shame, it was a big glitch in an otherwise pleasant stay. Of course if you've go nobody next door to you you're fine, but do you want to that chance? You're going to walk all day, you need to rest at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Charm and Character”
Reviews.Author: MBones7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you are a fan of the old time look and feel. Lobby looks like you are stepping into another era. Regular rooms can be VERY small. This time we stayed in a suite and brought the baby and it was a nice size and setup, although the bathroom is still pretty tight. I prefer this part of town as it is closer to historical sights and looks like what I picture when I think of Boston. For some, it might be a little quiet on the weekend. Parking, lot all places in Boston, is a fortune. Wired access for a fee only, no wireless. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff, has a nice luxury feel, which some places lack. Overall, my favorite lodging in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget business”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very clean with comfy beds. The hotel is getting a little dated... but it's one of the oldest hotels in the U.S. so that's not surprising. It appeared the last time I was there that they were starting to do some painting, etc. The biggest complaint I have is poor water pressure... but overall when you're looking for clean place to sleep that won't break your company's budget, this is a good choice. Decent service. Very central for financial sector meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Parker House”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parker House on a trip to see historic Boston. This place is right on the Freedom Trail so getting to it involves walking out the door to get started. We were greeted immediately on the street by a doorman to unload our luggage and to park out car (after a traumatic experience with Boston traffic in getting there). We checked in immediately and were given a nice corner room with a fabulous view of The Old South Meeting House. Since I had joined the Omni Select Guest program, I was given free internet service. The only bad thing (unavoidable I am sure) is having to pay $39.00 per night to park the car, but this is Boston. Check out was just as smooth as we had a bellman immediately who whisked our luggage away and stayed with it until the car arrived. This is an older hotel but is well-kept. The Parker's Restaurant was great, also as this is where the innovations of Parker House Rolls, Boston Schrod, and Boston Cream Pie debuted and we tried all three. It is a step back in time at this hotel when people were well-treated.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: swtnpetite
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a weekly conference. This hotel is located on a few minutes walk from Boston Common and the subway. The hotel is very old and has not been renovated. The helpful staff compensated for any old eyesores. The rooms were very small and cozy. Expect to high jump into the bed as the bed height is higher than normal. The conference rooms were adequate and the gym is very small. However; the fresh towels, fruit, and water helps you overlook the space.

Reviews.Title: “A classic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cubbyhole25
Reviews.Content: Great Location- Staff was amazing and very helpful! Loved the atmosphere and the rooms were very clean and welcoming! A classic place to stay, with tons of great history!

Reviews.Title: “Another excelent stay at this centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a four night (which turned into five nights because of snowstorm) stay at the Boston Omni. I've stayed at the property several times before and knew that it was centrally located, within walking distance of all the city's attraction. The main purpose of my stay in Boston was to see a couple of hockey and basketball games - easy walk from from hotel to TD Banknorth Garden. Checkin was its usual breeze. Swift attention by friendly staff. My room was ready at 2pm upon my arrival, and spotlessly clean. Room 1002 - a corner room with dual aspect, and I could see the Common from one of the windows. Fantastic. Room was cleaned every day, and turndown service was available. In room coffee was also there. A big snow storm (a foot - which would have nothing to New Englanders, but to us Brits was huge) meant I extended stay by a day - no problem for the staff, and this was easily sorted out. I will definately by back in the city for sporting events, and will continue to use the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CristyH
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a beautiful, historic hotel right by the Freedom Trail, just two or three blocks from Boston Common, and just one or two from the Government Center station, which takes you to and from the airport. Walking in we were helped to the front desk right away. They were very helpful, and since I had called earlier about early check-in, we were given a room right away (noon-ish). The room was very nice; we had a king deluxe. I thought the size of the room was pretty average and found it very comfortable. The bathroom was small but comfortable. The bed was very comfy. The only minor problem was that there wasn't enough drawer or closet space. All in all, our stay at the Omni was great. The staff was always helpful and our room was always clean when we came back in the evening. We stopped in at their bar, The Last Hurrah, on our last night and also liked it very much; all mahogany and leather. I did get a deal on Travelocity, so considering their regular rates I'm not sure when I'll stay next, but I hope to.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Brian-SK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a short tour of New England. The best thing about the hotel is the location, it is just a few minutes walk from the waterfront, Boston Common etc. The location would be hard to beat. The public areas and bars are all great and we received good and friendly service throughout. Only slight drawback and the reason for not giving 5 stars was the size of the room, as noted by some other reviewers, this was really pretty small as was the bathroom. Would definitely stay here again however.

Reviews.Title: “No Ghosts Here”
Reviews.Author: Quality1989
Reviews.Content: The rooms may be small, but the beds are wonderful and all desired amenities were available. The lobby is lovely and grand, and the service from every staff member we encountered was excellent. Priceline got us in for a very low rate, and our breakfast in the famous restaurant was expensive but nice. The Boston Creme Pie has undergone some changes, but was still delicious and served at breakfast, a very civilized option! We would stay there again and found the central location perfect for a busy day of visiting many areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Living in the past”
Reviews.Author: LizzyJohn
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews of others I was very glad to have upgraded to a De Luxe room since this was still not exactly huge. The hotel seems a bit sad, living on a glorious past history. Although our room clearly had been refurbished it had only been half done. Yes there was new wall paper in the bathroom but the tiles were as cracked and old as they had been in the 70s. The bed was incredibly comfortable but for such an old hotel, the walls were remarkably thin. I was woken by the sound of the man next door snoring... hmm, nice. The housekeeping left much to be desired. We arrived to discover a filthy duster had been left behind. The coffee pot (lovely idea) was left uncleaned and we found used tissues on the floor. It took three days of mentioning such problems before things changed - or was is that the cleaner changed that day? Was greatly disappointed and would not recommend the Omni nor will be returning. A great shame.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and ghostly....”
Reviews.Author: tabicma1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights in Jan. as a getaway. Loved the hotel, the location, and the staff. On our first night I saw what I can only describe as a ghost. Not once, but twice within a 15 minute period of time. My wife was sleeping and I was watching T.V. when I saw what looked like a woman in a robe in profile.Not to alarm my wife I put the nightlight on, shut the T.V., and went (or tried to go) to sleep, not mentioning a word to my wife who would think that I was suffering from jetlag or dengue fever. Three days later, over dinner in the North end my wife said that she had to tell me something but she didn't want me to think she was delusional. It seemed that, the night before she had seen a ghost. Yes, it was a woman, and yes it was in profile. Still not saying a word I asked her to draw, on a cocktail napkin what she saw, and I did the same. When we were done the drawings were identical, not close, identical. I then told her what I had seen as she couldn't understand how I could have drawn what she thought she ahd only seen. After 3 glasses of a very nice Tuscana we were sufficiently freaked out to attempt to return to our room. I have never, in 65 years seen a ghost or anything like it, nor had my wife.The rest of the trip was filled with good food, laughs, and not another visit. After we returned home we read up on the hotel and found that it did indeed have a history of ghost sightings and was named one of the 10 most haunted hotels in America. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, huge bed!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsB001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker house for 3 nights in January - it was the best hotel out of all the hotels on our honeymoon. They gave us an upgrade to a suite with the higest bed I have ever seen, couches, large TV, free internet and free drinks and newspaper in the morning (simply because we had signed up to the select guest programme which is free). As it was our honeymoon they also sent up two bosotn cream pies and a card to our room which was a very warming touch. The hotel is lovely and grand, all the staff are excellent and very helpful, and we really enjoyed it. The only downsides were that the bathroom was quite small, and the bath was a bit marked, and as other reviews have said, the walls are very thin so take earplugs with you. I would definitely reccommend this hotel and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but with some draw backs”
Reviews.Author: MiltonKeynesSte
Reviews.Content: This is our forth year staying at this hotel around the Christmas/New Year period. We love the sense of atmosphere in the place, especially in the bar - the Last Hurray - and the reception area. Last year refurbishment works were ongoing. The hotel boasts that its the oldest continuously operating hotel in the States. Unfortunately, some of the things that could have been dealt with were not. The heating/air con in the rooms is a external wall mounted unit. To say they are noisy is an understatement and we found that we had to switch the unit off during the night as when it kicked in it woke us up. Another noise issue is the sound transfer through dividing walls. This is made worse by connecting doors between some rooms (presumably so that they can be used as suites). Again, I would have thought some work would have been done on soundproofing of the doors but this does not seem to have been the case. We had a lady next door who had a bit of a winter cough - when she coughed it was as if she were in the same room. This does not reflect her ailment but the failure of sound proofing. Normal conversations could be easily overheard through the wall. The rooms are all (from our experience) well maintained and cleaned by friendly and helpful staff. However, there is a great variety of sizes. Rooms on the 'School Road' elevation although sold as 'deluxe' rooms are particularly small and if you are on the third floor you will find that your window sill is 4' 6" high although the view over the Old Town Hall is good. Alternatively, the rooms on the back are generally larger but have no view at all. Rooms have a good coffee making facility. Apart from its historic looks the hotels greatest asset is its workforce. We have always found them to be helpful and friendly and we enjoyed our visit despite the items mentioned above and would still recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Maureen76
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Omni Parker Hotel from 14th January for 3 nights. When we arrived at reception. we were informed that we had received a complimentary upgrade to Junior Suite. What a great start to our holiday. The room (804) had 2 double beds (sooo comfortable) and plenty of room besides. The bathroom was tiny but what the hell.... We ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning $21 each. The buffet was adequate but the selection was much smaller than previous years. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The area is marvellous adjacent to T, Shops, restaurants. We loved our stay. The hotel is warm and welcoming. We will definitely return. Maureen

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay at the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay at a Boston hotel one night because I had a train that left Boston so early, the subway did not begin to take passengers early enough for me to stay at my home. I was extremely lucky to find a really good rate at the Omni through their best rate guarantee, which was the only reason I chose it. I have stayed at other Omni's before so am a Gold Select Guest, which has its privileges. I had a key in my hands no more than five seconds into introducing myself at the front desk, where I got a warm welcome. I was given a really nice room: it was large enough for me to do my calisthenics without problems, it was well furnished, with an nice view. There was no noise from outside of the room. The bathroom was small and a little cramped (I had to maneuver around the door to get in and out and the toilet was very close to the shower). The shower was the worst part: terrible water pressure and it never got more than luke warm; nothing worse than a luke warm low pressure shower when you have 5 AM train to catch! I did not eat at the hotel, but was surprised to find that they dropped off a bunch of candies as an evening gift and had 24 hour room service available.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: beckstop
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel was superb, food was excellent, staff were very very friendly and helpful that included room staff, bar staff, desk staff, porters, restaurant staff and doorman. Rooms were clean, spacious and tastefully furnished. We are from England and stayed here for six nights to see in the New Year and if we ever go back to Boston we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good. Not great, but very good.”
Reviews.Author: SashaCT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House Jan 2-4 2009. My overall experience was very good, though the room was a bit small. For some reason their "deluxe rooms" actually come in different sizes. The one next to ours was significantly bigger (actually wider), and you never know which one you will end up with. The staff was helpful, the rooms were clean, the bathrooms nice and spacious enough, and the lobby is magnificent. Hotel location is very good, in the very heart of Boston, so that everything is quite near. Our room had street view, which was very nice, as the hotel overlooks a historic Boston street. The parking was expensive, almost 40 dollars a night, so we decided to park at the public garage under Post Office Square, which is only a couple of minutes away, and it costs just $ 9 per night on weekends. Unfortunately, you don't get free internet in the rooms (the fee is $ 10), but free wireless is available in the lobby. If you are lucky enough to get a bit more spacious room, Omni Parker House is a very good choice, and it's not terribly expensive, as we paid for our stay just over $ 100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nick1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker over New Year and it is a fantastic hotel, it is in the perfect location for exploring Boston and everything is in easy reach. The area it is in is very nice with lots of shops, attractions and restaurants nearby. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and polite. The rooms are a little small but they are beautifully finished and the beds are soooo comfy. Overall one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, in a great city

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawgirlvt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House at the end of December, and it is a beautiful old hotel. Overall it was quite comfortable, and the service was very good - at one point we bumped (almost literally) into a room service waiter when we were getting off the elevator, and he followed us down the hall, checking to see if we were enjoying our stay and asking if we needed anything. The lobby is very charming and old-world looking, helped by the holiday decorations. Our king room was a little small, but had a nice, comfortable bed and a flat-screen TV. The bathroom was very small, but with wonderful-smelling toiletries. Oddly, there was a large walk-in closet (about the same size as the bathroom!) between the bathroom and bedroom. My husband noticed a few places where plaster in the bathroom and on the edge of the tub was peeling, so it might be time for a few more renovations. But the location was excellent, and overall I was quite pleased with our stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our tour of New England”
Reviews.Author: stompers
Reviews.Content: After a long journey from London, England, we arrived late in the evening to be greeted by the words "we have given you an upgrade to a junior suite". This obviously biased our view of the hotel but everything from there onwards was first rate. Friendly helpful bell-hop and efficient reception staff. Don't expect much of a view from the room but the position in the centre of Boston, on the Freedom Trail is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “A True Grand Dame!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaySc
Reviews.Content: What a beauty! I had stayed there over 20 years ago so I was really excited to go back and see it again. Has a suite. It was superb. Roomy, great view.The staff truly helpful. One of the beast locations in Boston. I would love to go again!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GwynantWales
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Boston and could'nt have picked a better hotel. The hotel was so near to all the major historic attraction that we did'nt have to take a taxi. I had booked for a single room and expected to have a small room after reading the review's of this hotel. Instead my room was excellant, have no complant's about the room. The staff where very helpful and food in the restaurant was very good. If you are looking for a wonderful hotel in Boston, the Omni Parker House Hotel is the one to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: GCR1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, helpful staff and a hotel full of character. Had read 1 or 2 less than thrilling reviews which gave us cause for concern but, we found these worries to be groundless. Super value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: goldair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House for 5 nights at the end of November. We had been concerned about some of the reviews we'd read about the hotel, but decided to take a chance. We didn't regret it for one moment. Yes the room was smaller than we've come to expect while in the US, but it was very clean & extremely comfortable. only criticism is the size of the bathroom, it was tiny! The hotel included a complimentary buffet breakfast each day, which at $20 per person saved a huge amount of money. We ate in the Parkers Bar three times & had great food & excellent service on each occasion. The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail & within a 5 minute walk of Washington street shops & 10 minute walk of Quincy Market. I don't think you could ask for a better appointed hotel. A trip out to Salem is worthwhile & there are plenty of witch museums there to look around. Its easy to reach from North Station & the train fare is about $10 per person return. The area around Beacon Hill is also worth a visit as there are some beautiful houses to see. The original Cheers bar is also in this area. Quincy Market & the Fanieul Hall area is a really vibrant place with lots going on. Here you'll find Abacrombie & Fitch, Victorias Secret, Crate & Barrel & a whole host of other shops in the market buildings. There are lots of food stalls in the buildings & outside you'll find Hard Rock Cafe & McCormick & Schmiks seafood restaurant, both worth a visit. We'd thoroughly recommend this hotel & will definately stay there again when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip, but a little less noise ....”
Reviews.Author: marcusg123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to Boston a great deal and we always like trying new hotels. Was surprised I got such a good rate so close to the holidays at the Parker House. Was very pleased with the hotel, and the upgrades, chocolate strawberries and a nice card for my wife's birthday, express check in which allowed us to get into our room at 1 instead of 3 (one of the benefits of being an Omni member) without being charged. Room was larger than I expected, but a bit dated. Wallpaper was slowly coming off in some areas of the room. My wife loved the duvet and the comfort of the bed. It was a little hot in there to my liking but we adjusted the thermostat and were fine. Bellhops and support staff was great and because we were an Omni member, got free Starbucks delivered to our door with juice each morning and a copy of the morning paper. Great location as well - walking distance to everything. Pretty hectic outside the doors, but a minor inconvenience. The only negative, as has been expressed elsewhere here, was the paper thin walls. You can hear EVERYthing in the adjoining rooms. We were unlucky enough to have a family with small children that woke us up at 7 a.m. each day with a loud TV and parents singing to the toddlers to get them to quiet down. Pretty annoying. We flew home with another couple who had the same exact issue at the Parker House on a different floor. Surely something can be done about this>? Otherwise, a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Agnes18
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, definitely an upgrade from the Best Westerns and Marriotts that I am use to. A good deal for the location, walkable to many restaurants, downtown crossing, Boston Common, etc. Also walkable to a movie theater, which is a plus for me when traveling for business. Also, there is a cafe in the lobby with a Starbucks, an ATM across the street, and a T-station one block away. You can't beat that! Plus, the television had the right outlets so I could hook up my travel DVD player. The only thing is that my room was VERY small with narrow walkways - I could barely pry my suitcase to the bedside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fly2it
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is a historic hotel in a great location for any tourist as it is located right on the Freedom Trail which takes you to all the historical attractions in and around Boston. It is also within waking distance of the shops, Boston Common and Cheers. The hotel has just been renovated but has retained all of its old charm. We stayed at the Omni Parker House for four nights over the Thanksgiving Holiday. Arrived at around 11:00 am expecting to leave our bags with the bellmen and return later to check in, but to my surprise the duty receptionist said that the rooms where available immediately and that we where being upgrade to a larger room. The room was still a little tight on space but more than adequate, the furnishing where to a good standard with an extremely comfortable bed, flat screen TV, room safe, and Bathrobes. The bathroom was tiny with limited storage, but was spotless with plenty towels and toiletries. The Last Hurrah Bar is a good place for a drink with a wide selection of drinks on offer and are not over priced like most hotels in Boston. We where given complementary buffet Breakfast each day which was good as the Breakfast was expensive for what was being offered. Found all staff very friendly and helpful throughout the hotel. We had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone. You must try Emmits an excellent Bar/Restaurant on Beacon St located just opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “$7.43 for a bottle of water”
Reviews.Author: aaa050
Reviews.Content: I noticed an extra charge of $7.43 from Omni Hotel on my credit card statement. Asked the clerk and she confirmed it was for a bottle of water they had prepared in the room. Obviously it was my fault to have assumed you would get a free bottle of water from $200/night hotel, but c'mon, $7.43!? You could buy 24 bottles at a local grocery store and get some change. It's not like I don't want to pay for the water, but they should make it clear so that guests won't mistakingly think the refleshments are free and later get surprised by additional charges.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: dizzyy
Reviews.Content: Room extremely comfortable, clean, very helpful staff except for 1 bar man, dark haired 50's in bar off street.. However rest of stay was very good. Would most definitely return. Breakfast service excellent too

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We live North of Boston and decided to grab a room in town for the weekend to hook up with friends and not deal with the hassle of driving in and out of the city. The Omni is a historic hotel in a great location for tourists wanting to explore the city. It's easily accessible to loads of tourist attractions, the transit system, Quincy Market, the waterfront and lots of great bars and restaurants. Unfortunately, we booked our room through Hotwire and, upon arrival, were given the Omni's "Hotwire" room. This consisted of an extremely coffin like bedroom with a double bed. We went back to the front desk to ask for a room change and the gentleman as were told we could upgrade to a Queen if we were willing to pay an extra charge of $50 per night (so long Hotwire savings). We ended up paying the money for another very small room but with a larger, and very comfortable, bed. Morale of the story is buyer beware when booking on Hotwire. The rooms are slightly less expensive but I think hotels are offering up their lowest grade available to secure the booking. Of note, we really enjoyed dinner at Ruth Chris which is directly across the street from the hotel in the Old City Hall. Definitely worth a stop for drinks/appetizers or dinner - it's beautiful w/ wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: chr_8
Reviews.Content: Lovely, historic hotel conveniently located on Boston's Freedom Trail. Rooms are small ( single occupancy rooms are reminiscent of Pullman accommodations) but well appointed. On the plus side the food in the main dining room was outstanding in terms of sourcing and quality. The concierge suggested creative inexpensive nearby activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mbaxende
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Hotwire. Joined the Loyalty Program and was given an upgraded room. Nice size room overlooking the old city hall. Walls must be a little thin because we did hear the neighbors. Had no problem with staff. They were quick with services and even did a turn-down service every night. Nice bathroom and free internet in room because we were members of loyalty program. Would stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very imposing but friendly.”
Reviews.Author: brownbear250
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our 3 week tour of New England.Very well located in the heart of Boston and the reception areas all very grand and imposing.The room was small and a strange shape but very well equipped.(The bed was ridiculously small)Breakfast was expensive (but it is a 5 star hotel) but we had no problem finding cafes etc outside.All the staff were very efficient and friendly.On balance I don't think I'd stay here again as I do like to get a good nights sleep and I certainly didn't get that here.

Reviews.Title: “Yukk!!”
Reviews.Author: omgomg
Reviews.Content: DONT BOTHER! I did not like it. The staff was terrible, and the men looked at me as if they were hungry. Food, I cant even talk about. One good thing i can say is that my bed was comfty but no other things are good !

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: MuppetKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights at thestart of our trip round New England. The hotel is elegant with helpful staff and an excellent restaurant and a very convenient location on the Freedom Trail The rooms are rather small and only had a standard double bed but otherwise clean and comfortable As neither my wife or I have cooked breakfast it was very expensive to have the buffet at USD20. It would have been nice to have been offered a continental buffet at a lower price. We could not find a diner in the locality The hotel restaurant is closed on Sunday evening. Try the Oceania on Court Street. We found it excellent

Reviews.Title: “Love The History”
Reviews.Author: SARRECAT
Reviews.Content: I did not know all about the history of this hotel prior to staying. I got the reservation two days before I left on my trip. When I was there I heard about it being the oldest hotel in operation from our trolley tour driver. Since then I have done some research and found out all kinds of things that were very interesting. I really enjoyed my stay there and the staff was very welcoming and the food was excellent also, especially the Boston Cream Pie which was originated there as well as the Parker House Roll. It is in a great location for getting all around town. Very cool place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Boston with kids”
Reviews.Author: Batta83
Reviews.Content: The Parker has always been our favourite hotel in Boston. The location is perfect - just a few steps from Boston Commons and Faneuil hall. The hotel is a charming classic hotel but has been renovated in New England style - the beds are just wonderful. They also are very attentive to families with kids. Kids get little backpacks with small gifts and a special cup for unlimited free soft drinks. In the evening, somebody even brought complementary cookies and milk for the kids. In general the staff is extremely freindly and helpful. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to All At the Parker House for A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MerrieIreland
Reviews.Content: My husband actually booked the room online first, but wanting to confirm a few things, wound up dealing with the hotel directly. This was a surprise for me for our 25th anniversary and I will honestly say I was enchanted. Of course, as we had our wedding reception at the Parker House 25 years ago, and have stayed there since - I am a bit biased. The hotel has recently undergone a multi - million dollar renovation and it absolutely shows. It is lovely, even prettier than before. The staff, many of whom have been there for decades remembered us and took such care of us. We even went to a "Boston Orientation" session offered by the guest services manager who was wonderful! Lots of lore and helpful hints. He was great! The hotel, noting that we were celebrating our anniversary, upgraded us from a deluxe room to a 1 bedroom suite named for John McCormack (former speaker of the house). It was lovely, with a beautiful city view. Now, yes the rooms are small and the bathrooms tiny, but they are thoughtfully laid out and furnished so that they don't seem so small. I like the smallness - it makes me feel as though I've travelled to Europe. And besides, there is ample public space with comfy seating throughout the hotel! I would return in a heartbeat!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: MyAnnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Omni Parker House prior to leaving out on a cruise. I just want to let you know the Parker House is fabulous. The staff, the property, the food, the drinks, etc. It is within walking distance of shops, Cheers, History, Freedom Trail. We booked a junior suite, and boy was it sweet. New decor with kingsize bed. I am picking about my bedding and it was wonderful. Large room over 500 square feet. Full size sofa, flat screen TV, Mini Bar, Bathrobes, Vanity dressing table,etc. The price was $359 per nite, not too bad for Boston. The Parker House Bar, Last Hurrah Bar, and the Dining room was great. I would definetly recommend this hotel. It is the oldest running hotel establishment in US (I think). Anyway, lots of history and beauty. Book the Junior suite, you wont be sorry. I really look forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: sars4619
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ornate hotel foyer. We checked in around 11pm and I was totally ignored at the front door with my 1 luggage bag. no big deal but always nice to be asked. He even looked at me but said nothing. Checkin was smooth but when we asked what type of a room we had as in was it a king size bed etc, we were told that they had no idea and the hotel was fully booked. So we took that as if you dont like it, you got to lump it. Room was very very small. I had not seen a room that small since Paris - but then again you expect them small there. Room was quiet claustrophobic and not with a view.The bed was very small too and quiet high off the floor. The bathroom was large but nothing glam about it. Shower has low shower pressure and took forever to figure it out. Even noticed a bug in the bath. Bed was comfy enough but we did not sleep well. We felt the room was in the middle of the hotel and everybody was walking around it. In the morning it was particulary noisy with the housekeeping staff knocking and announcing themselves quiet loudly. 3 times they knocked on the door and eventually we got up, showered and left. 1 night was enough there. Location wise its perfect. Right downtown, but if you are after that little bit extra, I would look further a field. In my opinion, 4 star hotel it isnt and relax you wont there with noise. If it wasnt for the cheap deal we found, we would not have stayed there. Needless to say we were extremly disappointed and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent Staffing in a Beautiful Building”
Reviews.Author: Spellbinder
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful, elegant, lovely old hotel! What lackluster inattentive service all round! I stayed four-nights at the Omni Parker House, and was disappointed at every turn. Though an architecturally grand and truly historic hotel, the staff is just not at the level the building is! The entire staff, and I mean everyone I came into contact with in every department provided indifferent, perfunctory service, and were poorly trained and ill informed. What a shame that a grand old lady like this is now staffed by uncaring incompetent workers! I had truly horrid service at all the restaurants on the property, except for the pub. The front desk was ineffective and solicitous, and the concierges ill informed, and unresponsive. The doorman actually slammed the door on me when he learned I wanted to take my own carry-on bag in with me! The room had a broken towel-rack and faucet, burnt out light-bulbs, and missing toiletriesâ€¦ and when I called housekeeping I was told they were â€œclosed for the eveningâ€� and to try again the next day! After repeated notes left in the room and calls to the front-desk I got shampoo, but nothing was fixed and no one seemed to care. I also got a 5:30am wake-up call I did not want or request. A warm staff can make a cold hotel comfortable, and a cold staff can undermine a warm hotel, itâ€™s a shame as the location is great and convenient for business or travel pleasure. I intend to send a book on Customer Service to the General Manager, but donâ€™t hold much hope for changes.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Courtesy par excellence!”
Reviews.Author: NYC_2_Wheels
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent a night here and had read ahead of time about the exceptional courtesy of the staff. It's 100% true, from the moment you pull up to the curb. They were helpful, gracious, friendly, and even went the extra mile, taking our faux ice cubes from our cooler to the hotel kitchen to freeze overnight and offering--gratis--the Parker House rolls we offered to buy, to break a religious fast. The lobby and restaurants retain an old world "grand dame" hotel feel, which is refreshing. Our room was neat, sparkling clean, and cozy, reminding us of some of the charming hotels one finds in Britain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: doggunner
Reviews.Content: With this being our first trip to Boston, I did a lot of research because I wanted our trip to be the best possible. (It was our honeymoon) I felt that the Omni Parker would be the best choice because of its location, and it was. We were within walking distance of everything, and if it was too far, there were three "T" stops within a few blocks of the hotel. The rooms were definately small, and I knew that going in so I reserved a deluxe room. There still wasn't much room at all, but we weren't in our room that much anyway. The first three nights we were in our room, we were having trouble with our door look. Finally the third night, somebody fixed it. Neither my husband or I found the staff to be very friendly. The bell hops and the men who help with your luggage, were some of the nicest people we came across while in Boston. The front desk staff and also the managment were very rude to us a majority of the time. I'm not sure if it was because we were always dressed in jeans and t-shirts, and we weren't the "upscale" traveler or business person. The resturants at the hotel are quite expensive also. It is not a good idea to eat there if on a budget. The food was definately fantastic though. My husband had an omlette that was so big, even he couldn't eat the whole thing! Overall, we had a good stay at the Omni Parker House. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated, definately a nice, upscale hotel. One thing that also impressed me was the basket of fresh fruit in the fitness center every morning. It is a good treat after a hard workout. The location is definately unbeatable, the major factor in deciding where to stay while in Boston. All in all, I am glad that we chose this hotel for our first experience.

Reviews.Title: “a great anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: ginnybrown
Reviews.Content: We chose the omni parker because the price was right, what we didn't expect was a perfect place to stay in the middle of Boston, close to everything and a gorgeous place besides!! A manager was front and center every day to greet us, all the staff was friendly and helpful, and dinner and breakfast at the parker house was fabulous! They remembered it was our anniversary from the comment section when i first booked the room on line 6 months before, and we had complimentary champagne and strawberries in our room when we arrived with a lovely note from management. Word was shared with the dining room staff, and our waiter treated us to complimentary coffee and dessert . our king sized room overlooked the city and was very comfortable and attractive. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Parker House was Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MKChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parker House Sunday and Monday night of Labor Day weekend. The room was small but very nice, and the staff were friendly and accommodating. The location was great - right in the middle of the city, near to everything that we wanted to do, and next to a bunch of T stops. The lobby was very pretty as well. Overall, a very nice experience, for not a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Omni a good choice”
Reviews.Author: swanseaToronto
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a centrally located, high quality hotel for a two night stay in Boston so that my son (20 yrs. old) and I could see the sights and catch a Red Sox game at Fenway. I booked the Omni Parker House through Hotwire and got a very good deal - I think in part because we stayed just after Labour Day, and prices were already low. I was worried when I read the reviews here because many noted the very small room size. When we arrived, I asked if we could get a room with two double beds, and staff obliged with a very nice room. Not much of a view, but that was fine - beds were very comfortable, bathroom not large but very nice. And the location was perfect - close to just about everything. Check-in staff were great and the concierge very helpful with suggestions. A tip on parking - use the nearby Boston Common garage - its just a five-minute walk from the hotel, and very safe. It cost me $38 to park from 4:00 pm on Monday 'til 8:00 am Wednesday morning - hotel parking would have been over $100 for same period

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great staff and a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: akb8a
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on a package that included aquarium tickets, imax tickets and a wonderful breakfast. My kids loved the historic feel of the hotel (particularly the "gold" elevators) as did I. Yes, the room with two double beds was tiny but no smaller than many of the rooms we've been in while staying in NYC. Since we weren't spending much time in it, it really didn't matter. Everything in the room was clean and relatively new. I can't really find anything to complain about! Did the on-line check-in so room was ready early and we didn't have to wait in line to check in. Breakfast was much more than I expected...full breakfast buffet with a huge selection. Probably wouldn't have eaten there given the price but since it was included in our room price we did and were quite impressed. Kids were left milk and cookies for the evening and given little bags with some cool toys/treats. I liked these thoughtful touches. Each staff member we encountered was very friendly and helpful. Central location was a must for us - quick walk to the T. i would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but cramped space. Lobby/Reception service staff”
Reviews.Author: kimckawa
Reviews.Content: My gf and I stayed at Omni on this Labor Day weekend. Its in great location, walkable to anywhere - Copley Sq, Chinatown, Newbury Street, Beacon Hill etc. Also, the Omni Hotel has great history and pedigree of past quests - practically all US Presidents stayed at Omni at one time or another. Macolm X worked as a busboy and Ho Chi Minh worked in the kitchen. Who knew?? However, the space was very cramped and I am from NYC!! The cleaning ladies were wonderful and smiling always but the staffs at the Reception and Lobby were not too friendly and interactive. They were bit aloof to their guests needs and comfort. Wonderful Lobby space though. You quickly realize that the Hotel and their staff see every moment and inquiry as opportunity to pitch and sell their services and products....even snicker chocolate bars!! There are no FREE Wifi & internet access in the room. We were very disappointed to see that the Parker restaurant has gotten very very low rating from Zagat, so we did not even bother. Very unfortunate since this is where JFK proposed to Jackie O.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: njskiiier
Reviews.Content: My two young daughters and I stayed there for three nights. We got a lovely room on the top floor. Very clean and traditionally pretty. Bathroom was very clean. Breakfast was absolutely delicious, although pricey, but worth the splurge. Concierge service was great. The girls ordered a meal via room service and that was great also. The only problem we saw was that the fitness facilities needed to be cleaned and some things repaired. Front desk check in went smooth and front dest personnel happy to help. Would definately return. Would recommend joining their frequent customer program prior to visit- free perks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms are incredibly small”
Reviews.Author: zigmundz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Omni in Boston. Location was great... convenient to all. Service was very good as well. Valet parking while convenient, was expensive ($80 for 2 nights). We stayed in a room with 2 double beds. With 2 teenage daughters, this room was not for us, as there was no room to move around considering we each had a small pice of luggage with us. I understand this is an "old/historic" hotel, with a convenient location, but maybe they should consider turning some of these smaller crowded rooms into single/king rooms???

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Historic”
Reviews.Author: ccahill
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Omni Parker House and was very pleased with the entire experience. I'd read about the rooms being small--we had a Deluxe room and, while smaller than the new modern hotels, I didn't feel cramped at all. We actually enjoyed it more because of the style--it was impeccably clean and cozy with high ceilings and beautiful decor, and we felt right at home. Walking into the lobby makes you feel as if you are in a different time. I would highly suggest reading the detailed history of the hotel, which can be accessed on their website--it really makes the experience so much better. After all, part of the reason to go to Boston is to appreciate it's history. And, we arrived four hours before check-in, but they still got us right into an available room. Parker's Restaurant is gorgeous, and the food was incredible. The service was a little slow, but our waiter was friendly and we didn't mind the wait. We also really enjoyed Parker's Bar--our bartender was very fun and drinks were reasonably priced. The location is great, especially for those travelling without a car. It's a block away from the T and Boston Common, and within walking distance from Quincy Market and many other sights. I would highly recommend this hotel. The only drawbacks I would see is if you were travelling with children--due to the size of the rooms and there is no pool--but what it lacks in amenities it certainly makes up for in beauty and character.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mere_du_matt
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Omni. I booked a one-bedroom suite for my husband, teenage son, and me, because I'd read reviews saying rooms were small. We had a king bed in the bedroom and a fold-out couch in the living room -- plenty of room for the three of us. The bathroom was indeed small (pedestal sink, one-person walk in shower, toilet, no tub) for a suite, but it was well stocked and spotless. The room was very quiet and we never heard anyone around us. We had late-night light dinner in the Parker Bar on the first night and the food was very good. Both mornings we ate at the breakfast buffet in the restaurant. The buffet was also very good and the service impeccable (the first morning the buffet chef making omelets went to the kitchen to make us fresh pancakes and our server brought us complimentary shots of fruit smoothies; both mornings our server charged us half price for our teenage son since the server noticed he didn't eat alot). The concierge booked us tickets for the Duck tour and recommended dinner at Teatro restaurant, which was fantastic. Super clean, great location, efficient and friendly service -- we highly recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, somewhat diminished by cramped room”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice this summer at the Omni Parker House in Boston, and both my stays have had an identical feel: grand older property, nicely renovated common spaces, lovely amenities, and a great location -- all in fairly stark contrast to very small, oddly shaped rooms, at least in the category I booked. Both my stays were last-minute extensions of business trips, booked through Hotwire for a very competitive price. In both cases I booked a "standard double", which may be the key to my mild disappointment. On both visits, I found myself in a small room, somewhat oddly shaped, with either one or two windows overlooking a dingy, depressing air-shaft view. Both rooms had tiny -- but well-appointed -- bathrooms that suffered from one unforgivable trait: absolutely no vanity counter space to place shaving implements. In the end, I balanced my shaving kit precariously and hoped my toothbrush wouldn't end up on the lovely old Deco tile floor. Another nit: technology. Omni dudes: it just doesn't cost that much to provide free wireless internet to guests. Trust me, I don't want to check my email badly enough to pay to use your wired connection. That's the bad news. The good news is, the room, tiny as it is, is well-appointed, with a comfortable (double) bed, cushy mattress, very nice linens, and a stunning array of pillows and bolsters. Somehow, they managed to jam a desk/dresser combo into the room, and it was topped by a very nice 42" LG flat-panel TV, which, in a room this size, is like having your own movie theater on tap. Once in bed, with the lights dimmed, you definitely feel like you're in the lap of luxury. Too bad that opening the thick shade in the AM and peering out into the airshaft brings it all crashing back down. The Parker House is a venerable property in a great location, close to Boston's small financial district, an easy walk to Quincy Market, the Boston Common, and countless historic sites. I can well imagine -- in a bigger room -- this would make a great base of operations for a family vacation. That said, I would also consider another of Boston's century-old grand hotels, the Park Plaza, which is often available for similar or lower rates. You give up a little in amenities but (at least in the room I stayed in), you get a lot back in space and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: ratia
Reviews.Content: We, a party of four, two grown up two children stayed one night at the Hotel in Boston in July 2008. We had booked a "deluxe" room with two beds. Unfortunately I have not read the critics before we booked the hotel. The room is despite its name tiny. Your can hardly move arround the bed. If you have luggage you can not. There is no room to leave the luggage even if you leave most of it in the suitcase. I guess the Hotel management thinks that the amount of cushions on the bed justifies the hotel-stars. We had more than 10 of them and again if you wanted to use the bed for sleeping no space to put them in. To leave the bed you had to climb over cushions, luggage and clothes to get to the bathroom. The bathroom is tiny. THere is no space to put our own toiletties. The rack in the bathroom was crowded with things. We were on a New England roundtrip, so unfortunantely we had a car. Overnight parking costs 40 $. If you leave the car longer than 12oÂ´clock its an extra 16 $, no matter when you check in. On their homepage or in the traveladvisor-advertisement thei do not mention these expenses. The hall was nice, the floor to the room still needs renovation and smells sticky and dusty. The room was renovated and if I had been on a one night buisness trip it would have had been o.k. But a hotel should stick to the truth, when it offers rooms. The omni parker does not. The fitness room is a joke. There is no place to change. You are in an glass vitrine to be wachted. For the price there are much better and more honest offers even in Boston at this down town location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter97
Reviews.Content: Loved the Quiet. Food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrizzlysFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at short notice direct with Omni whilst on a two week holiday in New England - we were staying about 13 miles outside of Boston and planned to commute in but had a change of plan and decided we wanted to have the city on our doorstep. Got a pretty good rate (for Boston city hotels) and stayed for four nights with my wife and 12 year old son in a deluxe room with two double beds. The rooms are small but nicely decorated, well appointed and very clean with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. The lobby is large and ornate, has a really welcoming atmosphere and is a good place to sit and people watch. We ate at both The Last Hurrah and Parkers Restaurant (breakfast and dinner) and had excellent food and service at both. The price of the food and drinks seemed very reasonable for a luxury city centre hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect - right on the Freedom Trail and within easy walking distance of most sights/attractions. But the thing that really sets this hotel apart is the staff. We have stayed at many top-class hotels and I can honestly say that the staff at this hotel are the best we have ever experienced. From making the booking by telephone to checking out, all the staff (without exception - including the IT guy that sorted out a minor problem with our internet connection!) were friendly, polite, helpful, intuative, eager to assist and appeared to have just one aim - to make our stay as enjoyable as possible - they really made us feel as if we were the only guests staying at the hotel. There are too many examples of the good service we received to mention but we will always remember the card and the three huge complimentary chocolate covered strawberrys sent to our room for my birthday and the doorman carrying my son (who has a mild walking disability) from the taxi to the lobby in order to get him out of the torrential rain storm! They have set the standard by which we will judge every hotel we stay in from now on. We were sad to leave the Omni Parker and, if we ever visit Boston again, will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place/Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rancheros
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights (7/31/08-8/1/08) in a standard room. The room was pretty small for a "standard" double. We were offered a room with a "view" (i.e., a wide but short window up near the ceiling) and found out after we took it that the standard rooms with windows are smaller than the standard rooms without. We weren't in the room much though, so it didn't really matter to us. The full-size bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was nicely appointed with large tub/shower, and the flat-panel TV was great. The location of the hotel in the center of Boston can't be beat. The building itself is gorgeous. The lobby staff was very attentive. The cost of hotel parking is high, but you're probably not going to get a better deal elsewhere if you have to bring you car. We enjoyed our stay at the Omni Parker House very much.

Reviews.Title: “Living history”
Reviews.Author: hilaloz
