Reviews.Content: Hilal Ozcaliskan,Turkey One might say the rooms are small and I would say just unpack and throw yourself out while you are so close to everything! The hotel is really ideally located. I hadn't stayed in such a historic one before that the small room did not bother me at all. Even when you first step in, you feel there is something different with this hotel carrying you away. The lobby is magnificently large and you can get lost in the corridors while you are trying to find your room. I recommend you to eat in hotel's dining room which has a great atmosphere as well. Both the dinner and breakfast were superb! Lastly, I must thank my friend Derek who informed me of this hotel. I count myself lucky to have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the HIstoric Parker House”
Reviews.Author: neznau
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay at the Omni Parker House. I am a very picky traveler who puts time into finding a quality hotel, so I was very relieved when I walked into our room. It was very cozy, clean, and smelled very fresh. Although the room was small, we really spent most of our time enjoying the beautifully historic city. EVRYTHING you need is right there. The location of this hotel is really ideal! Staff was accomodating and pleasant. Didn't try the food, although options on the menu sounded delicious. Room service was efficient and accomodating. I can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Itsyontheroad
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House was simply terrific overall. The location: convenient to everything and the food was first rate. We're a bunch of foodies, from NYC, no less, but I would return for a meal at the lounge, even if I was not a hotel guest. Best of all was the service. First, there was shampoo and toilet paper--don't laugh, a few weeks ago this was not the case when I stayed at the St. Anthony in San Antonio--and the housekeeping generally was impeccable. But we mainly appreciated the helpful and unfailingly friendly staff, from the concierge and the bellman to the restaurant staff. I was attending a conference, but my two boys and my husband were along to just hang out and pitch a frisbee in Boston Common and they dressed accordingly. The staff were just as solicitous in helping them enjoy their stay, which they did thoroughly. You can take away the Boston Cream Pie (though we wish that you wouldn't)--what really matters is the experience, and this hotel really made it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Faded gentility”
Reviews.Author: Wilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker three nights in July, 2008. And I have no hesitation in saying that this was one of the worst room in any hotel we have stayed in throughout the world in nearly 50 years of travel. It's a bit of a cop-out to say the hotel is old therefore the rooms will be small. In our experience in Europe some of the oldest hotels have truly massive rooms. Not only are the rooms tiny but they are extremely badly planned; there is nowhere to put toiletries in the bathroom; there is only one chair in the room and it was like an assault course working your way from one side to tbe other. It is to be expected nowadays that rooms will include PC connections but the number of wires littering the floor was a real hazard. Add to this a bunch of bare wires from the air conditioning and it looked an accident waiting to happen. On the plus side the staff were friendly and helplful. We love Boston and we shall return - but not to the Omni Parker

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysarah
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the heart of Boston, with almost everything within walking distance then this is the hotel for you. Firstly, the taxi from the airport was $28 and back to the airport $18, so cheap and easy to get there. The hotel was clean, and the people who worked there friendly and helpful- I had both the consierge and porter help me with queries. I stayed in an Economy room which, while small, was everything I needed for my stay (although the shower pressure could have been a little better). A full sized bed, small wardrobe, bathroom and TV, was everything I required. If you're used to larger hotel rooms, don't stay in the economy room, but for $100 a night, it was brilliant value! I travelled on my own, and would highly recommend this hotel for lone travellers. I felt safe and secure staying there, and if I ever visit Boston again I won't hesistate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DWinATL
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for one night in Boston before I went to the north shore for the weekend, but downtown Boston is terribly expensive. So I went onto Priceline and was assigned the Parker House for a very reasonable amount of money. When one stays at a historic hotel in downtown Boston, New York, Chicago or DC, one knows that the rooms will be smaller than a new building and that parking will be extra. In fact, $38 a night for parking (which is what the hotel charged me) is on par for the area, so they're not taking any kind of advantage here. So I drove up to the Parker House with the expectation of a small room (particularly with a Priceline reservation!) and that I would pay for parking. The valet parkers were professional, but didn't smile or greet me - just a quick "what's your name" and then "these are the charges" and that was it. Somewhat curt. And I had just a rollaboard and a briefcase, so I wheeled my own luggage in - didn't want to try to navigate the revolving door with it, so had to pull open the door on the side and maneuver myself in. It was kind of tricky - and the valets and bellmen were standing there watching traffic while this all occurred. I think it's because I declined help with my luggage, so then I was on my own - they could use a doorman there. Then up the stairs to a very elegant lobby area and on to check in. I'm an Omni member, but since I had booked through Priceline, I didn't know if it would benefit me at all. The very cheerful desk clerk told me that they had already applied my number (that's very efficient, because it means they reviewed all their reservations that day to see if any of them matched their frequent guest records) and that they had upgraded me to a deluxe room in a quiet location. Up to the room on the 12th floor - very comfortable room. Comfortable and upscale furnishings, very clean and just overall very nice. Yes, it was on the small side, but that matched my expectations and they've made a great use of the room space, with two double beds, flat screen TV, desk, armchair, dresser, all well arranged in the space. Small but well appointed bathroom, again making excellent use of the space. Very nice spa amenities with the nice touch of cotton swabs and cotton balls in addition to the standards. The bed was extremely comfortable - I would have slept later than I planned, except I had requested breakfast in the morning, so had to be ready to get the tray. Omni member get complimentary coffee and juice (or tea, etc.) delivered to the room in the morning, and one can add breakfast items for a fee. And they have this wonderful option: they will leave the tray and knock - so one can wait a moment and then pull in the tray in one's pjs. Very civilized. The location is just fantastic - walked to the waterfront for dinner with friend and then walked Beacon Hill the next morning before checkout taking pictures. Check out was effortless - as I left the room, a chambermaid asked "are you checking out?" - I told her "yes" and then she replied "well we hope to see you again soon", a little thing that impressed me. Since they clearly tell you up front that it takes about 30 minutes to get your car from the valet (they use a local lot), I called down half an hour before I checked out. Went to the desk, again, efficient and personable service, walked out the door and my car was waiting. All in all, a very enjoyable stay. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Old, charming, and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Princess1043
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, however we were extremely satisfied with our experience. We usually love these older elegant properties, and this one was no exception. Our room was very large - we even had a sitting area and a little dressing room! (Hint to hotel managers: put a mirror and a little table in there, it would be very helpful). The bathroom was very small, which I read in many of the other reviews, but it was very nicely decorated, beautiful marble and all the expected amenities. The room service was fast and delicious, and yes, it was expensive. However we expected it - room service is always expensive! We really liked this property and because travel to Boston often, we'll definitely try to stay at the Parker House.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service and LOcation”
Reviews.Author: jsh35715
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to everything with a great staff. We had a junior suite which was spacious and not much more money. Hotel restaurants and bars were fine but the key was how close you are to walking to the great restaurants in Boston. I'll come back to the Omni and use it in othe cities.

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely, although expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Rain-woman
Reviews.Content: Have recently enjoyed a 4 night break at the Omni Parker Boston. We were lucky to have had a corner room which was actually quite spacious for a standard dobule room and the bed well..!! you had to take a running jump at to get in, it was very comfy and cosy with lovely quality linen. The bathroom was a little tired, however it was very clean. The bars in the Omni were quite expensive and the food was perhaps above average. The highlight of our stay was the great location for the Whale Watching trip (spectacular) most certainly not to be missed. So very sad though that due to the pollution caused of us humans that they are in danger! We also took the ferry from the harbour to Provincetown which is so very beautiful with it's clapboard houses and quality ecclectic shops.. Would loved to have had our stay there and it's much cheaper, still the Omni is lovely and found the staff very willing and well mannered.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler30301
Reviews.Content: The Parker House offered comfortable accomodations in a central location of Boston. The city hotels seem to be relatively expensive, so I wasn't shocked by the price. Parker House is located within walking distance of many areas of Boston, plus the main "T" station is across the street. That might be helpful to some, especially during the cold winters.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alice5432
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 3 nights at the Omni. We were greeted with smiles and a friendly helpful staff.The lobby is inviting and warmly decorated with an elegant charm. Bring your appetite because the food is not only delicious but the portions are very generous. The rooms are quiet, clean, the beds very comfortable, and the complimentary robes are a nice touch. The Hotel couldn't be more conveniently located. We spent 3 days walking everywhere. It is within walking distance of many of Boston's great attractions, shopping, dining and entertainment. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Look carefully at the web site”
Reviews.Author: emmjaybee
Reviews.Content: If you like dark brown and dirty fawn walls and carpets, this is the place for you. But that is not the worst thing. The room I stayed in was the smallest hotel room I can remember staying (and I have done some serious consideration on this point). Apparently recently refurbished but don't look to carefully to the finish. The front desk staff were indicative of American service. Lots of platitudes but no desire to help, in fact often the opposite. Its not all bad, the breakfast was quite nice but my recommendation is find a park bench or a cover bus stop as they would be more homely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful down to the details! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: jazzmina11
Reviews.Content: I booked this through hotwire.com and got a wonderful rate for my one night (a Monday night) there. This hotel is SO convenient right near Boston Commons and the T (subway). It is wonderfully renovated and decorated--defintely the 3-4-5 stars it has (depending on the review site you see it on). Yet when this southern girl arrived in my comfy shirt, jeans, and birkenstocks--the bellhops were so gracious to get right out to my cab, get my luggage, and get me in the lobby. (It is on a semi-busy street, so there were safety reasons to do so--but I did not feel rushed.) The hotel is a step back in time to another era... the lobby area is beautiful and distinguishing. Very inviting still and not imposing as if it were a museum and you can't touch anything. The front desk was warm and welcoming. Check-in was fast and gracious. My room was on the 8th floor. Now mind you...there is a lot of construction around the hotel. And this is a downtown hotel, so only so many rooms have a "view" of the street. So my "view" was on the side of the building and I was looking at another building. Nonetheless, the windows had shades, and I was grateful for the sunlight that came in. If you want a "view", stay elsewhere...but this hotel has location location location. The room was clean, tasteful, and classically decorated. Bathrobes are furnished and the amenities are wonderful. In a day when hotels are cutting back, they provided a sewing kit with pre-threaded needles. That sold me!! I had to make a repair, and it came in so handy. (I'm definitely coming back if they pay attention to such comfort down to this detail!) The bathroom was wonderful with a huge, well-lit vanity mirror. There is a fridge in the room to store munchies and there is an in-room bar if you want to dive in -- (The red wine and toblerone were tempting, but the half-bottle was $26...that killed the temptation.) In my room, there was a good sized walk-in closet with iron/board, nice desk, and dresser with the TV, fridge, and drawers all in one tasteful unit. Room drawbacks: limited TV channels if that's important. They have HBO and all local channels, but just about 30 overall covering the major cable channels. No free wi-fi/internet in the room either. You can hookup via a cable they provide for $10 or so per day. There is free wi-fi in the lobby though, so I just headed downstairs and took care of my stuff there. Now for my personal experiences: (1) I went out with a galpal from high school that I haven't seen in 15 years. And...well, we had a lot of fun. I saw her home to her place near Cambridge in a very residential section of Boston. So after midnight, I had no idea where I was in relation to a T or Bus station/route. I called the Omni and asked for the concierge...it was so late that they had already gone home. I explained where I was and the front desk person looked up taxi numbers for me on the spot. I made it back inside of an hour and thanked the folks at the front desk. And, well after my fun, I asked about breakfast. The same person took my breakfast room service order at the front desk for me which was promptly delivered when I requested it. (Breakfast by the way was delicious --get the parker house rolls!) (2) Concierge is so helpful! They have T directions written out ready for you to point you in the right direction. And ladies, they know where the H & M is. (3) They have a late 12 noon check-out which was wonderful. I didn't have to be at my actual destination until 4 pm, so they have luggage check available to hold your luggage so you can explore Boston. Overall...a wonderful experience! I will definitely return on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Jacks3
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker is in a great location in downtown Boston, just a short walk from Boston Common, Fanueil Hall and other places of interest. I stayed for a combination business and personal trip. The rates were reasonable, especially on the weekend when the rates dropped significantly from the weekday rate. My first room was clean and comfortable. However, it was across the street from a construction site and I was awakened at 4AM by the sounds of construction. I asked for a different room away from the construction site and was given a room on the other side of the hotel. That room was larger and very quiet and I didn't have any noise problems the rest of the stay. Everyone at the hotel, from the desk clerks to the concierge to the doormen to the wait staff, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The only negative aspect of the hotel is lack of free internet access in the rooms. There is wireless access in the lobby, or you can pay $9.95 a night for a wired network connection in the room. This kind of nickel and diming of guests is annoying for a hotel that supposedly purports to business travelers. It's 2008, provide wireless access throughout the hotel! Despite the lack of internet access I still recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in downtown Boston. You can't beat the location and you can find good rates, especially on the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JBrowne83
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to stay at the Omni for years due to it's great history and awesome location in Boston. I finally got my chance this June when my husband and I stayed for 3 nights. First off, be prepared to spend $40 a day for parking, second the room service is astronomical. It was a $68 bill for a hamburger, sodas and some ice cream. I had to get surgery in town and was not able to leave the room much so I was relying a lot on the service (or lack there of) the hotel was supposed to provide. The "deluxe" room is the size of a broom closet, although accomodations are not that large in Boston our room is abnormally small. We requested a 5:15 wake up call with a 15 minute follow up for the morning of my surgery. I awoke at 6:15 to realize the wake up call had never come. It takes the valet 30 minutes to retrieve your car so I almost missed my scheduled appointment time, what a nightmare that was. The hotel had never put us down for a wake up call and all the front desk could say to us was "sorry" which I thought was a little unacceptable for the inconvenience they had caused us. Housekeeping came very late in the afternoon on the first day, around 2 pm. The second day they didn't bother to show up at all and my husband had to call for someone to come clean our room. The location in Boston is great and the beds are very comfortable. The shower had very poor water pressure and the door opened awkwardly into the toilet. Our "mini bar" which was supposed to be replenished daily was never re-stocked. If you are not an Omni Member you have to pay 9.95 a day for internet access but it is free to become one. There are no DVD players in the room which was very disappointing for me being laid up after surgery. So all in all the Omni is a great place to sleep but I would not suggest relying on any other services the hotel has to offer. This was a very disappointing experience overall and I would not reccomend the Omni to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Old world Charm in the USA's oldest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: This is the oldest Hotel in the States & occupies a great site right smack bang in the centre of Boston. The Hotel was built in 1855 & has had Â£15M spent on it in the last few years. It truly is beautiful with many original paintings, antiques & chandeliers. The Hotel boasts a few restaurants & bars, which are very good but often the best bars as usual are in town. Of course Cheers was filmed in Boston & much is made of that right across the city. The rooms are small but very well equipped with great views fo the city & the harbour. Remember that this is a 4* and with that in mind I would recommend this totally. Boston can be very cold in November & the Hotel's heating system is very used to that & certainly works. Go enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I would NEVER stay her again!!”
Reviews.Author: Janiekins53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House last night to attend the Celtics game. The lobby is very nice but that is where the niceness ends!! The hallways are very run down and they have a strange smell. We stayed in a suite. The diningroom table was terribly scratched. The room was almost depressing looking. The bathroom is the size of a closet. We were woken up at 5:00 a.m. in the morning to the sounds of people talking so loudly in the hallway that we were startled. I would NEVER stay here again. Sure other hotels in Boston are a bit more expensive but they are well worth the extra money!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it...as always”
Reviews.Author: Brookke
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for many different reason: PROS: * Great location: Quincy Market, good restaurants and great shopping. Walking distance to the Boston commons * Subway is just down the street, makes for easy access to airport for a cheap price as well as around the city * Hotel is fabulous, comfy beds, good size. bathrooms are nice and clean *the soaps are nice* :) * concierge is very helpful * Great clubs and pubs in walking distance CON: * Ask for a room away from the elevators, they are quite noisy OVERALL: Satisfied as usual, I always stay there... you know what you will get: quality and comfort

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JM726
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker for two nights memorial day weekend. From the moment we arrived everything was perfect. Since we arrived before 2pm, the valet staff told us to wait until 2 to park the car (otherwise they would charge us an additional $16). Check-in was a breeze, very friendly front desk. The concierge was great too, mapping out our day for us. The only minor thing we encountered was the mini-fridge. They are new and not hooked up yet and they did not have the key to unlock them. Which we did not mind, but we had brought our leftovers back to the room for a late night snack but couldn't use the fridge. No biggie. Ruth's Chris steak house is across the street - I would totally recommend that as well, excellent dinner. Our waiter Andre had the best suggestions for wine and appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni Parker”
Reviews.Author: Keeling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel for 3 nights. We were pleased with the room. It was clean and the bed was so nice and comfortable but so high I had to run and jump to get on it because I am not very tall! All the staff were very helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome. It was close to Quincy Market and was right on the Freedom Trail which we walked from one end to the other and really enjoyed. It is also close to Boston Common (10 minute walk) which we liked. We will definitely stay at this hotel again if we ever return to Boston. When we stayed there was hardly any noise at all in the corridors or from adjoining rooms so we must have been lucky after reading the previous review. A*

Reviews.Title: “good location( thats it)”
Reviews.Author: hungry01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for three nights,we were annoyed that our room was directly outside a very noisey air con, very difficult to have a peacful sleep, also even though we had a one of the newly decorated rooms,it was dark. You have only the bedside lamps for lights!! There was a fridge in the room, but it was not connected.The halls of the omni are very run down( marks on the wall paper and stains on the carpets) Overall I would not stay here again after paying $1256.00 for just the room.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm!”
Reviews.Author: Racing_lady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker during St Patricks weekend and Easter week. From the moment we arrived to the time we checked out, we were treated like royalty! The staff were so helpful and friendly, check in was without issue and our bags taken from us at the door and dropped to our room. There were a few teething problems with the room (Lamp not working, coffee machine not working) but these issues were sorted out promptly and without any drama. The room was on the small side, but had everything we needed. The beds were amazing, so comfortable!!!!! I registered on their website for the Select guest programme (Which is free) and we availed of coffee, orange juice and a newspaper every morning, compliments of the Hotel! Made all the difference, that kick start to the day before we went for breakfast! If your going to Wrentham, transport can be arranged from the Hotel, just ask the concierge. The Omni Parker is so central, just up the street fropm Boston Common and around the corner from Downtown Centre shopping area, also a short walk to Quiney Market, so central. Overall a great stay, would deffinately stay here again. Would really be nit-picking if I was to give negitives, only the size of the room, and this was due to the fact that we did ALOT of shopping!! Stay here and see for yourself, you wont be dissapointed. The old world charm of this Hotel and the wonderful staff dissarm you and make the stay so worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “History, Character & Excellent Location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: stattlich
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Omni. We stayed in a Suite in the hotel. This hotel is all about history and character. The lobby is beautiful with a strong English influence and ornate, dark wood paneling; the hotel lobby reminds me of an old inverstment bank in London from the early 1900's. There is also original art on the walls. The hotel has a lot of history - this is where John F, Kennedy proposed to Jackie and the first reading of the Christmas Carol by Dickens occured. The Omni is on the Freedom Trail across the street from the old City Hall, which is an excellent location. It is in the middle of the action with easy access to the 'T' subway system. The service was friendly. A bell hop walked over to us and snapped a photograph of my wife and myself without being prompted. The rooms are smaller than in more modern hotels. You can not get around the fact that this was built in the late 1800's. Even the Suite that we stayed in was small . The bathrooms are also tiny. In my first stay, the walls seemed like cardboard, you could hear everything all around. In the Suite during our most recent stay, it was much quieter. The rooms are also in need of a remodel. You should only stay here understanding these limitations; otherwise, you will be disappointed. This is a difficult hotel to rate. The Omni certainly has character and we had a nice stay, but it is not practical for families with children. They will quickly overwhlem the tight living quarters. The location is fantastic, but the new Nine-Zero is next door, with more up to date amenities. I would really rate it 3.5 stars if possible. Finally, be aware that there is major construction occuring in the vicinity of the hotel and that the construction continues after working hours. Your room may be directly facing this activity. You should ask about this prior to booking your room. Have a nice time in Boston !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: PACT24
Reviews.Content: This property is nice. Nothing special, but not bad. Yeah the rooms are small, but it's a hotel, not a house. All you need is to sleep there, and the beds are comfortable. The rooms are very reasonable for historic Boston, and it's a great location, quick walk to all the History Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brigida52
Reviews.Content: Great location for downtown and the historic sites. Cosy old hotel, very comfortable rooms. The air condition could not be regulated and was very noisy, though.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - needed a little upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Mensallen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice on business in 2007. I was recommended this hotel by a friend who grew up and lives in Boston. It is a historic building and is very central. The Lobby is big and check-in staff excellent. The Bar is very old world and comfortable. Both my visits were short stays (2-3 days). First time I had a great room (Yes the rooms are small but I knew that in advance). second visit was not quite as good - very noisy room right beside elevator (10th floor I think) My floor hallway was very warm and obviously un-conditioned. However I was relieved to find my room was cool and bed was very comfortable. Concierge was very helpful and staff in general were good. The hotel was undergoing some renovations and there was alot of scaffolding etc. I would probably go back anyway - but I believe the rooms have all been upgraded - Which would make me definitely want to go back again. TIP - join the select guest program if you are not already a member and you can get some little extras such as Breakfast to your room, paper etc.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: cadetgrl24
Reviews.Content: Booked through Travelocity as a last minute deal, Omni Parker hotel was listed as a luxury hotel, one of the oldest in Boston. On arriving, there is scaffolding covering one part of the outside of the hotel but the rest is good. The lobby is spacial and has an historic charm. Onmi Parker hotel is beautiful, the lobby is spacious and our hotel room (574), while not the best view (there is contstruction going on) had very very comfortable beds, a nice tV and the bathroom was fine. Our first evening, we ate at the famed Parker Restaurant, I had the NY steak medium well, which was cooked to perfection. My sister on the other hand had the wild mushroom risotto, which she did not enjoy at all. Directy across the street from the hotel on school street, is the old city hall, and at the other entrance of the hotel, you are approx. 1 1/2 blocks away from Boston Commons. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is that the hallways need refreshing!! All in all, Omni Parker House is a lovely hotel close to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: BobAdams111
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Location: The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail and in easy walking distance of most tourist locations. 2. Hotel was recently renovated and in good shape. Cons: 1. Rooms are very small, even for this New Yorker's standards. I guess that's what you get for a Downtown Boston hotel. 2. Room was generally clean. However, there was spilt coffee on the desk. While this was a minor problem, this made me uncomfortable in the room initially, even though the rest of the room was spotless. 3. While the hotel is historic, it also had a very stuffy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Small beautiful room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Zooi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House for business - an annual conference that was being held around Copley Plaza. Though our room (1132) was rather small, we spent a great 5 days in a beautiful and peaceful hotel. There was a slight increase in noise as business travelers were replaced by 'tourist' but I'd say that is typical of most hotels. I highly recommend to anyone planning to stay at the Omni to become members of their guest programs - it's FREE and it will save you money! We got free internet in our room, which is a $10/day charge; we got free coffee and juice, which is normally $6-9 plus a $3 room charge fee (there is a coffee maker in the room, but the coffee was only so so); we also go breakfast options a great discount compared to their regular breakfast offering. The staff was wonderful and very helpful and accommodating in every respects. The omni is centrally located - you can easily access restaurants in the North End or go for a walk through the park and Beacon Hill or head for some water views.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected for the price or a hotel for that matter”
Reviews.Author: n4smith
Reviews.Content: The history of the hotel and location are what drew us to stay 3 nights. For our 3 nights we got very little sleep & awoke about 6a.m. each morning to contruction noise, lasting all day, so no naps either! We could hear everything in the room next to us & the hallways. Our room was called deluxe, however we disagree w/this discription. Our room was very small, we could barely walk around the bed, no tables w/chairs, & no mini bar, (the description said mini bar, what we found was a tray w/very overpriced items on it & no fridge w/out paying an extra fee. )Then, we walked to the window area,but kept running into the furniture as it's too crowded for such a small room. We've never stayed at such an overpriced, small place and hope to never encounter such a stay again....anywhere. The bed was extremely comfortable but not at all worth the price & couldn't make up for the sleepless nights! The trim in the entire place was lacking, & maintenance definately is needed. While the hotel was still under construction, they need to consider sound proof windows as this is a very noisy area especially w/the added construction going on all over the area as well as the hotel. Our key card worked after several tries, but only one of them & we had to ask for help at least twice to get into our room. Check in time was 3, we arrived early but was told they would rush & then we didn't get in until after 4p.m. being told that a "smoking" room takes longer to clean....please we know better. It ended up being a very exhausting trip because we could not get any rest. We were in town for a big convention, hoped to get a little vacation time in too, but we were so grouchy from our lack of sleep that we ended up going home earlier than planned. Rooms for comparable prices in the area offered much more in comparison to this hotel, but we wanted to stay somewhere historical, so we made a huge expensive mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with history”
Reviews.Author: LittleBritain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker for 4nights on a weekend trip from London. Landed late at night and caught a cab to the hotel ($24+tip). Friendly check in staff and the bell-hop even knew the Man United score which we thought was pretty impressive! We had booked through eBookers (Orbitz) and had got a very good rate including a BA flight and 4n hotel for approx Â£950 for both of us - so we were not expecting much on the room. We had a small room,with no view on 4th flr. Bed was the comfiest we have ever slept in, large flat screen TV, and a mini bar which was empty which we like so you can put your own stuff in it. Bathroom compact, nice toiletries, and powerful shower. Room service came twice a day, with nightly turndown and choccy on pilow. Hotel still has scaffolding around it but it definitely looked like it was coming down. Ideal location for all amenities in this very walkable city. Dumped our bags and went for a late night beer at BeanTown pub which is practically next door on Tremont. For breakfast we ate at the Paramount Cafe on Charles St (Beacon Hill area) and at Brueggers which is right across the road on School St. For dinner I must recomment Fajitas and Ritas on East St (walk down Tremont for about 7 blocks) for great food and drink at very reasonable prices, and then we had a family style dinner at Maggianos on Columbus St. Suggest you join the Omni Guest Programme - this gets you a free morning drink and a newspaper. We had early flight and took the hotel van which was $30. If I had to complain about anything - we ordered a wakeup call that never materialised- but we were woken with our 'free' morning drinks so I guess it was not really an issue. I would totally recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: Juror
Reviews.Content: Checked into a Junior Suite in April 2008 - $379 a night until Friday when the rate went up to $479. Thus, the hotel is seriously expensive. That would be acceptable if there was some value here. But, when I went to the room I found the following (contrary to the web site): No wireless internet, no mini-bar, small LCD TV (without any HD channels - yet picture is stretched making everything distorted), very small room, tiny bathroom, no temperature setting for air/heat, no view from 10th floor. All of this would be a problem at this price, but the real kicker is that I face a building site (at the same level as my room, with the construction floor being about 20 feet from my room window). When I called the front desk to ask for another room, I was told that none were available and that they all did not have a view and faced the construction (which of course is a physical impossibility). When asked why I did not have a mini-bar, I was told that they were renovating and none had been installed yet. I stayed at the Swisshotel in London recently. The room was cheaper and bigger (In London!). How do they get away with charging these prices and providing so little?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JADMIX
Reviews.Content: Stayed the last few days of march 2008 for a short break,The hotel is very convenient for the "T" (subway) Shopping,(tj maxx,macy's etc) only a 2 min walk,right on the freedom trail beside the old city hall on school street,Boston Common only a 2 minute walk,so this hotel cannot be beaten for location.We got the bus from the airport to the "T" (approx 2 minutes) then the "T" to the hotel using "state" station which is only 3 stops from the airport journey takes about 10 mins cost is minimal($2). As for the hotel itself,renovations are continuing at this hotel and my only complaint would be that due to the scaffolding that is present outside the hotel,the workers started at 7am and this involved the use of a lift (outside) to bring materials up the scaffolding for the workers,not the best way to be woken every morning,I did bring it to the attention of the Hotel and they offered to change my room which was fairly reasonable as there was little else they could do.the Room was fairly small but why do you need a big room? we went for the shopping!!.the hotel interior is beautiful and the staff were very courteous,the rate was fairly good (just under 500 euro) for 4 nights(room only),I would definitely stay there again and would recommend the hotel for others,JAD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beds Very "TIGHT" Rooms”
Reviews.Author: spotoeg
Reviews.Content: We had just spent the previous 3 nights at the Westin in Boston and found that the Omni accommodations were lacking (considering the price) in comparison. Our room at the Westin was very large and spacious and their signature "Heavenly" beds were truly "heavenly." Our room at the Omni was sooo small and tight that we could not even put our luggage down in an open position -- we kept having to open and close it when we needed something. Ironing in the morning was almost impossible and we could barely walk around the room without squeezing by each other. The Westin bathroom was also large and spacious and had a great double showerhead for added comfort. The Omni bathroom conditions were similar to the room conditions-- no where to put anything -- very inconvenient. Also -- walls were so thin that we heard every conversation and bathroom trip from the guests on either side of us -- noise from construction also very bothersome @ 7:30 a.m. On the plus side -- the hotel is in a great location -- very convenient to tourist attractions and shopping. The lobby is beautiful and the room was very clean. Although the beds weren't in the "heavenly category," they were luxurious and comfortable. Staff was also friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - HORRIBLE Management”
Reviews.Author: dsloves
Reviews.Content: Hotel lovely - excellent location, pretty lobby, large elegant rooms. It's a shame the management of the hotel takes the most extreme anti-customer orientation I have experienced in 40+ years of my travel history. I booked one night through Expedia, pre-paid. Some minor aggravations between the two electronic systems (kids not included in record on Omni side) but was able to work out those issues through a call to the hotel before arriving. Due to change in plans, we needed to stay a second night. Called hotel directly and was sent to reservations. In middle of call, got cut-off by agent. Called again. This time, issues on my end and had to cut it short but with understanding that they would e-mail the confirmation -- all seemed well. Upon arrival at hotel, learned no second night had been booked nor was any room available. I explained the multiple calls (I even game them times of calls - thank you cell phone logging), etc. and the manager agreed to try to help out and committed to follow-up call in the morning. UGGGH. No call so I called them. Different manager. DOUBLE UGGH. No room and the GM had supposedly reviewed call to reservation center and there was no discussion of a 2nd night. I asked whether they had reviewed all three calls. They had not. Moreover, we were told we had to leave right away due to the hotel being busy ... unless we wanted to pay $700 per night, in which case we could stay in the room. WTF? We were paying $249 a night with rack rate around $350. The topper: no offer to help us find another hotel (a 5 minute deal, but why not be helpful/gracious?) or even a basic "I'm sorry we couldn't make it work for you" ... Just nasty, nasty, nasty. NET: There are many lovely hotels in Boston. Why put yourself in position to be treated this poorly!

Reviews.Title: “superficial luxury only”
Reviews.Author: SquidBox
Reviews.Content: There are several nice things about this hotel, although none that go beyond ones expectations for a hotel of this purported class. There are many prior positive reviews, so if your interest is in flat screen tv's, having a bed with 7 pillows on it (for your seven heads?) or just enjoying the general appearance of luxury then you will be well- served by reading those reviews. As someone as much into quiet and cleanliness than superficial comfort and obsequious staff, this was clearly not the hotel for me. As with many aging hotels, a lot has been retrofitted, and the focus is definitely on appearance more than substance. Room temperature, for instance, is controlled by some horrifically ancient heating/cooling unit under the window. This thing would kick in every few minutes with an astonishing amount of noise. I know ventilation/heating isn't always quiet, and i am accustomed to having to turn such things off at night in order to be able to sleep (irrespective of the resulting temperature change), but this was easily loud enough to drown out conversation during the daytime, and with a 5-10 minute duty-cycle was incredibly annoying. As with most hotels, they seem to have not fully considered sound proofing, and corridor noise can be a major problem. When i awoke after my first night in this hotel, i was surprised to find the remnants of the previous guest's coffee still in the coffee maker. Rather more repulsive was finding short, curly hairs still in the shower. I am not sure if this is intentional or further imperfection, but the hot water is very far from hot---even after waiting for nearly 5minutes with the tap on full hot the water was at best lukewarm. This was not helped by the "water saver" shower head--- running around to get wet under a few, low-volume streams of lukewarm water is not a positive shower experience. For a vegetarian, this place is also far from adequate, although admittedly not much worse than other hotels. The in-room dining has a few egg dishes and grilled vegetable sandwich, but beyond that you'll be eating out or not eating. The hotel promised high-speed wireless access. In fact, it's high- speed *wired* access. This makes a difference---i didn't bring my usual, long ethernet cable since i was assuming wireless, so i ended up unplugging their cable from the phone so i could stretch it to my laptop. When i initially asked about the lack of wireless the concierge informed me of the ethernet port and claimed there was a cable in the closet---not true. Overall, given the price this was a huge disappointment. There was a special conference rate, but even so i didn't think it was even close to being worth the money. With less "luxury" furnishings I've had nicer overall experiences in much less expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker House - old fashioned charm”
Reviews.Author: JD70
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is outstanding. 5 mins walk to historic burial ground; the tube system etc Room was small but perfectly fine. The bathroom small but very well equipped and spotless. No view. We could hear the renovations at the front of the hotel from 8am so no sleeping in! But otherwise it was quiet. The lobby and the bar are just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Richard65
Reviews.Content: Now I have a rule that says â€œbe wary of returning to a hotel that you loved on a previous tripâ€� We stayed at the Omni Parker a few years ago and loved it I broke my rule and was disappointed. On the train from New York I tried to prepare myself mentally for this stay. I had just had four fantastic nights at the Waldorf Astoria where we were upgraded to a suite and so I knew that this would not be on the same scale however we had booked a superior room so it should still be reasonably decent. WRONG!! The room was tiny in fact it was so small that you could only pass on one side of the bed. When I complained I was told this was a superior roomâ€¦â€¦â€¦.well I would hate to see an average room. The hotel was undergoing refurbishment (which they did not inform us of at the time of booking) and I believe that we were put in a smaller room as the other rooms were out of use. I do love Boston and will defiantly stay here again but not at the Omni Parker.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home”
Reviews.Author: kellianne17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House during St. Patrick's weekend. Aside from the small rooms, the hotel provided a lush comfort that made me feel like I was somewhat at home. Believe the positive reviews about the beds--they are heavenly! We had a king (which took up most of the room) and I slept very soundly. There was some noise outside our room due to the construction, but since we were there on vacation and wanted to make the most of our day, I didn't mind being woken at 8am. It wasn't extremely loud, but noticeable if you're a light sleeper like me. The bathrooms were very updated and I loved the pedestal sink. Maid service was okay but the first day didn't give us new coffee mugs. A complimentary paper was delivered on days 2 & 3 of our stay and the plasma t.v. was very nice. The location of the hotel is PERFECT and the ornamental detailing was beautiful. We took advantage of parking outside the city for only $3.50 per day at Riverside and took the train in. The stop was only a block and a half from the hotel. We found that most things in Boston are a LOT closer than maps lead one to believe. The Freedom Trail is literally across the street and Boston Common is only about a block and a half away. We ate at Kinsale (across from the Gov't Center) which was an excellent Irish Pub and a French Restaurant, Pigale (WOW!), in the theater district. Around the corner is a Borders, Dunkin Donuts (tons of them everywhere), a CVS, and 2 blocks away is Feneuil Hall and Quincy Market with lots of restaurants and bars. One big negative was the restaurant: the chowder had undercooked potatoes and the service left much to be desired. Our server seemed like he couldn't be bothered and the hostess didn't credit us our OpenTable reservation (I did finally get it settled with OpenTable, however). The lobster roll was good, though, but I wouldn't eat there again. I would, however, recommend the Parker House to stay and would go there again for my next trip to Bean Town!

Reviews.Title: “Oh how I loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: NiamhGalway
Reviews.Content: Pulling up outside the Omni, we saw scaffolding outside but as I had already read here about that I wasnt phased! The porter outside the door took our bags from the cab and followed us into the hotel with them as we took in the fabulous lobby! The staff on the desk were the most helpful we had encountered during our stay and presented us with vouchers for the breakfast buffet which we weren't aware was included in the price. We were shown to our room by another porter, and on entering realised it was too small (one bed, and I was on holiday with my male cousin). We started to go back to the lobby, but the porter called from the room phone to the lobby and it was sorted out in less than a minute. We were brought to a room on the top floor that had the comfiest beds, a flat screen tv! Our view was overlooking the graveyard that Paul Revere was buried in, (which we found out on the trolley tour - well recommended), the bathroom was the perfect size, some might find it small but there was only two of us so we didnt need a big one. On our last night we tried the Omni Parker Boston Creme Pie, which is a definate must-have if you stay here, it was delicious! Overall, it was a wonderful stay in a fabulous, central hotel which was a five minute walk from Downtown Crossing and Quincy Markets, two places you must visit! For food, I would recommend Bertucci's and the Black Rose in Quincy Markets.

Reviews.Title: “Professional yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: tranman100
Reviews.Content: Very well located, the Omni Parker House Hotel is a great stay. You get what you pay for. The room might be small but the bed is very comfortable. Everything is clean and well done. It is situated between 2 very useful metro station. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Parker House, historic and well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Absense1
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I got engaged in Boston over the christmas break. She is not american, so I decided to show her around New England and we made a 3 day stop in Boston. The Parker House was awesome. The price was great, and even though the hotel was under some renovation, the place was clean, quiet and nice. We stayed in a deluxe room which was ENORMOUS. I couldn't have been happier with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna-and-Roy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for a week - unfortunately it didn't get off to a good start... We waited at the check in desk while the staff tried to find us a better room as we were staying for a long time. When we did get to 'better' room we were shocked at the standard. (room 241) Barely room to get the cases in and could only get into one side of the bed as it was pushed up against the wall. It begs the question what was our original room like? We had to stay that night as the hotel was full. Having said that we were moved to a much more comfortable room (340). The staff were very pleasant and attentive and apart from the noise coming from an adjacent building site the rest of the stay was very good. The advantages of this hotel are that you are right in the middle of Boston - we wallked everywhere and there are a number of very good local pubs and restaurants. We would not recommend eating in the hotels bars and restaurant. We eat in the Parker Bar on the Sunday (the main restaurant was shut) and the food was basic and not of a standard we would have expected from a hotel of this standing. Unfortunately the experience was not enhanced when we eat in the main restaurant. The food was pretty bland and tasteless and took a long time to come, even though the place was almost empty. On the whole an OK location but use the local area to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Check with Hotel for Renovations”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodCaddy
Reviews.Content: The only reason I am writing this review is because The Omni is renovating. We usually stay there when we overnight in BOS and have never had a problem. But we stayed there for V-day and my boyfriend was not told they were renovating. We were given a room next to a room that was set up as a wood/machine shop for the workers. There was scafolding set up alongside our side of the building. Everything was okay at night. But by 7am they were literally drilling through the walls. Wall and floor shook from construction. Deafening loud. Just make sure room given is not by construction and it will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old hotel, under renovation, great location”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: Before I booked this on priceline, I wish I had just booked through the hotel itself, because I would have got a lower rate. This hotel, for its location, is priced for a great deal right now because of the current hotel renovation renovation. The exterior of the hotel is being renovated at the moment, and though it is an eyesore, it does not affect your stay at this hotel. We received a double 'deluxe' room (no king beds available), but it was quite small for a a 'deluxe' -- we did not have a problem with this since we were only staying one night. The beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was well appointed to, though small. The lobby of this hotel is charming to say the least. This is one of the oldest running hotels in the country, and it has kept up its passed charms. Location of this hotel is convenient -- walking distance to restaurants, bakeries, the subway, and Boston Common. Just a warning that to park your car overnight is $38, and you have to be out by noon or else they will charge you again. If I needed a hotel in Boston for a night, and I got a good deal on this room, I would stay here, but there are a lot of other great hotels in the area with better equipped and larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: CF1985
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of Omni Parker House on Trip Advisor we decided that despite some criticisms it looked like a good hotel in a central part of the city. I am pleased to say that from the very moment we pulled up outside we were extremely happy with our choice and eager to explore the city and the hotel. As many people have mentioned, the lobby is something special, not only giving you a chance to understand the history of the hotel but also large and accomodating. The staff were friendly and attentive and i can not recommend highly enough the concierge staff who were on hand to answer questions and help us find our way around. Our room may not have been the biggest but provided all necessary provisions and was cleaned to a high standard every day. I would not hesitate to return to the Omni Parker House and would thoroughly recommend anyone to choose this hotel when considering a trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: suffolkwannabe
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Omni Parker House Hotel and it was my first time in boston. The hotel is gorgeous and had the most comfortable bed ive ever slept in. The hotel definitely made my trip. Theyre boston creme pie is the best, and at night they give out pieces of chocolate along with a weather forecast for tomorrow. I definitely recommend staying there, its a great experience, fyi, dont wear heels in the elevators, the elevators are really fast and stop suddenly and with heels on its not a good feeling, other than that, best hotel ive ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “The Parker House is Great”
Reviews.Author: SugarGrit
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House/Boston is a great place. We were there for an overnight. The staff was wonderful, from the front dest to Justina at the Parker Bar who got us late night ice cream!!! It is beautiful and full of character. Thank you to everyone at the Parker House who made our quick trip to Bean Town a really fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberCt
Reviews.Content: The hotel actually wasn't the draw for us (we went for the Argentina food & wine package which was fabulous). As it turns out, the hotel is terrific. The rooms are very nice. The location is convenient. The staff is very helpful, friendly and professional. What really struck us was the pride taken in the hotels storied past. Highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Timmy485
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for an extended weekend over MLK weekend. The hotel was under construction so it was surrounded by scaffolding. Unfortunately we didn't get to see the structure of the building so much from the outside. The lobby was gorgeous and definitely had an out-of-the-past feel to it. Check in was quick and the elevators never took more than a few seconds to arrive. The room was a bit on the small side. The beds had been updated and were very comfortable. The rest of the room was fine, nothing special. The bathroom was ok. Our view was not the best since we were looking directly into office windows with people working. We asked the front desk late one night about any places still open serving pizza. They said there weren't but directed us to the room service menu. We checked it and the high prices made us decide to try looking online. While back in the lobby we asked a bellman walking by the same question and he gave us the exact same answer. It took me about two minutes to find a place that was a few blocks away that was open. This kind of upset me but maybe I can give them the benefit of the doubt. The location of the hotel is great. You can walk to just about everywhere from there (Back Bay, Fanueil Hall, North End, etc.). All things considered, it is a great hotel and I would gladly stay there again. Oh and the construction never bothered us but hall noise might if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Parker House - Boston - More Than a Feeling.”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We did a 4 week tour of the USA over December/January 2007, with 3 older children (girl, 22, boy, 19 and boy, 18), going to San Francisco [Omni Hotel], Miami (South Beach) [Beacon Hotel], Orlando (Disneyworld, Pop Century Resort), Chicago [Drake Hotel], New York (for Christmas) [Beacon Hotel â€“ no relation to the one in Miami], Boston [Omni Hotel], New York (again) [Roosevelt Hotel] (including New Yearâ€™s Eve at the Renaissance Hotel overlooking Times Square), and a day trip to Niagara Falls. It was sometimes very cosy - sometimes downright stressful - with the kids. Anyway, here are my accommodation reviews. Iâ€™ll mention side trips and tours too. Sometimes the accommodation was arranged through a travel agent, but on a couple of occasions I organised it direct. We stayed 3 nights at the Omni Parker House in Boston. I chose it through Trip Advisor and looking at its history on the internet, but the travel agent booked it for us. We had stayed at the Omni in Washington on a previous trip and it was excellent, and had booked for the Omni in San Francisco on this trip too. I'd also joined the Omni chain's Select Guest program (free, over the internet, on the Omni website), which I'd recommend if you're considering staying at an Omni (free juice/coffee and newspaper, room delivered every morning). Once again, we had a double room for ourslves and a triple room for our offspring. The Omni Parker House seems a lovely old historic hotel, but unfortunately it didn't do us justice at the time. It was undergoing renovations externally, so I took no photos of the outside. There was a workman's lift right outside the kids' room, which seemed to run from about 6.00am to 9.00pm (even on a Saturday night). Fortunately, the last night was a Sunday, and they didn't work then. The foyer is nice, but the rooms, though well appointed, were the smallest we stayed in all trip, and very crowded. Ours had 2 (probably queen-sized) beds, a chair, TV unit (with drawers), and a bedroom table between the 2 beds that was cluttered with everything as provided by the hotel (phone, clock, tea/coffee making & mini-bar accoutrements, magazines and the Hotel's books on Boston, ice bucket and glasses, etc). That meant that there was actually no desk or table to put anything on. If we'd been sharing a room, it would have been impossible. There was a closet with a safe and room for 1 suitcase (we, of course, had 2 - cold country touring for 4 weeks takes up luggage space). The bathroom was also small but not too bad for us two. Internet access was free (for Omni Select Guests), but it was via ethernet connected to the telephone. This proved problematic - the phone was on the cluttered bedside table and there were no spare powerpoints. We actually had to get an extension cord from housekeeping, pull out the bedside table (which had the minibar fridge built into it), and virtually recable the phone so that it would reach to where the laptop had to be to get power. Then we wrote emails with the laptop on our knees or on the bed. The room really needed to be a single room, with one less bed and a desk and chair. The rooms that we had at the Omni Parker House were much smaller than in the Omni in San Francisco, and tiny compared to the rooms at the Omni in Washington. Valet parking was the only option unless you knew where the parking garages were, but the service was quick, though hampered by the construction work outside. The staff were friendly, but weren't as accommodating as at the Omni in San Francisco (who let the kids get juices under the Select Guest program - not in Boston as they weren't members themselves; a pot of "hot" chocolate as an apology for late delivery, but it was almost cold when it arrived). The location, however, is very good. Close to the 2 main historic walking trails, various shops (including the ubiquitous Macey's), buses, a collection point for the various "Beantown Trolley Tours", the Boston Common (including a popular ice-skating rink), and restaurants. We found a great place for cheap breakfasts ($3.00 for bacon, eggs and pancakes) just around the corner and a fabulous and reasonably priced restaurant called Fajitas & 'Ritas (guess what's on the menu), again around the corner. There were also some fine Irish pubs in the vicinity. The historic walks are easy to navigate, and the trail is marked on the sidewalk. We drove from New York in about 5 hours. Boston city (and it's parkways) was not the easiest place to navigate by road, but we downloaded excellent directions from Manhattan to get to the hotel from Google in advance, and these were accurate and worked well. We went up to Salem too (say, an hour's drive), which was a quaint little place, despite it's black history. The Omni Parker House had it's advantages, but our rooms, though clean with nice beds and crisp sheets, were uncomfortably small.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: jholshouse
Reviews.Content: Booked two junior suites for family weekend at famed Parker House Hotel. Arrived to find no doorman or bellmen in sight. Both suites were on the 2nd floor, both overlooking a building under construction approximately 5 feet from the windows. Hotel entrances are surrounded by scaffolding for repairs. No mention of construction on the website. In my search for electric outlets, found significant layers of dust behind furniture. Hallways are poorly lighted, walls are in major need of paint job and carpet is filthy. "High speed" internet is very slow. These junior suites each had 19" televisions - smallest that i have seen at any hotel in at least 15 years. Took a trolley tour of Boston and saw any number of hotels far superior in location, quality and price. This once-famous hotel has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! History and Location:)”
Reviews.Author: orchidgirl
Reviews.Content: If you love history and luxury, stay here. You can stay at the Hyatt, but it would just be another Hyatt. Here you get some culture and you are in the center of it all. I walked to Quincy Market and most major sites from here. The European style rooms are elegant and quaint even if smaller than usual. I loved this first rate historical hotel. Be where great minds in our county's history talked and in some cases worked:) This is one place you should not miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Night Location”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelboston
Reviews.Content: Very, very clean. Friendly staff. Quiet, old fashion. We had very small rooms, but we had a great price so we couldn't complain. Terrific location for First Night Boston - right in the middle of the Boston Common Fireworks and Waterfront Fireworks. We spent very little time at the hotel since the weather was great and the First Night Activities lots of fun for a family of five ranging from 7 - 13 - 16 - late forties parents. If you book for First Night plan to have breakfast on New Years' Day at the hotel since most restaurants are closed for breakfast that morning until noon.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, but small, tired room”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Deezel
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker is a difficult one to review. One the one hand the staff were fantastic and its location is great (minutes from Boston Common and walkable to pretty much eveywhere we wanted to go). On the other hand, while clean and comfortable enough, our room was small, dark and felt a little tired. I expect certain compromises when staying in city-centre hotels, especially one with the history of the Omni, but was left with the impression that a lick of paint and a lighter colour scheme would make the world of difference to the whoe experience. Finally, there are countless great places to eat in Boston, but the hotel's restaurant isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: i_am_rad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Deluxe Room at the Parker House this past June. We absolutely loved it! The location is ideal - we walked everywhere from Fenway Park to the Old North Church to the Museum of Fine Art. Plus, the hotel is right across the street from Boston Common and the T trains have a large terminal there. The room was incredibly comfortable - the bed had a really great synthetic-down comforter and fluffy pillows. Our room was cleaned really well each day and the bathroom was a good size. The only issue we had was noise in the mornings from the work being done to the facade during our stay. The staff were very friendly, and easy with the suggestions for dinner. One staffer recommended Pizzeria Regina to us, and we had one of our favorite dinners there! Overall this is an excellent place to stay for anyone looking to sight-see or visit Boston for the first time. The location is ideal with everthing either within walking distance or a subway stop away. Don't rent a car, you'll just end up frustrated. With this location you won't need one!

Reviews.Title: “Big dissapointement”
Reviews.Author: sardouk
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband to the Omni hotel for a three day stay. Our first impression was very very good, the valet service took care of our car right away and check in was a breeze. After that it was downhill all the way . The first room we were in was tiny and not sound proof. We were able to hear word for word the discussion in the room right next to us. We asked to have our room changed and that was done with no problem , but we realized all the rooms were the same. Both nights housekeeping knocked on our door to see if we wanted our bed to be turned when we had the do not disturb sign on. Last but not least, when we left the hotel , we realized that my husband sunglasses were missing from their box, although our car was parked at the Omni from our check in till our check out. We called the hotel and asked to speak with the valet service, they said they cannot do anything for us. Oh and when we got our credit card statements we realized they charged us twice for our bottles of water , but at that point we has just given up calling the hotel. I usually stay in Omni hotels and the one in Montreal is wonderful , however this one was not up to par at all.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: AveMariaNJ-NY
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the overall experience of the stay, and the entire staff. The concierge on duty during our stay, Joseph, was personable, charming and knowledgeable and made a great restaurant recommendation. All of the staff greeted us or wished a "happy holiday" when you saw them about the hotel. Our room was very comfortable and the hotel was conveniently located as noted in other reviews. And the cost/value ratio cannot be beat for what you get in terms of the facility and location in the heart of Boston. In terms of ambiance , the traditonal old world lobby was welcoming and warm; the front desk staff helpful and friendly. We could not have had wished for or had a better experience. The staff and the hotel exemplify the meaning of gracious hospitality and made it a wonderful holiday experience. We will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AnonyGuest14
Reviews.Content: In December, this hotel was available for the ridiculous Hotwire price of just over $100 a night. At those prices, or indeed twice that price, the hotel is a bargain. As others have described, it's just 200 yards from the Common; has access to all of the culture and nightlife concomitant to that location; and offers generally great service, with classic lounges and restaurants and a general old-Boston feel. It's true that there is a ton of construction right now: scaffolding all over, and work beginning at 9 AM on the weekends. But polite requests to be moved away from the construction are accomodated. If they're lowering prices because of needed work, but willing to let you stay where you won't be disturbed, why not take the opportunity to enjoy the rest of the premises? Highly recommended. Don't worry too much about the construction: the service is great, and they really try to make you comfortable. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Wendy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and have just got back. The hotel is in an excellent position just 250 yards from the common and right on the trail. The hotel is having a lot of building work at the moment (although we were assured by our travel company that the work was due to be completed early Nov this year). We had a room at the front of the hotel but had to move due the builders hoist that started work at 0700hrs however the builders donâ€™t start to 0800. We were moved to a room (402) away from the main work and had a quiet stay but be warned the chance of not being affected by the work is small as the construction teams were all over the hotel. That said we had a great stay and the hotel was FAB for the location and the service. We would not stay anywhere else if we were to return for another break out to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greg2847
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni in July 2007, What a great hotel!!!! We are coming back to Boston for New Years and we are going to stay at the Omni. We had first made reservations at the Fairmont Copley plaza, but due to our experience this past summer we decided to once again stay at the beautiful Parker House. I read that the scaffolding is still up around the hotel would love to see the building.. All of the people at the hotel are great from the Doorman to Room service..excellent....

Reviews.Title: “What a FAB Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: angel4031
Reviews.Content: I have literally just arrived back from the Omni Parker House. When we arrived I too was a bit disapointed by the scaffolding but once inside this soon became forgotten. Check in was smooth and efficient, and the bellman that took our cases to our suite was very knowledegable and full of advice and tips for our first trip to Boston. The suite we stayed in was a lovely size, there was a sofa bed in the living room, and 2 double beds in the bedroom, which were very comfy. The bathroom was a good size. Macy's is so close to the hotel but for shopping I would reccommend Newbury Street - it is the most prettiest street in Boston, esp at this time of year, lovely boutique shops and the trees are covered in small lights, it is located next to Copley Place and The Prudential Centre - which are both excellent for shopping. We booked a trip to Wrentham with the concierge, it was $38 per person return trip, and as there 4 of us this was the best option as it is a 45 mins drive (aprox, it did take longer on the return due to traffic). Some FAB shops in Wrentham & some excellent bargains to be had - well woth a visit. We had a slight noise problem at the hotel - from other gusts. We were also located in front of the building work and this had no effect on our stay, the reception delt with our problem quickly, friendly and effiecently. even when we didnt have a problem the staff were very nice and you felt they would really make an effort for you. When I return to Boston I will DEFINETLY stay at the Omni Parker House.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: caddy82
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four on our second visit to the Omni parker over the Thanksgiving weekend. On our arrival our rooms weren't ready although we had arrived early 2pm. After some confusion we did get two deluxe rooms as requested. The hotel advised that carpet was being fitted on the floor above our friends room , and our room was on the front where the scaffolding lift was operating, an early morning alarm call 7.am .we missed housekeeeping on thanksgiving day maybe short staffed. Saying all that as everyone says great location , nice atmosphere in lobby ,and hotel bars as people were in holiday mood. Breakfast buffet is best option as good value for Brits at the moment, There aren't any traditional breakfast diners nearby like in New York , or Dennys etc. Boston is great City to walk round you feel safe & there is more relaxed atmosphere than the "in your face New York ." experience. Taxis are cheap option if you walk to far off the beaten track. Great restaurants Grill 23 .4*. We had thanksgiving meal at the Top Of the Hub this overated and expensive for what was a pre prepd Meal nearly over $450 for a set menu for 4 people . Little Italy is worth a visit for a mixture of upmarket restaurants or cheaper pizza /pasta joints. Amongst other things we saw Boston Bruins Ice hockey this was a great experience worth seeing if playing . Overall a great 4day break would reccommend Omni Parker after January when building work finished. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: welshtrav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, we were a two minute walk from the T station. Macys is down the road and there are numerous bars and restaurants in the locality. Getting around was a breeze and cabs were not expensive I agree with the previous reviewer. The external work being carried out is a little bothersome but the hotel has so much character it would not deter me from staying there again. The Last Hurah Bar is beautiful with an excellent and affordable bar menu and great staff who are helpful and real fun characters. We had breakfast in Parkers on the Sunday as most of the Diners were closed . It was about $15 and whilst this is not expensive compared to UK hotels, there are quite a few local diners providing a great breakfast for less than half that. The doorman will advise. Rooms were comfortable although on the small side. Again like the last reviewer I spoke to the reservations manager who advised that there is to be a major refurbishment plan on a floor by floor basis throughout next year. The good news is they will not touch the lobby and bar areas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Fifilamue
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Omni Parker for 7 nights. It was our first trip to Boston and we were really pleased with the location. We found it easy to walk anywhere in the City from there. We joined the Select programme before arriving and can highly recommend doing so. Each morning there was a knock on the door and we were served steaming hot coffee and tea - I don't even get that from my husband!! There was no charge either. Check in was very smooth. We had booked a deluxe room and although the agent had booked a double room for us in error the management were very helpful and changed it to a twin room. We had disruption with the building site next door - there was some early morning noise. When we complained the hotel moved us and we ended up in a larger room on the other side of the hotel. Breakfasts were fantastic and the service very friendly and efficient. With the exchange rate being so favourable to us we had our breakfast in there most mornings. We also ate in the Parker Bar, The Last Hurrah, and the restaurant for lunch and can recommend them all. The hotel does need some renovation but I liked the character of the hotel and for once you didn't feel like you were staying somewhere that could have been in any city in the world. The beds were so comfortable it was difficult to get out of them in the mornings! But we did and walked the whole city - being on the Freedom Trail we of course did the tourist thing but we also walked to TD Banknorth Gardens, up to Copley Place and Newbury Street, with the posh shops, and Downtown Crossing was just round the corner where Macy's is located. There's also a cinema just down the road which was very helpful on Thanksgiving Day when everything else was closed. It sounds from the manager's comments that internal renovations are going to be made and then I think this really will be one of the very best hotels in the city. I would recommend anyone to stay there - we had a very good deal and were very happy with the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But...”
Reviews.Author: ChaShu
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice, and the service was excellent, but the value wasn't all there. The rooms were smaller than expected for an American hotel, and was pricier than warranted. The location itself was very good, centrally located in Boston. Leave your car parked and walk or take transit. Boston is a driver's nightmare. The hotel has great valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Marlin68
Reviews.Content: A deluxe room consisted of two beds, tv, bathroom, and a table with lots of snacks for sale. Example: very small jar of gummys cost $12.00. Room was so small that you had to move sideways to get past TV set. And would you believe this ..... NO CHAIR to sit on all for the cost of $348 per night. Hotel Staff were outstanding and the rooms were very very clean. But $348per night for a match box room is terrible. Look at their site room diagrams. Deluxe in reality looks nothing like the drawing they show you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsRotten
Reviews.Content: The Omni is in a great location for walking around the city. There is Valet parking only which costs $38. Definately worth it. The lobby is quite grand and very spacious, elevators extremely quick. Our room, deluxe category was nice but somewhat outdated. The two double beds were extremely comfortable with beautiful white duvets. The TV was quite small. The bathroom had a shower only - decent size. The bathroom was wallpapered which gave it an older house feeling. The bathroom shelving was old but if you like that sort of thing it could be called charming and slightly dusty.
