The location is what you pay for in Boston. Great location for shopping, about 5 blocks from TD North Bank - walkable distance but get good directions first. I would definately stay there again as Quincy Market was only 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Older (but not tired) hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: sm122097
Reviews.Content: This is written as a review for the business traveler (as I was there on business), It may, or may not, be relevant, for the leisure travel. Check-in was the fastest I have ever seen. I went to the front desk and gave them my name. In 5 seconds, I was told I was given an upgrade, given my key and told that they had my Omni number. I was in the elevator before I realized I forget to ask about directions. The rooms were an older style (in size and layout), but not in amenities. I was upgraded toa deluxe room (fortunately), which was small. I was told that because of the upgrade I was given a desk. I do not want to think about how small the original room would have been. The bathroom was small with very little counterspace. Although the equipment was all new, it was a very traditional style. The bed was comfortable, and the room had plenty of light,. I was very impressed with the breakfast buffet. Normally, once you order the buffet, you get no service but a refill of your coffee. Here, the server continued to come and aks if I needed anything (such as toast). The location is very convenient, close to the downtown area, the seaport, and the back bay.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Hotel"!”
Reviews.Author: politetraveller21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel for 3 nights in Oct/Nov. There were 3 of us two adults and 10 year old daughter. This is a very old hotel with lots of history. This is just what we wanted. If you want modern and cold this hotel is not for you. It is perfectly located right on the Freedom Trail and central to everything. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I was a little apprehensive having read previous reviews concerning the construction work and the small rooms. Our room was on 14th floor and I can honestly say that the construction work did not bother us at all. In fact, my husband found it very interesting watching the progress of the work from time to time. I really enjoyed the beautiful view of the Boston skyline at one point I could see as far as the river. Yes the work started early in the morning but who goes to Boston to stay in bed! Our room had 2 double beds and plenty of room for all 3 of us. It was a warm and cosy room and spotlessly clean. The complimentary (select guest) coffee and hot chocolate for my daughter left at the door each morning with a complimentary newspaper was a lovely touch. Our room was cleaned each day and towels, soaps etc were all replaced. We had breakfast (buffet $18 and $10 for child) each morning in the beautiful dining room. This was very good value especially when you convert to Euros. The staff were very helpful and welcoming even calling my daughter by her first name after first meeting. This was a wonderful way to start each day! We did not have dinner in the Hotel as there were so many places in Boston we wanted to try. I did see the Menu and it looked good! We had lunch in the Last Hurrah before we left for the Airport . My daughter had a lovely caesar Salad and I had the famous "chowda" which was to die for! Again the staff here were very effecient and very welcoming. I was a little concerned that this hotel might be a little dull for our daughter but this was not the case even though she seemed to be the only child around for the first couple of days. She enjoyed every minute of it and even received an Omni Kids Pack which contained all sorts of goodies. I cannot recommend this hotel enough for anyone visiting the wonderful city of Boston and we cannot wait to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “sweet and great location but no modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: Venturagal
Reviews.Content: This hotel REALLY , REALLY depends on what you are looking for as a traveler to Boston. Here is the good: 1) Centrally loacted to everything within walking distance (Freedom Trail, etc). This hotel is the heart of the city. Unless you are going somewhere really outside of the city, you will not need a taxi. Gotta love a hotel with a good location! 2) Friendly service everywhere. Fast check-ins, fast valet, great conceriege, great servers, etc. 3) The inside is historically beautiful. Very pretty old, dark wood. Charming. But old. Yes...old. Did i mention old? 4) The Parker Bar, restaurant and Last Hoorah bar (all located in the hotel) are great and upscale. This is an unscale hotel. No teenagers or little kids. We saw two weddings in the hotel. This is a good wedding location. JFK proposed to Jackie O in this hotel. That says alot about the charm huh? 5) Housecleaning service is outstanding. Best i have seen in a long time and i travel ALOT. 6) Room service was outstanding (fast, good, reasonable). 7) Good gym in the hotel and a Starbucks. Yes, in the hotel. 8) Bed is comfortable. Not the best that i have seen, but not the worst. I slept fine. No complaints. 9) Lots of nice extras, like good shampoo, lotion, starch, etc. These are replinshed each day by housekeeping. Here is the bad. 1) This is the oldest working hotel in the U.S. That means a few things. The rooms are smaller than hotels that we are used to. The t.v. is a tiny little t.v., not the huge ones that we are used to in modern hotels. 2) The bathroom is very tiny and my husband and i could not be in there at the same time (i weigh 100 pounds and 5'2). This would not be a problem if there was a cheap mirror somewhere in the room, but there was not. I wish the Omni Parker would spring for a cheap full length mirror that could be in the closet or somewhere!! It was very hard getting ready each day and not looking in a mirror. Omni- buy a plastic full length mirror. Us ladies need to look at our outfits before we go out! 3) The rooms do not have safes. We like to have safes. 4) You are in the heart of a big city. This hotel is noisy. You hear cars, people, whistles, etc 24 hours per day. If you want peace and quiet, this is NOT the hotel for you. 5) I thought the towels were a bit rough and could be nicer for this expensive of a hotel. 6) Within 1 hour of arrival, our main light bulb burnt out. No problem. We called down to the front to get someone to fix it. 2 days later, no one has come. My husband changed the bulb himself with one in the bathroom. 7) Again, this is an old hotel. Small bathtub that you cant use. And so tingy that you would not anyways. 8) Hard (even) for hotel staff to get me a taxi. I waited for quite awhile for hotel staff to hail a cab. 9) This hotel is underoing remodeling on the outside only. The WHOLE hotel is enclosed in scaffolding. You cannot open your window or a construction worker will be looking at you. Literally. My husband was caught off guard naked. Yes, they work Mon-Fri from 8-5. Very noisy, my fellow trip advisor friends. Ask when the remodel is complete before booking your stay. I do not know if i would stay here again. I loved the location dearly. So close to everything. But i am getting a bit spoiled for my need to have a big room and modern amenities. I hope that helps all. This hotel is not cheap either. We paid for a room with two beds from Thu-Mon and it was roughly 380.00(or more on the weekend) per night. We stayed in room 416. Ask yourself: Location or Modern Amenities? Then you have your answer. Boston Tips: * Do not miss the North End. Get a map. Look for it. It is not to be missed. * Can be difficult to get a taxi on the weekend. Give yourself a bit of time if you need to hail one. * Bring walking shoes. This is a walking city. *Subway felt a bit unsafe. Take a taxi if you are alone. *Do not miss Salem. Worth the 30 minute drive. Wonderful town at Halloween time. Great for kids. A huge carnival. Have your kids (or yourself) dressed in Halloween attire. Everyone else!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Historic Elegance at The Parker House”
Reviews.Author: Dave032
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant, stately, and very comfortable. After a tiring flight across the country and a quick cab ride from Logan, we were very pleased with the treatment by the fast and friendly staff. Everyone from the doorman, to the front desk, to the bellman was friendly and attentive. Were were travel weary so ordered room service the first night. A sumptuous meal of outstanding chowder, classic baked scrod, a bottle of Pinot Grigio, and delicious Boston Cream Pie. Yum! As you can read from other reviews, the location to historic sites and local transportation is excellent. The bed has to be the most comfortable we have ever experienced. Caveat.... as you will also see from other reviews, the rooms are small. If you need space, go for the larger rooms or suites. We absolutely loved the one bedroom suite. If you're looking for sports bars, all you can eat buffets, and gigantic rooms at bargain prices, this is not for you. If you want history, elegance, good location and fine service in Boston, Parker House has to be one of the best games in town.

Reviews.Title: “Early wake-up call!”
Reviews.Author: RangerRoger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parker House for 3 nights in late September. Forget the scaffolding on the outside - the interior is just great - including the main flower arrangement (neat idea having flower heads under water!). We were on the 4th floor overlooking the adjacent construction work which kicked-off promptly at 6.30 am each morning. Lucky for us we had just flown-in from the UK so were already awake. There were some housekeeping issues in that towels weren't replaced one day leaving us short but overall we liked the old-world charm of the place and thought the full breakfast buffet at $18 (or Â£9) a pretty good deal - it really set you up for a day's exploring. Yes - room price was high - but aren't they all in that part of Boston for equivalent hotels - and people roll their eyes when you say you stayed there! If you are from the UK then it's worth a punt whilst you can still get 2 bucks to the pound.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location very comfy bed but watch the flies on the buffet”
Reviews.Author: Thelostpearl
Reviews.Content: A wonderful central location with plenty of helpful Staff (although the front desk is woefully undermanned) and a grand welcoming lobby. Annoyingly the rooms have no safe and there are not enough safety deposit boxes. The bed is as comfortable as all reviews say. Its a good job as there is building work going on at the hotel plus right outside my side of the hotel. Watch the buffet, one day whilst waiting for the cereals to be re stocked i noticed a small fly crawling across all the meat and then another crawling over the bread. It was 90 degrees which was unexpected in October but it made me feel very sick. As Boston is so accessible it is good to have such a perfectly positioned hotel. I managed to get out to everything from this hotel for 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: naasboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the omni parker house while at a conference. Conference rate not available for two of the three nights, so they were at full rate (over $500 per night). A fine hotel, staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was small, next to the vending and ice corner so constant noise from the machines. Also a very noisy airconditioning unit so it was either sleep in the heat or try to sleep with the grinding of the ac unit next to the bed. Everything else was fine, but this was definitely not worth the rate charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Midnight_Garden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September this year, at the beginning and end of an organised coach tour, and we had a lovely time. The staff were all very courteous and friendly, the breakfast buffet was brilliant (and yes - they make GOOD coffee! This is such a rarity in the States) and we liked the style of the building. If you like old buildings which still retain their charm then you'll love this. The dining room alone is just gorgeous. I also enjoyed the rich history of the hotel; the room where you have breakfast is the same place where JFK proposed to Jackie many moons ago. Fortunately, we were aware of the scaffolding all around the building before we went there, thanks to reading some of the reviews on here. However, this did not deter us from enjoying our experience at the hotel. Yes, the rooms are a tad on the smaller side but believe me, I've stayed in smaller ones (read my other reviews and you'll know) and to be honest, I was expecting the room to be smaller after reading some reviews here. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a great room with two huge comfortable beds (and plenty of pillows to choose from), decent furniture and nice decor. The bathroom was a good size and all the fixtures and fittings worked well. Most importantly, everything was clean. On our last night at the Omni, upon the completion of our tour, we were put in a suite! It was massive!! I can definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is fortunate enough to see Boston, which is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Parker House : good location, tiny rooms, noisy”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLINGALONE068
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, and everything from next door was audible. So I didn't think it was 5 star. And I didn't think it was worth the hefty charge, for that I thought breakfast should be provided. But the history of the hotel was interesting, and the neighbourhood was fascinating.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ash625
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited about staying at a historic hotel in the heart of Boston; however, upon arrival we were immediately disappointed. The beautiful exterior of the hotel was covered due to renovations. We were not told about the renovations prior to booking and construction noises could be heard in our room. For the price we paid per night, I expected much more in terms of size of room and staff service. Our room was extremely small!!! The room was also awkwardly arranged-there was no desk or table, the television set was in a place that made it difficult to view, and the bathroom was very small and hard to move around in. The staff was polite, but they did not go out of their way to help us. In fact, we had to call the front desk twice to get assistance with our internet service. The location of this hotel is wonderful, but I would have traded location for a bigger room at any point on the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nanatwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to boston for a family vacation with our daughter and her two children. We needed adjoining rooms because our grand-daughter is a child with special needs. They could not guarantee that so they gave us a suite. We found the room clean, housekeeping department excellent, room service very accomodating and the front desk very helpful. We were on the fourth floor overlooking the construction and never at any time of the day or night was disturbed by noise. We would not hesitate to stay at the Parker House again or hesitate to recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Needs More Than An Exterior Renovation~It Needs LOVE”
Reviews.Author: AllyMoore
Reviews.Content: Just prior to making my second visit to Boston I utilized Priceline.com to book the Omni Parker House Hotel. Previously I stayed in a generic 4-Star, and while comfortable and clean I happen to like patronizing boutique hotels and/or spaces with a little bit of history. Upon arrival I noticed 3 bellhops/valets sitting outside straight chilling. As I approached I expected to hand my keys to someone or at least be assisted-no one budged with the exception of to adjust themselves to look harder at me. Bad sign #1. Get to the check-in desk, the 2 girls behind the counter look at me like I'm from mars. Bad sign #2. Get upstairs, step off of the elevator, the carpet IS HORRIBLE! The grand lobby is beautiful-but misleading. Get to your floor and you will be met by carpet that appears as though its been flooded; its stained, dingy and probably 20 shades darker than it should be. Get to the room: ITS HORRIBLE. Small/cramped, smells like it has been smoked in every day since the hotel's inception (I knew I took a chance with a smoking room, but this is ridiculous), dirty (there were pills and knick knacks on the floor under the desk from the previous guests), the furniture was dilapidated/torn/stained, the curtains looked like they were 50 years old and had never EVER been cleaned. The service was less than stellar, calls to room service yielded timely food delivery (positive), calls to concierge regarding simple matters like finding an ATM were met with serious attitude, valets messed my car's GPS system up-it was completely unhinged when I got my vehicle back. I don't know who is running this show but one thing is heir apparent to me: more than an outside renovation, this hotel needs a lot of LOVE-from its staffers and from its administration. I've stayed a lot of places-this is the first time I've felt it necessary to write a review because I simply would not recommend it to anyone unless you're in a jam and the rest of the city is booked up. I would choose a clean & friendly 2.5 star over this any day.

Reviews.Title: “Take Some Earplugs!!”
Reviews.Author: AVID-WATCHER
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 2 week holiday in Boston, staying at the Omni Parker Hotel, although it won't say anywhere in a brochure or website there is currently building work right next to the hotel where a block of apartments are being built! Work starts at 6am with deliveries and cranes being put into place and work continues until 4pm. Unless you are a heavy sleeper or like wearing ear-plugs I'd book in at another hotel until 2009 when the apartments are due to be completed! On a brighter note the hotel is superb, staff friendly, rooms thoroughly cleaned each day and food beautiful. The location is superb as just being over the road from Boston Common, the subway and shopping district although the noise from the building work was just too much each day!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni Parker Boston”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster2005
Reviews.Content: Great location, small but beautifully furnished rooms with fresh linen. Great breakfast. In all a good hotel with interesting history. The dining facilities are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bigreindeer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights towards the end of August. There were four of us including 2 teenagers so we went for 2 junior suites to get a bit of space. Very pleased with the rooms and overall service from the hotel. The breakfast buffet was excellent values (by the standards of English hotels). The outside of the hotel is being refurbished, but we did not notice any noise. There was a small amount of noise from the building site behind the hotel which our rooms overlooked. We chose the location to be central and close to Boston common and the T. We were very pleased with our choice. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline Bidders Beware”
Reviews.Author: msptravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Boston to celebrate our 20th anniversary. I booked via Priceline and felt good about my choice after reading the reviews here. What a surprise we were in for when we arrived! All I can say is Priceline users watch out for room 260. The room is so small the door almost hits the foot of the bed. You have to close the bathroom door to be able to get to the sink. And the view, forget about it, there isn't one. Now I know the Parker House is trying to sell excess inventory via Priceline but usually you get a full sized room not a converted storage closet. The hotel was also unresponsive when I asked for an upgrade. I e-mailed them prior to my stay and received no response. When we arrived I asked the front desk clerk if I could upgrade because it was our anniversary and she said, well the room does have a queen bed. If we hadn't prepaid through Priceline we would have checked right out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ”
Reviews.Author: occaisonal-traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Parker house on our family vacation this past August 2007. The Enire outside was swathed in a screen for restoration of the exterior of the hotel. This in no way affected the inside of the hotel ( which was fine), the operation, noise or any adverse effects on our vacation. They did however mess up my reservation, and almost charged me twice what I had agreeded upon. It seems that they mispelled my name on my reservation and subsequently on my confirmation Email. When I did'nt get my confirmation E-mail I called them and they did not seem very organnized or interested in straightening the problem out. The Room was clean and the Sevice was Ok, but I did have to call twice to get the roll-a-way bed brought to the room even though it was listed on the reservation. The Beds were fantastic and because it was a solidly built hotel there was no street noise. There was no desk or workspace-O-k because I was on vacation. There is Wi-fi in the lobby. Notes-Where you pull up in your car is 1 level down from the lobby and you will have to lug your luggage up or down or arrange for the bellman to help you. The $38 a night seems steep for parking, but I did'nt see any less expensive parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud”
Reviews.Author: craig2
Reviews.Content: Beware, this hotel is under construction and also has construction going on around it. Be prepared to hear loud construction noises.as early as 6:45 AM. When I say loud, I mean that even the soundest sleepers will have trouble. When I complained, I was told by the hotel management that I was on the "quiet" side and there was nothing they could do about the problem since it involved union work rules on a project that was not in their control. Bottom line, this is a nice hotel, but stay away until the construction is done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: jlplpn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Omni Parker House. The room was big and fit 5 of us. The location is great. We were within walking distance to many sites. The staff was superior. We traveled with a special needs child. The staff was very kind and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Living Entombment”
Reviews.Author: Andlovingit
Reviews.Content: The location is great--central to all the main downtown attractions. The hotel has a storied past. BUT . . . how disappointing. Our room was grim. Dark, worn, rather cramped. Sad. The public areas? Like an oak-panelled bus depot...cavernous and busy, but with no warmth. The hotel is screaming to be loved by an Arab sheik or a Russian oligarch who can pour in capital regardless of return and make it a fine place again. For now, however, some accountant rules and guests pay. The price was quite competitive, so perhaps I should not complain too much, but I was sorry to see a grand hotel in such mediocre shape. It's not an utterly horrible place, though. Just not what you would call very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding As Usual!”
Reviews.Author: CillaAgain
Reviews.Content: Once again the Omni hotel chain and hotels amaze me. From the time I call to book a hotel to the time I stay the service is outstanding. I never get this type of service from other hotel chains (even as a preferred guest). I am to be staying at the Omni Parker House in Boston for my birthday with my sisters and mother. I called two days before check in to see if the rooms where next to each other. We had two junior suites. I found that the floor we are staying on had only two at either end of the hotel. The general manager did everything he could to accommodate me. He even upgraded my room to have two rooms next to each other. This type of service is unheard of at any other chains or any other hotel (you are but a number). I can't wait for my stay. I am sure it will be as outstanding as the service I have received thus far! Once again Omni, you have surpassed all others!

Reviews.Title: “You can feel the history all around you!”
Reviews.Author: Tworunner
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Boston for vacation and found the Omni Parker House on Orbitz for a great price. It turned out to be in the perfect location b/c it's within walking distance to all major historical sites, and close to a 'T' stop for a quick trip to Fenway. We loved the location, but we also loved the room. It was good sized for a city hotel. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean and the shower had water pressure! The staff was friendly and helpful, and the lobby was absolutely beautiful - the woodwork was amazing. Room service was just OK. Internet was expensive especially considering it was a slow connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire278
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Omni after having walked past a number of times on a previous trip. I always thought that it looked so elegant and I wasn't disappointed. The whole hotel has a warm welcoming feel which makes you forget that you are in the centre of a bustling city. The location is the main draw of the hotel. For those who love shopping (like me!) it is about two minutes away from the shops of Downtown Crossing and Quincy Market. For the sightseers, the hotel is literally on the Freedom Trail and has honorable mentions in many guidebooks because of it's history. I was booked into a Deluxe room and it was very comfortable. There was more than enough room, the bed was HUGE and the bathroom about the size of my flat! Everything was clean and well kept. I have seen into an Economy room and I would say it is worth upgrading if you can afford it. The hotel staff were great. Friendly, competent and always willing to help. My one complaint was the housekeeping service. Even after hanging my "do not disturb" sign on the door, they insisted on knocking on the door at seven am to clean the room. This also happened when I was taking an afternoon nap. In my opinion, if the "do not disturb" sign is on the door then the person does not want housekeeping but wants to be left alone. However, after a quick word with the front desk the problem was fixed and the staff were even kind enough to send me a Boston Cream pie as a compensation! All in all I cannot recommend this hotel enough and I'm planning a return trip in a few months time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Arizona13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni while in Boston on a business trip. I expected great things from this historic property, but was very disapointed at every turn. When I checked in on Saturday night, I found that the carpeting in the hallways was worn and very dirty. There were hairs all over the bathroom and blood spatters on the shower curtain. After a long day traveling, I cleaned it up myself rather than wait for housekeeping. The bathroom constantly smelled like a sewer throughout my stay. When I asked maintenence about it, I was told it was an old hotel. On Sunday morning, housekeeping knocked on my door despite my "privacy please sign". When I asked them to come back later in the afternoon, the housekeeper actually rolled her eyes at me, as if this were a huge imposition. It was very hot and humid and I had my air conditioner set so the room was cool when I left. When I returned after midnight after a long day of appointments and a client event, the housekeeper not only had turned the a/c off, but had turned the heat on - it was like an oven. It took over an hour before it was cooled down enough to sleep. We had Tuesday monrning off, so I planned on sleeping in. But no, at 8am sharp workment with jackhammers sounded as though they were breaking into my room. I called the front desk to ask what was happening, and they said they were working on the brick facing outside. I was very unhappy that no one had told me about this construction work when I checked in. I spoke with the front desk supervisor, who apologized, but sounded like she could not have cared less. By this time, after so many problems, and no satisfaction at all, I called the General Manager, Dick Mason, and left a message. He called me back 4 hours later. He argued with me about whether it was jack hammers or air chisels, said they figured all the guests would be at the convention by 8am anyway, and it was the city that was doing the work, not them. He was rude and condescending, commenting that there were 6000 people in Boston for the conference and there was no way he would adjust my rate, or do anything else to make ammends for their poor housekeeping, maintences and customer service. To say I was surprised at this complete lack of hospitality by the General Manager of this caliber of hotel is an understatement. Yes, it is an historic hotel, but for over $200 a night, with dirty, stinking rooms and a complete lack of customer service, it is a disgrace. Omni should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsvardeman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Omni Parker House for business. The hotel is about 150 years old, so some of the rooms are smaller than others, but fortunately I got a decent sized room. You may want to check what type of room you are going to get when you check in. The smaller rooms only have enough room for the beds and television, no desk or sitting area. The staff is very friendly and courteous. I had no trouble checking in or out of the hotel. The food at the hotel is very good as well. They are famous for their Boston Cream Pies and Parker House Rolls. I would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Onmi”
Reviews.Author: lucky56
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our daughter in July of 2007, visiting places in New England. We flew into Boston MA on June 30. When we arrived at the Omni Parker House we were welcomed warmly, the rooms were roomy and beds were excellent. It was very quiet. We enjoyed the food that we had there. We had done a lot of sightseeing on our first day, had walked over 8 mile and so we went to bed around 9:30. At 4:00 a.m. our daughter called from her room saying she was really ill and wanted to go to the hospital. I dressed and contacted the Hotel emergency personel. They were right there. Called an ambulance for us and helped us get our daughter down and in the ambulance. The Omni is located just a mile from Mass. General hospital. Since we had no idea what was wrong and since we were supposed to check out that morning of July 1 we asked if there would be a room we could use if we needed it. They said they would find us a room and that there would be one for us as long as it was needed. They stored our luggage for us till they had the room ready and we got back. Our daughter had a kidney stone, was able to pass it and we were able to be back at the hotel after lunch and were able to do some more sighseeing that afternoon. We spend another night at the Omni. We are from a small town in Illinois, knew no one in Boston so the help that the hotel gave us was so very much appreciated. I would recommend the Omni Parker House to anyone going to Boston .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: gobsoffun
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed to hear we were staying at a old hotel. Boy was I surprised when I saw the hotel and lobby! It was beautiful! I learned about the history of the hotel. A staff member took me around and gave me a tour and told me a lot of history that happened over the years there. I had wonderful service from everyone there. The whole staff went out of there way for anything we needed. The room was wonderful. It was warm and cozy. I will always stay there everytime I come to Boston and I will tell people to stay there when they go there. Thank you for a wonderful stay at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Omni was ok but overrated”
Reviews.Author: lagrace80
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Boston on Sunday. Stayed at the Omni Parker House in room 788. Great location but small rooms. I opened the door to my room and practically ran into the bed. The carpet really needed cleaning. Restaurants in the hotel are very pricey. Nice place to lay your head but I wouldn't spend $300 a night for a room here!!! Thank God my company paid for it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: azrunner
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Boston along with my two adult children and we wanted to make it memorable. After much research, the Omni was our top choice and we were not disappointed. We are from the easy going state of Arizona and thought this may be out of our budget and league. Considering Boston is an expensive place to visit , the hotel rates were within reason. With all the famous people that have stayed there, we assumed we may have to tolerate some sobbishness. This was not the case! Many families were staying there and the staff could not have been more professional, friendly, helpful and courteous. We had a standard room with double beds. I guess coming from a big family, the three of us did not have a problem with the size of the room nor the bathroom. The room was immaculate with a candy on our pillows and plenty of towels and toiletries. We were given a view that we got a kick out of--overlooking the corner where the first public school in the country is located and around the corner is a cemetery. Location was key to us and this was the perfect place to start our day's activities. The "T" was within a 5 minute walk and we were right on the Freedom Trail. No need for a rental car--the "T" took us everywhere we wanted to go. We even took the "T" to and from the airport. Our second mode of transportation was our feet! Everything is close by. We did have the opportunity to eat at the Parker Bar. Great food and reasonable prices. We also stopped in at the Last Hurrah and enjoyed munchies. I'm not much for alcoholic drinks and the staff was kind enough to go to the kitchen to fix a cup of hot cocoa for me (it was rainy that day). I regret not getting around to trying the famous Parker House Rolls. For families on a budget, the hotel is just a minute away from donut , coffee, bagel shops and good old McDonald's. Did you also know the hotel is haunted <G>? The front desk provides a "fact" sheet of all the ghosts that wander the property. The Omni is also one of the stops for the ghost tours that are conducted in Boston. Yes, the hotel is definitely going through renovations, but the workers do not work too early and by the time we got back each day to our room, they were gone. The lobby, restaurants and bars were in great condition when we visited the first week in June. I would love to return to see the final outcome of the renovation. We had a wonderful time at the Omni and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal5
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel -- the staff was very helpful, the hotel has an incredible history, the lobby is magnificent, and the location is perfect for seeing Boston! We booked a mini-suite and loved the space. The carpets could use a good shampooing and one of the bellmen was an issue, but the rest of our experience was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay Again in a Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: gotonodj
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Omni in June on our first visit to Boston and we would stay again without hesitation. We are familiar with European hotels, so we took everyone's advice and prepared for a small room, something that should be expected in the middle of any large city. And, since it is located in an ideal spot for exploring the city, we were very happy with our choice of hotel. Yes, the bathroom is small, but we worked with the tight quarters and had no real problems. The rooms were very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. My only complaint was in having only one table to put things on. After accomodating the phone, clock, snack basket, lamp and coffee tray, there was no room for maps, watches, etc. And when we received our other coffee tray in the morning, we ended up having to store things on the floor beside the tv cabinet. Other than that, we had no complaints about the rooms. My only real complaint came from the gentlemen that waited on us in the Last Hurrah. We had dinner there one night and then stopped in for Boston Creme pie one afternoon. We found the two gentlemen that waited on us to be a bit cold and unfriendly. The other staff were so wonderful and friendly that we felt these two men really stood out. But they were the exception to the otherwise wonderful staff people. We were also pleased that our luggage was stored for us for our early morning arrival and again for our late afternoon departure. All in all, I can say that my family was very impressed and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lani721
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I just arrived from a 2-night stay at the Omni Parker in Boston. I am so delighted to let everyone of you know that this hotel is a great find! I would like to thank all of those who recommended it on Trip Advisor because without you, I most likely wouldn't have any idea what to expect. First of all, the front desk and valet are so nice. We had 2 junior suite rooms (3 women in each room). We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 a.m. (check-in is 3:00 p.m. if I'm not mistaken), and was able to check into one of the rooms! How nice is that? We were pleasantly surprised to find the our junior suite to be pretty large - my guess would be 550 to 600 s.f. It was very clean unlike some of the reviews. There were 2 very comfortable double beds and a sofa bed!!! Seriously, we easily could've fit more than 3 people in there, but it was nice having that large room. The hotel had a Starbuck's which is definitely a plus with our group (only 1 doesn't drink coffee). The gym looked nice although none of us ever made it in there! The only reason I am only giving the hotel a 4-star rather than 5 is that I did ask for a higher floor (although my girlfriends thought it was better to be lower during our "intoxicated" evenings, ha! ha!). We also had a problem with the toilet one day which of course they fixed the problem right away. There is construction going on although they gave me the 2 rooms not facing the construction and the rooms were next to each other which I thought was really nice. Next time we go back to Boston, we will definitely stay there again! The hotel has the BEST LOCATION ever! We walked all over the place - Quincy Market, Fanneil (sp?) Hall, North End, Back Bay area, etc. The T stop is also a block away if you don't want to walk. Trust me, you will be VERY pleased! Thanks to all of the wonderful employees at the Omni Parker! Boston is a great place to visit - kinda reminds me of my hometown Chicago - friendly and tons to do. A couple of restaurants I HIGHLY recommend are Taranta in the North End area and Atlantic Fish Co. in Copley Square. If you like Indian food, go to Kashmir on Newberry St. for their buffet on the weekends which was CHEAP - $15!!! Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetknees
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights, very friendly and clean. Room was large and bathroom a little on the small size but how big does a bathroom have to be. Staff helpfulland friendly. Public transport good and easy to use. Hotel very central to everything. Restaurant was great but we only had breakfast there. I would stay here again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “In the end location wins”
Reviews.Author: kmkinny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Omni Parker House. First of all, the location is great. That in itself is worth the stay. With that said...the room was a decent size. We've stayed in bigger but we were only there to sleep so it served it's purpose. The bathroom was tiny and the lack of storage for items such as make up, curling iron, etc was lacking big time. The plugs to use for charging phones, etc were in places where you had to get down on your knees and stretch...under the desk and behind the armoire. The carpet was very stained and the upholstery on the desk chair was very stained as well. The room and bathroom seemed very clean but I've never stayed in a hotel that had carpet or upholstery that bad. There really aren't restaurants around for breakfast so the Parker House restaurant was pretty much the place to go. Call me cheap but $16/person for breakfast is steep to me. The coffee is awesome though. One night after 8pm my husband and I went to the restaurant to try the famed Boston Cream Pie. Once we were seated (lots of empty tables available at that time of night) and we told the host what we were just going to have coffee and pie we were banished to the empty bar. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. Do they have areas for improvement? Absolutely. All in all the good far outweighs the bad in this case.

Reviews.Title: “There's good news and there's bad news...”
Reviews.Author: HopSkipJump
Reviews.Content: I had a picture in my mind of how this hotel would look on the inside but the reality was disappointing. It is not the Waldorf Astoria in NY nor the Biltmore in L.A. nor the Savoy in London. It is, by comparison "a nice older hotel" -- certainly not fancy if you've seen any of the top-rated older properties in the major cities of the world. Yes, it's nice inside!! But, it will not take your breath away. Echoing the remarks of the previous posters, the rooms are on the small side (although I understand that there are a number of different floorplans). The first one I was in had a king size bed, a desk, small "easy chair" and an armoire. While it was nice to have such a big bed, the "walkable area" around the bed was spare to say the least.. When my friend came to see the room, I attempted to move the desk chair -- on one side of the room -- to the other side of the room where the easy chair was so that we could face one another and talk. Try as I did, I could not wrest the desk chair from its cramped space between the bed and the desk. (I could have laid it on its side, rotated it and slided it out from under the desk but we opted to take a walk to Quincy Market instead. The second room had a queen but it was a slightly smaller room so it was not much better. Both rooms had carpet that was badly stained -- as if someone had dropped a pot of spaghetti sauce on the carpeting and did their best to wipe it up. It was murky and dark -- pretty unappetizing. The great news about this hotel is the location -- 2 blocks from 2 separate subway stations ("T" stations, as they are known in Boston) which afforded access to three separate subway lines to whisk you throughout the city. THe Parker House is also within walking distance of Boston Common. Fanheiul Hall and a whole bunch of other sites so if walking is on your list of things to do in Boston, then the Parker House is a good choice. THe service was above average. The concierges were especially helpful in giving directions and making restaurant recommendations. If I return to Boston, I probably would not stay at the Parker House again, largely because I've learned how to navigate the city and don't need to be in such a central location. For the money, I'd stay somewhere else. But, as a first-timer, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Great Service, Great Location, Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1-5 July. Greeted at the door by doormen. Smiling faces behind the counter greeted us and a quick check in. We had 8th floor and overlooked out to City Plaza area. Room was very clean, beds were very comfy, and room was spacious enough for three of us. We had two double beds. Room service was spot on. My only concern was table space. One table between the two beds held the coffee maker, alarm clock, phone, lamp, glasses, and snack tray. Lots of stuff for such a small area. One more shelf would have been great, but overall I would definity come back. Thanks Omni for making our last few days in Boston the best!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: DSD069
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House for four nights in June. We booked on Orbitz and got a decent rate for early summer. The one negative was that we asked for a non-smoking room and were given a smoking room. The hotel staff (which was very helpful) did put an air purifier in our room, which helped a lot. There is construction going on to the hotel and nearby. We were on the 12th floor and heard very little noise. Ask for an upper floor if possible. Other reviews have stated that the hotel could use a little sprucing up. The rooms are rather small, and the carpeting needs replacing in some areas. The best part of the Parker House is its location, right on the freedom trail. Also, it is two blocks from the subway. We took the green line all over the city. We bought a 7 day transit pass for $15.00. We more than got our moneys worth. The Beacon Pub is just down the street and very good for lunch. Go to Leagal's Seafood (several locations) for great seafood. We had a great time in Boston. We would definitely stay at the Parker House again. You can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: inspiredmommy
Reviews.Content: After much researching we chose the Omni to stay at with our 3 small children (6,2, 2) while my husband attended a bussiness conference. Overall we were very pleased with our stay. The hotel has lots of history and is located near the boston common, public gardens, and a short walk to Quincy Market. I actually walked with the kids by myself to the aquarium and the children's museum-was a bit of a hike I must admit. The staff was more the accomodating and friendly even to out kids which was a relief since this seemed like a travelers destination. The kids were met in the lobby with goody bags filled with treats and upon check in there was milk and cookies waiting in the lobby. Our room was spacious ( a jr. suite) and very quiet. The rug was a bit old and dingy looking but clean all the less. The AC kept the room at 73 which we would have liked a bit cooler, but again these are a picky things, all in all it was a great location with great staff to stay in Boston. We would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Special”
Reviews.Author: AnitaPage
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-day stay at the Omni Parker House and it is now (high) on my list of favorite hotels. It's perfectly situated - close to Boston Common, T stops, shopping, and right on the Freedom Trail. Our room was a comfortable size (spacious, compared to NYC rooms), clean, well appointed, had a closet big enough to hang ALL the clothes we brought and stow 2 large suitcases. Excellent food and service at the Parker House Restaurant - we appointed ourselves as clam chowder judges, ordering it at every restaurant and for almost every meal. The Parker House Restaurant definitely won the clam chowder competition! Service was 100% impeccable, from the concierge, to bellmen, to housekeeping. Most importantly, the Omni Parker House is unique (history) and special (true landmark). I'm so happy we stayed there and will return often.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: CJBLCS
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on ratings and comments from previous guests. However upon arrival we were shocked at the small size of the rooms. I was traveling with my family of 4. There was not even space for our luggage. Not even a desk or chest of drawers in the room we were assigned. After a long wait and debate with the front desk we were moved to slightly larger room. Our Air conditioner did not work properly (it made horrible clanging noises). We got very little sleep. The hotel management was unable to resolve the problem and did not seem concerned with our desperate need for a night's sleep. This property is also undergoing major construction and was very noisy during the day as well with hammering, power tools etc. All in all I must say I would never recommend this hotel for a family of 4. On a positive note, the hotel was clean, and the housekeeping staff very efficient. It would probably be fine for a couple who could contend with the very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Room”
Reviews.Author: Kikuchiyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Parker House while on vacation in Boston with our children (ages four and two). The hotel has a great location - close to Quincy Market, the Common, and a couple of T stops. The hotel is well maintained but a bit dated. The bathroom in our Junior suite was tiny, and there was a paucity of electrical outlets given the number of cameras, computers, ipods, and cellphones that we wanted to charge. One outlet near the desk didn't work at all. We also had problems with the bathtub stopper; it had come unscrewed and took some twiddling to put right. Soundproofing was great- we never heard anything from neighboring rooms (and hopefully they didn't hear our kids, either).

Reviews.Title: “Great time in spite of condition of hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelsc
Reviews.Content: Our 4 days in Boston were fun and the Parker House Hotel was a joy to see in the lobby and restaurants and bars. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Room service was always prompt. I am always happy to stay somewhere with history or a hotel with character rather than just a chain hotel that could be in any city or any town. That said, however, the condition of the carpet in the hallway on the third floor and in our 1-bedroom suite was deplorable. The only way to describe the condition directly outside our room (306) is NASTY and in the room was not much better. It is inexcusable that the Parker House would let things get to this point. The furniture was also frayed (which I could live with) and stained and filthy (which I could not). We hated to sit on the sofa but had to sit someplace. I thought of asking to be moved but after walking the hallways on 2 other floors I decided it could not be much better in other rooms. After reading the other reviews on this site I have decided that decision was a mistake. Apparently not many others have had that problem and I'm happy for their luck. We must have been assigned the worst area of the hotel! I was in the room one day when the maid cleaned and she did an excellent job so none of my complaints are with her. When I did bring it up to the young lady at the front desk, she was very nice and told me the hotel is to be renovated soon. (When I don't know -- perhaps sometime between now and never?) At any rate she was very apologetic. Unfortunately, no apology could make up for that carpet. I have not seen anything that horrible in a hotel room in many, many years. Perhaps a token pass with a steam cleaner?? I was amused to hear the "haunted tour" near the hotel one night talking about the 3rd floor of the Parker House being the haunted floor. No wonder I never saw anything -- no self-respecting ghost would hang out on that floor very long! Mr. Parker must be twirling in his grave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfort & service”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTN0828
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House in central Boston in mid-June 2007 because it was a location of a conference we were attending. It was wonderful! The room (although on the small side) and bed were attractive & more than comfortable. The fitness center was bigger & better than any we've seen previously. The hotel is located a few blocks from Quincy Market and it sits literally on the Freedom Trail. (a self-guided walking tour of Boston's historical sites). When the conference ended, we walked out the front door of the hotel and spent a delightful day on foot touring interesting historical sites. The concierge booked tickets for us that night to a popular Red Sox game and worked hard on our behalf. I would definitely go back to this hotel. Only slight problem: too many tempting high-priced food items sit on a tray on a bedside table -- but we just put them in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and room standard”
Reviews.Author: daisybuttonIreland
Reviews.Content: The location cleaniness and staff at this hotel were excellent. The only disappointment was the breakfast!!. Surprising for such an upmarket and pricey dining room. We ordered eggs benedict, which was cold when it came, and my egg white was still clear jelly in the middle. I should have complained but my English reserve must have got in the way! Would stay again but would not eat in the dining room. We did have dinner in the whisky bar and that was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “PRetty Nice, even for the Petite Roomette!”
Reviews.Author: wasthere
Reviews.Content: With a little trepidation after reading the hotel's description of its petite room, I booked the room for a trip in which I couldn't find any other place to stay in downtown Boston. (Good) Surprise once I had bumped my suitcase up a small stairway - the room was nice and very clean. While it was clearly on the small side, I had enough room for my suitcase and to sit down at night; most times, I went to bed almost immediatley coming into ther oom, anyway. The hotel's location -- by the T and a large Border's bookstore as well as several coffeee places, worked well for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: CCradio
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Boston. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms are wonderful, and you can't beat the lobby! By all means, this place is top notch! My wife and I stayed here for a trip to Boston (we toured the city for a 3 days) Staff was very helpful. Id stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelingfam040
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night for a quick trip to see the Sox/Yankees play at Fenway. After the great experience we had at the Parker House, we wished we could have stayed longer. We knew that we were taking a gamble on an older hotel based on past experiences, but we were pleasantly surprised when we checked into the Parker house. At first we saw the construction outside and got a little nervous, but it didn't detract from our stay at all. The kids were a little overwhelmed at arrival with all the attention given to us at valet and in the lobby, but it was nice treatment - everyone was friendly and helpful, and check-in was quick and pleasant. We had booked a Jr. Suite because we wanted to have enough room for four of us. It was very roomy and comfortable, with extra touches like eucalyptus hanging from the showerhead and a LAN cable in the closet for computer access. The milk & cookies left for the kids at turndown were an unexpected treat. Shopping is always fun at Faniuel Hall and Downtown Crossing, and there is a mini-starbucks in the lobby as well as a "real" one a short block away. We took the T to and from the game, and walked to everything else. No need for the car at all. We didn't eat at the hotel but had a drink at the bar - prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was nice. We would definitely stay at the Parker House again - the price was also very reasonable, compared to other downtown properties and considering the wonderful stay we had. Next time we'll stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - didn't see the ghosts”
Reviews.Author: Josie11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parker House and found it to be exceptional. Specifically, it was exceptionally clean and had great cusomter service. I had occasion to know how clean it was as I spent the entire first night of my stay sleeping on the bathroom floor suffering from food poisoning (not from the hotel food - my fault - this was the last time I ate raw sushi in an unfamiliar restaurant). I have to tell you - that was the cleanest bathroom floor I have ever seen up close. Only issue was with the ultra pricey ginger ale I had to break into the mini bar for. Great property and wonderful location - right by the common - everything is really within walking distance - but Boston's walkable so there are probably plenty of other hotels you could say this about.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Member3
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Omni Parker House in early May. As others have mentioned, the staff are happy to see you, everyone is helpful and smiling. The room was bigger than I anticipated and the bed was great. My favorite part of the stay was the check-in, where the young man who helped me was genuinely and sincerely enthusiastic. You can't buy that kind of service. We had a nice chat about Spiderman 3 and movies in general. He made me feel welcome and happy to be there. As others have mentioned, sign up for the Omni Select Guest program. You get two free beverages (juice, coffee, etc.) delivered to your door each morning plus free paper and internet! There is no charge for this program. There is a Starbucks half a block down the street and the location is close to everything. If you're looking for a hotel in the middle of it all with great service, the Omni Parker House fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmartin2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni from May 11th-16th. We had a great time and highly recommend this hotel. It's location is A+...within walking distance to everything. Yes, the hotel rooms are small..but that's typical of your older city hotels. The curtains and rug could have been a little cleaner, but I was not sleeping on the floors. The bed is to die for...comfy and clean..makes you not want to get up in the morning. I recommend signing up for the Guest Services. It was nice to have something to drink and read each morning I got up. You can sign up for this for FREE on the Omni Parker House main website. One thing that would be nice in the rooms would be a mini fridge. I'm coming back for sure. Thanks Omni for a great stay!!!! Stacie M.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jenniferann
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Omni Parker. Great location (right near where the T meets) - had easy access to all the neighborhoods we wanted to check out. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. The Last Hurrah also had the best clam chowder we tasted while in Boston and we tasted quite a few. Definitely suggest signing up for the Select Guest Program. It is free to sign up and you get 500 miles for doing so. You also tell them the things you like (on the site) - extra towels, extra pillows, etc. and they are in the room when you arrive. They also let you chose free drinks and when you want them delivered in the morning. That alone was a nice perk. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and would stay here again when I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LorIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel just before christmas and we loved it staff were very friendly and heplful. we definetly recommend this hotel and we will be goin back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: MicheleS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker House with my sister and her two teenaged boys (14 & 15) for a long weekend in Boston. We got a great deal on a junior suite via Expedia. (In fact, I had originally booked what I thought was a good rate on the room and a month or so later I noticed an even better special, so I cancelled and rebooked at the lower rate. Even after paying a $25 cancellation penalty, I still saved over $100 on the rebook.) The hotel is indeed a great location, right on the Freedom Trail between the Boston Common and Quincy Market. It's also right between two T-Stops. We had a slight hiccup on check-in: I had reserved a junior suite expecting to get two doubles and a sofa bed and turns out not all junior suites have sofa beds. We checked in to find ourselves in one of those junior suites that doesn't have a sofa bed. The hotel offered to move us to the only junior suite open with a sofa bed, but warned us that this particular room was near construction and there might be noise early in the morning. So, we decided instead to stay put and accept a complimentary rollaway, which turned out to be a hit with the teenage boys fighting over who got to sleep in it. The Omni House was a great choice. Besides being an impressive historic hotel that is very well located, it had all the conveniences we needed including a Starbucks and snacks in the gift shop downstairs, a computer room where I could check email daily, complimentary juices/beverages at our door each morning, and very comfortable beds with luxurious linens. We were very happy with it. Our bathroom was small, but I loved the deep old-fashioned bathtub and the fact that there was plenty of hot water. The staff was very accommodating and this was definitely a first-class experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: orphan60
Reviews.Content: The parker house is a nice "vintage" hotel.....we like the older more historical hotels...not big on crome and glass. We were in an economy room on the 11th floor. The room was small, but when all you do is sleep there, what does it matter....it was clean and even had a white bed spread...which was comforting because it didn't hide any mystery stains with multi-colors. Plenty of hot water and supplies....the bead was comfortable. No complaints about the room. The help was courteous and helpful....we were 3 hours early to check in, but that wasn't a problem...the room was ready...... The hotel is located close to most points of interest....you can walk to the Commons in 5 min...Fannuel Hall in 5 min....Bank North Center (Fleet center) in 15 minutes.....As you will find out nothing is very far away if you know what direction to head. We took a bus in to town and walked from South Station to the hotel in 20 minutes.....The Prudential Center and mall isn't that far away either... We have no complaints with the Parker House and we will stay there on our next "getaway" to Boston....

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kimal
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient, and the area is easy to walk around. It's a beautiful old hotel with a great history. The staff couldn't have been more courteous. We stayed in a junior suite, and our room was very large and comfortable. The breakfast buffet in the Parker House Restaurant was wonderful, and the servers there were extremely friendly. We enjoyed our first visit to Boston, and we would definitely stay at the Omni Parker House again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker House, the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: BTLogic
Reviews.Content: The keyboard of my laptop started to fail on my way to the airport, I new that upon my arrival (which was at midnight) I needed to spend some hours working on my next day's presentation. I called the hotel to ask if their business center was open 24 hours as I was not going to be able to work with my lap top. The Concierge told me that their business center was not open at that time. When I arrived at the hotel, there was a new keyboard waiting for me in the reception, the concierge went to a computer store and buy it for me. That is deffinitelly beyooooooond expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: CatherineB
Reviews.Content: The staff were lovely especially in the restaurant. The hotel is very impressive to look at and the location is perfect. The room was a bit small and crowded with no available space to use on the bedside table so we had to move things around and put the huge tray of drinks and snacks on the floor! We had all the water from this tray but it was not replaced so we had to order more from room service. The charm of the hotel is its history so we did not expect double glazing but there was a bad storm while we were there and the windows rattled considerably and were also draughty. There was also noise from the doorman outside our window frequently blowing a whistle to attract taxis. The restaurant is stunning and the food was amazing (and reasonably priced) and I would say that our dining experience was the best we experienced in Boston. Breakfast was impressive with service second to none and a huge choice of food although less reasonably priced. The bar is also good with a lively atmosphere. The location is perfect - you are right in the middle of the action - shops, restaurants, sightseeing, business.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sascha93101
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews covered most of the usual stuff, so I'll just add a couple of random observations. 1. There is a construction site by the eastern side of the building. The site opens early and if you are a light sleeper and it's not a weekend, you might want to avoid rooms on that side. When I asked a receptionist about the noise, she offered me another room, but she also said that there is no one working on the construction site over the weekend. I stayed in the original room and, as promised, the site was quiet over the weekend. 2. All stuff we talked to was pleasant and helpful. They seem to be genuinely interested in making our stay as good as it can be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loads of history!”
Reviews.Author: Wyc0mbeWanderer
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to our stay at the Omni and we were not disappointed! It is in a great downtown location and is America's oldest hotel with loads of charm and character. The rooms are finished in a colonial style with comfortable beds and crisp white bedlinen. Our room, although a little small, was perfectly clean, tidy and quiet. The breakfast is worth a try and was one of the best we had on our trip - esp the blueberry pancakes. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and we didn't want for anything. It was excellent value for money and we would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiuseppeC.
Reviews.Content: Full of story and heritage, Omni Parker House is a typical Omni Hotel proprierty: a "Flawless 3 star" place that sometimes/somewhere/somehow could look like a 4 star, but -after all- it remains a 3 star. Rooms were average in space and style. The lobby, the restaurant and the bar is somehow attractive/decadent and the wi-fi zone is a good touch, but is also dark and too crowded ad any hour of the day (e.g. it is not easy to speak with the concierge). The in room air-conditioning system made a "toc" every 10 minutes, which is not really plaesant when you try to sleep. I bought a 40 minute videogame service in room, and it lasted 15 minutes only. Price/value of the room is good (around 140 dollars per night). Location is the best you can find in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfy and worth the price”
Reviews.Author: tennis0228
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on several websites including tripadvisor.com, I decided to go with the Omni Parker. We stayed at the Omni for 4 nights and weren't really disappointed. The hotel is well-maintained as evidenced by the appearance of the lobby, restaurants and rooms. The hotel is clean and comfortable with the staff pleasant and helpful. We didn't run across one sullen staff person. The rooms are small with virtually no surface/counter space which takes some getting used to but nontheless the rooms are clean, comfortable and cozy. The bathrooms are quite small. Also be careful getting into the shower/bathtub, the side of the tub is quite high to climb over, there is no bar to hold. All n all, it was a great place to stay, convenient to the "T" too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dothedew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni Parker House from 3/30 - 4/1. We enjoyed the hotel, but mostly were there for the sites so were out most of the day. There is a Parking Garage accross the street for $10 per day (after 4) so do not use the Valet unless you want to spend 3 times as much. There is a snack shop attached to the hotel that had Starbucks coffee, which was nice when your on the go. The hotel is in a great location, so close to everything. We used the Park St. T Stop to get everywhere; if you know you'll be on it a bunch, buy a day pass for $9. Are room came with "Go Boston" cards so we were able to get free admission and discounts to a lot of the sites, so we tried to get to as many as we could. Restaurants: We went to the "Barking Crab" for dinner which was fabulous. It was the best seafood, I have ever had. We had to wait awhile, but the bar was fun so the time went quick. Bars: There are so many great bars we went to. The Beantown Pub, which is a block away on Tremont was fun. If you are a beer drinker, Bukowski on Dalton St. is amazing. There were so many beers I had to ask the bartender to surprize me. When we go back to Boston, we're definetly staying at the Omni Parker House again.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Paradox”
Reviews.Author: MTL-GUY
Reviews.Content: I have to admit one thing; any hotel where I wake up in the same position in which I fell asleep, (even if it is for but a few hours) is a VERY good thing, so I give it 5 stars for comfort because I am usually well rested after the first night at the Omni. Donâ€™t expect (because youâ€™re paying full rate) that you will be specially treated. I paid 199$US per night for my room and had half the room size I had last year, which was already small (in the same hotel), my room this time, was on the third floor, and if I jumped high enough over the A/C-Heater unit, or climbed on the chair, I was able to look out onto a construction sight behind the hotel. On my last morning, I had the privilege to get the construction noises from 6 a.m. I understand that it isnâ€™t obvious to get someone a nice room on a Thursday evening, but I had reserved for 4 nights, such a room should be distributed to someone staying one night only (I work a front desk in a 4-star hotel, so I hand out rooms according to the rate the clients paid and the number of nights they stay â€“ which is a very perspicacious thing to do, it shows the client that I care). Thankfully, I wasnâ€™t in the room long enough to care to invite some other guests over, besides, where would I put them? It was even more disconcerting to have my friends come down from NH on the Saturday night, rent their own room and get a free upgrade to a Suite with a view and a living room, paying 10$ less than me â€“ SAME as last year!! Not fair!! The room was very clean and so was the bathroom but donâ€™t expect a bathtub in all rooms. Mine was misplaced somewhere in a different room and I was only allowed a cramped shower stall with very low water pressure. While my colleague had a mini bar in her room, my room was too small to even have a picture of one. This may be an isolated case, but an irritating one nonetheless. Now the stars go down to 4. My iron had burnt crust on it and thus left some on my shirt before realizing I had to clean it myself so I could use it in the here and now and not have to wait around for housekeeping to bring me another one. This should be verified BEFORE the client check isâ€¦ Breakfast was superb; every day! I couldnâ€™t rave enough about it. The healthy choices are exquisite and I loved the small shotglass of fresh fruit smoothie at the end; nice finishing touch and caring enough of them to have your daily minimum required amount of fibre!! Letâ€™s not forget the wait staff and hostess, all polite and efficient. The Last Hoorah bar is great. The food served is delicious and you donâ€™t have to wait around for hours to be served. Parking attendants, on the other hand, will make you wait quite a bit. I checked out on the Monday morning and asked the attendant if it was busy. When he replied negatively, I asked for my car and waited at least 20 minutes. I STRONGLY suggest calling for your car 15 minutes beforehand, no less. For a whopping 38$ per night youâ€™d expect service to be a little quicker. Another piece of advice, donâ€™t call long distance to your loved ones, even if it is for a couple of seconds. The brutal connection fee of 14$ per call will quickly add up to a traumatizing experience. Be WARNED!! Iâ€™d recommend the place to most people but I donâ€™t know how to go about getting a better room next time Iâ€™m there. Sucking up is not my thing. Maybe itâ€™s time I moved on, just for the sake of trying something new.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travel4ever2
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is a perfect place to stay for the business or leisure traveler. I was the latter. I stayed there for 5nts and thoroughly enjoyed it. First of all, it is in a terrific location. It is on School and Tremont Streets right in the heart of downtown, and it is on the Freedom Trail. Nearby are Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, which aside from their historical significance, provide a wide variety of shops, restaurants, and a comprehensive food court. It is also right between two major subway stops, Park Street and Government Center. Both stations provided access to the North Station where you can hop on a commuter train if necessary. The lobby is rather large; the staff is very personable and professional; the room was a good size (2 dbl beds/nonsmoking) and clean. The bathroom was quaint with all the comforts of home. One caution...if you are a mini bar user, check the dates on items. There were some bottles of juice that looked like they had been there for years and not replaced, and some of the items had dust on them. If you are in need of the internet, it's a good idea to bring your own laptop. We made the mistake of not bringing ours and had to pay $5.95 for only 15 minutes of use on the hotel's public computer. Another good tip, sign up for Omni's Select Guest program. You get two complementary beverages of your choice delivered to your room along with your choice of newspaper each morning!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff who care”
Reviews.Author: Marmitegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker hotel in February for my birthday. Initially we were looking for a hotel graded as 4 stars and very nearly didn't book at the Omni Parker as it is graded at 3.5 stars - boy are we glad we did! Aside from the location that other reviews have noted and the classic decor that great you when you check in, this is a hotel staffed by a team who care about making your stay special. We had contacted the hotel in advance and explained it was my birthday and also my husbands first trip to Boston and that we were looking forward to staying. The hotel were kind enough to arrange a lovely room (with incidently the most comfortable bed and pillows of any hotel in our 2 week vacation!), with a great view. Shortly after we arrived they also sent chocolate cover strawberries and a kind hand written note to our room as a birthday surprise. When you consider how many people stay at the hotel, this shows that the staff really care about making your experience special. Incidently - the strawberries and wonderful and on the room service menu - I would highly recommend ordering them! Thank you very much to all the staff at the hotel for making the stay special and i would encourage anyone who is thinking of booking a 4 star hotel in Boston to ignore the 3.5 stars and book at the Omni. This is a hotel that provides a luxurious experience at great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker House Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: Marli34
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Omni Parker House over the St. Patrick's Day weekend. After several posts to TA, it continued to come up as a recommended hotel. I read a few reviews and was a bit worried that I may be stuck having a bad experience. I took the chance after a local Bostonian convinced me. I am so glad that we stayed there!! To begin with, the location of the hotel could not be any more centrally located. It is within walking distance of everything you could imagine. The hotel itself is a gem. The first impression is the glorious lobby. The staff was fabulous. Very helpful and always a smile. The rooms are a bit small, but very comfortable none the less. The rooms are clean, the bathroom as well. The hotel is in excellent condition. Do not be detered by the few comments on the carpets being old, they are not. I am not sure if they have just been replaced or really steam cleaned, but they are not old looking nor dirty. The restaurant The Parker House offers wonderful food, with excellent service. The Last Hoorah was a nice bar to have a cup of coffee or a drink before turning in for the night. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfkb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March 2007. Hotel location is excellent, a very short walk from Boston Common and two T stations for easy access to everywhere in the city. Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, joined the Select Guest program before I left. Check in was easy, they had all my details already, and check out was similar. Nice touches of complimentary drinks and paper for Select Guests. Room was very comfortable, although the bathroom was a bit cramped. Staff were helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but terrific location”
Reviews.Author: NCTravelinFool
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Omni last weekend. It is a beautiful hotel from the lobby to the rooms. The concierges were very helpful and the breakfast at the Parker House restaurant was excellent (I usually don't have breakfast in hotel restaurants because they tend to be overpriced and mediocre. This is not the case here). They have homemade corned beef hash, which is a rarity where I come from. The location is fantastic. We could easily take the Freedom Trail from the hotel. It has 2 metro stops nearby and everything you need to see is within walking distance or a metro ride away. The only downside to this superb location is the noisiness on the street below. We were on the 3rd floor and could hear the raucous revelers way into the evening. Our room was facing School Street. But that was the only downside. I hope to visit Boston again and I will stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Omni Parker House, and would certainly stay there again. The hotel could not be in a better location (right on the Freedom Trail); the service was great; the beds were incredible; and the staff very friendly. Spend a little extra for a deluxe room - you will certainly have enough room. Also, register as an Omni Select Guest on the hotel's website (it's free!) and you will be able to pre-select your room type and also receive some special treatment (we received free juice every morning, a newspaper, and turn-down service). We had a great stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Omni Experience!”
Reviews.Author: taxiplease
Reviews.Content: Where else can you eat breakfast at the same table that JFK asked Jackie to marry him?? The Omni Parker House is a history book come alive in the most accomodating way.
