I love the chocolates and weather cards on the bed at night, the ornate architectural features throughout, and most important of all the "aim to please" mindset provided by the entire staff. We just stayed there for the fourth time in a year, as our daughter attends college in Boston. I would not stay anywhere else. I can honestly say that the Omni Parker House is my favorite hotel in the world. It's got to be the best considering they came up with Parker House Rolls and Boston Creme Pie. The Omni Parker House captures the essence of Boston in a most unforgettable way.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location ”
Reviews.Author: barbarawesttisbury
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and granddaughter spent our bi-annual visit to the Parker House for our "girls weekend". We love this hotel, cookies and milk waiting in the room for the six year old and a gift bag with lots of goodies. We booked a Junior Suite because these week ends are special to us. Staff couldn't have been more accommodating, tea and coffee in the lobby. Room service was prompt and food delicious. Location is great, close to all Boston attractions. We were able to walk just about everywhere. Would definitely recommend this hotel and we can't wait for our next visit.. Please sign up for Select Guest, juice and coffee delivered at a designated time with the morning paper. You will definitely enjoy the Omni Parker House, Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service = relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: LilRelly
Reviews.Content: I truely enjoyed my stay at the Omni Parker. I was in Boston participating in an Expo and my husband chose the Omni Parker instead of the suggested hotel... boy, am I glad. The staff we friendly and helpful (particularly Steve) who took the time to mark points of interest on the map. It's convieniently located and the lobby is beautiful! The restaurant and bar staff were less enthusiastic, and the food & drink was a little over priced. However I was very pleased with the overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: BradyWanderer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The Hotel was in excellent condition with several new upgrades. We booked a suite at $189 a night and thought it was well worth the money. Restaurant was a bit pricey but we were expecting that. Service was excellent from all aspects of our stay including, valet, bell captain, reg desk and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: quindad
Reviews.Content: Even though we`re locals, we couldn`t resist the amazing travelzoo promotion that this hotel was offering at $109 for a junior suite. We spent President`s Day Eve here and spent a delightful Sunday overnight in Downtown Boston. This hotel is filled with old world charm and an extroverted, cheerful and helpful staff at every turn. Our suite (#564) was huge and stunning with a king sized bed with luxury bedding, a large sitting area with sofa, coffee table, and 2 chairs, a separate alcove with desk and chair,coffee maker, 2 good sized closets, a compact, but well thought out marble bath with abundant towels and thoughtful amenities and views of downtown from 2 large windows with luxury window treatments. Housekeeping here is superlative in every way and needs to be commended. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor we joined the select Omni guest program which is free and very advantageous. We had express check in, requested needs were in place upon arrival, beverages and newspaper delivered to the room in a timely manner in the morning, turndown service and late check out. We were so impressed with our stay that we`re considering doing it again next weekend while the promotional rate is still available. TA reviews indicate that many of the rooms here are very small. The junior suites are spacious and highly recommended. Not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “The Classic Parker House”
Reviews.Author: ldat7
Reviews.Content: In the heart of downtown Boston, the Omni Parker House is a classic, old-style hotel with a comfortable lobby and nice rooms. Room service is excellent, given their famous food, including the delicious Parker House rolls. I also attended a conference at this hotel last spring and it was a great place for it. This is just a nice, classy hotel all around - I wish I could live there!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: NYHolley
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel strictly for location. We were a bit hesitant because of some prior reviews. We just stayed one night and it was wonderful. The staff was quite friendly and the rooms were very clean. The Omni probably had the cleanest bathroom floor we ever saw. We did not see any chipped paint in our room or dirty carpet. The carpet in the hall could be replaced but in the room it was fine. The rooms are a bit small but most people who travel to larger cities are aware of this. Yes, room service is pricey - but that goes with the territory. I have never stayed in a hotel offering room service where it wasn't pricey. You are not forced to eat there. Contrary to some reviews - it is not too expensive for what you get. It is right on the money. You are not going to get the ritz carlton for $175.00 a night. But, if you are used to staying at a budget inn, then yes, I guess this would seem very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nicholefecteau
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night weekend trip to Boston. I had registered to be a Select Guest on the website (free) and also mentioned that we were going for my husband's birthday. When we arrived, the doorman gave us some great tips and told us where we could park for $10/night. We declined and opted for valet service ($38/night)- he gave us some good advice- pick up the car by noon on checkout day to dodge an extra $16 fee. Great doorman- we loved him. Check-in was already done for us as we had paid online- just had to pick up our card and go. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. We got to out room (1102)- which had a king bed and two windows with great views. The room wasn't enormous, but certainly wasn't too small. It was clean and comfy. The bathroom was very clean as well. The staff had left 6 chocolate dipped strawberries and a birthday card for my husband. Now, when I booked I opted to pay with my Amex card which entitled me to an extra amenity- we chose a bottle of wine. The wine wasn't in the room so I called the front desk. THey said it should be there already and left it at that. I let it slide since they were kind enough to leave the strawberries but at checkout my husband mentioned it and the woman checking us out gave us a bottle of Parker House wine to bring home. Again, they were very nice. We also ordered 2 dozen Parker House rolls and a Boston Cream Pie to bring home. Both were fabulous. The Last Hurrah bar was nice- albeit stuffy. The drinks were well made, the seating very comfy. The second night we went around the block to the Hub Pub- more of a rowdy atmosphere. All in all, everything was excellent. The beds were to die for and they even brought us extra feather pillows. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: stef49
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on the Omni website and got a pretty good rate for a hotel of this quality. The room I stayed in was well sized and very clean. Housekeeping do a great job here. Room service was fast and of a reasonable value. There was a large selection of meals even after 11pm. The locations is great, just a 5 minute walk from Boston Common and the City shopping mall. I'd definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but with a great history.”
Reviews.Author: thesnops
Reviews.Content: Location ok for exploring, room very small with two large beds (who needs 2 beds?!), dated appearance - could do with a lick of paint. Doors too thin - we could hear everything going on outside when people passed by. Would probably choose somewhere else to stay if we went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ok at parker House”
Reviews.Author: MeNH
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Parker House. Comfortable bed. Ok Housekeeping. Carpets look stained and in need of cleaning or replacement on our fourth floor. You will need earplugs. Noise from the corridor and the street is louder than normal. Room service is ridiculously overpriced. $15 eggs plus $3 charge plus gratuity then taxes. Now add coffee! We skipped it and enjoyed the plentiful dining options nearby. Valet and Bell service was excellent. Nice historic hotel with first rate location.

Reviews.Title: “A History Buff's Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamsin72
Reviews.Content: I teach 3rd grade and I LOVE history...so this hotel was like Heaven to me! I had so much fun exploring the history of the place that I was able to overlook the fact that it is not a totally modern place to be. The ornate lobby was beautiful. The location is amazing. There is a book on the history of the hotel that you can get for free at the front desk if you are interested. I found it fascinating. There are a few minor things that I noticed about the hotel. One was the carpet in our room seemed a little threadbare. Our room was considered a junior suite which means it was a little larger than other rooms. The rate was $149 and I got that by just calling the hotel. The extra room gave us a lot of space for the kids to play. The toilet in our room backed up once, but was fixed promptly. The food was incredibly expensive. But the hotel is very close to other restaurants and fast food places. We did order room service once for breakfast. We ordered only two breakfasts to split between us b/c each one was $15! Unfortunately, when it was delivered it wasn't very hot. I couldn't melt butter on the pancakes or toast...so definitely not worth it. So if you couldn't care less about history, you might only give this hotel three stars, but in my opinion sleeping in the same hotel that once housed Charles Dickens and many others is worth an extra star.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: ET13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here on Christmas Eve. Aside from the ideal location there wasn't much else that was exceptional about the hotel. The hotel likes to boast about its history and events that have occured over there, but those things are meaningless if the rooms are antiquated and small. We stayed in a hole in the wall with a view of the alley. The room had a very musty smell and it didn't feel like any of the pillow cases were changed recently so we tossed most of them into the closet as there wasn't anywhere else to put them. The walls are also very thin as I was forced to listen to several other guests in the hotel as they sang badly and laughed hysterically throughout the night. And before I checked out I had called down to the front desk to have a taxi ready for us by a certain time because we had a plane to catch. When we got down to the lobby, the porter wasn't even outside and of course there wasn't a cab in sight. The porter finally appeared and I reminded him that we had called for a taxi earlier. He ignored me and then ran to the corner to hail a cab (I could have done that myself). Another family exited around that time and the porter wanted us to share a taxi to the airport (2 in our party and 3 in the other). Finally another taxi came and we placed our own bags in the trunk and rushed in to leave immediately since we were already 15 minutes behind schedule. The porter flagged down our taxi before we left and demanded a porter-taxi fee even though he failed to have a taxi ready for us at the time we requested. I gave him a couple of dollars as I was too tired and too rushed to argue. My wife called the hotel after we got to the airport and they said they didn't have a porter-taxi fee. I didn't expect to have such rude service in a supposedly grand hotel like the Omni House. Overall a very disappointing stay aside from the location. Better to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Boston "Omni Parker House"”
Reviews.Author: Myalibi
Reviews.Content: This hotel I have been coming to for years. I belong to their Select Member Group and save, save, save. I always get a fantastic upgrade, rooms quiet, comfortable and inviting. Close to everything, walk to everything. Staff professional and very attentive. Always a smile and concern. Great amminities, popular lounge, fun smaller lounge, formal and non dining, pub to jacket. Coffee bar downstairs, computer center clean and supplied. Work out Area impressive. I will always stay at this Hotel, in fact, this Hotel is the incentive for me to open a branch office in Boston for my businesses. I feel I have a home there already. I rate this Hotel 1,000% the finest. Cordially, Mrs. Elizabeth Cordier-Roeder CEO, Tiara Mortgage and Pro-Se Legal Center, Stuart, Florida.

Reviews.Title: “needs refurbishment but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thelbie
Reviews.Content: When we travel to Boston we usually stay at the Omni which has a great location, close to Fanueil Market, Boston Common and a plethora of historical sites. We arrived late morning and was told by a rather brusque young woman that "check-in was not until three, that I could check my bags with bell captain and should come back in 3 hours". Bell captain was much nicer than front desk. I roamed around downtown enjoying the christmas hubbub and walked over to the Common to watch the ice skating at the frog pond. This was a lot of fun watching many skate for the first time. I used to skate but I am not that brave anymore and fear for breaking something. Returned to hotel and was greeted by a MUCH friendlier gent at the front desk. My room was ready. I am a select guest member and was taken aback by the room they gave me. It was on top of a very loud construction site and quite shabby. I immediately called the desk and requested another room and within minutes a bellman was there to help me with my luggage and a key to a much quieter and less shabby room. He said he didn't blame me for wanting a room change. He was surprised they even rented it out . New room was small but the King bed with what they call 7 layer luxury was devine (three sheets, light duvet, heavy duvet 7 pillows). There is one chair next to small desk, a walk in closet which was bigger than the tiny bathroom that had no place to put your toiletries but it was clean and towels fluffy and white. The room overall needs refurbishment, rugs need replacing in both the rooms and the corridors. The last time a major refurb was done was when omni took over in 1969 (i think that was the year) so i think it's time for another one. Ate this time at Parker's restaurant where jfk proposed to Jackie, food was superb albeit expensive but service was slow but friendly. Last Harrah Bar serves a wonderful "Boston Cream Pie" Martini at $10 a pop but they give you complimentary bowls of mixed nuts. Fun bar and a lot of history here. All in all I still like this hotel and most likely will return, however next time instead of immediately booking there I will probably search out some other options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: WHATSLEFTTOSEE
Reviews.Content: Only spent three days in this hotel in Boston, on a multi city trip this was our first port of call and definately the best hotel on our trip. Room was excellent, spotlessly clean, quite spacious, very comfortable bed and excellent ensuite facilities. Hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. Good facilities in hotel, fitness room etc. Restaurants and bars very well run, although a bit pricey, and the location of the hotel was excellent, within ten minutes walk from Quincey Market and Harbour area. I especially was impressed by how security conscious the Omni Parker was. No one could use the elevators without their room card, you needed this to operate the elevator. Safety deposit boxes were available at Reception free of charge. The hotel foyer itself was very impressive, very spacious and ornate, old world type hotel foyer, this hotel was obviously a favourite of John F. Kennedy as his picture adorn walls everywhere in the hotel foyer. To conclude if I was returning to Boston I would hope and be delighted to stay in the Omni Parker House Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience at the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: Aptos
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly pleased with my stay at the Omni Parker House during my November 2006 visit. My room (#1426 @ $185/night) was a perfect size for me, beautifully appointed, and exceedingly comfortable. According to the hotel floorplan, some rooms were smaller (I probably wouldn't have enjoed that as much) and some were larger. I had a queen bed and plenty of room to move around. I joined Select Guest before my arrival, and received morning coffee, juice, and newspaper, and also evening turndown service (and chocolates!). The Select Guest suprised (eucalyptus bath salts) was lovely. I was impressed by all staff of the Omni Parker House whom I came in contact with, for their professionalism and graciousness. I will definately book future hotel rooms with Omni, and will happily recommend Omni and the Boston Omni Parker House to my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “They stole our belongings!”
Reviews.Author: abg2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for his business conference in early October. We had a great time - they were extremely accommodating with having a crib in the room when we arrived and allowing for later housekeeping times (due to my son's nap schedule). All staff we encountered were very professional. However, upon checking out and going to our next hotel we realized we'd left some clothes in the closet of the room, so we called the hotel less than 2 hours after checking out and our clothes were gone. Security was no help whatsoever, when my husband asked to file a report the security manager took it but when we called back the next day they could not find a record of it. Repeated calls back have gone unanswered. Would have been a great stay because of that, but now we won't go back. The room was by far the smallest hotel room I had every stayed in and it was a deluxe room. I would hate to see what a standard room looked like.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect way to end the weekend”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a weekend when I was attending a concert in Boston. The staff was amazing. I had enrolled in the Omni Select Guest Program but wasn't sure I would be able to take advantage of the program since I had booked through Priceline; however, I was offered the opportunity to upgrade to a large deluxe room if I was willing to wait a few hours, which I gladly did. I did get a chance to see the smaller rooms and I would not recommend them as there is barely room for a bed and desk. The large deluxe rooms are wonderful and I had a great view. No interest access in rooms, only in the lobby. I personally don't like to use my computer where people can see my business. Also thought it was strange that hotel staff recommended a bar down the street for a drink when the hotel bar was open. Only other issue: as a Select Guest member you are entitled to two complimentary beverages and newspaper in the morning - I originally chose one time and then decided I wanted to check out earlier so called room service and asked if I could have an earlier delivery and they never showed up; however, Nicole at the front desk (thank you, Nicole!) went and got me a cup of coffee to go as I checked out. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: JJQuick
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation on AAVacations.com. The Omni Parker House in Boston is a great hotel. I highly recommend it. The hotel is nice and is in a terrific location. It seemed like it was close to everything. It is formerly the Boston Parker House. I was quite surprised to discover the rooms are very very small--even for 2 people. We were given a room with 2 full size beds. Waaaaay too crowded. I kept bumping into things. We stayed in the room our first night. The next morning I requested a room with one queen or king bed. Luckily, one was available and so we switched rooms. Room still small but no where near as crowded. The bathrooms were small, too that had a pedastal sink, so no counter top. The bedroom has high ceilings and has the charm of an older hotel. But, that is Boston: old and charming. I do have my complaint about the room and bathroom being small but I would say overall, hotel is still an excellent place to stay. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Concierge always there to give recommendations (where to eat etc.) Also, we needed a rental car for one day (drove up to New Hampshire) and concierge made the rental car reservations for us. The car was brought to our hotel. One less thing to worry about.. Note: You do not need a car to see Boston. The best way to see Boston is by foot. Overall, I would definately stay at the Omni Parker House again. Hopefully I will see Boston again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - lots of history!”
Reviews.Author: sparktraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in Feb. Rooms were a bit small but very very clean and well beautifully decorated. The bed was super comfortable and I absolutely loved all the plush pillows and comforter! Great location as it is just a short walk to Quincy Market area and the original Filene's Basement; though once the sun sets, there isn't much open in the area as it is downtown. (We just cabbed it elsewhere.) Seems like a great, comfortable, classy stay for business - well equipped with hi-speed cable and nice restaurant/bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Allyone
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent one night here on a brief trip to New England. This is a splendid Hotel, very classy, as the Lobby illustrates, we had an upgrade voucher ( we joined their hotel pragram-free via the internet ) they obliged, with a large room, king size bed, and all thge other amenities,with a great view over Boston. We ate out, so cannot comment on the food, we did have a cocktail in the bar, and that was so good!!! If you are interested their is a great deal of History attached to the hotel, demonstrated by pictures throughout the Lobby and Bar areas The Hotel is a block away from Boston Common, and the freedom trail literally goes by the hotel, so you could not get a hotel in a better spot. We will certainly go back to this hotel on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel trading on its history”
Reviews.Author: Justatraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked in for four nights here. The room itself was too small even to open our suitcases and depressingly dismal - paper peeling off the walls, aircon unit buzzing alarmingly, empty and dirty minibar, great view straight into other bedrooms about 10ft away - but staff assured us they'd be able to find us a better room the next day, so we thought we'd give it a chance. Maybe, we thought, the restaurant will make up for the room. Some hope. The bread seemed to be straight out of a packet. The soup was tepid and my fish (very hot) came on a bed of rice whose temperature varied from cool to warmish. On our way back to the room (we had specifically requested a quiet room) we heard loud music from the ballroom on the floor above. Back in the room itself, the aircon unit now sounded as if it was about to explode. We thought we'd use the wi-fi network to look up another hotel on the internet... except there was no information about it in the room and we couldn't find a way of logging in. Eventually we found a number for another hotel in a magazine, rang and made a booking. The receptionist was not in any way rude as we left, merely resigned. We got the impression she'd seen it all before. The doorman who'd helped us in with our bags a couple of hours earlier seemed genuinely sorry to see us go so soon. But even he didn't seem surprised. It's a beautiful building, an impressive lobby, but it takes more than historic walls to make a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ashvas
Reviews.Content: great place - highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: BarnetBlackDog
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here as part of a wedding party in early Sept 2006. We benefited from a preferential rate as it's a bit expensive otherwise in my view. The hotel has a great location right in the heart of downtown Boston - pretty much everywhere of note is within walking distance - this will save you $$ on cabs. Parking is OK albeit the staff could be friendlier and the check-in process is prompt (tip - join the frequent guest scheme and you will get express check in and out and complimentary drinks and newspaper). The lobby is grand and the downstairs bars are good - although they are not open very late. Lifts are old and small and can take a time to reach your floor. Rooms are clean and light but not big and could probably do with an update. Concierge service is great - we used it to get our laundry done and it was delivered in room on time. Breakfast is not cheap but is very good. The ballroom has great views but very dated decor (we were there for a wedding) and really needs an update.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay and everything nearby”
Reviews.Author: Marcia Mae
Reviews.Content: Very pretty lobby, but room with king-size bed small. Bathroom small too. Location is it!! Personal very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location is not everyting”
Reviews.Author: vdoolittle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House this last May, 2006 during a business trip. I was very excited to be staying in this historic hotel (claimed to be the oldest in the U.S.) even though I felt the nightly rate to be excessive. This is my 4th trip to Boston and it has become one of my favorite cities. The location of the Omni Parker House is outstanding, within easy walking of all the sites of central Boston and well within reach of anything else by cab. The doormen were always quick at getting us a cab and very helpful with suggestions and advice. There is so much to see and do in Boston, this convenient location made it easy to access all the fun I wanted. However, even knowing this was the nation's oldest hotel was no excuse for the poorly kept rooms, their bad smell and lousy restaurant, front desk and lobby store service. They claim there is a ghost in the hotel and I have no doubt this ghostly haunting is someone's way of getting revenge on the hotel for the same problems I encountered. The room was incredibly small, almost too small for two people. When several friends arrived to pick us up for dinner, we all could not even fit in the room at one time! Fortunately, we were rarely in our room and this saved us from feeling too ripped off. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on 2 mornings. They were only a handful of patrons in the restaurant and despite the fact that there was a breakfast buffet and at least 4 staff were visible, the service was slow and the staff surly. When they found out we wanted to order off the breakfast menu instead of having the buffet their attitude got even worse. I ordered the lox and bagels, which cost almost as much as the buffet and was very disappointed to see that my plate was put together by the waiter from the buffet spread! The other wait staff doing set up and clean up were very noisy and practically threw things from across the room! The way they handled the lovely antique sideboard was appalling. The lobby shop leaves a lot to be desired. Granted they were in the middle of adding coffee services but this was no excuse for poor service. I went into buy some Kotex for an unexpected emergency and was told I could not purchase them as the staff could not get one register to work and did not have the key to the other register and the guy who did was out for coffee! I asked to leave money over the amount of the purchase ($5.00 for a $2.99 purchase) and pick up my change later as this really was an emergency and she refused and suggested I walk several blocks to the drug store. Several times I went into the store and there was no one there at all to pay for my purchases. The front desk was very inefficient, we checked out at 5 am for a 6:30 flight and waited 40 minutes for a bell boy to get our bags. The front desk had only 2 computers working and it took almost 30 minutes to check out at the desk due to the computers not taking the information and having to be reentered repeatedly. The front desk staff were very friendly and in their defense, the hotel was extremely busy and they even said their computers were so antiquated they did not know how they got through the day sometimes. Worse yet it was the front desk staff that had to double as bell boys and get bags from the room during check out that morning. On a positive note, the bar was most excellent, just the flavor and character I have come to expect from Boston. Elegant and interesting surroundings, wonderful and personable bartenders who definitely know how to serve a real cocktail. I would not stay here again as I felt it was not a good value for the price due to lousy service and size of the room, despite its historical significance, excellent in house bar and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: TAmembers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on family tour of New England. Couldn't have chosen a better location, we walked straight out of the hotel into the middle of everything you need in Boston. Great to stay in such an historical building. We are a widely travelled family and rarely have we stayed in a hotel that has felt like a home. We had a very large room, very clean with an excellent bathroom. On the first night room service brought complimentary milk and cookies for the children. The whole experience was very comfortable. Only drawbacks - no pool and the car park around the corner was at $35 per day the most expensive we saw in Boston. However it was a nightmare navigating the one way system through Boston to the hotel and easier to leave it there. Apart from usual sights dont miss courtyard of Boston library which we found by accident finding a loo for our daughter. Tube is great but trip to Harvard is an enormus disappointment. We loved Boston for its compact size and mix of old and new and the stay at the Omni Parker was the icing on the cake. We planned to stay 4 nights but found 3 days in Boston enough.

Reviews.Title: “smalled room size for a 4 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: nathan13
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 4 night labord day holiday weekend. I was ready to experience the comforts that I have come to expect for hotels of this rating, but alas I was very very disappointed by the room size. The economy room has a 4 feet long bed and a 2 feet space around it. It is just as big as the hole in the movie "Shawshank Redemption" if you need something to relate to. I mean seriously its really really really small room for the price you are paying for a 4 star rated hotel.. I had to upgrade it to deluxe room but even that room was very very small room. Normal size bed, but not any space to move around it. Even the other side of the bed is flush against the wall with no space The only virtual tour and pictures they have here is the deluxe room which is the biggest and the only normal size room they have. For a 4 star rated hotel, the room size in this hotel is a complete joke. Plus they do not offer "NESN" Tv channel which is a complete surprise for a hotel in Boston as NESN exclusively carries Red Sox games and Boston is all about Red Sox.. Please stay away from this hotel if you want to enjoy your stay in Boston !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dartmouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights, 12 August to 15 August. We were in two deluxe rooms which were the largest hotel room(s) I have ever stayed in, although the bathroom was tiny with little storage space. The king size bed was huge with plenty of pillows; best three night's sleep in a hotel for a long time. The location of the hotel is perfect, being on the freedom trail and close to a T station (Boston Common) and Faneuil Hall (where you can eat reasonably). We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant on the last morning as it was raining heavily, but it was a nice finish to our stay there. The hotel reception area, restaurants and bar areas are really traditional and make you feel like you've walked into somewhere very special. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We registered as select guests on their website before we travelled and as such enjoyed complimentary turn down service, hot drinks in the morning and a surprise of chocolate covered strawberries as it had been my birthday a couple of days before. Highly recommended and we will stay at the Omni Parker on visits to Boston in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an excellent town”
Reviews.Author: GOMCP
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - very central position - 5 minutes walk from the Common, City Hall and Quincy market. Old fashioned dÃ©cor â€“ generally in clean and good condition â€“ but a piece of wallpaper was loose in the bathroom. We had Room 1462 - a big spacious corner room - not very good views but quiet. The Front desk was very helpful when our plane was delayed (by over 24 hours) â€“ they did not charge us for room even though we were outside the defined time when we notified them. They were also very helpful and knowledgeable with our queries. Breakfast was extra, but there was an excellent choice and a good cold buffet. An excellent hotel in an excellent town.

Reviews.Title: “Seven pillows on my bed!”
Reviews.Author: RuthAnn1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend as our last hurrah :-) (you have to go to Omni Parker to get the joke!) after a road trip which included hiking and biking in Acadia Park, Maine. Check-in was a breeze - excellent attention to us. Rich, elegant lobby. The birthplace of Parker rolls and Boston Creme Pie! Rooms small but luxurious. Beds and the 7 pillows very comfortable. Can't beat the location for running through the Boston Commons to Charles river and the Esplanade, Newbury street, Quincy square, catching the T to Harvard, Macy's and Filene's basement of course! Not cheap, but also not overly expensive considering it was high season.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hounslea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before a trip to Cape Cod. The hotel is fantastic with a beautiful lobby. Bed rooms a decent size for a city and beautifully appointed. Staff were very helpful and ideally situated in the Boston area for sightseeing. Would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Terry1956
Reviews.Content: The room had two double beds, one small chair. There was no desk. There was no room to move around. The bathroom was tiny as well. The closet was tiny. There were luggage racks in the closet, but no place to open them up -- yes, that's how tiny the room was. I had to iron while kneeling on the bed! No room to stand. This was room 316 -- careful! The tv remote didn't work. With two kids, this is important. The hotel is very well-located. It's right near the State House, the Boston Common, the Park Street "T" station, a five minute walk to Faneuil Hall, etc. So weigh what you need. If you don't rest during the day, this is a good place to go. If your room is important, it's not. With two kids, I wouldn't consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend bargain”
Reviews.Author: howden
Reviews.Content: I might feel differently if I were paying the $400 plus rate they show during the week, but the well under $200 weekend rate for a room (Expedia) with two Queen beds did just fine for my family of four. No, the room is not huge, but it is more than nice for what you will probably need. Most of our time was spent outside, so the late evening and sleep use of the room was fine. A great location in a beautiful historical hotel. Great staff. Remember, this is Boston. Parking stinks no matter what hotel you stay in, and its pricey. This was my second stay at this place, and I would return, no question!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: herbsUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 night with my wife in May to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel reception is very well presented and the staff are very polite. Our room was on a high level with a great view (as asked for when originally booking the hotel) and was very nice as you will see from the pictures. We didn't actually eat in the hotel as we were busy out and about but the location is excellent, only 2 minutes from the common. A few days in we received a call from reception saying that room service was being sent up and they delivered a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries covered in chocolate as i'd mentioned that it was our anniversary (in passing of course). The gym is fairly good and although we were not in the hotel too much as we were sight seeing we would highly recommend it. Boston is a lovely city, not as big as we'd imagined and 6 days was probably a bit too long, but again would recommend giving it a visit. The duck tours were great and walking around Boston Common in the sunshine will stay with me for a long time. ps-travel is easy, the T is cheap, easy & safe

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: YoungDallasCouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Omni and loved it! The location can't be beat near Boston Common, the Freedom Trail and the T. Everyone was very friendly and helpful especially the bellboys, concierge and wait staff. Our room was large, clean and nicely decorated with a great view. The bathroom was pretty and well appointed with a sewing kit, mouthwash, cotton balls and Q-tips in addition to the standard lotion and soaps. Maid service was excellent each day and our bed was turned down each evening with two chocolate mints. You can borrow CDs (everything from Classical music to Rap) from the front desk to play in the clock/stereo/CD player. Although we were on the 11th floor, we never had to wait more than 30 secs for an elevator. There are 4 or 5 elevators and they are all fast. The hotel is reputedly haunted but we didn't see or hear anything unusual while we were there. We did love all the stories and historic touches about the hotel including Charles Dickens' huge mirror hanging in a hallway on the mezzanine level. The combination of great location, friendly service, interesting history and beautifully elegant decor makes this hotel a joy to visit! We won't stay anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced tiny room”
Reviews.Author: wlb692
Reviews.Content: We reserved a "deluxe" room at some additional cost over the "european" room and found it to be very cramped especially for close to $400 per night-- we've stayed in more spacious rooms for much less cost in Paris, London, and New York. There was one chair, no desk or writing space in the room and no other real amenities. On check in we learned that construction on the facade was in progress: no advance warning about this when we booked and no offer of apologies. Walls were thin and we heard more than we wanted to hear from our neighbors. Our toilet did not work and we were rudely reminded by hotel staff that the lower level restrooms were for guests only. (We would not be using the lobby restrooms if ours had been operational.) Location is great, but we did not have a good experience with the room or hotel staff and would certainly choose somewhere else on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent resturants, great views”
Reviews.Author: IceOnFire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni between July 5-10 at the peak of the touring season. Very nice spot conveniently located between 2 subway stations Park St (Red/Green Line) and Government Center (Blue Line). Though they offer overnight parking, it is outrageously priced at $36 per night. The bell hops were very helpfull and courteous. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker House-Absolutetly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: knitchick11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Omni Parker House over the 4th of July. The review before mine gave all the wonderful details, so I won't repeat. My husband and I would definately stay here again. The Select Guest Program is a must and makes you feel extra special--plus it can be used in other Omni properties. The room was extremely comfortable (wonderful down comforter and linens) and the bathroom was sparkling clean (as were the rooms). The staff and Concierge were wonderful and there are safety deposit boxes available for valuables or laptop. Walking distance to many attractions and blocks away from the T. Be sure and try the Pear Martini in the Last Hurrah Bar---a wonderful place to unwind at the end of a day--cushy chairs with decor and courtesy of staff reminiscenc of bygone days while watching the world go by outside the windows. Will definately stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: We were there 27May for 3ni. and again 2Jun for 2ni. We had a great time. Hotel is in a great location. Very close to local attractions. Service was great. We stayed in an executive room and it was huge. It had to have been close to the size of 2 rooms. The bathroom was small, but it wasn't anything to complain about. The staff was very friendly and the concierge was very helpful. There is a subway stop a couple blocks away. Sign up for Omni Select Guest before you go. They will bring you drinks every morning. Choice of Coke, Diet Coke, Apple Juice, Orange Juice, Milk, Evian, Etc. I recommend eating in Litte Italy. Great cuisine and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: musicluvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House for 4 nights. We found the room to be extremely comfortable. (Yes, they're small, but 1. what do you expect from a hotel in a big city? and 2. you're in Boston! You shouldn't be in your hotel room except to sleep and shower!!!) I felt the room was very clean and very well taken care of considering how old this hotel is. Also worth mentioning are the linens, which were luxurious - nicer than the ones on my own bed! Overall, we loved the Omni Parker House and will stay there the next time we go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Faaabulous!”
Reviews.Author: trektravel
Reviews.Content: Great service, great hotel- will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Net1
Reviews.Content: Ok so the rooms are a bit small (we had a European room) but you cannot fault the location of the hotel, the service, and the decor of the rooms themselves. The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The hotel is about a 5 min walk to Quincy market and Fanueil Hall, it's on the Freedom trail and restaurants and bars take no time at all to walk to. Recommendations for dinner - Legal Seafoods at the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “There Must Be Better Places to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in early May. At check-in, I wasn't offered the option of a smoking or non-smoking room and ended up in a TINY room that reeked of smoke. When I called the front desk to ask if I could be moved to another room, they said the hotel was fully booked and they would see if they could move me the following day. They did move me the following afternoon, but I was not happy that I was put in a smoking room that was downright awful. My new room was also tiny--with a view of an ugly roof and brick wall. Secondly, because I am a member of their Select Guest program, I was given complimentary beverage vouchers to hang on my door at night. The beverages are supposed to be delivered the following morning, at whatever time you request. Well, the Select Guest tokens weren't even collected from my door two out of the three days that I was there. The location of this hotel is great, but as far as I'm concerned, that's the best thing about this hotel. I will definitely not stay here on my next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and charming”
Reviews.Author: BeforeSunrise
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at this hotel while visiting me. I found the rooms to be comfortably sized, renovated and well decorated in a traditional style. The lobby is elegant and historic, as one would hope to find in this part of Boston. It is centrally located and convenient to many subway lines. I recommend this hotel for visitors to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Couln't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Parker for a couple of nights at end of a tour of new Hampshire and certainly picked a winner. The location is brilliant, within walking distance of Qunicy market, right on the Freedom Trail and near to the park. Our room was lovely with two comfy queen beds and lots of pillows to sink into after a day walking around Boston. The bathroom was clean and traditionnal with little extras like sewing kits, mouth wash and cotton wool provided. Staff were friendly and helpful and would definitely stay here again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: IUGrad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from the Omni over Easter weekend. I am a Select Guest and we were automatically upgraded to a King Suite. The room was huge and the bed could have slept (4) people. The staff here was very friendly as we asked for directions and suggestions for places to dine. The Last Hurrah is a good place to grab a bite and a cold drink if your feet are killing you after a good day of walking. The Omni is very well located as far as walking to Quincy Market, The Boston Commons, Newbury Street, or the North End. T stops are very close as are many stores and restuarants. Anyone going to Boston should stay at this people friendly hotel and be sure to enjoy a Boston Creme Pie and the Parker House Rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: All of their beds are *extremely* firm”
Reviews.Author: sfchris
Reviews.Content: When I got into my room, I laid on the bed and it was of the "extra firm" variety. I have shopped at Sealy/Beautyrest mattress warehouses and have laid on many beds... this bed would certainly qualify on the extreme end of firmness. I called the hotel management to ask them if this was somehow a special bed and they said no, all beds are the same... even so, they showed me another room and the mattress was the same. If you don't like sleeping on an extremely firm mattress you will not sleep well at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must...LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Fantastic staff. Beautiful rooms. Value for money. The most gorgeous hotel we've stayed at, felt like film stars!! Excellent location. Cannot fault this hotel at all. FANTASTIC!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice evening away”
Reviews.Author: TravelAways
Reviews.Content: We stayed here St. Patrick's Day weekend, Saturday night. I was thrilled to finally check out this hotel. We valeted the car for the night ($36/night for parking, a bit steep but that's Boston hotels). As I walked through the rotating brass doors in awe, I walked up the stairs to the lobby, I see what the valet explains 'It doesn't always look like this, they just removed the lobby's carpet today'. I was a bit disappointed I was not told this when making the reservation, but its to improve, it must be done some time or another (after all, it is the oldest, longest hotel in operation). It just made the lobby look so dark and blah, compared to the picture you see on the website. The bell man took us to the room, we reserved a King Suite. It was very nice room, one was the sitting area with sofa, desk and TV, the other had the King size bed with TV. Small bathroom with only a shower, it could use a hand towel rack near the sink. The best part: 24hr room service, which I was pleased to find out since I missed getting Boston Creme Pie in the hotel bar by 15min! (a hotel bar that has last call at 11pm, on a Saturday night? I was surprised.) The dessert was awesome! It was one of the reasons I wanted to stay there! The bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. They had turn down service which was accompanied with some delicious chocolate mints. The next day, we called ahead as requested to get the car, and checked out by noon (their check out time). I used my Select Guest voucher which brought the rate to $89.50/night.

Reviews.Title: “Web site does not accurately reflect the rooms”
Reviews.Author: JaymarConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in Boston for two nights on 24 and 25 March 2006. The public rooms, reception areas etc are all beautiful. The web site looked great and the pictures of the rooms all looked very luxurious. The location of the hotel is excellent. However, our room was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. We asked for a Deluxe room with two doubles as I was staying with my husband and three children. We also asked for a cot for my daughter. (which was not in the room when we arrived). I was so shocked at how small the room was we thought maybe they had assigned us to the wrong room. My husband asked at reception if we had been given the correct room and was told by the reception staff - "all the rooms here are small". Not only was the room small, we also had peeling wallpaper by the window and a stained carpet right in the middle of the floor which looked awful. I cannot even describe how awful it all was. This hotel is not one you would want to stay in with children - they had to search the place when we requested a high chair at breakfast. I was told this hotel had undergone a refit - I am certain none of the refit money was spent on our room! My family and I have travelled extensively and can honestly say I have stayed in cleaner (and bigger) B&B's back home in my native England. There must be better hotel rooms in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel, thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: mrpapa93
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at the historic Parker House Hotel. Lots of positives: - Good service - Clean, but small rooms. Bathroom is very small. - Great location, near all the main sites. - Staff was very helpful at the main desk, concierge and bell hops. One Negative: - very thin walls, heard everything from people walking in the halls, to person snoring in the next room. It didn't bother us much, but imagine if you happen to get the wrong neighbor, it could be a nightmare. Overall, nice hotel, but I don't think I would stay here again if I had a choice. On a side note, I don't see the big deal about the Parker rolls, they are nice and soft, but nothing really to rave about. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House because it was a historic hotel and it was close to the things we found interesting. It turned out to be just perfect! It was within walking distance to everything. The rooms were clean, quiet, and they looked historic without looking dated or not kept up. The staff members were friendly as well. The exercise room was really nice also. I would recommend this hotel to anyone not familiar with Boston because you really get to see a lot of things without walking a long way or taking an expensive cab.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars all the way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for 3 days for my 30th birthday in the executive room. the room had mini bar, comp robes, nice sitting area for reading and the bed had feahter pillows and big down comforters. we mentioned to the bellboy(rytis) it was my birthday and that evening we recieved a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and a birthday card. the hotel itself was clean and rich with history jfk proposed to jakie here and malcom x worked as a bus boy. the hotel also offers 24hr room service, upscale resturant and bar in the main lobby a bit pricey but worth it. join the rewards club through omni hotel. we recieved 2 coupons for 1/2 off and free room upgrade. the room was 159.00 we paid 74.99 a day, also you can check in early and check our late, our last day we were able to check out at 4pm not 12pm, free of charge just for being a rewards member. one resturant you have to check out is top of the hub on the 50th floor overlooking the city, worht every cent(great romantic spot)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel (but not perfect)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Omni Parker House after reading about it on the internet. It is located right in the downtown area of Boston â€“ 5 minutes from the park and 5 minutes from the shops. We booked in advance and had a great offer, having also registered as an Omni Select Member (which is free from their website). On arrival we were given a free room upgrade (which had two double beds instead of one). The hotel lobby is fantastic with wooden dÃ©cor and an old charm â€“ definitely worth a sit down there to admire. The rooms are nicely decorated and cosy, but the beds were on the small side. We ended up sleeping in separate beds by the third night. Our room was also directly across the road from an office block, and you often had to close the curtains to get some privacy. As an Omni Select member you get free coffee & juice and newspaper delivered to your door in the morning (which you usually get in other hotels for free anyway), but nevertheless it was nice to have after waking up. The hotel has two bars (Parkerâ€™s Bar was closed for renovation when we stayed), but the Last Hurrah bar was excellent. You felt like you were thrown into a 50s movie set, with dim lighting and black and white photos on the wall. As much as we enjoyed our stay, it wasnâ€™t without its faults: The elevators were difficult to understand (you had to insert your card at precisely the correct time), and we often encountered confused people going up and down for ages. On your departure day, you donâ€™t get a newspaper delivered (even though you are given a voucher to get one) and the in-room free internet stops working (which was rather a pain, as we wanted to check our flight details). Donâ€™t ever use the telephone to make international calls. We had to cancel some lost credit cards and ended up with a bill for $120 â€“ thatâ€™s over $10 a minute!!! Anyway, it was definitely worth a stay and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - VERY comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston for 3 days for training for my job. I was alone, and my training went until after dark, so instead of navigating Boston on my own, I decided to order room service every night - and the food was delivered really quickly by a very friendly staff person. The bed was extremely comfortable - for being in a strange city, by myself, I slept like a baby !! I will not hesitate to recommend the Omni Parker House to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: TigerMomMiddlebury
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Parker House with our teenaged daughter during her Feb. school break in order to go see Les Miz at the Opera House. The Opera House was just a few short blocks away -- so the location was great. We also easily walked over to Newbury St. in the morning and then to Quincy Market for lunch. As everyone says the location couldn't be better. As others have said the room and the bathroom were small - but we were prepared for that. What made us most happy was the VERY comfortable mattresses, wonderful pillows, comforter, spa robes, and fluffy towels!! Back in December, we stayed at the Marriott Copley Plaza (and had paid more money than at the Parker House). At the Marriott the beds sank down so much in the middle that it was actually difficult to sleep. This time at the Parker House we had comfy beds that couldn't have been more perfect! The bathroom had a shower stall but not a tub. So if you need a tub - you had better ask for one. Everything was very clean. Clean room, heavenly beds, and great location -- we were very happy campers!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Omni for its central location (only hotel on Beacon Hill), uber friendly service, and the upgrade to the Mother Goose Suite we were given upon arrival. We also showed up about three hours before check-in, but the room was ready to go. Big plus. View from the suite was non-existent, but that only matters if you're planning to gaze out the window a lot. We ate a meal in the bar downtsairs - tasty Clam Chowder and the sinfully lovely Parker House rolls! Had room service one night - nothing remarkable, but again delivered in record time by the nicest gentleman. All of the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful... that always seems to make such a big difference, don't you think? Bed was heavenly - although the sheets smelled sort of bleachy. I complained until my husband asked what I'd rather they smelled like. Point taken. One complaint about this suite in particular - the bathroom was teeny! It was this huge, over-sized room with a sitting area and full-sized table, and then an itty-bitty bathroom. Kind of old school in that regard. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Love Boston, love New England, and now we love the Omni too.

Reviews.Title: “Best historic hotel in Boston! (and a tip for better service)”
Reviews.Author: Dave7702
Reviews.Content: After quickly scanning the reviews of this hotel, I cannot imagine where the negative reviewer from Dublin stayed. I have stayed at most of the old hotels in Boston (Lenox, Park Plaza, etc.) and this was the best! BIGGEST TIP: Sign up for Omni's "Select Guest" program. It's free and you'd be an idiot not to sign up. By doing so, you get to check out late (as late as 5PM!!), free room service drinks and a paper in the morning, and other small things that makes the entire experience worthwhile. The room was nice and was a good size. Try the Deluxe rooms as they are not much more money and provide you with more space. The staff was so very nice. My wife and I arrived at 12:30AM after our flight was delayed. We checked in quickly, were greeted with smiles and quickly made it up to our room. We ordered room service (24 hours) and it came in about 5 minutes! The food by the way was the best for room service I have ever had. Overall, we had a great vacation. Oh! Their gym is great:pretty sizable and a number of machines, weights, etc. Only negatives: Their gift shop is being remodeled so it is currently in a temporary location. That and the bar, despite it's history closes at 12am on weekends...at a hotel I found this a little strange. But this was such a minor problem, it did not make one difference to our trip. Don't forget to try the Parker House Rolls!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: Grand old hotel with an old fashioned and busy lobby. The room was extremely small but well-appointed and had comfortable beds. The bathroom was a decent size but sported a dorm room style shower stall that would have made a heavier person claustrophobic. That being said, the service was friendly and the maid service quick and efficient. This is a great location for the Boston Common-Fanueil Hall-North End side of town (though I prefer Copley Sq when I stay in Boston). And the walls are thick so it was quiet unlike its newer neighbor Nine Zero. If you want sleek and new don't stay here...it's charming but old.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucymontgomery
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8-year-old son and I stayed at the Omni during a sightseeing trip to Boston in August 2005. Our room was well appointed, but very, very small. The bathroom was also nice and a more comfortable size. We found the staff, the concierge especially, to be very friendly and helpful. The sushi restaurant down the street was great, and perfect after a long day of walking around town. The location is within walking distance of many of the tourist attractions around Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Queen Suite at the Omni Feb 3-5. The corner room was comfortable and spacious. We paid 159.00 a night and loved the hotel. The service was incredible, the staff was tripping over themselves to help us. We walked everywhere. If you go to Boston with a date a nice place is the resturant on the 52nd floor of the Prudential Hall. It's a cool jazz spot with a view and great martini's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old classic hotel- rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: BronxLady
Reviews.Content: If you like classic hotels with history & character, this is an excellent choice. I've stayed there twice. The service is very good, the fitness center is excellent, the bar is just fabulous and the location is good. The downside: the rooms are very small. If you're not ready for this, you'll be disappointed. The "standard" rooms are miniscule, the " deluxe" rooms are actually quite tiny, too. I once stayed in a terrific executive room, there, though. I'm giving the hotel overall an excellent rating, because I just really like old hotels, and I would go back to the Parker House anytime

Reviews.Title: “Heavy on nostalgia; light on compassion”
Reviews.Author: carolart
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently spent three nights at the Parker House on a little nostalgia trip for her. She is 85 and graduated from the Mass. General School of Nursing way back in the 1940's. We were delighted to get an upgraded room with a great view and all the comforts of home. The staff was pleasant and the hotel was very serene. We had dinner there on one occasion and the food was very good; the wine selection was also very adequate. However, one evening my mother was not feeling very well and wanted just a cup of soup for dinner before turning in. She looked at the room service menu and announced that she would not call them, nor would she pay $40. for a few sips of broth. I had to laugh, but could not help but agree with her. So she sent me off in search of some soup that might sit better with our (her) budget. At the dining room, I was sent to the bar called Hurrah's down near the street entrance. I explained what I wanted and was told that the manager would have to OK a bowl of soup! I waited for about fifteen minutes but no one ever came back to speak to me. Since I was obviously being ignored, I had no recourse but to leave. That's when I went tramping through the rain in Boston in the dark to find poor Mom some soup! That experience at the Parker House was probably not typical, but it might be worth mentioning if you assume that they are top notch on service - as seems to be the feeling after reading some of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Good Value”
Reviews.Author: divasmom
Reviews.Content: After our first disasterous trip to Boston, we discovered the Omni Parker House. We have stayed here several times while visiting our college student. The location is perfect. We fly in to Logan (carry on bag), hop on the T, get off at Government Center, and walk to the Omni. We don't have to bother with a car rental. Cheap eats available at Fannueill Hall, as well as some pricier options. Some terrific rates are available at various sites. Ironic that we have stayed here for less money than the first dump we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful-great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Writer312
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is not only absolutely beautiful on the inside, the staff, the rooms, even the in-hotel bar were wonderful. The room was small, but it was extremely comfortable especially the plush queen size bed! The bathroom was great-huge fluffy towels, perfect water temperature, great bathroom amentities. We even got down to the hotel bar late night and had a drink (usual Boston prices), but very friendly atmosphere. The only way we were able to stay here is becuase we got a deal online. If you ever have the chance, I strongly recommend the Omni Parker!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: island_kimbit
Reviews.Content: Last week stayed for 3 nights at the Omni. Had no complaints at all. Had a deluxe room on the 14th floor. Spacious and very clean. Loved the ambiance of the hotel. Had breakfast there 2 mornings, expensive but good. Very good service. As others say, the location was fabulous. Everything very close by. Great walking town!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, and Quality: Parker House is Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: LeeByTheSea
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! The location of the Omni Parker House is unmatched. You are ON the Freedom Trail, a block away from two T (subway) stations, five minutes' walk from Faneuil Hall, ten minutes' walk from the North End. With this location Omni could fake everything else, but they don't. We got helpful handling of our reservation by Skyler, a clean, quiet, comfortable room that was ready on time, attitude-free service, free orange juice in the morning, and free wired high-speed Internet service. The price made Omni Parker House a very good value indeed, while introducing us to a hotel chain which delivered a high quality stay in Boston. There is good advice in the reviews dated before this one. We took advantage of it. Let me summarize the key points I learned from other reviewers, plus some things I discovered: 1. Join the Omni Select Guest program (see the Omni website) before you do anything. It is free, almost instantaneous, has no downside, and has numerous benefits (priority in room selection when they assign rooms, that free orange juice, and more.) Use your Select Guest number every time you can. 2. Rooms vary a lot because it is a very old hotel. Phone direct at an unbusy time and seek your reservationist's advice. (When you arrive, if you don't like what you get, ask to see one or two other rooms. We didn't have to do that but another TripAdvisor reviewer did.) 3. Stay on the 8th floor or above for quiet. Even though the windows seal well, you are in the middle of the city and police and ambulance vehicles go right by with sirens on. (On the 11th floor, noise was not a problem for us.) 4. If it works for you, select a king-size bed rather than two double beds. They put the noise-making minibar between the beds in most dual-double bed room layouts. 5. Book online for the best price (we saved a little by specifying the AAA rate), but then contact the reservationist with your confirmation number and Select Guest number and add your requests. We had to have a non-smoking room because of my wife's allergies, so the reservationist added a strong note to our reservation record. We also asked for a corner room (it's larger) and a high floor. All of those requests were honored. 6. Skip their costly phone and average restaurant. Use your cell and go out for meals. (Since we took that TripAdvisor advice, I cannot say anything about the Parker House restaurant or its famous dinner rolls.) We walked and used the T to explore Boston. We found the old twisty streets confusing, especially with the Big Dig not quite done, and got lost the first night we arrived. The following days I used the map much more carefully and we got the hang of it pretty soon. For instance, the fast way to Faneuil Hall/North End is to walk toward downtown, pass the T station on your left, go through the paved area between two monolithic buildings in Government Center, and there you are across the street from it! The North End has wonderful Italian restaurants. Our favorite destination restaurants were #1 Taranta, #2 Terramia. They are both ten minutes' walk from the hotel. Excellent pizza and pasta and delicious cannoli desserts are no further away. A bagel shop and a 7-11 are one or two short blocks away; their items plus freshly made in-room coffee and the aforementioned orange juice gave us a good fast start every morning. The hotel's final convenience was the Avis rental car office that is a five-minute walk from the Parker House. We trundled our bags over there and drove away with good route advice after our car-free Boston trip segment was done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: phick
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. Room was very clean. The staff was very helpful and more than willing to serve. You can not beat the location, everything downtown is within walking distance and what isn't is accessible by subway. Previous reviews mentioned the excessive amount of time for the valet to return their car, our's was there in less than 15 minutes. I would stay here again. I also echo those prior who recommend taking the time to join the Omni Select Guest Program we had a late flight and the late checkout was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: sandradee7777
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Omni Parker House. This was our first visit to Boston. What a wonderful experience from the time we checked-in...early check-in "no problem" I had up graded our room to an EXECUTIVE ROOM. Room # 1462 is the best and largest.I found that tip from another tripadvisor.com review. We received coffee,juice and newspaper every morning. Make sure you join their "Select Guest" on the Omni site before you go. Wonderful location,you can walk to almost everything. All the restaurants in the hotel were great. Plus you are just around the corner to many more. The maids did a wonderful job taking care of the room...turn down service at night too. It's time for us to leave, but our flight isn't until 7:00 p.m. Late check-out "no problem" we stayed until 5:00 p.m. I loved this place! I know a little bit about hotels because I have worked in some of the best for 25 years in Las Vegas. The Omni Parker House was Great! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Business Hotel in Boston !!!”
Reviews.Author: dorchester21
Reviews.Content: I am an investment banker here in Boston and I have always put people coming up from New York in the Parker House but I stayed the other day for the 1st time IT WAS GREAT !!!!!!!!!!!!!! The perfect hotel for business in Boston. Wifi and great location (Two Blocks from my office in Post Office Sq) and great people. I actually saw a senator having Boston Cream Pie in Parkers restaurant If you are going to Boston, New York, or San Fran I always liked the Omni Hotels locations and hotels

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in the best part of boston”
Reviews.Author: simonstreatfield
Reviews.Content: i visited this hotel in late november with my mother,we stayed for 4 nights. We have stayed in an OMNI before( washington), so we knew what we were getting.They really are a cut above the rest. The lobby was grand, with chandeliers, and the staff were excellnt.Booking in was no problem and was allocated a room on the 11th floor.Lovely view from the room.Yes the rooms are small but the bathrooms are very good, the showers especially. We are a member of the select guest program, which i would recommend taking 5 mins on there website, you just get extra perks. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance”
Reviews.Author: botlon
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House is the longest continuosly operating hotel in America - and sometimes its starting to show. The reception area looks a little dated but is always strangely busy due to the free internet access. The crew behind the front desk are friendly but somewhat ineffecient - they had real problems trying to find a corkscrew to use in my room. The accomodation is showing its age - a few stains and scratches on the rather gaudy fittings. Still the beds are comfy. The only food I sampled was a breakfast plate and it was AWFUL. Worth taking advantage of the downtown location to find a better place to eat in the evening. Overall it could be worse, but I would look to the Nine Zero one block down the street for a better place to stay downtown in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahms
Reviews.Content: I really can't understand some of the negative comments about this hotel - we had a briliant stay there for a week. Before we went I registered with the Select Guest program - this is worthwhile - you get a welcome Boston Creme Pie waiting for you, choices of pillows etc and papers and tea every morning. Unlike other posters on this site, our arrived on time every morning - they even gave me a birthday card!! Thansk to Kate Casey the Selct Guest coordinator. The room we had was on the 11th floor with a view of Boston Comm. We had booked a deluxe room and it was a lovely size with a huge King sized bed, desk, armchair, TV and games console, huge wardrobe and a nice bathroom - particularly liked the night light in the bathroom which meant you didn't have a full blast light if you went to the bathroom at night. Extremely clean room and very very comfortable after a long day out. My husband had no problems linking his hand held computer to the Wi Fi network in the room and hotel whcih was free - we checked Trip advisor for some restaurant tips several times!! We ate in Parkers restaurant which was very good but our favourite was the Last Hurrah bar where we would come back to every evening for a Bud and some nuts. It has a real buzz to it - lots of locals after work. The staff couldn't do enough for you - several times the general manager walked around talking to guests which was a nice touch. Its location meant you could virtually walk everywhere - my feet still ache! All in all it was a great hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HISTORICAL OMNI”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People go on about the size of the standard rooms at the Omni Parker. How much time do these people spend in the hotel while in a city like Boston. Stop moaning about the size of the rooms and get out into the City. We stayed in a standard room and although small had everything we needed. Everything was clean, well laid out and had obviously been redecorated. We thought the hotel lobby was wonderful and old fashioned in an historical not in an uncared for sense (and coming from England where we have a lot of history that's saying something.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel because it is so close to everything; we were about 2 blocks from the Orpheum Theater which was our destination. A million other interesting places were within walking distance. Thew room was filled with down comforters, pillows, and the view was of the river. The service was excellent -- they brought cookies and milk to the room for my child -- and we loved the ambience of the lobby. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: dwldds
Reviews.Content: Having just ended a Thanksgiving weekend in Boston, we have to say that the low point in our trip was the hotel stay. On arrival at the Omni Parker House, we were informed that the king/2-double deluxe room we reserved was now a Queen deluxe. Despite voicing our dissatisfaction, the only response was that "it's written in the really fine print". Not a good start to our stay. The room itself was small but reasonable, had a nice view, and the interior was well maintained. The small bathroom was inviting considering it was the size of a closet. The TV was a bit on the small side, about 24 inches, and the one on-demand movie we ordered had some A/V problems. The vending machine on our floor was out of service and was not repaired for the duration of our three day stay. The hotel has complimentary internet service via ethernet cable in the rooms. Our cable was broken and had to be replaced - with another broken cable. After the first day, I could not get online via hotel internet despite calling the toll-free tech support. Eventually, I just used my wifi to pick up an off-site signal. Again, Not acceptable. As an Omni Hotels member (free registration) we got the complimentary morning beverages and newspaper - well sort of. The first morning of delivery, we received the beverages 30 minutes early (8:15) even though we were able to choose a specified time (8:45-9:00). The second morning of our stay, the paper was not delivered. Room service was adequate. Despite being quick - we got dinner delivered within 25 minutes - the food was lukewarm and cooling. Check out was a snap, though the valet service was lacking. We could not reach the valet via room phone, and when we got it, there were stains on the passenger seat. Again, not acceptable. Overall, the hotel is adequate. However, we have stayed at several large chains and boutique hotels in the past. The Omni is fine if you don't care about refinement, but for the price, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny-Tiny Room, but still loved the Parker House!”
Reviews.Author: koala2
Reviews.Content: Had researched The Omni Parker on this site before leaving home, so was prepared for the small room, but the matching mini bathroom was a surprise! The bed was super comfortable and the comforter a treat. Staff were friendly and obliging. Fantastic location, would definitely stay there again. The sense of history that surrounds the Hotel was not lost on this girl from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking about”
Reviews.Author: SLC80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated perfect for downtown sightseeing. EXCELLENT location, we were able to walk everywhere. Asked for a room with a view, higher up, and got it (14th or 15th floor?). The room we had was VERY small for a family of four with luggage. No table at all. Everything we brought was on the floor at the foot of the beds where there was only about 2 feet to the wall. But we were forwarned by another reviewer here about that. The first night we came back to our room there were milk and cookies left on the beds (that MAY be a perk from becoming an "omni" club type member BEFORE we booked....do this, the perks are worth it, including flexability checking in and checking out). Outstanding historic hotel, lobby is a beautiful sight to behold. Restaraunts are pricey, as are rooms. But for the location I found it worth it. Carpet was filthy in the room, stained something awful, and the room wasn't as clean as I would have like for the price or name. All in all we'd probably stay there again but ask for a larger room, IF they even have them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel wa sfirst class and situaated in the main area of Boston no need for transport the freedom trail started right outside the main door. Would certainly stay again. excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Omni Parker House!”
Reviews.Author: superez
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4-nite stay at the Omni Parker House and thoroughly enjoyed it! I had previously stayed here about 5 years ago for a conference and since I had a good experience then, I decided to book the hotel again while vacationing in Boston with my parents 10/14-10/18.
