I know some people have complained about the size of the rooms, but both times I have stayed in the Executive Double room and was pretty pleased with the size and configuration. The room was huge - about 500-600 square feet with a sofa, coffee table, TV w/ cable in a nice armoir, 2 easy chairs, 2 double beds with that comfy triple sheeting and down comforters, a small area with workdesk, 2 closets and a decent size bathroom with tub. I had originally booked a regular double room but decided to sign up with the Omni Select Guest Program. You must do this if you plan to stay at the Omni!! I got a coupon for a room upgrade which I used this time and another coupon for 50% off a weekend stay at any Omni! However you must book through Omni and not thru Expedia, etc. Also, being a "select guest" they get the room ready to your specs and offer complimentary morning beverages for you and everyone staying with you, plus a small but discounted room service breakfast menu. The room was nice and quiet, although occasionally I would hear faint voices from the room beside us and out in the hall but it didn't bother us at all. We were on the 4th floor so didn't hear any noise from the street below. We had a view of a side street with some restaurant and shops and partially of a brick parking garage but that was ok. All of our interactions with staff were great. The front desk staff were especially nice and always ready to assist. My parents had accidently put their wet umbrellas in a trash can in our room and the maid threw them away thinking they were broken, however the front desk was very helpful in investigating for us and even gave us a credit on our bill for the inconvenience. We did have a light dinner in the Last Hurrah bar and the salads were huge and reasonably priced. The drinks were a little pricey but typical for a hotel. Overall, I highly recommend the Omni Parker House if you're staying in the city. It is centrally located near the T, Boston Common, the Freedom Trail and a few blocks walk to Faniuel Hall/Quincy Market. Plus, its beautifully gilded lobby and decor is very nice, and staying in such a historical place is so interesting! (JFK proposed to Jackie O here, Malcolm X and Ho Chi Minh worked here, etc). If room size is a concern, do look into upgrading to the Executive room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SJWALSH
Reviews.Content: We loved the location,friendly staff and the hotel is very clean. We didn't experience or find any of the poor feedback the hotel received was less than one of the best we have stayed in a upscale hotel in the USA. Recomend staying here as the value is outstanding and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby in places”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the oldest in the U.S. and it shows. It is grand but shabby. I upgraded my room to an executive one, it was huge - but all it had in it was two enormous beds and a small lamp table. I felt like I was sleeping in a barn. The bathroom was miniscule, unbelievably tiny. The handbasin was cracked and the plug in the bath didn't seal properly. I had great expectations of this place, but wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: Jakethepeg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for 7 nights during Sept. I cant understand how some people critisise the staff of this beautiful hotel,as far as we are concerned they were charming and courteos. We had a delux room which made are stay very comfortable,we would definetly stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere & service, though small”
Reviews.Author: resaben
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work conference just last week. I was a bit surprised (had forgotten to check this site for reviews to be prepared!) by the size of the room, but soon adjusted. The furnishing of the room were simple and beautiful, though as many have said, the room was a little cramped. I was worried at first, because I was going to be there for several days on this conference. After I settled in, I really loved it. I know not everyone does, so here is my explanation - when I travel, my priorities are this order: cleanliness, service, atmoshere, amenities, space. I'm usually willing to sacrifice amenities and space for any or all of the first three. So, here are the things that made me enjoy the place: 1. The room was very clean, and well-stocked with towels. I hate calling down for towels, and never had to do this - there were plenty there. They were even the nice size towels, not the tiny ones you can barely dry off with. The housekeeping people did an excellent job maintaining my room while I visited. 2. Service was great! The reception, concierge, bellhop, restaurant waiters, bar waiters - everyone was friendly and helpful, and I felt very welcome in their hotel. Phone calls down to the concierge or reception for problems or questions were answered promptly and with great courtesy. I never felt like anything I was asking for was a problem. 3. Atmosphere - I know this is silly, and entirely subjective, but I hate staying at hotels that all feel the same as every other hotel, where you could be in any other city if the curtians are drawn. No such feeling in this place. It was beautiful, had character, and I felt like I was at home the whole time, rather than a sterile box. I didn't have any of the problems people mentioned earlier about leaks or other maintanence issues. I can see how that would be off-putting.

Reviews.Title: “Stop the leak”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We called the front desk to report a water leak and was told someone would be right up. It took them 24 hours and another call before they got there. The first person showed up with towels and said it was fixed. The second checked and said yes it was fixed. The third said he would have to turn the water off to repair it. The rooms are to small and a desk would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “embarrassingly small room”
Reviews.Author: asianPrince-S
Reviews.Content: I live in Boston and I did have some friends coming over and staying in Radisson or Hyatt or Hilton. This was my special occasion for my parents to attend my graduation from abroad and I wanted them to stay close to where I live and chose Omni-parker hotel and checked their lobby to make sure it is the right place for my parents and booked a deluxe room for 4 nights. The first time they checked in, the accompanying PA called and addressed the concern of the hotel. And I rushed in to check their room. Instead of contacting me beforehand, they already checked in. The room was awfully small. They squeezed two double beds into the single room and there was no way that my poor folks could unfold their suitcases unless putting them on the bed. There was one chair in the room but it was in the way making anyone unable to get out of the bed from the window side. Basically the room had 2' around two double beds and one separate bathroom with rusted & outmoded features. I remind the readers that this was the deluxe room. I wend to the lobby and asked for changing the rooms but they said it was all full as it was a graduation season. We originally asked for a king bed with the view to the park st/Boston Common but, they were facing ugly rooftop of government center side with two double beds giving no space to move around. And, I canceled the reservation and moved my folks to my condo and still had to pay for not just for the first night charge but second night charge as well. Still passing by the hotel today, I get really upset to see this hotel being run as they ruined my plan to have my folks enjoy their stay while in Boston. Anyone traveling to Boston should know that the best location to stay should be in COPLEY PLAZA AREA-Hynes Convention Center- Kenmore square, not PARK STREET. The next best location will be HARVARD SQUARE. The third location will be Kendall Sq. MIT but there are only two hotels there. If your location is none of these 3 locations, you will feel like you are distant from the scenes. There are no true 5 star hotels in Boston. And, don't waste your money in Omni Parker hotel rated as 4 star. You can find better deal at lower cost in Westin/Marriot/Hilton at the same price or lower. The only part I like about this hotel was the flower arrangement and carpentry works in the lobby and you are free to enter to see them. But would you pay 30%-40% more to stay in half the size of the rooms with late 80s decor? To me, simply it was a cheesey deceiving business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: seremarcus
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, well worth the extra money to stay in the middle of everything, walking distance to Quincy Market, Freedom Trail, etc. Small room, but excellent service, good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews had me not knowing what to expect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our daughter graduated from college in May and my entire family flew out for the week. We started our trip with our stay at the Omni Parker House. The reviews, although helpful, can make a traveler nervous since it is hard to determine if the writer just had a bad day. We went anyway and were very, very pleased with the service and our accommodations. The rooms were a bit smaller, not tight though, for an older hotel but truly nicely furnished and the beds very comfortable. Dinner in the bar was not the best and the morning room service was not worth the price but all in all a very nice stay. I would go back - the location was great and walking very convenient. The valet service for the car was timely and the entire staff very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “i can't”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it was the most terrible vbisit I'va ever had a bathroom is so small and the people in the hotel are very agressive i never back there

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Boston where we celebrated our 10 yr wedding anniversary. Fortunately, we chose to stay at the Omni Parker. Being that I used to work in hospitality I find that I can be overly critical of hotel staff/service. The service and attention to detail at the Omni was exceptional, we arrived around 11pm and at 11.30pm room service arrived with a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. I at first thought my husband had pre-ordered this treat, but found out that they offered this as an anniversary treat. I have read some reviews of the rooms being small but I found that our room was a decent size, unless you are accustomed to living in a penthouse suite? We were on a main road but could not hear a thing from the traffic below, and the views of the park just down the road were lovely. We drank drinks in the bar and the prices were your standard bar prices. We had a wonderful time. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker in January 2005. The lobby is very grand and the room was of a very high standard, 2 beds a lovely bathroom and well heated. The in-room bar / snacks were over priced - nearly $5 for a packet of crisps! Dont bother there are plenty of stores close by if you need a midnight snack. Although the room was great the hotel has an eerie feeling, maybe its the fact that its one of the most haunted buildings in Boston. The hotel bar was a great place to relax in the evening. The reception staff were really helpful and honest about the city and gave us tips on where to go. It's in a good location, Boston common only 5 mins walk and there are lots of tourist attractions close by including Fanueil Hall. A lovely hotel in a good location and worth the money if you want to treat yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Small Room/Big Room - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monument
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well situated in the heart of Boston 15 minutes travelling time from the airport. It is a step into Bostons history. JFK was a regular, Ho Chi Min worked there, the Boston Cream Pie and Parker House Roll were invented there. The lobby is awesome. I travelled with my wife and two teenage kids. We stayed three nights and had two twin double bedded rooms. The porter took us to the 14th floor and the first room was run of the mill, clean, well decorated but pretty small with a smallish bathroom. Leaving my wife and daugther there we were shown to the second room - WOW. This room was absolutely huge with three windows giving views to three side of the hotel - If you can ask for room 1462. The hotel bar was nice and no more expensive than bars outside the hotel. The restuarant was more formal and expensive. The hotel was very nice and misses out on 5/5 because of the small size of one of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: vttravelers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Omni from July 15 - July 17, 2005. It was my husband and I and our 12 yr. old son and 12 yr. old nephew. The rooms with two double beds are EXTREMELY tiny for four people. I would definately stay here again, but not with our children or I'd move to a larger room. The room was very nice albeit small. There is a tiny closet which in the hotels' defense they try to make accomodating even though its stuffed with iron/ironing board, suitcase holder, hangers, extra pillows and blankets. It does not leave a lot of room for clothing. The beds were fine with very nice bedding, lots of pillows, etc. There is a chair shoved in the corner which is not really useful since you have to climb over the bed to get to it. The TV is in a huge cabinet which again takes up tons of room. All in all they try to make the room appealing but when you walk in with 4 people and luggage it's loses it's charm. The bathroom was very clean, but again small. The one major issue is the lack of outlets in the room. Today with portable this and that you need some outlets. We had to play "Gumby" and plug in the charger for our cellphone. After that no where else to plug in much of anything. This was a bit frustrating. The facility itself is gorgeous and in a prime location. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Again, if and when it's just me and my husband we would definatley stay here again. We did have an enjoyable stay and I expected going in that the rooms would be small but they were a bit too small for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Parker House. It is very plush and charming. They are having their 150th anniversary this year, so it is very historic. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms, while small, are beautifully decorated and clean. The concierges were extremely helpful in advising us of tours then making reservations as well as giving directions to various sites. Its location is convenient to Faneuil Hall, Boston Common, the Freedom Trail and public transportation stations.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for our 10th anniversary trip. Chose it based on reviews from this site! Although you would never know by looking at the outside, The Parker House is a beautiful, historic hotel with a lot of character. The staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We arrived earlier than check-in so we had them store our bags while we explored the city. They called us on our cell as soon as our room was ready so we would not have to guess about when to return. We chose the deluxe room which was tastefully decorated, had a desk, comfortable king bed with very nice linens, TV armoir, corner chair and ample space for a city hotel. Noise was not a problem, but that may just depend on your neighbors. The bathroom was small, but pretty and had shower with bathtub, pedestal sink, nice towels, etc. Everything was clean. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant. It was very good and sort of takes you back in time. The location can't be beat either. Right on the Freedom Trail, you can walk to most of the main attractions in minutes, and one block to Gov't Center T stop. Sure there may be newer, ritzier hotels with bigger rooms, but not with this location at this price! I highly recommend the Omni Parker House (unless, for some reason, you prefer contemporary!). TIP: Join select guest on Omni's website. It is free and gives you nice perks!

Reviews.Title: “I really like this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second time staying there. Stayed for 2 nights at the end of June. I don't know what to say but that I love this place. The price is great for the location. Sure the room isn't the biggest but I don't know how big you need a place to be as long as you have the 2 beds (in my case) and room for bags. Most of the time you'll be outside walking around Boston anyways. The close proximity to Faneuil Hall and Boston Common/Public Garden is very key. The staff was helpful especially the valets. I would recommend it to anyone looking to visit Boston. Besides you're right on the Freedom Trail as well. What I thought was very nice is that I got a handwritten note from the housekeeping crew. Never seen that before. Can't say enough about the place. I'm sold on the hotel and I plan on staying there every time I come to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: txlonghorn95
Reviews.Content: Overall the Omni is nice. Small room, but not as small as some in New York City... great location. Generally expensive room rates. Free internet in room (ethernet, not wireless) but it is a bit slow. Better than dial-up, but slower than DSL at home, but at least there is no charge. My only real complaint is there is no desk in the room! Makes it hard to work. I am using my laptop in bed now since there really isn't another place to work. Bathroom has shower only (no tub). TV is small (20" max). Nice linens, comfortable bed. Walls are a bit thin (can hear people talking next door).

Reviews.Title: “Small room for the price, but beautiful historic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sf_couple107
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way out of the Boston area. The location is great and is within walking distance to the North End and other local attractions. The common areas of the hotel are gorgeous, with many architectural details. Not sure if we were given our room because it was a Sunday or because we happened to stay during the Boston Universities commencement weekend, but the room we had was a corner room, small in general in size, and smelled of old cigarette smoke. The size of the rooms is understandable since this is an old building/hotel, but it was a let down after sitting in the reception area downstairs which is spacious and gorgeous. We also had a handicap accessible room, which may have been the reason why the room itself was smaller (to allow for a larger bathroom). The larger bathroom was a plus, but all the mirrors, sink, and shower designed for handicapped people, so everything was lower and the shower was an open stall w/ support handles, etc. I liked the location but I probably wouldn't stay here again for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Overview, Omni was great”
Reviews.Author: Where
Reviews.Content: The bed linens are white with beautiful cherry wood furniture and great window treatments. Room was quiet, a haven in the large city. Our favorite was the bathroom with stand alone sink and deep tub. Great towels. Join the Select Guest and get a good morning beverage tray, turn down service at night, robes and the daily paper. If you air gives you any trouble, call maintenance there is a quick solution (moving sensor away from curtains). A little trip planning: The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail near Park St. and Govt Station on the "T" in the heart of downtown. National Park Service tour at 2 on weekdays and 10, 11 (?), 2 on weekends. Filene's basesment bargain is right around the corner (make a left out of the side door and then first left and you'll see it up about a block). It takes about 45 mins to an hour on the T to get to JFK library museum (9-4, need about 2-3 hours there) and about 30 mins to get to Fenway Park (on non-game day). Be sure to ride over to Harvard, quaint place. In summary, the hotel is within walking distance (very easily) of Filene's Basement, Freedom Trail, Boston Commons Park, Swan Boats, Esplanade, Quincy Market, Fanueil Hall, Blue Man Group (go see it). Great restaurants in Boston, we loved SkipJack's and Legal Seafood (get reservations for both). One of us loved Giacomos' in the North End (go up that way -follow Freedom Trail). Stay away from the Improv Asylum-not funny. Mike's Pastry was a classic. I took a Brush Hill tour to Cape Cod-it was a bus tour, harbor ride, incessant driver talking giving many details about the area and a stop for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Kim05
Reviews.Content: All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were well appointed and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: lsh78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parker House June 3-6 for a weekend getaway in Boston. The location is fantastic -- right on the Freedom Trail and a 5 minute walk to Faneuil Hall. The staff was very polite and the room was clean and well appointed. Rooms are on the small side, but we were barely in it so it didn't really matter. The bathroom was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. I highly recommend the Omni Parker House. The rate of $179 was very competitive with other nicer hotels in Boston and the location is unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service I've ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to the northeast with another couple and spent a few days in Boston. We used this website to determine where we were going to stay and I'm so glad we did. Not only is the Omni Parker house a historical building, but the customer service was incredible! Any time we had a question, the people at the front desk went above and beyond to assist us. The bellman was wonderful. The rooms were small, but clean and comfortable. I loved how old everything was, it was beautiful. It is in a great location and the little bar in the hotel is quite nice as well. We appreciated the service so much, that we gave our Boston Red Sox tickets to the bellman (the game was rained out the night we were supposed to go and we were leaving the next day). My whole party felt the same way. We've have all travelled quite a bit, and we were very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Bad shower”
Reviews.Author: me_heart_traveling
Reviews.Content: The Omni is in a great location, close to Quincy Market and other sites. We were upgraded to a suite, which was fair as far as suites go. No complaints about the room itself, BUT the shower!! Oh, the shower! It spits. The location might be enough to sway me to stay here again, but it would have to be a good rate. I gotta have a good or even decent shower, folks...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Candacewp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Omni Parker House from 5/26/05-5/29/05 and was very disturbed by the customer service with the exception of the check in clerk. Concierge was condesending bordering on rude. Maids didn't leave new bath towels and it took over an hour to get them. Trash not emptied, glasses barely rinsed instead of being replaced. Worse was the service in Parker Restaurant for breakfast 05/29/05. Waitress was surly - didn't smile until presenting the hefty check which was the only time she returned to the table. Food was as cold as the coffee and refills had to be begged for and water never refilled. Horrible - as a frequent traveler would hesitate before ever staying at an Omni again. Although the hotel is beautiful star rating should be 1 not 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston for his 27th birthday, it was a surprise for him. Everyone at the Parker House made us feel special. I must say that you have to eat at the Parker House Restaurant. The Parker House rolls are some of the best I've ever had and the Scrod is out of this world and I don't even like fish. The rooms are small so do not book the European room, it's way too small! Get the deluxe size room and make sure you ask for a view. Our view was of a man's office, we were so close we could see what was on his computer screen. It was funny to us, the guy was really messy. Also, I read several reviews about this hotel saying that you should join the omni select membership, please do this! It's absolutely free and you get free drinks and a newspaper of your choice delivered to your room everyday! It's the little added touches such as this that will make my husband and I come back to the Omni Parker House. Truly a relaxing, romantic, fabulous weekend for two newlyweds! Thanks Parker House for the most memorable birthday weekend my husband's every had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Worst service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and its location is the best. Our room was a "corner room" but very small, the size of one car garage. The bathroom was a size of a walk-in closet. We're avarage-size people and could not stay in there at the same time. TV was broken and someone had to come in to fix it. The queen-size bed; however; was very comfortable. We had to walk 5min to/from the elevator to the room. Also, the service was very poor. We arrived after 10pm because of the flight delay. We asked the front desk where could we go for late dinner, and he didn't know. He didn't ask anybody he just said "I don't live around here" So we had a room serivce. Our salad was floating in the dressing, burger was rock hard with wilted lettuce. At this point, we had it, so we complained. They didn't charge the meal. We usually have a breakfast in room. But there is Starbucks across the street, so we went there instead. The only good thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend, and two of my friends, and it was a great experience! Firstly, it's in a great area of boston with many of the most popular tourist places nearby, not to mention the subway stop (Park) is right up the street. The place itself has a lot of charm and is quite nice in the lobby. The staff were all very curteous, kind and catering. For our room itself, we had a non-smoking room with two double beds. As most Boston hotels, the room wasn't massive, but it wasn't much of a problem, even with four people. Everything was very clean, including the bathroom, and everything was also in working order, including the internet and the cable and the CD player, which we made great use of. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and the sheets seemed new and were definitely clean, so i don't quite understand some of the other reviews where people say their sheets are old and outdated... Overall, even though I live in Boston, if i will be looking for a place to stay in Boston other than my apartment, this would definitely be my first choice, and i recommend it to any person who enjoys a place with a little character, charm, and style.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Omni Parker House many times. The hotel is really nice and the staff was always very polite and professional. The location is perfect, so I will continue to stay there, whenever I am staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: eamato
Reviews.Content: Hotels get ONE chance to impress me. I travel at least twice a month and spend a lot of time in hotels. The Omni in Boston is old. The technolgy for the TV did not work, and the HIGH SPEED Internet was not. Service was stuffy and snooty. the bed was hard and sheets were frayed. Why stay here when every other hotel chain is imporiving their sheets and beds and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: scottinmaine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Parker House for our honeymoon and couldn't have found a better place! We stayed in a king bed suite -- living room was a corner room with a bedroom off the living room. As other posters have noted, this is an historic (meaning OLD) hotel but we found it to be charming. The room was immaculate and the bathroom was obviously recently renovated. Plus, we booked through Omni's website and paid around two hundred a night. The staff were top notch (although the concierge was almost a little snotty!) and we were treated like royalty. The restaurant was "formally relaxed" -- you could have easily worn a jacket & tie or jeans & a polo shirt. The food was excellent and service was attentive. I've stayed in several other Boston hotels and the Parker House is by far the best for us. We like the old world charm, the historic features of the hotel and the quirks of an older hotel (weird, curvy hallways, especially!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: franfrompa
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Omni for the Boston Marathon and it was great! The staff was very friendly and efficient. The location is great for tourists as it is close to the Common, Downtown Crossing & Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market and lots of other historical sights. Only had to walk three blocks to catch the bus to the start of the marathon. The hotel even had a special conference room set up as a runner's lounge for after the race. This is so important at a large race when you don't know where to meet your friends and family. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable - lots of pillows which I loved. I know I will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Fiji80
Reviews.Content: It paid to join the free Select Guests program. We were treated like royalty when we arrived (even though we booked through Priceline at $120/nt)! From the doorman to valet to check in, service was top notch. We were upgraded to a corner top floor room. It is an old world hotel, so don't expect contemporary decor. The bar was a great place for watching the Yankees/Red Sox and having a few drinks. Caution against bringing a car as overnight parking is $35 per night w/ an additional $16 if you are not out by Noon the next day (unless you are a select guest). Park across the street at the Boston Common Garage for only $10/day on weekends. Our daughter is going to Emerson College down the block next fall, so we will be back often...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bit old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni Parker in Boston last August for four nights. The location is totally perfect, however the hotel isn't as great as it's made out to be. I wouldn't give it four stars. I think when you first go in it looks very grand and old colonial style, loads of history attached and we had high hopes of a nice room. However, our room was tiny. We had just flown down from Canada where we stayed in a huge hotel with massive rooms so the Omni Parker felt really claustrophobic. Also the room's very musty and old fashioned. There's a funny smell in the hotel, especially when you get out the lift. It smells of old things, all foosty. I've since heard it's haunted and I'd almost believe it! Although the lobby etc is grand it's like it hasn't been given a lick of paint in 100 years and the decor is original from last century. We asked to be moved to another room, I asked for a king sized. They said it would be $100 but thought that would be worth it for abig room. However, the new room was a smoking room and it totally stank of stale smoke. Started coughing and spluttering the minute we walked in. and it wasn't any bigger!!! I think the hotel's popular because of its name and it's been there for years/all that history attached to it. BUt it needs a major renovation, they need to strip out all that old smelly furniture and decorate the place. However, the location is so good,. It's right on the freedom trail, 2 mins from Boston Common and 5/10 mins at most to Fanieul hall and QUincy market. Boston is an amazing city. So friendly and loads to see and you can walk everywhere. Oh, also we didn't eat in the hotel. It looked too formal with white table clothes etc. That might be nice for older couples actually. But we were all relaxed on holiday and didn't want to watch our manners/get our best frocks on just to eat. Went to fab places in the North end, loads of Italians, and in QUincy market area. We're going back to Boston this September, it's such a great city but no way will be stay at the Omni Parker again.

Reviews.Title: “Give me a break people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would say the only good thing about the Omni Parker House is the location. We had several problems. Believe me I am not a picky person - I like pretty much everything, including camping but come on! The rooms were so musty and moldy that my husband had a severe allergic reaction. The AC unit was old and was spewing allergens into the room. We turned off the AC and burned up. We ended up checking out a day early after two sleepless and miserable nights. Checked into the Doubletree in chinatown which was GREAT! And less $ too...the reason I write this so late is because I wrote a letter to Omni after we returned and I wanted to see if they could redeem themselves. Instead, we got a snide letter from the manager...with a very very thinly veiled appolgy. Thanks for ruining the Omni hotel chain for me...never again...p.s. the hotel was kind of creepy, it was old and our friends that visited us in the hotel thought it was haunted...also, the ashtray mysteriously fell off the nightstand one night (while I was wike awake so it wasn't a dream). Bed tiny, bathroom tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old worlde hotel”
Reviews.Author: woblynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights following our UK flight, prior to travelling to Maine for a ski holiday. We were informed we were in a deluxe room (not the European room thankfully) on the 8 floor overlooking the area where the doormen stand greeting people from taxis etc. We then asked for a higher floor room which was equivalent due to the original room getting some noise from the doormen's whistles. The room had two double beds, TV, desk, small bathroom with toiletries and closet. We found it perfectly adequate for a 2 night stay and had wonderful service off the bellboy who followed us to the new room with our bags and gave us some advice about the area. Had a couple of drinks and some food in Parkers Bar and the barman was excellent and told us some great facts about the hotel and where to eat. Overall, a good hotel, but even so in US terms, the rooms are small but in European terms, average size. We would stay there again as the location was excellent for anything in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: gopatriots
Reviews.Content: Wow! My 2 friends and I just stayed at the Omni on March 19th and check-in was a breeze. We actually checked in early. We loved our room and the staff were really helpful. Our room was on the 8th floor and overlooked the Old City Hall. The location was very central, just a block from Filene's Basement. We could walk everywhere. I am from the local area and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Simply a nightmare hotel. My room was not available at check in. I was checking in at 5 PM. I did not reserve any kind of special room. After waiting an hour, (now 5 PM) my room was "ready". I was given keys to the room and went upstairs. I entered the room and it was occupied by another family. I went down to the desk and the staff acted like no big deal. Next, I was given two new keys that did not work. I returned to the guest again and asked for the manager. The staff member, Kevin, said he was the mangager and wasn't helpful in the least. I finally was able to get into my room and then realized it was a smoking room. I went back to the front desk a third time and spoke to another person. I asked for the manager and got the same incompotent person as before. When I asked for his manager or another manager Kevin said he was the only manager. Yet, he kept retunring to the back office to speak to someone whenever I made a request. It was very odd. Lastly, Kevin the "manager" of front office practically evicted me from the hotel. I was quite upset about waiting two hours, having keys that did not work, being sent to a smoking room, and entered an allready occupied room. I told him I would never stay at this hotel again and felt I should not have to pay for the night. Before I knew it he had cancelled my reservation and said I would not be charged for the night and I could go elsewhere. Honestly, who has that kind of staff? After the bellman took fifteen minutes to "find" my luggage I went around the block to the hotel Nine-Zero on tremont street. (The hotels share the same block)... I highly recomend this boutique hotel and say pass on the Omni. So much for being a "select guest" at Omni Hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joseph4
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the Omni Parker House in Boston and thoroughly enjoyed it. This historic hotel is in a great location and near everything. It was the perfect choice as it was my first time in Boston. The rooms were immaculate and the service was very good. I understand that it has a reputation of being haunted and, while I do believe that such things are possible, I'm happy to report that we encountered no ghosts or odd occurances.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Omni for a ridiulously low price. They gave us a room on a high floor (great view of south church) and a corner room. The rooms were as big as I imagined and the closet was huge and kept our bags out of sight. We especially enjoyed the hot cocoa every morning with a paper (thanks to the preferred guest program which is free) The room was very quiet and the bed comfy. We had a great experience with the front desk and concierge. We have always found that the usual tips to the right people give us better service (this is true at all hotels). We would stay here again and will since we visit often. Location is the biggest draw. Thank You Omni for a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dingy looking, and the service goes right along with the dingy look. Decided to try the famous Boston cream pie--It was still frozen when they served it. The coffee I ordered with it was room temperature. While I was there a few convention attendees had been robbed. I overheard them talking to the front desk staff, and honestly, the staff seemed not to care one iota! For the same money I would have been better off at the Seaport Hotel or the Boston Harbor Hotel. I won't go back to the Parker House, despite its historic location.

Reviews.Title: “middle to high”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, this isn't exactly a luxury hotel but it is fine and it's history is compelling. Location is good - was only there for two nights but was close to Quincy Market area and easy to walk around from here (be careful if driving as very hard to find your way around). Was originally placed in a smallish room but asked to be moved to one with a desk which they did immediately and graciously. Good hotel if you are there on business, perhaps not so much if you are looking for something small and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need updating, concierge needs attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: kidscomingwith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House recently on a weekend trip with my husband. We were looking forward to a romantic weekend in New England. Unfortunately, we got a terrible recommendation from the concierge for dinner at some shabby place down the street, (we asked for seafood besides Legal Seafoods, they had fish and chips!), ended up walking out and going someplace else. Made me wonder if the concierge was receiving kickbacks because we saw a few other people from the hotel there as well. When we stopped by the concierge for other area information, he acted as if we "tourists" should just stay out of Boston. The problems rating is based solely on the jerk of a concierge we dealt with. The valets, however, were great about helping us after the concierge told us to p--- off. The room was shabby, but our view was nice. It is definitely time for a remodel. I'm used to small hotel rooms, so the size didn't bother me. With a few cosmetic and one personnel change, the hotel could regain some of its past glory.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Hotel. The staff was very friendly & the conceirge was extremely helpful, we were very impressed. Located in great area, we walked everywhere. The room was perfect & the beds were very comfortable. We would definitely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was kinda gross. I usually stay at the Langham Boston (formerly the Le Meridian) which is so much nicer, but the Omni was only $99 for the night. I do know why it was only 99 bucks though!!! I had booked one of their "Economy Single rooms", because all I would do is sleep their for the night. At times I do not mind a small room, but this room was pretty gross. This entire hotel (especially the rooms) needs to be totally renovated. My room's capet was all stained and dirty, the wallpaper was peeling in a few different places, and the decor was just so dated. I picture Omni Hotels to not be Four Seasons, and Ritz- Carltons, yet I do picture them up with Westin, Hyatt, and Fairmont. They are NO better than regular Marriotts, Sheratons, and Hiltons. Also, I am planning a trip to Chicago and thought to book the Omni Chicago Hotel, but I have definitely changed my mind and am going to book the Hyatt Regency. The Parker House does have a great location though, right in the Middle of Boston near Fanuil Hall and Quincy Market.They are lucky to get a 2 out of 5 from me. AVOID Omnis, they are not that great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayitaazul
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Omni in February of 2005 and we loved it! The hotel is in a GREAT location, our room was beautiful, the consierge was extreamly helpful and the meal we had in the hotel restaurant was one of the best I have had. I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston I will defintely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: MJ17
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston for a long weekend in December 2004. We'd never been to the USA and didn't know what we would find. We booked the Omni because it was doing a great offer. We arrived exhausted after a 2 hour flight delay and 1 hour delay at immigration after the computers broke down. The hotel staff were very sympathetic and helpful and we were fortunate to have an upgrade to our rooms. The Omni is a throw-back to the days of oppulance and is a little shabby in places, but the service and people make the stay well worth it. We filled up on the buffet breakfast and didn't have to spend on food again until the evening. The hotel couldn't be better located, as far as we were concerned - a stone's throw from shopping and sightseeing. We found Boston to be a fabulous city and the Omni the ideal place for us to stay. We haven't stopped talking or thinking about it since we left, and we can't wait 'til we take the kids for their first trip there, next week.

Reviews.Title: “Room size disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dishy27
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel and I found the staff helpful and friendly. My room, however, was minute and the view from the window was of a brick wall. I was in Boston with work and know we paid a high price for the room-more than I could have afforded. If it had been my own money I would have cried.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to ending our trip in Boston at a nice hotel. When we arrived we were fooled into thinking that the whole hotel would be inkeeping with the grandeur of the lobby - it isn't. We knew that the "european-style rooms" would be on the small side, but coming from the UK we didn't expect a shoebox. The room was very small, smelt of smoke and the carpet was full of cigarrette burns and stains. We asked to change room and were moved to a larger room (larger because it was one of the hotel's disabled access rooms). While this was a much nicer room on a non-smoking floor (although we had requested non-smoking in the first place) it was still a little shabby. The carpet had certainly seen better days and the wallpaper was coming off in places. Having said all that, the location is superb and the concierge is very helpful and recommended a great restaurant nearby (77 Chestnut). The bar also is very charming. If you're expecting opulent luxury don't stay here. But for average accomodation in a great location it's worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Historic Hotel-A Terrific Historic Location”
Reviews.Author: USCTrojan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel this December 2004. Our room was lovely. We had a walk in closet-very unexpected and the usual amenities. The staff was excellent and very helpful. We dined in all of the restaurants-which ranged from very casual to fine and enjoyed each experience. Great chowder, and you must try their Boston Creme pie-delicious and a delight to the eye. It was a real kick to stay at the oldest continuously running hotel in the nation. Malcolm X and Ho Chi Min were former employees of the hotel. The Omni Parker House is the only hotel in Boston that is actually part of the Boston Freedom Trail. Location***Location***Location When you stay at the Parker House you are close to the Commons/Public Garden, subways, theatre district, and Fanueil Hall. It is fantastic. You are surrounded by history everywhere you go. Run, don't walk to the Omni Parker House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel & Wonderful Dinning Room”
Reviews.Author: HIWALSH
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be beautiful and the dinning room was gorgeous with beautiful decor. We will be back again to enjoy dinner as our Halibut and Boston Creme Pie was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Luxurious Historic Hotel /Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the kids and went to see the Lion King show and enjoyed our dinner along with a Wonderful Suite. Thanks to Omni for a Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “opulent and luxurious historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Parker House is a throwback to the glory days of the full service downtown hotel. The lobby is the best of any high end hotel in Boston, it's breathtaking. Parker's restaurant is so rich and well appointed, I just love to eat there. The staff is great and you're treated like family. I'd live at the Parker House if I could. The rooms vary in size so if the hotel isn't full, see a couple first. The location is terrific, a couple of blocks to Qunicy Market and Boston Common. In the good weather you can walk to the North End for dinner. Don't think twice about staying at the Parker House, just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Omni - Very nice Hotel within walking distance of all historic sites.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni with my wife and three children the week between Christmas 2004 and New Years. The hotel was very nice and the rates were very reasonable. We had a superior room that was quite large with two beds and a pull out sofa. We ate at all Three dining areas in the hotel and found all to be reasonably priced. (Never had to wait for a table). The hotel sits on the historic Freedom Trail and everything we went to see was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, after we had booked, we were apprehensive about the hotel, as some of the reviews were offputting! We were pleasantly surprised, therefore, when we arrived at this lovely hotel, and enjoyed our 6 day stay very much. The bedroom was very clean comfortable and nicely furnished, and the bathroom had everything we needed. The staff were extremely helpful. It was our own fault that we arrived on Thanksgiving and everything was closed!! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Boston, and in the Omni Parker Hotel, and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for Thanksgiving and we were very impressed. It is an old style hotel with good service and clean, well appointed rooms. We got a deluxe room for USD117 on hotels and we were more than pleased. The staff were helpful and housekeeping kept our room in pristine condition and we weren't disturbed by noise,. Location is excellent for siteseeing and this hotel is full of history, they have a five page piece on Boston and it's history. Top marks all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel November 22-24 2004. The location is awesome, right on the Freedom Trail and within walking distance to the theatre district, the North End, Faneuil Hall and shopping. The staff is friendly and the ambience is great. Rooms are a little small, but attractive. It is a great value. We recommend dinner at Giacommo's (North End), but bring cash, they don't take credit cards. The Blue Man show was great for all ages. Historical stuff was fun to see, we walked the entire Freedom Trail and went in all the museums along the way...buy a multi-ticket at the first stop for a discount on all three. We rode the "T" to the Prudential Building tower to see the city views, but the charge is $9.50 for adults...a little pricey we thought to see an aerial view of the city. All around a great trip. We would stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Very lucky choice with the omni”
Reviews.Author: AnitaMoore
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews of the Boston Omni Parker before our four night stay in November 2004 but we were very pleasantly surprised by the standard and quality feel of this old hotel. The public areas are quite grand, and reception service very friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. Our two rooms were very comfortable, well furnished and quite spacious and the housekeeping staff very good. Good view, extremely convenient location for all the sights and thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “One word.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ....Excellent!!!! My wife, 14 month old son and I stayed at the hotel the first week in November 2004. From the moment we arrived the service we received was great. Our flight had got in early so we arrived at the hotel before the check in time of 3pm within about 15 minutes of arriving we were shown to our room. When we returned that night after going out for dinner there was milk and cookies on the table for our son which we thought was a nice touch. Our room was a suite with the separate living area which cost approx $199 per night, which compared to other hotels was reasonable especially for its size. The complimentary broadband internet access in the room and lobby was a bonus. Didn't bother with the mini-bar as there was a seven-eleven just down from the hotel. Location of the hotel is ideal as well, 5 minutes to the start of the freedom trail, fanueil hall, quincy market, macy's etc and about a 15 minute walk to the prudential centre, the aquarium and the childrenâ€™s museum. After our experience it is hard to believe some of the comments from other visitors, any problems we had were rectified quickly, the service from the front desk and concierge was 1st class. The only things that stopped the hotel from getting 5 was that they tried to charge me for something from Parkers and the cost of making phone calls (it would have been cheaper to use my mobile). Would stay here again and would recommend to anyone - just check your bill at the end of your stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your luggage!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my family this summer. The hotel luggage porter left 1 of our bags in the taxi. We expended extra taxi expenses, telephone expenses and a lot of our vacation time talking to taxi people, police, drug stores, doctor offices and hotel personnel in trying to resolve this issue. In addition to missing medication, all cosmetic needs were also lost. The start of our Boston vacation was disappointing, worry-some and enough to say that we would not stay at the Boston Omni Parker House Hotel again. We sent letters to both the hotel and corporate headquarters trying to resolve this dissatisfaction with no resolution. I cannot recommend this hotel to my friends, family and you.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain, I saw the Red Sox parade out the front door!”
Reviews.Author: DaveKC74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in October 2004. Got the room last minute at an inflated rate due to the Red Sox celebration parade (can't complain, it was on the parade route.) The room was small, with a double bed. The amenities were nice, as was the bathroom. The pillows were horribly uncomfortable, very lumpy. Service was somewhat lacking - there was a sign on the mini-bar inviting me to "sumptuous treats" inside, however it was locked and I was not given a key. I called the front desk, who assured me that a key would be sent up right away. After a half an hour, I went to get the key myself from the front desk. When I returned to the room, I found that the mini-bar was bare - nothing inside. Then I went back to the lobby to return the key and tell them the thing was empty, so as not to get accused of cleaning it out. No apology or explanation. No late checkout available, even though my car was not available until 2pm due to road closures (known ahead of time). Upon check out, it took one hour to get the car from the valet. No one seemed to know who, if anyone, went to get the car. Parker's bar was very nice, good service. Overall great location, OK if you can get it at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: chatwizme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni last Aug with a coworker to attend some business training classes. Check-in was a hassle, as my coworker did not get the room we had reserved. However, he was upgraded and moved to another room the next morning. The accomodations were clean and neat and the bedding was luxurious. The bathroom was indeed the smallest bathroom I have EVER tried to maneuver within! Everything was updated and extremely clean, but wow, talk about close quarters ! I had to leave the door open to be able to brush and blow dry my hair at the same time ! The Omni is an old building with lots of interesting history. If you are looking for something shiney and new, you won't want to stay here. I was most impressed with the location - it was absolutely PERFECT. It was our first trip to Boston, and we were thrilled at the opportunity to be there. The Omni was within walking distance of everything we could dream of. Close to the Harbor, close to the Commons, Close to shopping, Fanieul Hall, within walking distance of Little Italy, and Chinatown...we stayed eight days and LOVED it ! I would recommend the Omni Parker House for the location and the cleanliness, and I would rate it a good solid 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overrated but fortunately over there.”
Reviews.Author: thx1138
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni Parker House a couple of years ago and having paid in excess of Â£200 sterling a night without breakfast I was expecting a decent room with a view. What we were presented with was a small box with a view of another wall approx 15 feet away covered in peeling paint. Needless to say our hearts sank as we were there for 10 days. I immediately insisted on another room with some sort of view and we were moved to a higher floor into a slightly nicer room with a slightly obscured view of Boston. The hotel is old (by American Standards) and well located so we were prepared to tolerate the cramped room and poor view, however by no stretch of the imagination was it worth the price premium we paid. I'd give it a miss, there are plenty of better value, larger, better appointed hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in September and, after having stayed at Le Meridien in Chicago, this was a major disappointment. No one was at the door when I arrived, which meant shlepping my large suitcase up the stairs (there is no handicapped sloped platform, which would have made life easier). The lobby, while rather grand in spots, has all the charm of a convention center. The front desk folks were busy, but did their job efficiently. But, what greets you upstairs really scares you -- hallways that are narrow, dingily lit, and rather institutional. We were upgraded to a larger room but the bathroom was no bigger than a closet. And, if there was no one at the front entrance when I arrived, there were two doormen and one other guy (didn't know what HIS role was) standing around chatting while I dragged my bag to the car. This place needs a major makeover and a change of staff. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A perfect location and a terrific staff. We had a beautiful room, but like all older hotels, the walls are a bit thin. Once the chatty-cathy next door stopped talking, we had a couple of great nights. PS - the Last Hurrah makes a great martini.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Can You Say Creepy?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not knowing what to expect, upon arrival we were intrigued by the beauty of the lobby and it's historical nature. The rooms were nice, but a bit small. Within only a few minutes of arriving in our room, in the bathroom, I faintly, but clearly heard early 1900's old victorian music, the kind that used to be played by the first "record player"ever invented (victrola?) coming directly from underneath the sink, there were no speakers, no vent, nothing. Strange, but at the time I didn't think much of it. At night the A\C was too loud, so from the 7th floor, we resorted to the window which had no screen, we admired the view for a few minutes. About 2 minutes after I turned my back and went back to bed, the window slammed completely shut, That was a bit nerve wracking!! That same night there was a knock at our door twice but no one was there. Thats when I got a nervous and stiff as a board. The next morning our friends, who stayed in the next room, heard what they thought were like nails- tapping on the walls. That same night since it was October, we took a "Ghost Tour"of Boston. We walked all throughout downtowns cemeterys etc.. and ended up at the Omni Parker House where we were staying, as part of the ghost tour and learned all about the history and hauntings that took place there in the hotels' hallways, ballroom, suites, elevator entrances etc. It was pretty creepy, and it all started to make sense after that. I was creeped out. Needless to say we left right after the tour. Probably woudn't do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sofie_Rose
Reviews.Content: I just returned from eight days in Boston (8/27 to 9/4) where I stayed at the Omni Parker House. I could not have been more pleased. As mentioned by many others here, the Omni's location is excellent. I found the staff to be most friendly and helpful, and the hotel lobby really is quite grand. I arrived at the front desk to discover my room had been upgraded from a European single to a deluxe double; it was not only a lovely room, but spacious as well. While Parker's restaurant was so-so and service in the Last Hurrah was a bit spotty, room service was excellent. My only complaint about the hotel was that it was occasionally noisy, happily though, not noisy enough to disturb my sleep. I will undoubted stay at the Parker House on my next trip to Boston and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location best thing”
Reviews.Author: TechMomNE
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. The public areas, lobby, restaurant, bar, etc are beautiful. Our room was small but nice. The Body Shop bath products were a nice touch. The main reason we would return is the great location though. We walked to practically everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in August and enjoyed it! This is the best location in town. You can walk to almost anyplace you want to go. The hotel was very clean and quiet. We stayed in a "deluxe" size room and found it comfortable for two people. From what I've read, it is the European room that is so small. Are some of the rates that seem too good to be true on internet sites for the European rooms? If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. One negative: had a hard time getting served in Parker's Bar. Visit the Last Hurrah - good service and pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mold on the bathroom walls, stuffy room with musty smells... How much did we pay for this? I can't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to celebrate our first anniversary (August 15-17) and heard the Parker House was the most centrally located hotel in Boston. They were right! We were so close to everything-we walked everywhere! The staff was very accommodating, friendly and helpful. They upgraded our room to a suite and it was beautiful. We truly had a great time there. We did not eat in the restaurant because we heard it was not all that great. I did try a piece of the Boston Cream Pie since it was invented there and to be honest, did not like it at all. Oh well! There are places at Quincy Market that had wonderful pie, along with everything else you can imagine! We will definitely stay at Parker House again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni Parker House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in the early spring. It was WONDERFUL! The staff was very helpful and polite. The hotel was majestic, clean and beautiful. The location could not be beat. Our room was very nice but the bathroom was very small. I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay lasted 1 hour - smoker's paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay lasted 1 hour before we were moved to another hotel. The room we were offered was full of tobacco smells, there was cigarette burns on the carpet and the european sized bed was not much bigger than a single. A great disappointment as we had read great reviews on the website. The hotel is a faded lady with a not very helpful manager who blighted our stay and travels in the USA

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had six days here at the start of our New England holiday - and it was great. The opulence of the lobby and dining room gets you started and we found the staff to be generally very friendly. Our room was a good size for the stay, but seeing some of the other rooms sizes on the way to the lift made us grateful that either we had struck it lucky with a room that had previously been two, or had been upgraded without being told. Either way we enjoyed the visit and made some use of the dining room (Parkers) for breakfast. Do this once for the surroundings rather than the service. Food quality was good, price was expensive as you would expect. We managed cocktails at the Last Hurrah, much more expensive here but - hey we were on holiday. Again the service was pretty good but the bar itself is not much to shout about. Location wise you can't beat the Omni. Close to so much, walking distance for most things, including the "T" to take you further afield. Definately a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker House is OK”
Reviews.Author: MrDoof
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Boston and stayed three nights at the Omni Parker House. The location is fantastic with close access to sites, the "T", and Boston Common. Our room was nice, but a bit underwhelming in size with no storage space in the rather cramped bathroom. Staff were efficient and friendly including a great group of folks from Jamaica. We had dinner one night at "The Last Hurrah". Wanting a light meal and the food was awful and very expensive. It doesn't take much to please my wife and I - but we would have been better off walking a couple of blocks to a local pub. There are plenty of good to great restaurants very close by - so enjoy the hotel and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni Parker House this past July 1-5. First of all, the location is perfect. You are steps away from all the great locations, including the freedom trail walk. The front desk staff was professional and very helpful upon check-in. The room was great. Large room with separate sitting area. We couldn't have asked for a better room. Room Service was prompt and the food was outstanding. The only concern we had was the restaurant in the lobby...Parkers...we had breakfast one morning and the service was poor and the food was not so good. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay at the Omni Parker House again.

Reviews.Title: “Parker House is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Sjordantex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parker House in April. Great location. Convenient to everything. The place has character missing in many of the newer hotels. Staff is very accommodating. Only 10-15 minute trip to airport. When we go back to Boston, we will stay at the Parker House.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Omni Parker House Hotel has it all...historical significance, beauty, class. The hotel is located right in the middle of many historical sites and within easy walking distance of wonderful restaurants and the neighborhood is beautiful. It rained during our entire trip to Boston and yet we still had a fabulous time seeing the sights and eating the food. The OPHH is a great place to begin...try the Boston Cream Pie and also the drink of the same name. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Parker is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: MaggiF
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Omni Parker House in Boston and found it to be superb! The staff are the best, the European Room we had was beautiful, and the bathroom products were excellent. The mini-bar prices were a little high ! The location, right on the Freedom Trail with a three minute walk to Fanueil Hall and Quincey Market, is hard to beat and we found everything easily. The harbourside restaurants and views were simply stunning. Go to Boston as your first choice of holiday in the US, and choose the Omni Parker as best location - book via Lodging.com for a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rachelhale821
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a one bedroom suite, and needless to say the room was lovely. Very clean, beds comfortable. Dinner in the dining room was nice and room service was good as well. My only complaint is that the front desk staff is quite young and inexperienced, the young lady did not know the answer to my questions and didn't know what types of beds were in the room. Overall the staff was polite and attentitive. Parkers bar closed unusually early for a Saturday night, 11:30pm, so this is not the place for a late night drink.

Reviews.Title: “Best located hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Gadgeteer1066
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best located hotels in Boston. It's right on the Freedom Trail and easily in walking distance of most of the places of interest, not that Boston is spread over a large area any way. It has a grand feel to it and despite its age, it is well maintained and comfortable. I read someone complain that the lifts here were slow but we found them to be amongst the fastest anywhere - we even commented on the fact while we were there. The hotel is exceptionally friendly. Front desk, concierge, management all go out of their way to offer a friendly smile. Only exception was in Parker's Restaurant over breakfast one day - the server was well below par. Watched some guests having to go and get their own coffee refills. She was the exception though. The room we had was on the 6th floor. It had one chair and two double beds and was extremely small. No table or desk, just a large refrigerated bar between the beds as a table - but cluttered with phone, coffee maker, lamp and selction of snacks and waters for sale - so no space for your own posessions. The view out of the window was of an office block across a very narrow alley which meant the curtains needed to be kept drawn most of the time. I booked direct with the hotel and got their 'net-savvy' rate which was around $179 per night and was comparable to hotels.com et al. when I booked. I suppose discounted rates do tend to lead to being allocated the smaller rooms, but for a 3 night stay it was more than adequate. Overall, a well maintained, friendly, comfortable hotel located right where you would want to be. Despite the room size, this is where I would stay if I came back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Omni and would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston. It is well within walking distance to all the attractions. We also found the staff to be very helpfull with all of our questions. The room was clean and comfortable and the atmosphere in the lobby was charming. A Fantastic Hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARKLakeWorth_Fl
Reviews.Content: We spent two nice nights here and found the location of this hotel to be absolutely perfect. We walked everwhere, including Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, Cheers bar (both locations), Boston Commons, etc. You'd be hard pressed to find lodging in a better location within Boston. The Freedom Trail runs right in front of the main entrance.The hotel is beautiful and well maintained and we found the staff friendly and helpful. The food was very good though the Boston Creme Pie was disappointing considering it was invented in this hotel.Our room was very nice but quite small and cramped and we had a problem with the AC unit, though it was fixed promptly once we reported it. However, we didn't spend much time in the room because it was so easy to get everywhere. Overall I'd say it was a great choice of hotels if you're visiting Boston and want to be close to everything. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Parker House Rolls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a charming old place with an exceptional location. The lobby is a bit threadbare and the elevators are lovely but slow. Food and beverage service in the bars and dining room are average...go elsewhere to eat or drink. Guest rooms are nice but unless you grab a great rate, there are nicer places elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Grace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! After reading so many great reviews and visiting the hotel's excellent website, I had very high expectations. My expectations were more than exceeded by the beautiful accommodations, friendly staff, and perfect location. The food was pricey, but very good. The staff handled a room change for me at very short notice, and I ended up getting a great deal on a small room -- $119 per night. The hotel has a wide variety of room types and prices, and the reservation staff is very helpful in matching up your needs and budget with the right accommodations. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Boston, particularly after talking to people at the convention I attended who had stayed elsewhere for three times the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: jjapples
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we stayed at the Parker House and we were not disappointed. The hotel,staff,and the location are all great.

Reviews.Title: “35th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reserved a room at the Parker House for three nights and celebrated our anniversary one night there in the main dining room. It could not have been a better evening. The hostess Veronica, the maitre d" Rudy and our watiress Mary were professional, personable and a pleasure to have there with us. They made a special occasion very memorable. From the time we arrived there on a Friday afternoon until the time we left on Monday morning, the service and response by the entire staff we met was flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Nice Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni Parker House in November of 2003 in no small part due to the reviews found on this site. We chose the deluxe room with queen bed (a seemingly worthwhile upgrade). Location is excellent - we walked and took the T to everything from the hotel. No need to rent a car. Hotel was historic and beautiful - just what we were looking for in Boston. The staff were friendly and made our stay a pleasure. We were, however, alarmed at the noise from the street (honking, sirens and construction throughout the night) - I did not sleep well most nights due to the thin walls and exterior noise. We also had a problem with the auto-closing door mechanism (had to be sure to pull the door shut manualy) and the maid on our third day did not make sure the door was shut when she finished. We arrived back to the room surpised to find the door cracked open - fortunately nothing was missing. When I informed the front desk of the situation, they apologized and sent someone from engineering up to fix it - however, they did not seem as alarmed as I would have thought appropriate considering the situation. Generally, we were pleased with our stay and would reccomend the hotel to others travelling to Boston. That being said, we will consider other hotels for our next stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on the hotel online. I stayed there for three nights. I travel a lot and really took note of how friendly the staff was. If you are traveling with one or two people the European room will do just fine. It is so well appointed that the size is not really noticed! The shower and bed were great. You can walk to the subway station which is only two blocks away. No need for a rental car. The hotel did miss bill me, but quickly corrected my credit card balance after a phone call. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be the perfect location! you can walk to absolutely everything from here. We were at Faneuil Hall in two minutes, all the main shops even quicker and the Fleet Centre is no more than a ten-fifteen minute walk. Excellent! However the walls were paper thin and the carpets had seen better days. Our room was tucked into a tiny corner and was small. Even for a city centre hotel. Other than that it was a pleasant enough place. Great breakfast from room service.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location located steps form Downtown Crossng and Fanueil Hall. You can even walk to the Fleet Center. All tings considered, the 110 spent is a bargin in Boston and the hotel i right on the Freedom Trail, classy, friendly ad solid bar and restraunt. Walls are a bit thin in the rooms, but who cares because with the 200 restraunts and bars within 1/2 mile you won't get back till late so it will be of little bother.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it.....................”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An Absolute gem of a hotel,great staff,Good size european room,fantastic location,just a stones throw to Boston Common(Beware The Squirrels). Great pub around side of hotel(Pub in the Hub)(Take your ID). Did the whole Cheers Bar,Ice Skating,Harvard trip,Quincy market thing. The T is a doddle to use and very safe and very good to and from airport. Got upgraded with Northwest when we flew out of Amsterdam. Booked with Expedia.co.uk and got a great deal. A fantastic hotel and a great City. Ian and Michelle Cadd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Dirty Carpets”
Reviews.Author: SourcesOnline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Parker in February 2004. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the hotel is stituated in an ideal location for shopping (Filenes, TJMaxx, boutique shops), siteseeing--at the foot of Beacon Hill, and business--the financial and govenment district is only three blocks away.I stayed in a "European Room" at a wonderful rate advertised on Travelocity. The room was actually much bigger than real European rooms I have stayed at in Europe. The furnishings were very nice, the bathroom was a nice size, and the room rate included high speed Internet. My only complaint is the carpets in the room(s)! I know that its Wintertime and carpets are hard to keep clean. But my gosh. There were big dirt stains on the carpets. I looked at two rooms...the second room's carpet dirtier than the first...before I finally settled on a semi-stained carpet in a third room. The rooms themselves were very clean, its just that the carpets were shamefull.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, but VERY noisy! Also, the parking valet service was fine - until we left. The folks running the valet were snickering and commenting after we tipped the valet driver who brought us our car. Did I mention the noise? I was awake probably half the night listening to sirens, etc. An okay hotel, but I would stay in the burbs next time around.

HotelInfo.Name: Omni Parker House
HotelInfo.Address: 60 School Street, Boston, MA 02108
